loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Miss Ángela Y. is 20 years old, single, and lives with her mother, Mrs. Arsenia Y.. The two women have worked together for three years in a space that they rent. Ángela studies in the morning and is in college.

Mrs. Arsenia is a single mother. For this reason, she struggles every day. Her daughter struggles with her to move forward. The two women run a catering business. Their main clients are the people that work in local businesses of the area. Ángela wants a loan so that she can buy a motorbike, as this will speed up distribution efficiency now that the business has more and more clients and the food weighs so much.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Ángela Y. tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive con su madre la Sra. Arsenia Y., ellas trabajan juntas desde hace 3 años en un salón que ellas alquilan. Ángela estudia por la mañana, esta en el nivel universitario.

La Sra. Arsenia es madre soltera por ello es que ella lucha día a día, junto con su madre, para salir adelante. Ellas realizan servicio de comidas en viandas (catering) a domicilio. Sus principales clientes son las personas que trabajan en los negocios de la zona. Ella desea el crédito para poder comprar una moto, ya que eso agilizará su reparto pues cada vez tienen mas clientes y las viandas pesan mucho.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.en: Mukadam is young businesswoman. Her business is selling food products such as cakes, biscuits and wafers. She buys her goods from suppliers from Uzbekistan. Additionally she has a contract with local food workshops and sells their products too. Her business place is located in the central market in Panjshanbe, Khujand. She has good turnover, as her business place is in the passageway of the market and is crowded every day. She is not married and lives with her parents. Her dream is to get a good education and to find a job with good salary. She is requesting 1000TJS ($300 USD) for business expansion.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Cyntia

texts.es:
Srta. Cynthia P., 19, is single and lives with her mother, Sra. Maria Palma. They've worked together for 3 years, as street vendors selling clothing. Their merchandise includes, among other things, t-shirts, pants, shorts, and skirts. Cynthia goes to school in the mornings and she's now in her last year of high school. She hopes to finish high school, go on to college and, one day, have a professional career. By doing so, she believes she'll have the greatest chance of providing her mother, her biggest supporter, with a decent life.

The income from their joint business supports them. Cynthia has been thinking of starting a business selling clothes from a home-based store so they will no longer have to go out to work everyday in the oppresive heat. For that purpose, she's applying for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of merchandise--t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, seasonal clothing, for example--for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Cynthia P. tiene 19 años, es soltera, vive con su madre la Sra. María Palma, ellas trabajan juntas desde hace 3 años, se dedican a la venta de ropas de forma ambulante. Entre algunas de sus mercaderías podemos citar: remeras, pantalones, shorts, faldas, etc. Cynthia estudia por la mañana, esta cursando el ultimo año de la secundaria. Su mayor anhelo es culminar sus estudios y seguir una carrera universitaria, ser el día de mañana una profesional y de este modo acceder a mayores oportunidades laborales; piensa que de este modo ella podrá dar una vida digna a su madre quien es su mayor apoyo.

Con el ingreso de las ventas, ellas mantienen la casa juntas. Cynthia tiene pensado montar su negocio de venta de ropas en su casa, de este modo evitarán salir todos los días a recorrer las calles en el agobiante calor; para ello solicita el crédito pues desea invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, tales como remeras, vestidos, jeans, camisas, pantalones, y prendas de temporada.

loans.use: Buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts and seasonal clothing for resale.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Sr. Elias D. is married to Enriqueta Villalaba and they have 3 children, two sons and a daughter. All the children are grown, with jobs of their own, but they still live with their parents, pooling their earnings together to support the household. Sr. Elias repairs and sells mobile phones with the help of his wife. He started the business with capital raised from the sale of part of his property in 1994. He subsequently learned to repair mobile phones, a highly income-producing skill. One of his projects is to add rooms to his house so that they no longer have to share the same rooms.

He's applying for a loan to buy more merchandise--cell phones, cases, batteries, chargers, etc.--for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Elías D. es casado, su señora se llama Enriqueta Villalba, tienen 3 hijos, dos varones y una mujer. Todos son mayores de edad, ellos trabajan en forma independiente, pero siguen viviendo en la casa con los padres aportando con los ingresos mensuales. El señor Elías vende y repara celulares, ayudado de su esposa. Se inició en la venta con un pequeño capital que obtuvo al vender un terreno de su propiedad en el año 94, posteriormente se capacitó en reparación de celulares, cuya profesión le es muy rentable. Uno de sus proyectos es la de construir más piezas de modo a distribuir mejor la casa ya que viven entre varios en la misma.

Solicita el crédito para comprar mas mercaderías para el negocio, como celulares, estuches para celulares, baterías, cargadores de baterías, etc.

loans.use: Buy mobile phone products for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Sra. Gloria is married to Ramon Baez, 41. The couple have a daughter in primary school. Gloria is the owner of a store where she sells all kinds of everyday products: milk, bread, sugar, flour, and pasta, etc. She set up the business with her savings and the earnings from a previous job where she was a housekeeper. Combined with a loan from a local lender, she then had enough capital to open her store. Gloria's husband, a construction worker, also helps with household expenses. Most of their income goes to daily expenses and profits from the business are partly reinvested in the store and partly in savings.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise at wholesale prices because the store's customer base has grown over the last months; buying wholesae will allow her to increase her margins because she'll be able to get significant discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wisman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Gloria es casada, su marido se llama Ramón Báez que tiene 41 años. La pareja tiene una hija que estudia en la escuela básica. Gloria es dueña de una despensa donde vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como leche, panificados, azúcar, harina, fideos, etc. Ella monto su negocio gracias a un ahorro que fue juntando del salario que obtenía de su anterior trabajo, ella era ama de llaves en una casa de familia. Luego de juntar una buena cantidad más un préstamo que solicito en una financiera de plaza logro juntar el capital suficiente para abrir su despensa. Su marido también aporta con los ingresos de la casa, es constructor de obras. La mayor parte de los ingresos son destinados al consumo diario y las ganancias que genera el negocio los reinvierte en el mismo y ahorra una parte.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar mercaderías en cantidades mayores ya que ha incrementado la cantidad de clientes en los últimos meses; la compra al por mayor también le genera mayor margen de ganancia, pues, comprando al por mayor consigue descuentos importantes.

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale prices for resale.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Sra. Guillermina is married to Sr. Ramon Benitez and they have one 9-year old daughter who is in a local school. Guillermina works as a house cleaner in the mornings and as a street vendor in the afternoon, selling sneakers in different neighborhoods of the city. Guillermina is a dynamic, enterprising young woman. She has a vehicle, bought on consignment, to augment her business and allow her to offer more merchandise.

She's applying for a loan to buy a wider range of sneakers because demand peaks this time of year and sales increase considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Guillermina es casada, su marido es el señor Ramón Benítez, tienen 1 hija de 9 años de edad que estudia en la escuela. Ella trabaja por las mañanas en casas de familia como empleada domestica y por las tardes vende zapatillas de forma ambulante, recorriendo diferentes barrios de la ciudad. Guillermina es una joven dinámica y emprendedora; tiene como consigna adquirir un vehiculo para poder aumentar sus ingresos y así poder vender mas variedad de artículos.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar mas variedad de zapatillas ya que en esta época del año son bastante solicitadas y las ventas aumenta considerablemente.

loans.use: Buy sneakers at wholesale prices for resale.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Sr. Ignacio R., 60, and his wife, Sra. Marcelina Bogado, have three grown children who live with them and help with their father's business. Ignacio is both a merchant and a farmer. He has a farm in Encarnacion, a city 200 kilometers from Ciudad del Este. He cultivates soy beans when conditions allow but it's not an easy business because prices aren't stable and because this area of the country is constantly plagued by drought.

Ignacio decided to open a store to ensure an income for his household but he's still farming. During the planting season, he goes up to Encarnacion, leaving the business in the hands of his wife and children. Ignacio is a dynamic, enterprising man with the drive to get ahead. He's applying for a loan so that he can buy products like flour, milk, fruit, produce, pasta, sugar, etc. for the store at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Ignacio Rodríguez tiene 60 años, casado con la señora Marcelina Bogado, tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que viven con ellos y ayudan con los negocios del padre. El señor Ignacio es comerciante y agricultor a la vez, tiene una finca en Encarnación una ciudad que dista 200 Km. de Ciudad del Este. En esa finca cultiva soja de forma temporal debido a la inestabilidad de los precios y la sequía que azota constantemente en esa zona del país.

Ignacio decidió abrir una despensa, para asegurar los ingresos de la casa, aunque aún sigue cultivando soja en su finca. En las épocas de cosecha, Ignacio viaja hasta Encarnación dejando el negocio a cargo de su esposa e hijos. Ignacio es una persona dinámica, emprendedora y con ganas de superación. El crédito solicitado lo desea invertir en la compra al por mayor de mercaderías para la despensa, tales como harina, leche, frutas, verduras, productos enlatados, fideos, azúcar, etc.

loans.use: Buy flour, milk, fruit, produce, pasta, sugar, etc. for resale.

loans.name: María Segunda

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Segunda is a 67-year-old widow running a small grocery in Carapeguá, Paraguay for the past 20 years. Maria has nine children all of which are now fully grown and independent. Since the death of her husband 15 years ago, Maria has had to work constantly to support and educate her youngest children.

She began her grocery business in her neighborhood in order to compensate for the income lost when her husband died. With much sacrifice and perseverance, she has been able to keep her business moving forward.

Maria has asked for a loan in order to purchase greater quantities of the merchandise she offers in her store. Her primary products include: drinks, rice, noodles, flour and yerba mate.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of the merchandise: drinks, rice, noodles, flour and yerba mate.

loans.name: Myrian

texts.en:
Miryan G. is just 23 years old, living in Carapeguá, Paraguay, with her son of two years of age. Miryan lives with her partner, Oscar Lovera, for the past three years. To ensure a steady income, Miryan sells blankets and hammocks in the artesan market in Asuncion. Oscar also contributes to their small family by working in a company that produces leather. Both work very hard so that they will be able to provide a better life for their son and to also build and furnish their home.

Now, Miryan wishes to buy more of the merchandise to continue her way of life. The items she wishes to buy include: hand-made blouses, mosquito nets and fans. These items have been quite popular and now that the weather is getting warmer, the demand for them has increased. With the credit she receives, she will purchase these items.

loans.use: To buy hand-made blouses, mosquito nets and fans

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda is 42 years old and the mother of two children. Through her life she has conducted herself as a hardworker and a very good traveling salesperson. It's not only important to her that she gains customers, but that she establishes a connection of friendship with each person. Thanks to her friendly service, she was able to enter the market of Huancayo and Jauja where she brings her blankets to sell, offering payment plans to her customers. After a lot of time and many hours of work, she continues to build her business and wants to expand to a new project, buying and selling spare parts with her husband. To begin the construction of this project they need to buy some tools for the first phase. Thanks to his work as a driver, her husband understands the basics of mechanics. With two small children at home, this couple has decided to go after activities which will enable them to improve the quality of life for the family. For that reason, Clorinda is requesting a loan to increase the number of blankets she can offer for sale, growing her income and getting closer to the day when they can construct a small space from which they can sell the spare parts. We count on your kind contributions to help this couple as they continue to work hard to better their lives.

Clorinda tiene 42 años y es una admirable madre de familia que en el transcurso de su vida se ha conducido como una excelente dama trabajadora y una muy buena vendedora ambulante; que más que adquirir clientes se preocupa por entablar lazos de amistad con cada una de las personas que acuden a ella por algún servicio.Gracias a ello pudo ingresar al mercado de Huancayo y Jauja a donde lleva sus frazadas y las comercializa dando facilidades de pagos quincenales a sus clientes.Después de mucho tiempo y de horas interminables de trabajo aún ahora sigue esforzándose con el propósito de trabajar en un nuevo proyecto de compra y venta de repuestos mecánicos en compañía de su querido esposo; para iniciar la construcción de este sueño desean comprarse un torno como herramienta de trabajo como primer paso de implementación ya que gracias a su oficio de chofer tiene conocimientos básicos de mecánica. Contando con dos pequeños en casa esta pareja de esposos ha decidido incursionar en cuanta actividad se les presenta para procurarles bienestar a cada uno de los miembros de su familia.Y es así que Clorinda para seguir con la elaboración de su proyecto y la manutención de su hogar solicita un préstamo con el propósito de incrementar el número de frazadas que ofrece a fin de elevar el nivel de vida de sus queridos hijos y hacer más cercano el día de la construcción del pequeño espacio de ventas de artículos mecánicos.Contamos con vuestra gentil contribución para aminorar la carga de un matrimonio que sigue luchando para establecerse y ubicar una mejor ocupación.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE BLANKETS WHICH SHE SELLS IN THE MARKET, INCREASING HER INCOME AND ALLOWING HER AND HER HUSBAND TO INVEST IN ANOTHER SMALL BUSINESS.

loans.name: Elcira

texts.es:
Elcira is a happy and kind grandmother who is 63 years old. She makes meals for her neighbors, who sit at her modest tables and enjoy her wonderful food everyday. She invests all of her energy in this so that she can proviD. that which is most important to her—the wellbeing of her son and herself.

Thanks to this effort, her son is close to finishing his university degree in pedagogy. However, the little money she makes is not sufficient to support him fully, since she has to deal with market prices, which are rising all the time. For this reason, she wants to increase her number of customers and thereby grow and be able to satisfactorily pay her daily purchases. This would allow her to cover all of her son’s expenses. Let’s contribute to this noble mother’s happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elcira, es una alegre y tierna abuelita D. 63 años, que se dedica a dar pensión a sus vecinos quienes día a día se sientan alrededor D. sus modestas mesitas y prueban su estupenda sazón y sus riquísimos platillos en el que vierte todo su esfuerzo diariamente, para poder cosechar aquello que es más importante para ella, el bienestar D. su hijo y el suyo.Gracias a ese esfuerzo su hijo esta a puertas D. culminar sus estudios superiores D. pedagogía; sin embargo el poco dinero que obtiene no es suficiente para apoyarlo plenamente, ya que tiene que afrontar los precios del mercado, que cada vez son más altos.Es por ello que desea incrementar su clientela y por enD. acrecentar y asumir satisfactoriamente los gastos D. sus compras diarias, que le permitirán cubrir todas aquellas necesidades que tenga su hijo.Contribuyamos con la felicidad D. esta noble madre.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to continue cooking her delicious meals

loans.name: Ernestina Bertha

texts.es:
Ernestina is a diligent mother who takes her products to the city of La Oroya to sell each week. She spends part of the days that she doesn’t travel to La Oroya taking care of the small store she has in her town. Due to the innumerable tasks she has everyday, she begins working very early in the morning, along with her mother who helps her raise her 8 year-old daughter. Ernestina provides for her daughter without the help of the girl’s father, since he decided to abandon her and leave her without any support.

The fact that she does not have her own shop in La Oroya results in her having to pay very high rent. For this reason she would like to get her own shop so that she can work without worries and begin to save and increase her products. She wants to expand and stock her small space with the best products. In this way, she can fully cover the household expenses and give her daughter a good education. Let’s help Ernestina make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ernestina es una diligente madre de familia que se ocupa de llevar sus productos a la ciudad de La Oroya semanalmente, los cuales son infaltables por su atención y simpatía; así mismo dedica parte de los días que no viaja a esta ciudad a la atención de su pequeña tienda que tiene en su localidad. Por el sinnúmero de ocupaciones que tiene diariamente empieza sus labores muy de mañana junto a su madre con quién vive y la apoya en la educación de su hija de 8 años a la que otorga bienestar sin la ayuda de su padre porque decidió abandonarla dejándola sin ningún amparo. La carencia de un local propio en la ciudad que visita periódicamente para ofrecer sus productos le genera una suma de alquiler muy alta y muchas veces poco rentable.Por este motivo desea adquirir un local propio para trabajar tranquilamente y empezar a ahorrar e incrementar sus productos, ampliar y surtir su pequeño espacio de ventas con los mejores productos, de esta manera podrá contribuir con la plena cobertura de los gastos de su hogar y otorgarle una adecuada educación a su pequeña niña quién es su fuente de motivación. Ayudemos a que doña Ernestina haga sus sueño realidad con vuestra colaboración.

loans.use: To buy a small shop space in the city of La Oroya

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is 49 years old and is a hardworking woman who has maD. great sacrifices in order to achieve some assets to support her children. She has dealt with many misfortunes like the abandonment of her eldest daughter's partner and the death of one of her daughter-in-laws (who was a mother, had become a friend, and used to help her in her business of breeding animals). Her goal is to help her children and in turn assist with the welfare of her grandchildren. The shortcomings Victoria and her family have experienced have been endured by their immense effort and purely because of the love she has for her grandchildren and the joy they bring to her. In order to continue supporting her family, and improve the breed of the animals she maintains, she needs to buy her own small corral space, in which she can breed and raise her animals and stop paying a considerable amount of money for the rental corral space she currently uses. Victoria needs your help in order to grow economically and to continue to proviD. for her beloved grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria tiene 49 años y es una mujer empeñosa que con mucho sacrificio pudo alcanzar algunos bienes con los cuales apoya ahora a sus hijos, que tuvieron que afrontar algunas desgracias primero el abandono D. la pareja D. su hija mayor y luego la muerte D. la esposa D. uno D. sus hijos D. los que se ha convertido además D. madre y amiga en socia con el objetivo D. que cada uno D. ellos pueda otorgarle bienestar a sus pequeños niños. Las carencias D. su familia se han visto muy bien copadas por el inmenso esfuerzo D. sus hijos y la alegría que le otorgan sus queridos nietos. Con el objetivo D. seguir otorgándoles bienestar y ayuda a sus hijos e incrementar y mejorar la raza D. los animalitos que alberga en su corral y conjuntamente con ello comprarse o establecer un amplio lugar donD. criarlos para dejar D. pagar una considerable suma D. dinero por el alquiler del espacio que ocupa solicita un préstamo con el que podrá establecer y ambientar un pequeño corral. Victoria requiere D. su colaboración para poder crecer económicamente y convertirse en un sostén para sus nietos que ahora forman parte D. su corazón.

loans.use: To purchase a small corral in which to breed and keep her animals safe, and eliminate corral rental fees

loans.name: Ruth Maribel

texts.es:
Ruth Maribel's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an independent carpenter, didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her little daughter. (Her husband's slow productivity is) due to the fact that sometimes it takes him a while to finish working on a piece of furniture, which results in him being paid later. This was the reason that Ruth decided to start her own business.

In March, 2000, she first started selling beauty products like Avon, Fuller, Jafra and jewelry and nowadays, she sells clothing. She started selling these products to family members, neighbors and friends and then they began recommending her to others.

However, she would like to continue bettering herself (and her business) so her situation will be stable in the future, if something should happen. She is asking for a loan of $375 that she will pay back in 4 months. With this money, Ruth will be able to buy seasonal clothing for men and women, like jackets, sweaters, pants, shirts, etc. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La falta de un trabajo estable por parte mía y la poca productividad del negocio del esposo de Ruth Maribel, quien trabaja como carpintero independiente, no dejaba recursos suficientes como para solventar los gastos del hogar y de su pequeña hija. Todo esto debido a que a veces tardaba mucho en terminar un mueble y esto retardaba el pago, motivo por el cual se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio. En Marzo de 2000, primero comenzó vendiendo productos de belleza como Avon, Fuller, Jafra y joyería, y actualmente ya se dedica a la venta de ropa. Comenzó vendiendo estos productos entre sus familiares, vecinos y amistades y ellos me fueron recomendando más clientes.

Sin embargo ella desea seguir superándose, y así poder estabilizarse en algún momento, actualmente está solicitando un crédito de US $ 375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses. Y con este dinero Ruth podrá comprar, ropa de temporada para dama y caballero, tal como chamarras, sudaderas, pants, suéteres, blusas, pantalones, etc. En tus manos está el poder ayudarle a sacar adelante a su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson Centurión, 39 years old, and his wife Maria Liliana Franco, 27 years old, live and work together in Quiindy, Paraguay. Nelson and his Wife have two children; a boy of 3 and a baby girl, only 2 months old. Maria Liliana is a pharmacist, however she currently works with Nelson in his store and cares for their children. 

Two years ago, Nelson decided to open a hardware store. Before opening the store he worked in a cotton plant. He began the hardware store with his brother. Later the agreement between he and his brother was dissolved and he went on to run the hardware store alone. He has had much success doing so. 

Thanks to his good management techniques and hard work the store has been growing day by day. The credit he has solicited will go toward purchasing large quantities of high-demand items for the store. These include electronics and plumbing supplies.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of  electronics, and plumbing supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
My name is Maria A. and as of 4 years ago, I've I dedicated myself to making and selling tortillas. Sales have improved during these past few months, and that is why I need to produce more in order to grow my inventory. I also need to hire a person who will be dedicated to the distribution of tortillas, now that the demand has increased and I want to keep my customers happy. In my country, tortillas are a main staple in every family's meal. With the money that I make, I am able to sustain my family (my mother and my siblings).

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Me llamo Maria A. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años. En estos ultimos meses la venta de tortillas ha mejorado por lo que ncesito tener mas inventario, tambien necesito contratar 1 persona para la distribucion de las tortillas ya que la demanda es grande y deseo quedar bien con mis clientes, en mi pais la tortilla es uno de los ingredientes necesarios en cada comida. con las ganancias que obtenga poder sostener mi familia (mi madre y hermanos).

loans.use: To purchase cornmeal, salt, matches, water, gas, and coal.

loans.name: Kethy

texts.es:
Ketthy is a strong-will woman who strives each day to reach for her goals. Due to her effort and strength , for the past 8 years she has been able to get the support from her family, especially from her husband who obtained a loan to opened up a hardware store in La Oroya by making deliveries. With time and dedication, the business has grown substantially.

A little while ago, she found a small place that she is now leasing in the city of Huayucachi. Ketthy works the store by herself making sure that all her clients are well-taken care of, and by offering sales/promotions to acquire more clients. Her business is growing due to good customer service.

Thanks to this business, they have been able to support themselves for the past years since there are no formal jobs in this area. She is an obstetrician by profession, but due to the lack of jobs and current circumstances she is unable to exercise her career. Regardless, she has decided to serve her community.

She wishes to open up another store in another nearby location close to her hardware store. This way she can sell more of her products. She is requesting a loan and she promises to repay it by working very hard. She wants to provide a better living condition and happiness to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Ketthy es una mujer valiente que se esfuerza para lograr lo que se ha propuesto de manera decidida; el ahínco y fuerza de su propuesta le ha permitido conseguir beneficios para su familia ya que hace 8 años recibe el apoyo de la familia de su querido esposo con el préstamos de un capital para que se inicie en el negocio de ferretería en La Oroya de manera ambulante; con el transcurrir del tiempo y la dedicación que le otorgó a su labor este negocio ha dado frutos y le ha permitido crecer de manera sostenida. Hace poco se estableció en un pequeño local de la ciudad de Huayucachi donde hasta el día de hoy se desempeña y permanece; Ketthy atiende personalmente en los ambientes de su ferretería y siempre ofrece ofertas y promociones de sus productos para tener más clientes, el buen trato que la caracteriza se ha convertido en un punto a su favor y observa satisfecha que su negocio va en aumento. Gracias a este negocio ella y su familia se han podido sostener durante años y fue una salida favorable ante la escasez de un empleo formal, ya que ella es obstetra de profesión pero debido a la falta de empleo y a las circunstancias no puede ejercer su carrera; sin embargo tiene en mente servir a la comunidad que la alberga y apoyarlos con sus conocimientos. Anhela aperturar una sucursal en otra zona cercana a su ferretería y así incrementar la oferta de sus productos para ello recurre a vuestro generoso corazón y se compromete a seguir trabajando para otorgarles bienestar y alegría a los miembros de su familia.

loans.use: To lease retail space

loans.name: Santa De Jesus

texts.es:
My name is Santa de Jesus A. and I dedicate myself to the sale of consumer goods. I've had my business for 5 years and my son helps me in the store by attending to the customers. Thanks to this loan, I'll be able to grow my business and purchase a refrigerator to store my perishable goods. Right now, I also need to purchase a variety of products in order to meet the demands of my customers. With any profits that I generate, I intend to cover my home's expenses and continue to provide my son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Santa de Jesus A. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes, gracias al prestamo que me otorgaron pude hacer crecer mi negocio y poder comprarme una refrigeradora para mantener mis productos, estos momentos necesito capital para poder comprar mas variedad de productos y asi poder cubrir con la demanda de mis clientes, y con las ganancias que genere deseo cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar y seguir dandole un buen estudio a mi hijo.

loans.use: To purchase products such as cereals, butter, sugar, coffee, rice, soft drinks, sanitary products, batteries, soaps, detergents, vegetables, sweet breads, spices, salt, water, etc. to supplement grocery store supplies

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila owns a small women’s clothing business located at the busy Central Market in Novaya-Kahovka, Ukraine. For many years, her business has provided a source of income to help support her family. Ludmila and her husband, Oleg, have a son and daughter who are now in their twenties. Ludmila first started her business about 15 years ago and has gained much valuable experience as an entrepreneur. She has been an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine for the past four years and has never been late with a loan payment. Ludmila’s strategy is to take a loan four times a year to help purchase new inventory supplies. She has requested a short-term loan of $500 that will help her accomplish this goal and be prepared with new inventory for the upcoming colder season.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en:
Leonid is a very experienced taxi driver who supports himself and his wife, Svetlana, by driving his taxi around the city of Novaya-Kahovka, Ukraine. He has been providing transportation services for over 24 years and is still going strong. Leonid currently drives a Russian-made Lada, one of the most popular car brands from Soviet times. His monthly income is typically around $200.

Leonid would like to continue providing reliable transportation and has requested a loan of $750 to have some work done on his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Leonid as he works hard to make a living.

loans.use: Make repairs to taxi

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is a sharp, young businessman from Nikopol, Ukraine. He owns a profitable business selling clothes and shoes at one of the outdoor markets in Nikopol. Alexei likes to concentrate on clothing that is popular and is not overly expensive. His strategy has been successful. After five years of being in business, he has built up around $3000 in working capital and makes about $400 per month in profit.

Alexei has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase a new supply of inventory for his business. In the future Alexei hopes to expand by opening more sales kiosks. This loan will help him as he continues to develop his business while pursuing long-term goals.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Purificación

texts.en:
Ms. Purificación G. is a 40-year-old mother of four living with her partner, Vidal Cuellar,in Carapeguá, Paraguay. Purificación and her partner have been living together for the past 10 years. Purificación divorced her first husband with whom she has two children. She is now a grandmother, as her oldest daughter now has a child of her own. This is a particularly felicitous event since one of Purification’s own children died within a few months of birth when she was younger. In addition to her partner and youngest child, Purificación also takes care of her aging mother.

For the past 15 years, Purificación has worked in the municipal markets selling new and used clothing. Thanks to this work, she has been able to maintain her family's well-being and also has begun selling other goods in Carapeguá, closer to her home. Her partner, Vidal, is also a vendor and assists her with this work.

loans.use: To purchase new stock of her business including seasonal clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila owns a small market business selling clothing and undergarments at the busy Central Market in Nikopol, Ukraine. Hard-working, consistent and honest, Ludmila has many qualities that have contributed to the success of her business. By selling reasonably priced, quality products that are always in demand, she is able to make a good profit – typically about $400 a month. As a single adult, her business is an important source of income for her. Ludmila has been in business for four years now and would like to grow her enterprise further as she is able. She has requested a loan of $1000 to help purchase new clothing inventory so that she can continue to make good profits, provide for herself, and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mrs. Sara O. is 60 years old and is extremely active living in Acahay, Paraguay. She is a retired teacher, however, she still helps out at the private high school. In addition, Sara also runs her own telephone hub, a store that allows people to use phones to call anywhere they choose for a specific fee. She also makes yogurt and ice cream, which she sells to different companies.

Sara was not able to have her own children, however, she cares for her two nephews as if they are her own. They are her daily inspiration. Sara has had to overcome many obstacles in her life. When she was younger, her mother died so as a teenager, Sara has had to support herself. She was forced to work and study at the same time. During this time, she worked as a domestic servant and studied at night. Thanks to her dedication and intelligence, she was able to receive her teaching degree. This work has supported her for many years.

Her telephone hub is well-equipped and popular in the neighborhood. In addition to this store, Sara owns a van, which she uses to deliver the yogurt and ice cream she makes. Her next goal is to buy some land so that she can open another telephone salon in a new location.

At this time, the loan she is seeking will go towards buying a fax machine.

loans.use: To buy a fax machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a better pen for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
Sr. Octaviano A., 49 years of age, is married to Sr. Hermógena, 42 years of age, together they have two children ages 23 and 13. 
Octaviano is dedicated to selling fresh strawberries from his mobile stand in Aregua, Paraguay. One day he decided to purchase two packages of socks and sell these along with the strawberries. He was able to sell all of the socks by mid-day. Due to his success in selling the socks he decided to take out a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya to buy more merchandise. Octaviano bought: wallets, t-shirts, cell phone cases, watch batteries and of course, more socks. Now, Octaviano is thinking about further expanding his stock. The money he’s earned from these new items has been crucial in increasing quality of life. 
He now hopes to open his own stand rather than having to move around all the time. A kind woman he knows has allowed him to set up his stand on her street. With this added stability Octaviano is able to sell more than ever before.

loans.use: to purchase socks,wallets, t-shirts, cell phone cases, watch batteries

loans.name: Petita

texts.es:
Mrs. Petita and her family dedicate themselves to selling foods and other necessary products out of a small section of her home. She began this business 8 years ago, when she had a little money saved and decided to find a way to help her family with expenses.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase a copier since her small business is across from a school and many people have asked about this service, and which will help to grow her business.

Mrs. Petita is 42 years old, is married and has 3 children. Their home is made of cement. Her plans are to continue to make her business prosperous in order to secure her family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Petita y su familia se dedican a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un local que han adecuado en su casa. Ella comenzo con este negocio hace ocho años cuando con unos ahorros decidio buscar la forma de ayudar en la economia del hogar.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el credito para comprar una copiadora pues como esta su negocio frente a una escuela hay muchos clientes que le han solicitado este servicio y eso le generara otro ingreso para su negocio.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 42 años y tres hijos su esposo le ayuda en el hogar y su casa es de cemento. Sus planes son de hacer prospero su negocio para asi asegurar el futuro de su familia.

loans.use: To buy a copier for use as a service in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for Christmas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for home adaptations and merchandise purchase

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Description of Business

Isidro Daniel and his wife sell basic goods at a store, which is also their home. In addition, he also sells shoes in a nearby city ,and on the weekends, his wife sells sausages and roasted buffalo wings. All of their income from these activities have supported their business's growth.

Use of Loan

He needs the loan to buy more merchandise so he can be well-stocked for the year-end sales when he is very busy.

Personal Details

He is 46 years old and has five children, four of whom are students. His wife takes cares of the cement home they live in. Their plans are to grow and flourish their business so it can secure their family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Isidro Daniel junto con su esposa tiene a la venta productos de primera necesidad en local que acondicionaron en su mismo domicilio. Ademas el vende prendas de vestir como zapatos en una ciudad cercana y su esposa los fines de semana vende embutidos y alitas de pollos asados, todos estos ingresos han hecho que el negocio de ellos crezca.

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el credito para adquirir mas mercaderia y asi estar abastecido para la temporada de fin de año donde se vende mucho mas.

Información Personal

El tiene 46 años y cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro estudian su esposa le ayuda en el hogar y su casa es de cemento. Sus planes son de hacer prospero su negocio para asi asegurar el futuro de su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Sra. Hilaria R., 34 years old, is married to Sr. Hermenegildo Barreto, 49 years old. Together, they have three children - one girl, 14 years old, and two boys, eight and four years old, respectively.

Before obtaining her first loan from the Fundación, Hilaria worked in a local supermarket chain. In this position, she earned very low wages. After gaining experience by working in a retail setting, Hilaria, decided to open her own store. She decided to sell household items, such as cooking utensils and glasses, as well as some clothing, towels and other daily necessities.

Her first loan with the Fundacion went toward helping her acquire these things. Her current loan will allow her to begin construction on a store. With her own location, Hilaria hopes to establish a regular client base and continue to grow her business.

Hilaria is very grateful for the help the Fundación has given her. In the future, Hilaria will take classes to become a hairdresser and eventually expand her store to include this service as well.

loans.use: To invest in the construction of a room

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro O. Gómez is 45 years old and married to Petrona Rodríguez Morales. They have four children: three boys and one girl, all of whom are enrolled in school.

Teodoro has worked in agriculture since the age of ten. He and his family live on their own land where they cultivate crops and care for two cows and two oxen. He is also a member of a musical group that performs on the weekends.

He is requesting this loan to buy more land in order to cultivate more crops and increase his production and income. With an increase in earning potential, he hopes to improve his family’s quality of life. He is a client with great personal references and possesses a strong work ethic. With this loan, he plans to increase his production of sesame and cotton.

loans.use: To buy more land

loans.name: Aldo

texts.en:
Aldo is 27 and single. He learned how to be a tailor from his father and worked with whom he worked for many years. He is an extremely dedicated and hard-working young man; he works as a tailor during the day and at night attends the University of Paraguay where he studies Administrative Sciences. He is currently completing his third year.

Two years ago, Aldo opened his own tailor shop and now works independently. Today, he is passing on the trade to the next generation. His two children work and assist him in the tailor shop.

With the micro-credit loan, he plans to buy a sewing machine. Since he has a high level of demand with established clients, he needs to be able to produce large quantities of clothing in short time spans. This is a goal that will be made possible with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Aydee Jeremías

texts.es:
Aydee is a strong-will woman. This is why she has become one of the best embroiderers in her area.

She started doing this when a friend asked her to join one of the local groups where they export their work to other countries. She decided to join this group and she has been doing embroideries ever since. She is very happy doing what she loves to do.

With this job, she is able to help the family financially. Even though, it's a seasonal job since there is some time during the year that embroideries are not very sought after. Regardless, she dedicates her time all throughout the year to make the best embroideries so that she can sell them during the religious holidays in her area such as Fiesta de Santiago. This is when the demand is very high for her beautiful embroideries since they're very high-quality.

She wishes to continue working in this type of art taking advantage of the fact that there's a lot of tourism in the area where she lives. She is always striving to provide a much better quality on each of her work of art. She needs to increase her income since now she has more bills to pay due to the fact that her 2 daughters are going to school, and she is recuperating from a recent surgery. But this doesn't stop her in anyway because she is full of strength and can't wait to get back to her daily work.

She's asking each one of you to loan a little bit so that she can use this loan to increase the quality and variety of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Aydee es una mujer valiente y fuerte, es precisamente estas características las que en poco tiempo la han convertido en una de las mejores bordadoras de su localidad. Incursiona en esta actividad a raíz de que una de sus amigas la anima a integrarse a un grupo que realizaba este trabajo bordando túnicas para su exportación y es así que decide iniciar su travesía y hasta el día de hoy dedica su tiempo al desempeño de esta labor y se siente muy feliz por hacer lo que le agrada. Este trabajo le permite generar aportes para incrementar su economía familiar por temporadas ya que existen épocas del año en las que el trabajo de bordados es escaso; sin embargo durante todo el año se dedica pacientemente a elaborarlas para ofrecerlas durante la fiesta de santiago que es una celebración nativa de la zona que habita y cuando mayor demanda de sus hermosas piezas tiene por la calidad de sus trabajos. Desea seguir incursionando en la artesanía y en la fabricación de mates burilados aprovechando que la zona en la que radica tiene mucha afluencia turística y es por ello que está en constante capacitación con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de cada uno de sus trabajos ya que necesita incrementar su economía debido a que ahora tiene mayores gastos, sus dos hijas están estudiando y se está recuperando de una reciente operación a la que fue sometida y a pesar de este último hecho está recuperando sus fuerzas y desea incorporarse pronto a sus labores cotidianas. Para reunir el préstamo que solicita recurre a cada uno de ustedes a fin de obtener respuesta para pronto incrementar la calidad y variedad de sus productos.

loans.use: To increase the quality and varierty of embroideries

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.en:
Maria and Robert are married with two children. Togther they run a Kiosk while their children attend school.

Maria learned all about running a Kiosk from her mother at an early age and when she married Robert she decided to start her own business with the financial backing of her family and husband.

With the micro-credit loan Maria plans to increase the amount of goods she has in stock. With greater quantities of oil, sugar, pasta and flour she will be able to meet the demands of her clients and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase oil, sugar, pasta and flour

loans.name: Martín

texts.en:
Martin is 47 years old and lives at home to care for his mother. He is responsible for the familial income. He has a small farm dedicated to the production and selling of milk. He is an incredibly hard worker and wakes up before sunrise everyday to milk and care for the cows. Afterwards he uses his horse-drawn cart to deliver his milk products to the clients. In the afternoon he feed his cows and works in his garden where he grows food products for self-consumption. He also uses part of his land to cultivate sugar cane for the market.

With this loan he plans to buy a milking machine that can milk 5 cows at once. This will ease his work load while helping him better his production.

loans.use: Purchase a milking machine

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
Julia is 48 years old and lives in Puerto Malabrigo in the district of Rázuri, in the province of Ascope, the department of La Libertad. She has three children, none of whom live with her as all of them are adults, and they help her cover some of her expenses. Julia completed secondary school.

Before becoming a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas,” she depended solely on the money that her husband earned at his job. With the first loan of 300 soles (approximately $100) that she received, she asked her daughter to send her costume jewelry from Lima and she began to sell them as a street vendor in all of Paiján. Later with her earnings and with other loans that she received from the Communal Bank she bought a larger quantity of jewelry, as well as men’s clothing and women’s lingerie. She rents a stall in the Tambo D. Piján market and is dedicated to the sale of her products.

Due to the death of her husband, she returned to live in Puerto Malabrigo. She now has put a small shop in her house and, in addition, when she travels to Lima to buy merchandise she brings some products such as “King Kones” and shoes to sell to her suppliers.

With the loan of 2,000 soles (approximately $667) that she receives from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in four months, she will be able to reinitiate this new business and supply the store. She dreams of buying a store in a mall.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Julia tiene 48 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Pto. Malabrigo en el Distrito D. Rázuri en la Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene 3 hijos, ninguno depenD. D. ella, ya son mayores D. edad y le ayudan a cubrir algunos gastos. La señora Julia estudió secundaria completa.

Antes D. ingresar al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” ella dependía sólo del dinero que ganaba su esposo en el trabajo, con el primer préstamo que recibe D. S/.300 ($ 100 aprox.) le piD. a su hija que le envíe D. Lima joyas D. fantasía y empieza a venderlas como ambulante en todo Paiján, posteriormente con sus ganancias y con los otros préstamos que recibe en su Banco Comunal compró mayor cantidad D. joyas así como ropa D. hombre y ropa interior D. dama, alquila un puesto en el mercado el Tambo D. Piján y se dedica a la venta D. sus productos.

Debido a que falleció su esposo regresó a vivir al Puerto Malabrigo, ahora ha puesto un pequeño bazar en su casa pero además cuando viaja a Lima a comprar mercadería lleva algunos productos D. la zona como king kones y zapatos para venderlos a sus proveedores.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,000.00 ($ 667 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, podrá re-iniciar este nuevo negocio y surtir el bazar. Sueña con comprar una tienda en un centro comercial.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
Maria is 51 years old and lives in the Paijan District, Province of Ascope, Department of Liberty. She has 4 children but only one of them depends on her support. Maria attended school and completed her studies through high school. Ever since she was young, she loved business, and began her first business by selling beauty products. With her earnings, she was able to sell soft drinks, beer, empanadas (meat pastries) and candies, etc., out of her home.

One of her aunts invited her to become involved with the United Hands Community Bank (Banco Comunal Manos Unidas), where she received her first loan of approximately $100 USD. With this loan she was able to begin selling foods, soups, etc. She also used part of the money to buy rice and cooking oil to supplement her grocery items.

Now she is requesting this loan, which will bring approximately $333 USD, and which will be repaid within 6 months. She'll use this money to buy other grocery items like: chocolates, yogurt, milk, etc. to supplement her grocery store inventory.

Maria dreams about travelling outside of her country, and also of starting her own creole restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María tiene 51 años de edad, actualmente vive en el Distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope, Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 4 hijos, solo uno depende de ella. La señora María estudió secundaria completa. Desde muy pequeña le gustó el negocio, empezó vendiendo productos de belleza y con las ganancias que obtenía puso en su casa una mesa pequeña para vender gaseosas, cervezas, empanadas, caramelos, etc. Una tía la invitó a integrar el Banco Comunal Manos Unidas y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 ($ 100 aprox.) comenzó a vender comida (shambar, caldos, etc.). y otra parte del dinero lo utilizó para comprar arroz y aceite para continuar implementando su bodega. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000.00 ($ 333 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará otros como: chocolates, yogurt, leche, para surtir un poco más su bodega La señora María sueña con ir a pasear al extranjero y también con poner un restaurante para vender comida criolla.

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items such as:  chocolate, yogurt, milk, etc. to supplement her store and continue to grow her business.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila is a married woman with three children whose husband is a truck driver. However, in spite of that, his job is very tiring, it keeps him away from home, and he makes very little money. In addition, he is losing a lot of time that he could spend with his children and attend their events at school. Domitila isn't defeated by this obstacle and always tries to raise her children well and continue moving forward. Therefore, she looked for a job that wouldn't take her out of the house all day so she could be with her children so they wouldn't feel so alone and so at the same time, she could make some money. This was how she started to sell shoes from a catalog. Little by little, she has been looking for new customers so that she can contribute to the expenses in the absence of her husband.

Lately, the situation in her house has become very difficult because her husband's trips have been longer, keeping him away from home for longer periods of time. Because of this, she had to use her earnings to feed her children and today she has no money to be able to restock with new products to sell. Therefore, Domitila is asking for a loan of $375 that she will pay back in in 6 months. She will use this money to buy merchandise for the winter season. WIth your help, Domiltila will be able to help her family during this time of need.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Domitila, es una mujer casada y con tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer de trailer, sin embargo a pesar de que el trabajo de su esposo es muy desgastante y se la pasa fuera de la casa, el dinero que gana es muy poco, además de que pierde todos esos momentos que pudiera pasar con sus hijos, y asistir a sus eventos escolares. Domitila no se deja vencer por este obstáculo y siempre trata de sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo tanto buscó un trabajo que no le quitara todo el día, para poder convivir con sus hijos y no se sientan tan solos, y obtener ganancias al mismo tiempo, así fue como comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, y poco a poco a ido buscando nuevas clientas, para que ella pueda aportar a los gastos que suceden en ausencia del esposo.

Estos últimos días, la situación en su casa se a vuelto muy difícil, porque los viajes de su esposo se hicieron más lejos y los días que se queda fuera del hogar son más. Así que tuvo que utilizar sus ganancias para darle de comer s sus hijos y hoy no tiene dinero para poder surtir nuevos productos que ofrecer, Por lo tanto Domitila está solicitando un crédito de US $ 375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y ese dinero utilizarlo para comprar mercancía para la temporada de invierno. Con tu ayuda Domitila podrá sacar adelante a su familia de esta temporada de escasez.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Azucena Maritza

texts.es:
Sra. Azucena is 35 years old. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad and has 5 children, all of whom live with her. She was only able to finish elementary school.

Azucena used to make a living only from farming and raising animals but thanks to an initial loan from Manuela Ramos, through the "Mujeres con Futuro" (Women With Futures) community bank, of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100), she started another business making, buying and selling cheese and buying and selling milk. She bought the cheese from producers in nearby towns and sold it in the city of Trujillo. With her earnings and other loans, she bought some calves and other animals, like pigs and sheep, the meat of which she sold with the cheese.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.2,000 (about US$667), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy pigs that she will fatten for end-of-year celebrations along with feed for the pigs.

Sra. Azucena dreams of seeing her children in professional careers despite the lack of opportunities for them in this part of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Azucena tiene 35 años de edad, actualmente vive en el caserío Quiñigón que pertenece al distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 5 hijos, todos dependen de ella. La señora Azucena estudió solo primaria completa.

Antes se dedicaba solo a la agricultura y a criar algunos animales, pero gracias al primer préstamo que le brindó el Movimiento Manuela Ramos en el Banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro de S/. 300.00 soles ($ 100 aprox.) inició otro negocio que es la elaboración y compra - venta de quesillo y la compra - venta de leche. Los quesillos los compra en diferentes caseríos de Mache y Salpo y los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Trujillo, con sus ganancias y con los otros préstamos que recibió se compró algunas vaquitas, también tiene otros animales como cerdos y ovejas; junto con los quesillos lleva a vender la carne de cerdo y carnero.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.2000.00 soles ($ 667 aprox.) el mismo que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará cerdos para engordar para las fiestas de fin de año y otra parte lo utilizará para comprar alimento para sus animales.

La señora Azucena sueña con ver a todos sus hijos profesionales aunque duda que esto llegue a pasar porque no hay muchas oportunidades en esta parte de la sierra.

loans.use: Buy live pigs and feed for farming business.

loans.name: Narcisa Idelsa

texts.es:
Sra. Narcisa is 70 years old and lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She has 5 children, only one of whom--a son who works--lives with her. Sra. Narcisa finished three years of high school.

Thanks to a niece who showed her the ropes, Sra. Narcisa started a business selling roasted meats as often in the city of Trujillo as in her own town of Mache. Once she learned the business, she joined the "Mujeres con Futuro" (Women With Futures) community bank because she needed new funds to support the business. The bank gave her an initial loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) which she used to buy and sell cheese, a product that her customers demanded. She also subsequently added sales of pork meat.

With her own earnings and other loans from the community bank, she set up a small store in her house where she works most days so she only has to travel out to sell her products once a week now.

The recently-granted loan of S/.1,000 (about US$333) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 4 months, will be used to buy merchandise like writing supplies and lamps for the store. Sra. Narcisa dreams of having a large store with a range of products so that she can earn her living solely from it and give up the weekly trips to Mache to sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Narcisa tiene 70 años D. edad, actualmente vive en el distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco, Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene 5 hijos, solo uno vive con ella pero él trabaja. La señora Narcisa estudió hasta el tercer año D. secundaria.

La Señora Narcisa empezó con un pequeño negocio gracias a su sobrina quien le facilitaba carne D. res para vender tanto en Mache como en Trujillo así fue aprendiendo el negocios por eso es que se animó a participar del Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro” y también porque cada vez tenía mayor número D. clientes y necesitaba mayor capital. En el Banco Comunal obtuvo un primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $100) con el que se inició en la compra y venta D. quesillos debido a que sus clientes también pedían ese producto, posteriormente también incrementó su negocio con la venta D. carne D. cerdo.

Con lo que ganaba en este negocio y con los otros préstamos que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal fue implementando una pequeña bodega en su casa a la cual también se dedica ya que viaja a vender sus productos sólo una vez a la semana.

El reciente préstamo que obtuvo D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000.00 ($. 333 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, será utilizado para comprar productos como útiles D. escritorio y lámparas para surtir más su bodega. La señora Narcisa sueña con tener una tienda granD. con variedad D. productos para dedicarse solo a ella y dejar D. viajar a vender fuera D. Mache.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es:
Pedro Francisco is a man who struggles to take care of his wife and his little daughter who is only 2 years old and who needs a prosperous future. Everything started 4 years ago, when Pedro was let go from his job. Pedro was desperate because he couldn’t find a job – but he began to see a way in which he could take care of himself and his wife. After thinking a long time about a suitable business, he heard that in Leon, Guanajuato, they sell inexpensive, but good quality shoes. So with the little money that he had left from when he was let go, he embarked upon a new venture and bought shoes to sell outside of his neighborhood.

It was in this manner that little by little he established himself and today he has a daughter for whom he constantly struggles to get ahead. Because of the change of the seasons, Pedro is asking for a loan of $375 that he will pay back over a term of 6 months. With this money he is able to stock up for the Christmas season. The ability to help Pedro is in your hands, so that he can buy a small gift for his daughter that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro Francisco, es un hombre que lucha por sacar adelante a su esposa y a su pequeña jiha de tansolo dos años, quien necesita de un fururo próspero. Todo comenzó hace cuatro años, cuando despiden a Pedro, y desesperado porque no encontraba trabajo comenzó a ver la manera en que él pudiera sacar adelate a el y a su esposa, después de pensar un largo tiempo en el negocio idóneo, le comentan que en León Guanajuato venden zapatos de buena calidad y económicos, y se lanzó con el poco dinero que le había quedado de su despido. Y compró zapatos para vender fuera de su colonia.

Así poco a poco fue estableciendose. Y hoy tiene una hija por quien lucha constantemente para salir adelante. Debido a que es cambio de temporada Pedro está solicitando un crédito de US $ 375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dienro poder surtir para la época navideña. En tus manos está en ayudarle paraque Pedro pueda comprarle un pequeño regalo a su hija que tanto quiere.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana is a woman with a whole lot of dreams to move ahead and each day she works hard by doing her best embroidery for each of her clients who are repeat customers. She has been doing this for many years since she was a little girl. Her mother taught her the art of embroidery in her home land of Huancavelica. She now lives with her husband in Huari where they bought a piece of land. She works while taking care of her two daughters who give her all the motivation to move up ahead. This is why she works very hard so that one day her daughters can have an education and a place they can call their own.

It takes her approx. 40 days to do each embroidery since it requires a lot of dedication and a keen eye for color coordination to make sure that the needlework is perfect and to make sure everything is done on time for delivery.

She will continue to work with the sole purpose to provide a better future for her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more color thread and fabrics, the basic components to make her embroideries. Let's support this young mother who works hard to keep her dreams alive in her mind and in her heart.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Feliciana es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación en mente y cada día trabaja por ofrecer lo mejor de su arte a su clientela que le extiende muy a menudo sus solicitudes de bordado; lleva dedicándose a este arte muchos años desde su niñez, debido a que su madre le enseñó a bordar en su tierra natal de Huancavelica y hoy que radica en Huari desde que se unió a su pareja y compró un terreno sigue trabajando en esta actividad.Todo este trabajo lo realiza en bien de sus dos hijas que día a día la motivan a seguir adelante, es por ello que su esfuerzo se hará constante con el propósito de lograr habilitar su casa y que sus pequeñas que aún estudian en un pequeño nido de su localidad puedan acceder en el futuro a una educación de calidad.Ella realiza sus bordados que en promedio duran alrededor de 40 días ya que son trabajos que requieren de mucha dedicación y buena vista para combinar de manera exitosa los colores de los hilos así como el de algunas aplicaciones como lentejuelas a cada fustán que confecciona y borda para realizar su entrega de manera oportuna a quienes le solicitaron el pedido.Seguirá trabajando arduamente con el objetivo de forjar un futuro prometedor para su familia y por eso solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas, insumos básicos para realizar sus bordados.Apoyemos a esta joven madre a seguir esforzándose por un noble deseo que atesora en su mente y corazón..

loans.use: To purchase more thread and fabrics

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
Maria Yolanda Martinez is a mother of 4 small children whose husband works for a man that sells display cases. His job, however, doesn’t provide enough income in order to feed them.

Things are getting worse as the children have been growing and have more needs, like clothes and shoes that no longer fit – in addition to school supplies that each time are growing more expensive. Due to this problem, she started to make handcrafted items to sell to her friends. However, she wasn’t making enough income to maintain her home, and therefore she started to sell fruits and vegetables out of her house for people in her neighborhood.

This is how, little by little and with a lot of heart, she is raising her children. However, the current situation is actually very difficult, since her husband hasn’t had many sales and there are still household expenses to take care of. In addition, the sales she’s had from her business have left her without any product and she needs to restock to be able to sell more. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $375 to pay over a term of 6 months. With your help, Maria Yolanda will be able to raise her children, while stabilizing her business and the job of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

María Yolanda M., es una madre de familia, de 4 pequeños hijos, y su esposo trabaja para un señor que vende vitrinas, y el trabajo no le deja suficiente como para sacar para comer. Las cosas se fueron empeorando en medida que los hijos iban creciendo y teniendo más necesidades como de ropa, los zapatos que no les quedaba, y lo útiles de la escuela que cada vez que van creciendo son más caros. Y debido a ese problema comenzó a hacer manualidades para venderlas entre sus amigas, sin embargo esto no le dejaba suficientes recursos para poder mantener el hogar, y por lo tanto empezó a vender frutas y verduras en su casa, para que los de la colonia le compren.

Así es como poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo a sacado a sus hijos adelante. Sin embargo la situación que está pasando actualmente es muy difícil, puesto que uno de su esposo no a tenido muchas ventas y en su casa los gastos no dejan de parar y las ventas que a tenido en el negocio se le fueron totalmente y necesita volver a surtirlo para poder vender más. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda María Yolanda, podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos, mientras se estabiliza su negocio y el trabajo de su esposo.

loans.use: To buy material and merchandise

loans.name: Nancy Soledad

texts.es:
Nancy is a young woman with many hopes of succeeding, and the great strength that she possesses has allowed her to overcome each and every one of the economic difficulties that her family has had to face. She is the youngest of 7 siblings, and her already elderly parents couldn't continue supporting her. This is why she has become the main source of support in her house, and she had to postpone her dream of becoming a great professional for awhile. Her wish is to have a career after finishing her secondary studies, and this is what drove her to work in a shop that manufactures sweaters, where she offers her sewing services. She works every day from very early to very late and is one of the most outstanding workers in the shop. Nancy is very happy because this work that she does lets her save to be able to start studying at the university in her beautiful city. Nancy hopes to continue supporting her parents and to support her studies, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $200 to invest in a small sewing shop in her parents' home. This is how she will have extra income and will be able to increase the quality of life of her beloved parents. Let's support this young talent with a promising future. She is thankful for your anticipated attention and will.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy es una joven con muchos deseos de superación y la gran fortaleza que posee le ha permitido sobrepasar todas y cada una de las dificultades de escasez económica que ha tenido que afrontar con su familia, ella es la menor de 7 hermanos y sus padres ya ancianos no pudieron seguir apoyándola y en la actualidad debido a esta razón se ha convertido en el principal sostén de su casa, por lo que tuvo que postergar por un tiempo su sueño de convertirse en una gran profesional.Su deseo de ocuparse en alguna actividad tras terminar sus estudios secundarios la condujeron a trabajar en un taller de fabricación de chompas ofreciendo sus servicios de costura, diariamente trabaja desde muy temprano y ahora es una de las trabajadoras que más destaca en el taller, Nancy está muy contenta por La labor que realiza y esto le permite ahorrar para poder empezar a estudiar una carrera profesional en la universidad de su bella ciudad.Nancy desea seguir apoyando a sus padres y sostener sus estudios es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares para invertirlos en la implementación de un pequeño taller de costura en casa de sus padres, de esta manera podrá tener un ingreso extra y podrá elevar el nivel de vida de sus queridos progenitores.Apoyemos a este joven talento con un futuro prometedor, ella agradece por anticipado tu atención y disposición.

loans.use: Implementation of a small sewing shop in her home

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a native of this area and decided to stay in her birthplace to establish a home and to raise her kids with her husband, her faithful lifelong companion. As a fruit of their great love, they have 10 kids and have always worked together to offer them well-being and to satisfy their needs through farming the land. They have done this work for years as an inheritance from and for the legacy of their parents. Even today they do this exhausting and noble labor to increase their quality of life now that each of their children has left their modest home to pursue other activities and to proviD. their own families with well-being. With the immense desire of progress in each of their minds, each of them has decided to increase the variety of their products this harvest season with wheat and barley because these require less investment and greater profit. In previous years, there were considerable losses because of the terrible cold that whipped their fields and didn't let them make any profits. As a result of this event, Florencia got sick and needs to undergo a costly medical treatment. This is why they are determined to increase their strengh and products with the objective of obtaining quick results and a lot of happiness. Let's give our support to this noble request so Florencia can recuperate her health, well-being, and much happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Florencia es natural D. la zona y decidió quedarse en su tierra natal para establecer un hogar y hacer crecer a sus hijos junto a su esposo, su compañero fiel D. toda su vida, fruto del gran amor que se tienen nacieron sus 10 hijos y siempre han trabajado juntos para ofrecerles bienestar y satisfacer sus necesidades mediante el cultivo D. la tierra a la cual se dedican por años como herencia y legado D. sus padres.Hasta el día D. hoy desempeñan esta agotadora y noble labor para incrementar su nivel D. vida ya que cada uno D. sus hijos migró D. su modesto nido para desempeñarse en otras actividades a fin D. otorgarles bienestar a sus propias familias.Con los inmensos deseos D. progreso en mente ambos han decidido que en esta época D. siembra incrementarán la variedad D. sus productos con el trigo y la cebada por la oportunidad que les ofrece porque requieren D. una menor inversión y otorgan una mayor ganancia.En años anteriores hubo pérdidas considerables por el terrible frío que azotó sus campos D. cultivo y no le permitieron obtener ganancias; a raíz D. este acontecimiento Florencia enfermó y necesita someterse a un costoso tratamiento médico por eso es que están decididos a incrementar sus fuerzas y productos con el objetivo D. obtener muy pronto buenos resultados y muchas alegrías.Solidaricémonos con esta noble petición para que pronto Florencia recupere su salud, bienestar y mucha felicidad.

loans.use: Increase of capital to grow wheat and barley

loans.name: Josefina Salomé

texts.es:
Josefina Salome is mother to 6 children. The youngest is in kindergarten and the two oldest are married. Her husband works as a bricklayer, but this profession leaves people without work for long periods of time. This is why Josefina, thinking about making sure that nothing is missing in their home and that their children are able to study (something she always wanted to do but her family wouldn't allow her to do because of lack of money), she started an elote (corn on the husk) stand outside of her own house, and little by little, because of the great taste, she built up a clientele until she had enough money to buy a cart.

With the experience she now has, Josefina is requesting a loan for $375 to be paid over a 6-month period, to buy another cart so her husband can sell in a different part of their neighborhood and take advantage of the high sales of elotes in this season. Buying another cart will let this family expand the little business that with so much effort they have managed to create. In your hands you have the ability to help this poor family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Josefina Salomé es madre de 6 hijos, el más pequeño está en el kinder, y los dos mayores están casados, su esposo trabaja como albañil, pero esta profesión deja desempleado a las personas por largas temporadas. Por lo tanto Josefina pensando en que no les falte nada en el hogar y que sus hijos puedan estudiar, algo que ella siempre quiso hacer pero su familia no la dejó por falta de dinero, puso un puesto de elotes en las afueras de su casa, y poco a poco y con mucho sazón, fue haciéndose de clientes hasta que logró juntar dinero para comprar un carretón.

Con la experiencia que ahora tiene Josefina, está solicitando un crédito de $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, para poder comprar otro carretón, y que su esposo lo atienda para que surta en otro lado de la colonia, y así aprovechar lo mucho que se venden los elotes en esta temporada. Comprar otro triciclo logrará que esta familia vaya creciendo su pequeño negocio que con mucho esfuerzo han logrado sacar adelante. En tus manos está el poder ayudarle a esta pobre familia que desea salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying a cart to sell in a different zone

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es:
Aniceta is married and has three children (all of them married already), but her husband works as a Laborer, and doesn't earn sufficient income in order to keep the household. This is why Aniceta decided to begin selling clothing outside her home, and little by little her clientele grew. Today she has a clothing stand in a small market close to her home.

Unfortunately her house expenses are such that what she earns goes directly to paying electricity and water, among many other expenses. Today, she is requesting a loan of $375 USD, which she will pay within 6 months, and which she'll use to purchase clothing to sell during the cold season. With your help, this couple will overcome the economic problems they are experiencing.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Aniceta, está casada y tiene tres hijos, todos casados ya, pero el esposo trabaja aun como Obrero, y no recibe suficientes ingresos como para mantener el hogar. Así que Aniceta decidió comenzar a vender ropa a las afueras de su hogar, poco a poco fue incrementando su clientela y hoy ya tiene un puesto en un mercadito cercano a su casa.

Pero los gastos en el hogar son tales, que lo que gana se va directo al pago de la luz, el agua entre tantas otras cosas. Por lo tanto hoy está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así poder comprar pacas de ropa para tener qué vender en la temporada de frío. Con tu ayuda colaborarás a que este matrimonio supere esos problemas económicos que tienen.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the winter season

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha M. C. has a general store, which she was able to establish thanks to the help of her sister who lends her the locale. Martha has two children and her husband is also a merchant. Martha decided to start her business because her husband's income was only enough to pay the household expenses and to eat. However, Martha strongly believes that education is the basis of success, and so she opened her general store to pay for her children's education.
