Currently, her daughter is in nursing school, a very nice profession. However, the cost of her school and the high school in which her son is studying is very high, so a portion of her income goes directly to these expenses, and the inventory of her store is affected by these expenses.

Thus, Martha is requesting a loan of US $925, to be paid over a 6-month period, to be able to buy more merchandise to sell in her store and to expand the locale so her clients can find everything better organized. With your help you will make it possible for Martha's daughter to become a good nurse and for her son to finish high school. Thank you!

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Martha M. C., tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que logró poner gracias a la ayuda de su hermana que le presta el local. Martha tiene con dos hijos, y su esposo es también es comerciante. La Manera en que Martha decidió iniciar el negocio es porque lo que gana su esposo sólo alcanzaba para pagar los gastos del hogar y para comer. Sin embargo Martha cree fielmente que el estudio es la base de la superación, por lo tanto, ella abrió tu tienda de abarrotes para pagarle los estudios a sus hijos. Actualmente su hija está estudiando enfermería, una profesión muy bonita, sin embargo los gastos de su escuela y de la preparatoria que está estudiando su hijo son muy altos, por lo tanto mucha parte de las ganancias que recibe se van directo a los gastos de los hijos, y el surtido de la tienda se ve afectado en los gastos.

Por lo tanto Martha está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses para poder comprar más mercancía para vender en su tienda. Y ampliar el local para que sus clientes encuentren todo más ordenado. Con tu ayuda lograrás a que la hija de Martha pueda ser una enfermera de bien, y su hijo pueda terminar la preparatoria. ¡Gracias!

loans.use: Expand her locale and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Victor Ismael

texts.es:
Victor Ismael, aside from having a general store minded by his wife, is a cab driver and while he drives around, she is at home at the general store. This all started when their little girl was born. She suffered of many illnesses and the hospital expenses were very high. What he made as a cab driver was not enough to pay for al the expenses. Because of this, they started buying a little bit of merchandise to sell at their neighborhood and so they grew their business little by little.

Currently, they are thinking of expanding their little general store, and so they are requesting a loan of US $575 to be paid over a period of 6 months. With this money they will be able to buy more merchandise and offer more variety to their clients, who request more products depending on their needs. With your help you will allow this family to succeed, and that their efforts to improve are not brought to an end.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Victor Ismael, además de tener un puesto de abarrotes que atiende su esposa, es taxista y mientras él se la pasa en sus recorridos ella se encentra en su casa con la tienda de abarrotes. Todo comenzó desde que nació su pequeña hija, la cual padeció de muchas enfermedades, y los gastos del hospital eran muchos. Y lo que ganaba en el taxi no alcanzaba para pagar todos los gastos. Por lo tanto comenzaron por comprar poca mercancía para vender a los de su colonia, y así fue creciendo poco a poco su negocio.

Actualmente, están pensando en agrandar su pequeño local de abarrotes, por lo tanto están solicitando un crédito de US $ 575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con ese dinero poder comprar más mercancía para ofrecer una mejor variedad a sus clientes. Quienes dependiendo a sus necesidades solicitan más productos. Con tu ayuda lograrás que esta familia salga adelante, y su esfuerzo de superarse no se vea truncado.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Claudia Hilda

texts.es:
Claudia Hilda is married and her husband works as a mechanic. She has three children whom she adores, but they had started to grow and their clothes did not fit them anymore. Since she didn't have money to buy new clothes, she decided to sell her children's clothes to make money to buy them clothes that would fit. She realized that she could make money from selling clothes, so she bought used clothes from other people to resell . After some time she started new clothes, which also sell well. She currently has a stand at a market close to her house.

However, she needs to invest in clothes for the coming winter season, so that people who are looking for gifts can come to her, and so that her household is not missing anything. Claudia needs a loan of US $475 to be paid over a period of 6 months. With your help, Claudia will be able to continue her daily business and increase her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Claudia Hilda está casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico, tiene tres hijos que son su adoración, pero estos comenzaron a crecer y la ropa ya no les quedaba, pero como no tenía dinero para comprar ropa nueva decidió irse a vender la ropa de sus hijos y así sacar dinero para comprarles ropa que les quedara, comenzó a ver que sí podía sacar dinero en la venta de ropa así que compró ropa usada de otras personas y las revendía. Y después de un tiempo empezó a meter poca ropa nueva que ve que también se está empezando a vender. Actualmente tiene un local en un mercado cercano a su casa.

Sin embargo necesita invertir en ropa nueva de temporada de invierno, para que las personas que anden buscando un regalo puedan ir con ella, y así en su casa nos les faltará nada. Claudia necesita un préstamo de US $ 475 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Claudia podrá emprender un negocio diario y tener nuevos clientes a los que ella ya tiene.

loans.use: Buying clothes to sell for winter.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Thomasa is involved in a personal struggle to move her life forward, and today she is realising her dream with the help of her husband, who has always helped her in everything she does and with the things she likes, namely decoration. Ever since she was small she used to draw attention to the arrangement that were made for weddings and girls’ fifteenth birthday parties that she used to attend.

After her marriage, they asked her to be to be the “protector of the wine glass” (a Mexican wedding tradition). She decorated the cup and they liked it some much that the people ordered one for the following month. Her business thus grew by word of mouth and as a result of the good work she delivered, she began to have more and more customers.

Unfortunately, this business is seasonal, and at the moment it has been a long time since any orders were placed and as a result she withdrew capital from the business. However, she has just received an order and as a result she needs a loan in order to be able to push forward and return to the business with greater force. Tomasa needs a credit of $750 USD which she intends to pay back within six months. With your help Tomasa will be able to buy more and better quality merchandise in order to be able to offer her products at a price which will provide her with greater profits and as a result her house will no longer lack anything.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Tomasa lucha por sí misma, para salir adelante, y hoy ve realizado su sueño, con ayuda de su esposo, quien siempre la ha apoyado en todo lo que ella hace y en lo que a ella le gusta, la decoración. Desde pequeña le llamaban la atención todos los arreglos que hacían para las bodas y las fiestas de 15 años a los que asistía.

Después de casada le pidieron ser madrina de copa, y ella la decoró, le gustó tanto a la gente que le hicieron un pedido para el siguiente mes. Y así se fue pasando la voz y con los buenos trabajos que realiza comenzó a tener más y más clientes.

Desgraciadamente, este negocio no es constante, en este momento lleva largo tiempo sin tener pedidos por lo tanto se descapitalizó, sin embargo le acaban de hacer un pedido y por lo tanto necesita un crédito para poder sacarlo adelante y volver con más fuerza a este negocio. Tomasa necesita un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Tomasa podrá comprar más mercancía y de mejor calidad para poder ofrecer sus productos a un precio que le rinda más a ella y así en su casa no falte nada.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
Maria Candelaria works as a maid, and in her free time she sells jewelry and shoes by catalogue. This all started when she helped her employer sell shoes by catalogue and gold jewelry by catalogue approximately 2 years ago. She then realized that she could do that herself and keep the profits, and so little by little she started getting clients. Helping her employer and seeing the need for things in her own home motivated Maria to continue with the business. Since Maria's husband is a bricklayer, and in that line of work there are extended periods of time in which he has no jobs, his income is very small.

Right now her husband has no job and she is taking care of the household expenses, so that all her profits go directly to pay for their expenses and she has no money left to cover her orders. This is why Maria is requesting a loan for US $ 375 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money, Maria will be able to buy the orders she has received. With your help Maria will be able to take care of her family while her husband gets a job.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

María Candelaria, trabaja como empleada doméstica, y en sus horas libres, se dedica a vender joyería y zapatos por catálogos, todo inició cuando ayudó a su patrona a vender calzado por catálogo y joyería de oro por catálogo esto hace aproximadamente 2 años, después se dio cuenta que ella podría venderlo y quedarse con las ganancias y así poco a poco fue haciendo clientes. EL ayudarle a su patrona, y ver las necesidades que había en su casa la motivaron a seguir con ese negocio. Puesto que el esposo de María es albañil y en su trabajo hay largas temporadas en que no tiene trabajo y el sueldo que gana es muy poco.

Actualmente el esposo no cuenta con trabajo, y los gastos del hogar los está absorbiendo ella, por lo tanto sus ganancias se van directo a sus gastos y no le queda dinero para resurtir sus pedidos. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con ese dinero María podrá comprar los pedidos que le han hecho. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a su familia mientas su esposo consigue trabajo.

loans.use: Buying seasonal products and covering orders.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi P., 52 years old, lives in Xuan Hoa District, Phuc Yen Commune. She was an employee of her province' general store. When it disintegrated, her life became much more difficult because her husband was away in the army and she was the sole bread-winner of her family (with two kids at school). In 2002 Mrs. P. borrowed 50USD to buy vegetable and sell it in the local market. When another store was about to disintegrate, she found it a good opportunity to buy those household products at cheap price for her grocery store. With her great experience and the high demand of local people and students from nearby schools, her store always attracts a lot of customers with a variety of products. The smile on her face proves how her life has improved. Her husband is now retired and helping her with her store. Her oldest son graduated from college and starts to work. Mrs. P. would like to borrow 450USD to invest more on her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn Thị Phấn, 52 tuổi, sống tại phường Xuân Hòa, thị xã Phúc Yên là nhân viên HTX dịch vụ tổng hợp cũ, sau khi chuyển đổi cơ chế HTX giải thể, khi đó cuộc sống gia đình cô gặp nhiều khó khăn, chồng cô đang còn trong quân ngũ, một mình cô xoay sở nuôi 2 con ăn học. Năm 2002 cô tham gia vào Quỹ, vốn vay khi đó chỉ là 50 USD cô chỉ đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ như rau quả sinh hoạt hàng ngày. Khi cửa hàng quyết định thanh lý một số gian hàng, cơ hội đến với cô và gia đình cô đã mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư mua sắm một số đồ dùng sinh hoạt, với kinh nghiệm sẵn có cộng với điều kiện rất thuận lợi là nhu cầu mua sắm sinh hoạt của khách hàng rất cao. (Đặc biệt là các sinh viên ở các trường chuyên nghiệp đóng trên địa bàn). Đến nay cửa hàng của cô đã thu hút rất đông khách, với nhiều mặt hàng đa dạng và phong phú. Nhìn gương mặt rạng ngời của cô cũng đủ thấy cuộc sống của gia đình cô đã thật sự thay đổi. Chồng cô đã nghỉ hưu và giúp cô công việc hàng ngày, con trai lớn đã học xong đại học và đã đi làm. Cô mong muốn được vay 450 USD để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy household products for her grocery store

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đỗ Thị Tuyết is 45 years old. She is a member of TYM fund since 2001. In the beginning the loans were of small amounts so she could only use it to buy goods to resell. The profit margin was small, it was difficult. As a side job, she offered child care service for the families in her neighborhood. The demand was so great that the idea of opening a child care center was germinated in her head. She consulted her family members about this and decided to do so. At first, there were a lot of obstacles: lack of capital, lack of material and especially the paperwork procedure from the Education Ministry was lengthy and complicated. It also took a lot of effort and time to attend "child care education" classes to obtain the permit. After a few years of hard work and dedication, everything was set in place. She gained trust and support from everyone including the Education Ministry and her customers. Her husband is very supportive, everyday he goes to the market to buy grocery to prepare food for the kids. The child care center is quite neat, there are 5 classes under the supervision of 5 teachers specialized in young children education. There are about 100 kids attending the child care center. Ms Tuyết is a examplary member for the Xuân Hòa branch of TYM fund. She requests a loan of 750 USD to buy toys for her child care center

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Cô Đỗ Thị Tuyết, 45 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2001, lúc ban đầu vay vốn nhỏ cô chỉ bán hàng nước nên nguồn thu nhập còn rất khó khăn. Ý tưởng nảy sinh từ khi cô chỉ nhận trông giúp hai ba trẻ ở trong khu tập thể, thấy nhu cầu gửi trẻ của các gia đình rất nhiều cô đã bàn bạc với gia đình mở lớp tư thục, công việc khi đó gặp rất nhiều khó khăn, thiếu vốn, thiếu cơ sở vật chất … và nhất là xin giấy phép của UBND phường, Phòng giáo dục Thị xã, đặc biệt là việc tham gia lớp bồi dưỡng giáo viên mầm non. Sau nhiều năm kiên trì thì mọi việc đã trở nên thuận lợi, chính quyền và nhân dân rất tin tưởng và ủng hộ cô, đặc biệt là chồng cô, hiện tại chồng cô hàng ngày giúp cô đi chợ mua thức ăn cho trẻ. Cơ ngơi của cô đã khá khang trang với 5 phòng học, 5 cô giáo chuyên môn và gần 100 trẻ. Cô Tuyết đã thực sự là một trong những thành viên điển hình của phường Xuân Hòa nói riêng và chi nhánh 3 Phúc yên nói chung. Chị Tuyết đang làm đơn xin vay 750 USD để mua đồ chơi cho trẻ trong trường của mình.

loans.use: Buy toys for her child care center

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đỗ Thị Điền, 57years old, is an active member of TYM fund, branch Phúc Yên. She became a member in 2002. With her first loan, she opened a restaurant serving breakfast only. She gained experience rapidly. Combined with a strong customer service and confidence, she applied for other loans which were used to expand her restaurant. It now opens all day serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. Is is very busy, there are customers at all hour. One of the reasons for her success is the food: it is tasty, cheap and clean. On top of that, the service is good and pleasant. Her long term business plan is to borrow 1200 USD to expand her restaurant to be able to serve more customers because the demand is there. It is truly wonderful to be one of her customers, to taste the delicious food prepared by her. Ms Điền applies for a loan of 575 USD to buy more products for her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Cô Đỗ Thị Điền, 57 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên tích cực của chi nhánh Phúc Yên tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2002, với đồng vốn vay cô đã mở quán bán hàng ăn, lúc đầu chỉ là bán hàng ăn sáng, dần dà với kinh nghiệm và sự phục vụ khách hàng chu đáo cô đã mạnh dạn vay vốn và mở rộng cửa hàng ăn phục vụ ăn uống sáng trưa chiều, nên quán của cô luôn đông khách, một trong những bí quyết thành công của cô là thức ăn ở đây rất ngon và rẻ, sạch sẽ và đặc biệt là sự vui vẻ niềm nở phục vụ. Kế hoạch trong thời gian tới của cô là vay vốn 20 triệu để tiếp tục mở rộng cửa hàng ăn đáp ứng nhiều hơn cho khách hàng. Thật tuyệt vời nếu được là khách hàng của cô và thưởng thức những món ăn do chính tự tay cô nấu. Hiện cô đang xin vay 575 USD để mua thực phẩm cho cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy foods for her restaurant

loans.name: Ni Wayan Weg

texts.id:
Nyoman Weg is originally from Timbrah village, Karangasem. Since 1981 she moved to Denpasar to work. Her business is a Food stall. The location of her food stall is quite strategic, next to a school. This has a positive impact on her business. At school times, her food stall is busy from incoming school children. In that time daily profit could reach Rp45,000 (about US$5). Daily expenses of Rp15,000 (about US$1.65) is manageble. Of course she is thinking of savings, since she would not be working forever. At this moment she lives with her 2 sons. Both are working, but not yet married. Her husband passed away. Although a widow she is busy running her business. Also her 2 sons support her in the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Nyoman Weg berasal dari Desa Timbrah, Karangasem. Sejak tahun 1981 dia pindah ke Denpasar untuk bekerja. Usaha yang ditekuninya yaitu warung makanan. Letak warung makanannya cukup strategis. Warungnya terletak bersebelahan dengan sekolahan. Hal ini berdampak positif dengan usaha warung makanannya. Pada musim sekolahan warung makanannya ramai dikunjungi oleh para murid. Selama ini keuntungan per hari yang dia peroleh mencapai Rp 45.000,00. Biaya hidup perhari Rp 15.000,00 dapat ia penuhi. Tentu saja dia berpikir untuk menabung, karena tidak selamanya dia bisa bekerja. Saat ini dia tinggal bersama 2 anak laki-lakinya. Keduanya masing – masing sudah bekerja, namun belum menikah. Sementara suaminya telah meninggal dunia. Walaupun dia janda tapi dia tetap tekun menjalankan usaha. Lagipula kedua anaknya tetap mendukungnya.

loans.use:
To add business capital

Menambah modal usaha.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert sells fried Dominican foods such as tostones (fried plantain chips), chicharron (fried pork skin), and other fritters from the side of the road. He has been doing this for 14 years he said, but only with the help of this loan will he finally be able to sell enough that he can begin to save some of his money as well. He lives by himself, and has no wife or children.

His dream is to have a better life, so that before he dies he can own his own house and sleep peacefully each night. Albert is very thankful to everyone who is helping him; although he is old, he knows it's never too late to change.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Liberacion #5 Group

texts.en:
Ana has a hard life; her husband lives and works in the capital, Santo Domingo, nearly six hours away. She runs a small colmado (grocery store) by herself, and tries to always offer her community members fresh fruits and vegetables of good quality.

She is asking for this small loan so that she can buy small snacks such as chips, mints and small candies to sell in addition to her agricultural products.

She says her biggest challenge in life is staying happy and on top of her business by herself. She says she gets very lonely since her husband is gone, but that hopefully in the future they can save enough money so they can both work and live together again.

Ana is very thankful to everyone who is helping her with this loan, and knows that it will help bring her one step closer to living with her husband again.

NOTE: This $750 loan will fund Ana's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be maD.. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Evelyn Amparo

texts.en:
Evelyn owns one of the larger clothing and shoe shops in her community. She offers her neighbors the latest fashions in new and used clothes and shoes, and at reasonable prices. She has participated in group-level loans before, and is asking for this individual loan now so that she can really improve and advance her store.

She plans to use the money to buy a wider range of women’s clothing, particularly tank tops, jeans, and skirts. She says that this is the perfect time for her to take out this loan because in November, when the tourism industry picks up, people have more money to spend and will want to buy more of her clothes. By offering a better selection, she knows she will be able to capitalize on this opportunity.

Her goal is to continue expanding and improving her business every day, and to more importantly, always ensure that her two children, ages 7 and 9 years old, will always be able to attend a good school.

Evelyn is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams with this loan.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Sara Fabiao

texts.pt:
Sara is unmarried but lives with the father of her 4 children. She lives in Chicumbane, in the Xai-Xai district. She began the loan program in 2003. Her children study. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing and kitchenware to sell. Sara helps her husband with household expenses. Together they are gathering building materials to construct a home.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 4 filhos. Sara vive em Chicumbane, sede do Distrito de Xai-Xai.Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2003. Os filhos de Sara estao a estudar. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para comprar mais roupa e loica para a venda.Sara ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa. Ela e o marido estao juntando material de construcao para construirem uma casa .

loans.use: To buy more clothing and kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Akessa

texts.fr:
Miss P. Akessa is a 28 year-old tailor. She works from her home since she does not have the means to open her own workshop. She has not yet been able to establish her own clientele and the income from this business is not sufficient to provide for her needs. She is a very dynamic and conscientious woman, and would like to start a jewlery business as well, however, once again, she does not have the means needed for this. WIth the end-of-year festivities approaching, she would like to go and buy new jewels from Ghana but her income is insufficient. In order to accomplish this, she is asking for a credit of $400. This will increase her income and give her financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 28 ans, Mlle P. Akessa, est couturière de formation. Elle exerce son métier à la maison car les moyens ne lui permettent pas d’ouvrir un atelier. Elle n’a pas de clientèle et les revenus de son activité n’arrivent pas à subvenir ses besoins. Très dynamique et soucieuse de son avenir, elle veut se lancer dans le commerce des bijoux mais de moyens non plus. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle veut aller acheter des nouveautés de bijoux au Ghana mais ses économies sont très maigres. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui donnera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of jewlery

loans.name: Reshad

texts.ru:
Reshad K. was born in 1980 in the town of Aksu. He is married and has one child. Two years ago, Reshad opened a pharmacy and has been growing his business since then. Reshad was lacking funds and he turned to Normicro for help. He took a $300 loan. Now, he needs another loan to purchase products inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кязымов Решад родилься 1980 году в городе Ахсу. Семейный, имеет одного ребенка. Два года тому назад решил заниматься бизнесом. Открыл себе аптеку и начал двигаться в этом направлении. Ему не хватало средство и он обратилься за помощью в Нормикро Ахсуниского филиала. Взял кредит на сумму 300$. Для покупки инвентаря ему нужен еще кредит.

loans.use: To purchase product inventory

loans.name: Samira

texts.ru:
Samira I. was born in 1989 in Aksu. She has been in business for three years. Her business has been actively growing, and Samira took a $500 loan from NorMicro to finance the expansion. Now she asks for another loan to purchase an inventory of products.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Исаева Самира родилась и проживает в городе Ахсу . 1989-го года рождения. Третий год подряд занимается бизнесом. Ведет активную торговлю. Самира хотела расширить свой бизнес , поэтому она взяла кредит в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала . Взяв сумму в размере 500 долларов она дополнительно купила еще товаров .

loans.use: To purchase more goods

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22683

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is a 28 year old mother of three children. Alice and her husband live in Rongo, Kenya. She has received and successfully repaid two microfinance loans from KMET. She began her tailoring business in the year 2002. She specializes in both men's and women's clothing. She currently offers training to 4 teenage school drop-outs in dressmaking. To cope with demand she has employed an additional tailor.

The central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. She has combined the additional money from K-MET with hard work and perseverance thus building a successful income-generating business. Alice is proud of her accomplishments and that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. She requires US $800 to further expand her business, increase the variety of clothes-making materials and purchase tailoring supplies to keep up with the growing demand.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jene Blanca

texts.es:
Jene has been linked to agricultural work since she was little because she would go with her parents and help them every day with their work. That is why she grew up with the wish to keep doing this work and chose to stay in the land that she saw progress in the company of her loved ones. Today she works in the fields growing mainly potatoes and maize. The incessant efforts that she gives every day in her arduous work are motivated by her 7-year-old daughter, who is her reason for living. She hopes to give her the best.

Jene is a single mother and doesn't have sufficient support for the well-being of her daughter. This is why she strives every day for her. Presently, Jene lives in her parents' home and works in the fields that they gave to her. She hopes to keep improving herself, and that's why she cares for her small plots of land with immense love. She is appealing to each one of you to obtain a loan with the objective of investing the money in farming a space of land that had been left fallow do to the lack of capital.

The support that you offer Jene is very urgent, and this loving mother will be grateful and appreciative.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Jene desde muy pequeña estuvo ligada a la labor agrícola porque diariamente recorría y ayudaba a sus queridos padres en cada una de sus tareas, es por ello que creció con el deseo de seguir dedicándose a esta labor y optó por quedarse en la tierra que la vió nacer para progresar en compañía de sus seres queridos; hoy siembra en sus campos de cultivo principalmente papa y maíz y los esfuerzos incesantes que ella desplega en el trabajo arduo de cada día es motivado por su pequeña de 7 años que es su razón de vivir y desea darle lo mejor.

Jene es madre soltera y no cuenta con el apoyo suficiente para el sostén y bienestar de su pequeña es por ello que es aún más el esfuerzo que pone cada día por su propio bien y el de su hija.

En la actualidad vive alojada en la casa de sus padres y trabaja en los campos de cultivo que le corresponde a ella por herencia de los mismos.

Desea seguir superándose y trabajando por eso cuida cada sus pequeñas parcelas con inmenso amor; recurre a cada uno de ustedes para obtener un préstamo de dinero con el objetivo de invertirlos en la siembra del espacio de terreno que dejó sin producir en la temporada pasada por falta de capital.

El apoyo que puedas otorgarle es muy urgente y será muy apreciado y agradecido por esta amorosa madre.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to farm a small plot of her inherited land.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a woman with much courage who strives to proviD. her three sons and her grandchild, who live with her, with food on the table. She is the mother of six children and has always strived to proviD. every member of her home with health and well-being. She goes to the fields every day, where she is now growing potatoes, maize, and peas. The routine in this process of farming and harvesting ends with selling the products in the market in the area. She was a little discouraged after losing her harvest last year after a harsh winter that destroyed the young shoots of her products. In spite of this, she hasn't lost her strength that characterizes her since she still has the responsibility of caring for part of her family. Her husband passed away three years ago, and since then, she has assumed the role of provider by herself. She works while she waits for the harvest to arrive and has planned to start selling meat and trout by travelling to other cities. This is why she requires a loan to use as investment capital. Let's support this great effort by a mother who wants the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Vilma es una mujer D. mucho coraje que se esfuerza por lograr que sus tres hijos que están bajo su cobijo y su pequeño nieto puedan tener siempre un pan en la mesa D. su hogar, ella es madre D. seis hijos y desD. siempre se esforzó por otorgarles bienestar y salud a cada uno D. los miembros D. su hogar.Día a día por esta época se dirige a sus campos D. cultivo donD. ahora está sembrando papa, maíz, arveja. La rutina en el proceso D. siembra y luego cosecha termina con la comercialización D. sus productos en el mercado D. la zona. Estuvo un poco desanimada al perder el año pasado toda la siembra tras la fuerza inclemente del crudo invierno que destruyó los pequeños brotes D. sus productos.A pesar D. este hecho no pierD. la fortaleza que la caracteriza ya que tiene la responsabilidad D. cuidar aún a parte D. su familia, su esposo falleció hace tres años y desD. entonces ella asume sola esta carga. Trabaja mientras espera que llegue la cosecha y ha planeado iniciar también la comercialización D. carne y trucha D. manera ambulante viajando a otras ciudades por ello requiere un préstamo para utilizarlo como capital D. inversión.Apoyemos el granD. esfuerzo D. una madre que quiere lo mejor para sus hijos.

loans.use: Investment of capital for the commercialization of two very important products for the Peruvian population.

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
Miss Diomith belongs to the Women in Action Communal Bank. Her business is located at San Jose de Sisa, El Dorado province, San Martin state. She sells groceries, fresh fruits and vegetables. She also sells appetizers such as cassava starch donuts and other wheat and corn flour candies. These products are highly esteemed amongst Diomith's clients. She's been working in this business for 20 years.

With the recent loan of S/. 1,500.00 ( US $500.00) received from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 4 quotas, she will purchase more products such as: rice and sugar (1 bag of each), packages of varieties of candy (8 different product packages), boxes of eggs (10 boxes), cookies and crackers (3 boxes each), soaps (1/2 box of each brand) and various brands of liquid detergent. She will also purchase wheat flour (2 bags) and 2 bags of starch to elaborate her appetizers.

Diomith is married and has two children, both of which are still under her care. The oldest one is about to finish high school and the second one just started high school. Her children are her main impulse to continue, next to her husband, to contribute in their schooling expenses. She considers herself to be very hardworking and to have solidarity with her family. She always supports her brothers when dealing with delicate situations.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Diomith, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres en Acción, tiene ubicado su negocio en la Localidad de San José de Sisa, provincia de El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras frescas; además complementa su negocio con la producción de bocaditos como son las rosquitas de almidón de yuca y otros dulce de harina de trigo y maíz, que son muy requeridos por sus clientes; se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500.00 ($ 500.00), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará más productos como: arroz y azúcar en sacos (01 saco de cada productos), variedad de glolosinas en paquetes (08 paquetes de diferentes productos), huevos en jabas (10 jabas), galletas (06 cajas, entre dulces y saladas), jabones (1/2 caja de cada marca), detergentes de diferentes marcas, además comprará harina de trigo (02 sacos) y 02 sacos de harina de almidón para la elaboración de sus bocaditos. Ella está casada y tiene 02 hijos, ambos aun a su cargo, el mayor está por terminar sus estudios superiores y el segundo acaba de iniciarlos, son su principal impulso para continuar y junto a su esposo contribuir en los gastos de sus estudios. Se considera muy trabajadora y solidaria con su familia, ella siempre apoya a sus hermanos para afrontar situaciones delicadas.

loans.use: Purchase various products (groceries)

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Don Amador is originally from this area and he has been farming for many years. He takes care of his farm every day. He farms potato, 'habas and 'olluco' which are native to this area. He gets up early each day to take care of his daily chores and to make sure his harvest is productive. He wants to get better each day ,and even though he's alone because his wife past away about 12 years ago, he admits that he will continue to do this with dignity for the well-being of his grand-children. He wants to take full advantage of this harvest season, and in order to get better results, he wants to purchase fertilizers. This is why he's requesting a loan to increase the quality and quantity of his products. Let's help this unselfish father by making his dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Amador es natural de la zona y hace ya muchos años viene dedicándose a la agricultura, diariamente se dedica al cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo y siembra papa, habas u olluco.Todos los días de la semana debido a que se encuentran en época de siembra se levanta muy temprano para iniciar sus labores y posteriormente cuidar sus campos para que su cosecha sea productiva, sigue adelante porque quiere ser mejor cada día y aunque ya no tenga a nadie a su lado porque su esposa falleció hace 12 años señala que seguirá esforzándose para vivir dignamente y por que quiere incrementar el bienestar de su familia a través de sus pequeños nietos.Esta época de siembra quiere aprovecharla al máximo y para conseguir buenos productos y mejores resultados al final desea comprar abono y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo invertirá en la compra de lo que requiere para incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.Solidaricémonos con el noble deseo de este abnegado padre.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to increase productivity and to get better product quality

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
Miss Leocadia belongs to the Rosales Communal Bank. Her business is located at San Martin de Alao, El Dorado province, San Martin state. Her charisma and working spirit has allowed her to maintain her clients. Her clients have also recommended her to other people. She has her store at home but she preferst to go out to sell at the village town centers. She feels that going to the town centers allows her to have more direct contact with her clients.

With the recent loan given by Manuela Ramos of S/. 2,000.000 (US $667.00) which will be repaid in 6 quotas, she will purchase various assortments of merchandise. The end of the year holidays are coming and it is the time of year when her clients purchase the most. She will assort her business with the purchase of gentleman's dress pants (two dozen of diverse colors), lady's dresses (12 units), ladies', gentleman's and boys' underwear (6 dozens of each), dress polos ( two dresses), dresses and outfits for girls (two dozens) and other clothing items requested by her clients.

She is 48 years old and her adventurous spirit has allowed her to have a better contact with her clients because she is not afraid of knocking on their doors to offer her products. She has four children, two boys and two girls. The two oldest, a girl and a boy, help her sell her merchandise from home.

Her husband works in agriculture. This activity has allowed her to meet more people and increment her sales. She always does her best not to miss an opportunity to increment her client portfolio.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

señora Leocadia pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Rosales, su negocio está ubicado en la localidad de San Martín de Alao, provincia de El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Su carisma y espíritu trabajador le a permitido mantener a sus clientes y que ellos mismos la recomienden. Tiene su local en su domicilio pero ella prefiere salir a vender en los centros poblados aledaños, ya que allí siente que tiene un contacto más directo con sus clientes. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 667.00) el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará mercadería muy surtida ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año y es una de las principales épocas donde sus clientes compran en mayor cantidad. Surtirá su negocio con la compra de pantalones de vestir para caballeros (02 docenas de diversos colores), vestidos para damas (12 unidades), prendas interiores para damas, caballeros y niños (06 docenas de cada tipo), polos de vestir (02 docenas), vestidos y conjuntos para niñas (02 docenas) y entre otras prendas que le vayan pidiendo sus clientes. Ella tiene 48 años y su espíritu aventurero le a permitido fidelizarse más con sus clientes, ya que ella no tiene temor para tocar sus puertas y ofertarles su mercadería, tiene 04 hijos, dos de los cuales son varones y 02 mujeres, los dos mayores, una de ellas mujer y el segundo varón son quien le apoyan en la venta de la mercadería en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ya que es una actividad que le ha permitido a ella conocer a más personas e incrementar sus clientes, trata de no perder la oportunidad de aumentar su clientela.

loans.use: Purchase clothing items

loans.name: Sonia Benita

texts.es:
Sonia is a 34-year-old married woman. Her family is composed of her, her husband, and their three children. She sells a variety of products, such as telephone cards, sweets, soda, etc, in a portable kiosk that she has in the Hospital Modelo de Yapacaní. Her husband also contributes to the family income by lending his services as a reporter to the radio station Emisora Local OMEGA.

Sonia's kiosk is the only one established and authorized in the hospital, so she doesn't have any competition. This is why she needs the loan to obtain another portable kiosk to increase her amount of products and sales. For Sonia, it is very important to fulfill all of the demand of her variety of clients. This is the third loan Sonia has had with this institution, and she has proven herself as a responsible and punctual person with her payments, and has never been one day late.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia es una señora casada de 34 años de edad, su familia está conformada por cuatro miembros, su esposo y tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de toda variedad de productos como ser tarjetas telefónicas, dulces, gaseosas, etc., en el kiosko portatil que tiene dentro del Hospital Modelo de Yapacaní, por otra parte el esposo también colabora con los ingresos familiares ya que él presta servicios como reportero en la radio Emisora Local OMEGA. El kiosco de Sonia es el único establecido y autorizado en el Hospital razón por la cual no tiene competencia, es por ello que requiere el presente crédito para la adquisición de otro kiosco portátil (anaquel) para aumentar sus productos y sus ventas, para Sonia es muy importante el atender a cabalidad la demanda de variedad de sus clientes. Esta es la tercera frecuencia de Sonia en la Institución y en ese tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos, esto debido a que a la fecha mentiene cero días de mora.

loans.use: Purchase of a kiosk

loans.name: Ninfa Juana

texts.es:
Miss Ninfa belongs to the Women in action Communal Bank. Her business is located at her home, near the Agua Blanca highway, at the May 2nd town, San Jose de Sisa district, El Dorado province, San Martin state. She sells groceries and bread. She recently expanded her business to distribute sodas. She has had this store for twelve years.

She recently received loan of S/. 3,000.00 ( US $1,000.00) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in four quotas. With this loan, she will be able to purchase various brands and varieties of of noodles (8 packages), preserved fish (4 boxes), rice and sugar ( 2 bags of each), oil gallos (for retail) and by liters. These products are highly required by Ninfa's customers. She will also supply her soda stock.

She is 41 years old. She has three children , two girls and a boy. The oldest daughter studies outside the city and she also works to help with her schooling expenses. She was born in the state of Ancash. Her wishes to move forward and help her husband with the home expenses drew them to migrate. She considers herself to be a fighter, persevering and she feels that this is a great job for her children because of her dedication to the business and unconditional support to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ninfa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres en acción, tiene ubicado su negocio en un local propio en su misma casa, por la carretera a la Localidad de Agua Blanca, Centro Poblado de 02 de Mayo, distrito de San José de Sisa, provincia El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar y abarrotes, además amplió su negocio principalmente a la distribución de bebidas gasificadas, tiene desarrollando la actividad hace 12 años. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000.00 ($ 1,000.00), para pagar en 4 cuotas, comprará fideos de distintas variedades y marcas (08 paquetes), conservas de pescado (04 cajas), arroz y azúcar en sacos (02 sacos de cada producto), aceite en galón (para su venta al menudeo) y en litros; debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos en la zona, además de surtir su stock de bebidas gasificadas. Ella tiene 41 años de edad, 03 hijos, 02 mujeres y 01 varón, la mayor de sus hijas estudia fuera de la ciudad y que a su vez trabaja para ayudar en los gastos de sus estudios. Nació en el departamento de Ancash, los deseos de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en contribuir con el hogar los impulsó a migar. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos por su dedicación a su negocio y apoyo incondicional a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase various items (groceries)

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Senora Lidia is a part of the communal bank called Los Rosales. She has a business located in the district of San Martin de Alao, a province of El Dorado. She runs a business from her home selling various household items. This allows to take care of her children at the same time. She has been doing this for approximately 10 years, managing the day to day business while her husband helps by making contact with wholesale providers. Due to an illness, her husband is not able to move around very much.

With the recent loan received by Manuela Ramos for $833, which will be repaid in six payments, she will buy fertilizers in liters and bags, in order to take advantage of the growth in cultivation of coffee, cocoa and corn in the region. Her existing clients have been requesting these products, which is why she wants to make this investment.

Lidia is 37 years old and has 3 children, three girls and a boy. She has had an interest in business from a very early age, and she feels secure in her new investment. She has a lot of confidence in her ability to sell to her customers, especially with her charisma and the constant support of her husband to help grow the business and improve the living standard of their family. She feels her area is growing more every day, and she will be able to meet the needs of her customers.

La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Rosales, tiene ubicado el negocio en el distrito de San Martín de Alao, provincia de El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar (variados), su local se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa, lo que le permite atender a sus hijos y su negocio a la ves, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años aproximadamente. Ella es la que administra el negocio y su esposo es el que apoya con el contacto con los proveedores mayoristas, debido a que su esposo tiene una enfermedad que no le permite movilizarse demasiado. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($ 833.00) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará agroquímicos en litros y sacos, para aprovechar las campañas de café, cacao y maíz que se han incrementado en áreas de cultivos por la zona, son los mismos clientes los que le han solicitado la venta de esos producto, es por eso que en esta oportunidad desea invertir en ese rubro. Lidia tiene 37 años y 03 hijos, dos mujeres y 01 varón, a ella le gustaba el negocio desde muy temprana edad, es por eso que se siente con seguridad cuando tiene que decidir la compra de productos porque confía mucho en su capacidad de convencimiento hacia sus clientes, además del carisma que posee y el constante apoyo de su esposo por sacar adelante el negocio y la familia. Siente que su localidad esta creciendo cada vez más y que ella es un aporte para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZERS TO MEET THE REQUESTS OF HER CUSTOMERS AND EXPAND THE SALES OF HER SMALL SHOP.

loans.name: Rolando Richard

texts.es:
Rolando is married and has three children: Rolando 9, Magaly 11 and Waldo 3. His business is selling toys and making overalls. Rolando and his wife have been working at these two businesses for about 3 years. Both make and sell the overalls, and there is little competition in this field. However, there is a lot of competition within the toy-selling business, and the key to success is having good contacts to be able to buy directly from wholesalers outside of Bolivia.

He would use the loan to purchase toys to be sold retail. Prices vary according to product's type and quality; for example, a box of dolls runs about US$25, remote control cars about $135, and remote control motorcycles $14.

Rolando has been granted loans in the past, and he has always made his payments on time and responsibly. Pictured above is Rolando's wife, as he was not available at the time the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Rolando es una persona casada que se dedica a la venta de juguetes y también a la confección de overoles, su familia está conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, Rolando de 9 años de edad, Magaly de 11 años y Waldo de 3 años de edad. Rolando junto con su esposa trabajan en ambos rubros aproximadamente 3 años, ambos confeccionan y posteriormente venden los overoles, en este rubro no tienen mucha competencia, pero por otra parte el negocio de venta de juguetes si tienen que enfrentarse a una competencia más elevada, la clave de su negocio es que cuentan con buenos contactos para comprar directamente de los mayoristas fuera de Bolivia. El presente crédito es para la adquisición de juguetes para su posterior comercialización al menor, los precios varian dependiendo del tipo y calidad del juguete por ejemplo el precio de la caja de muñecas es aprox. $us. 25.-, los autos a control remoto $us. 135.-, las motos a control remoto $us. 14.-. Actualmente Rolando cuenta con antecedentes crediticios en nuestra institución, está es su cuarta frecuencia en la misma y siempre demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad. se hace notarque cuando se fué a tomar la foto del negocio Rolando no se encontraba, en la foto se ve a su esposa.

loans.use:
OPERATING CAPITAL

CAPITAL DE OPERACIÓN

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 22693

loans.name: Meguita

texts.es:
Mrs. Meguita lives in the region of San Martin and the province and district of Picota. She belong to the communal bank of Santa Isabel. Her business is located in the municipal market of Picota where she sells food in order to improve the economic standing of her family. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to go on and in this way help her children and partner.

With the credit she recently received from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000.00 ($333 USD), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy supplies to prepare her tasty food.

Meguita is 46 years old and lives with her husband, her older son, daughter in law and grandson. Her dream is to have her own restaurant and service her clientèle from the comfort of her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Meguita vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Isabel, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Picota y se dedica a la venta de comida, con la finalidad de mejorar la situación económica de la familia, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación supo salir adelante y de esa manera apoya a sus hijos y pareja. Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000.00 ($ 333.00), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará insumos para elaborar su sabrosa comida. Meguita tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo, su hijo mayor, nuera y un nieto; su sueño es tener su propio restaurante y atender a su clientela desde la comodidad de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchasing Supplies

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa is part of the Banco Comunal Flor del café. She sells chicken meat at a stand at the local market in the district of Soritor, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She decided to start her business in order to continually support her family and to generate her own income in order to grow personally.

With the recent loan given to her by Manuela Ramos of $233 that will be repaid in four installments, she will buy 30 to 40 chickens, special pepper, and garlic in kilos to sell her farm chickens. This way she is able to meet the needs of her clients and the local market.

She is 54 years old and has five children. She is content with what she does and she is satisfied with the results she has obtained ever since her group of clients has increase. Her goal is have her own shed to raise the chicken. She wants to sell large and small quantities and to supply the region with this essential food to many families.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor del café, se dedica la venta de pollos viscerados, tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad, en el distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martin. Decidió iniciar su negocio por que tenía que sacar adelante a su familia y de esa manera generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona. Con el reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 700.00 soles ($ 233.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 30 a 40 gallinas de las chacras, especies como culantro, ají especial, ajos en kilos para licuarlos y surtir su puesto de venta de pollos de granja y criollos, y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y del mercado local. Tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, esta contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha su clientela aumentó, su meta es tener su propio galpón para criar y tener su centro de acopio, vender al por mayor y menor y abastecer a la zona con este alimento primordial en la cocina de muchas familias.

loans.use: Purchase chicken and garlic.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda is 40 years old and lives with her five-year-old daughter, who is her inspiration to keep working and fulfill her dreams. She belongs to the Working Women's Cooperative Bank and lives in San Martin, in the district and province of Lamas, and works at the municipal market in Lamas. Eduarda began humbly, selling small quantities of fruits and vegetables on the street, but through great care and dedication she has arrived at where she is now with a market stall and growing customer base. Eduarda is asking for a loan of 800 soles, or around $275, to buy all kinds of fruit and vegetables: papayas, oranges, mandarin oranges, yuca, cilantro, onions and peppers and bananas. She will repay the loan in 4 months.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eduarda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Lamas. Su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Junín Cdra. 1, Mercado Municipal de Lamas y se dedica a la venta de frutas, y verduras frescas y de calidad. Gracias a su esmero y dedicación ha logrado que su negocio prospere, pues cuando empezó vendía por las calles en formas ambulante pequeñas cantidades de frutas, actualmente posee un puesto en le mercado de Lamas, vende frutas y verduras en mayores cantidades, su clientela ha crecido considerablemente. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($267.00), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará frutas en variedad como papaya, naranjas, mandarinas en cientos, además yuca en sacos, culantro, cebolla china en kilos, ajíes de distintas variedades, plátanos en racimos entre otros. La señora Eduarda tiene 40 años, vive con su menor hija de 5 años quien es el motor que le da energía para seguir trabajando y llegar a cumplir con sus sueños.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Florencia is a hard-working woman. Each day she works the land which she has been doing since she was a little girl. She grew up farming. She is originally from Casacacha. She was raised there, and now she lives with her husband who has always been there for her after so many happy years of marriage. It's just the two of them for now since they're done raising their kids whom they made sure were well-taken care of and were happy growing up. Each day, Florencia and her husband work very hard in the field. For them this is more than an obligation, but also a distraction. They farm 'mashua' and 'olluco' which are native to the land, corn, wheat and barley to later sell them to local stores in the area.

They both have decided to improve their harvest by purchasing fertilizers. Let's contribute by making their wish come true by helping these well-deserved farmers achieve a better living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Florencia es una mujer que cada día labra la tierra con sus manos y viene realizando esta actividad desde que era muy niña porque creció viendo y viviendo las actividades agrícolas a lo largo de su vida. Ella es natural de Casacancha, allí creció y ahora vive al lado de su esposo que siempre la acompaña tras muchos años de feliz matrimonio y ahora ambos viven solos pues ya han cumplido su labor y durante la etapa de crecimiento de sus hijos les procuraron bienestar y felicidad.Día a día Florencia y su esposo trabajan arduamente en el campo y para ellos esto se ha convertido más que una obligación en una distracción; cultivan mashua, olluco, maíz, arvejitas, trigo y cebada para comercializarlos en la época de cosecha al por mayor. Ahora ambos han planeado mejorar esta cosecha y para ello compraran abono y fertilizantes. Contribuyamos con este noble deseo para sigan incrementando su bienestar estos dedicados agricultores.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia is part of the Banco Comunal Las Bandinas. She is involved in the tailoring business and the sale of clothing. Her business is located at her house at Jr. CahuiD. Nº 787, district of Banda D. Shilcayo, Province and Department of San Martín.

She decided to start her business in 1990 when she was unemployed.

With the recent $200 loan from Manuela Ramos that will repay in four months, she will purchase large quantities of silk lace, buttons in a variety of forms and colors, and thread.

She is 46 years old, married and has three children. She is very happy and pleased that she can help other women who want to work since she has many women working at her tailor shop. Her goal is to open a shop in the downtown area in the city of Tarapoto.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Bandinas, se dedica a la confección y venta D. prendas D. vestir, su negocio está instalado en su propio domicilio ubicado en el Jr. CahuiD. Nº 787 del distrito D. la Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Decidió iniciar su negocio al encontrarse sin trabajo en el año 1990. Con el reciente crédito recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 600.00 ($ 200.00) para pagar en 4 meses, comprará artículos D. pasamanería por docenas (botones, blondas, en variadas formas y colores) para el acabado D. sus confecciones, e hilos en variados colores, porque muchas veces el cliente lleva la tela pero ella realiza los acabados con su propia mercadería, asimismo confecciona vestimenta para danzas donD. utiliza estos artículos. Tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, se siente una mujer realizada y contenta ya que pueD. apoyar a mujeres que quieren trabajar pues tiene a su cargo operadoras en su taller D. confección, su meta es tener un local propio al centro D. la ciudad D. Tarapoto.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of silk lace, buttons, and a variety of thread.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo. She lives in the San Martín region, province and district of Lamas. Her business is located on Jr. Junín Cdra. 1 (Municipal Market of Lamas) and she specializes in the production and sale of baked goods such as mini-sandwiches, bread, cookies and muffins.

Thanks to the help of her husband and children, along with her own strength, she has been successful in expanding her business. She first started producing small quantities and now she produces over hundreds of baked goods. She sells at her own stand in the market, where she has a large number of clients. She also delivers her product to other stores around the area.

With the recent credit she received from Manuela Ramos of $500 that will be paid back in four months, she will purchase products such as flour, sugar in quantities of 50 kilos, butter, and other ingredients for the production of her baked goods.

Mrs. Francisca is 65 years old and lives with her husband and her grandson. She works everyday in order to meet her goals. She also demonstrates that there are no limits. With dedication and strength, goals can be easily achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas y distrito de Lamas, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Junín Cdra. 1 (mercado municipal de Lamas) y se dedica a la producción y venta de bocaditos como rosquitas, kekitos, panes, biscochos, entre otros. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos y al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar su negocio, pues en sus inicios producía en pequeñas cantidades y actualmente produce bocaditos por cientos, los cuales vende en su puesto del mercado, tiene gran clientela, además reparte sus productos a diferentes bodegas de la localidad. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,500.00 ($ 500.00), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará insumos como harina, azúcar en sacos de 50 kilos, manteca en latas, y otros para la elaboración de sus bocaditos y cumplir con todos los pedidos pendientes. La señora Francisca tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo y su nieto, trabaja diariamente, demostrando de esa manera, que para cumplir las metas, no hay limites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Sra. Trinidad belongs to the "Mujeres del 2000" (Mothers of 2000) community bank in the Peruvian region of San Martin. She operates a business growing and selling garden produce.

Thanks to help from her husband and their children, as well as her own dedication and persistence, the business has grown considerably, from uncultivated lands at the beginning to fields of lettuce, onions, coriander, cucumbers, cabbage, etc., all of which is sold, at wholesale, in the nearby market at Tarapoto.

With a recently-granted loan of S/.2,500 (2,500 Peruvian soles or about US$833) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 9 months, Trinidad will buy seeds, fertilizer and mesh (for protecting the crops) and repair her cultivator so that she can provide the quality of produce that her customers expect.

Sra. Trinidad is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children, for whom she works everyday so that they can fulfill their goals in life. Her future plans include growing and selling roses. She's already planted 200 rose bushes which will produce 200 roses a day next year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del 2000, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Lamas, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Reynaldo Bartra 1080 y se dedica al cultivo y venta de hortalizas.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos y a la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio solo tenia tierras sin producción y actualmente cultiva hortalizas como lechuga, cebolla china, culantro, ají pimentón, pepinillo, repollo, las cuales las vende al por mayor en el mercado del distrito de Tarapoto.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($ 833.00) el mismo que será pagado en 9 meses, comprará semillas en kilos, fertilizantes en frascos y sacos, malla sombreadora y reparar su motocultor, para obtener hortalizas de calidad y cumplir con las expectativas de sus clientes.

La señora Trinidad tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día para cumplir sus metas, uno de los proyectos que tiene en mente para el futuro, es dedicarse al cultivo y comercialización de rosas, actualmente tiene 200 plantones instalados con los cuales tendrá una producción de 200 rosas ínter diario, para el próximo año.

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers, along with maintenance costs for cultivator.

loans.name: Herayda

texts.es:
Herayda is a native of Casacancha. She's always had exposure to agriculture. Four years ago, she decided to sow her own potatoes, mashua, and olluco. (The latter two are other types of tuber crops). After several years, she and her husband established a family; now, they are surrounded by five little ones and have in mind to provide the best for them. To make the most and best of farming, they always have sold their products wholesale. Before this, they work intensely and carefully to cultivate them so later they can reap tuber crops of excellent quality. She and her husband are thinking to start a business raising and selling animals with the profits they make in the next harvest. Currently, they seek a loan to invest in manure and fertilization to improve the quality of their products. Let's support this young family who have respectable goals to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Herayda es natural de Casacancha y siempre desde niña ha mantenido contacto con la actividad agrícola, es así que hace cuatro años decide sembrar en sus propias tierras papa, mashua y olluco; tras varios años de actividad ha logrado junto a su esposo establecer una familia y hoy esta rodeada de cinco pequeños y tienen en mente seguir esforzándose para brindarles lo mejor.Para hacer mucho más provechosa esta actividad agrícola, siempre ha vendido sus productos al por mayor, previo a ello realizan un intenso trabajo de campo con sumo cuidado para obtener excelentes tubérculos.Tienen en mente iniciar el trabajo de crianza y venta de animales con las ganancias que genere la comercialización de esta próxima cosecha y ahora solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.Apoyemos a esta joven familia para que continúen con el noble proyecto de incrementar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure for better harvest

loans.name: Enma Diana

texts.es:
Enma I. is a hardworking mother of two children. Together with her husband, she works daily with the goal of bringing a better quality of life and a good education to her two small children. She and her family live in her mother in law's house. Enma decided to open a small shop in the house to help contribute economically, while still being able to manage the work around the house without problems.

The business is growing. However, the main goal of this family is to get their own home. They want to fix up a small area in the house where they can open a retaurant serving regional cuisine, permitting them to save money for their children's education. This is why they want to increase the number of products they sell in their shop, so they can increase their income and get closer to realizing their goals. With your generous support we can help this family achieve their dreams

Enma I., es una laboriosa madre de dos niños, que junto a su esposo trabaja diariamente con el afán de poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación a sus pequeños vástagos. Ella y su familia viven en la casa de su suegra, en la que Enma ideó abrir una pequeña bodega con la cual apoyaría económicamente a su querido esposo y a la vez realizaría las tareas de su hogar con efectividad y sin ningún problema. El negocio marcha adecuadamente, sin embargo la gran meta que tiene esta familia es conseguir una casa propia para cobijarse con libertad, armonía y con el propósito de acondicionar un pequeño espacio para aperturar un restaurante de comida regional que les permita ahorrar dinero para la educación de sus hijos. Por esta razón desea incrementar la cantidad de productos de su bodega a través de una mayor inversión para iniciar la construcción de sus sueños. Ayudemos a que esta familia logre sus anhelos con vuestro generoso aporte.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE EVERY DAY ITEMS NEEDED TO STOCK HER SMALL SHOP, ENABLING HER AND HER HUSBAND TO ONE DAY PURCHASE A HOME OF THEIR OWN, AND SAVE FOR THEIR CHILDREN'S EDUCATION.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora is a diligent and noble mother. She can be found daily immersed in her small grocery store where she sells a large variety of basic goods and products. Currently, by some heavenly force, her ice creams are in highest demand. She bought them initially to sell them from time to time in her little store. With her entrepreneurial spirit, she soon learned how to make them from a good friend. Now, she sees this product as an opportunity to fulfill her wishes. She still lives with her in-laws and one of her dreams is to buy her own home where she can live comfortably together with the youngest of her 5 children and move her little store into a new space. She needs your generous support to stock up her store with more products and start producing ice cream in mass production to sell them to more people and other nearby stores. Let us count on your cooperation to help Teodora's family be happy.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Teodora, es una diligente y noble madre D. familia, a la que podemos hallar diariamente sumergida en su pequeña bodega, donD. cordialmente expenD. una gran variedad D. productos D. primera necesidad. Ahora y por la constante presencia del astro solar los productos que más comercializa son los helados, los cuales compra para poder venderlos en las instalaciones D. su tiendita; gracias a su espíritu emprendedor hace poco aprendió la elaboración D. estos gracias a una amiga que muy gentilmente le enseñó y ahora ha visto en este producto una oportunidad para lograr sus anhelos.Aún vive en la casa D. sus suegros y uno D. sus sueños es obtener una casa propia donD. vivir cómodamente junto al menor D. sus 5 hijos para trasladar su pequeño negocio a un nuevo espacio; requiere D. vuestro generoso aporte para implementar su bodega con más artículos e iniciar la producción D. helados para comercializarlos en gran número a más personas y tiendas aledañas.Contamos con su colaboración para hacer D. la familia Teodora una familia feliz y realizada.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to supply the store and start making and selling delicious ice cream

loans.name: Victoria Saragoza

texts.es:
Senora Victoria N. is 40 years old. She is a courageous and strong mother, immersed in the commercial activities of her small shop together with her oldest son. She is the only provider for her 4 children, since her husband abandoned her, leaving her in charge of all the responsibilities of the family. But this did not discourage her. On the contrary, with the help of her children and her efforts and desire to get out of this difficult situation, she realized she needed to improve the education and quality of life for her children. Unfortunately,her oldest son had to stop his plans for a higher education because there was not enough money. It's because of this that Victoria needs to increase the quantity of the products she offers in her shop, and with the income her children will hopefully be able to get an adequate education. Your generous support will help her realize her goals.

Encontramos a la señora Victoria N. de 40 años, una madre vigorosa y valiente, inmersa en las actividades comerciales de su pequeña bodega, en la que cordialmente oferta sus productos en compañía de su hijo mayor.Ella es el único sostén de sus 4 hijos, a raíz del abandono de su esposo, dejándola a cargo de todas las responsabilidades familiares y de la manutención de su numerosa familia Esto hecho no la amilanó y por el contrario con la ayuda de sus hijos se esfuerza con el afán de salir de esa difícil realidad con el objetivo de mejorar su educación y calidad de vida. Sin embargo muchas veces este esfuerzo no es suficiente ya que su hijo mayor tuvo que desistir de sus planes de estudios superiores debido a los bajos ingresos del hogar.Es por ello que Victoria desea incrementar la cantidad de productos de su bodega y través de el sus ingresos económicos familiares con los cuales podrá lograr que sus hijos puedan estudiar adecuadamente.Recurre a vuestra generosa ayuda a fin de poder hacer realidad sus anhelos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY AND VARIETY OF EVERY DAY ITEMS TO SELL IN THEIR SMALL STORE

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
"I need to secure the windows at home as it is very unsafe.  A while ago, someone broke one of the windows.  I would like to spend the money to make the repair.  I have been concerned for my family's safety.  I seek a loan of $500 to secure the windows of my home. " 

 Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer. 


Tengo la necesidad de poner protecciones en las ventanas de mi casa ya que son muy inseguras, hace algún tiempo me quebraron el vidrio de una de ellas así es que prefiero hacer el gasto de ponerlas además me preocupa la seguridad de mi familia. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner protecciones en las ventanas de mi vivienda."

loans.use: security for windows

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
"I need to enlarge the space in my home since the rooms are very small. I would like my family to be more comfortable. In fact, social clubs are just too small for large families like mine. I seek a loan of $800 to enlarge my home a little more spacious in the front part. "

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de ampliar mi casa ya que los cuartos son muy reducidos, me gustaría que mi familia estuviera más cómoda, en realidad las casas de interés social son muy pequeñas y las familias grandes como la mía no cabemos. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para ampliar un poco mi casa hacia el frente."

loans.use: to enlarge my home

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Sra. Rosa belongs to the Santa Rosa community bank in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 39 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a day laborer but his earning don't cover the basic household expenses so Rosa began looking for ways to help. She didn't have enough capital to start a business, though, so she turned to Manuela Ramos for a loan to start a shop selling candy, cookies, etc. She now has a small store stocked with a variety of products and can count on help from her children.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,500 (1,500 Peruvian soles or about US$500), to be repaid in 4 months, she'll be able to improve her store and buy 1 case of milk, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 3 cases of soft drinks and 5 "casilleros" of eggs.

She's very happy to have the extra income to cover the family's various expenses and also that the family has been able to work together, united.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa, A. H. Juan Bautista Mz C Lt 18 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su pareja es obrero y lo que gana no alcanza para las necesidades básicas D. su hogar, por ello Rosa buscó oportunidad D. negocio pero al no contar con el capital necesario recurrió a Manuela Ramos y desD. ese entonces, y con su primer préstamo, decidió vender galletas, caramelos, chocalatillos, etc. Ahora tiene una pequeña bodega con una variedad D. productos y cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,500 (US$ 500.00 aprox.), el mismo que será cancelado en 4 meses, podrá mejorar su local y podrá comprar 1 caja D. leche, 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar 3 cajas D. gaseosa y 5 casilleros D. huevo.

Ella está muy contenta D. contar con un ingreso adicional y así cubrir los diferentes gastos, además tiene una familia muy unida donD. trabajan juntos.

loans.use: Buy supplies for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
"I have some unfinished construction due to lack of money. But now, things are a bit better and I would like to finish construction so I can live in these rooms. I just need some flagstone. I seek a loan of $1000 to finish my construction. "

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción si terminar ya que me falto dinero pero ahora me he recuperado un poco y quisiera terminarla para poder habitar esos cuartos solo me falta la losa. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción."

loans.use: Finish construction and layout of flagstone

loans.name: Nilda Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is a young woman, aged 28. She can't share many happy moments with her husband, because he is a policeman in a distant county called Huasahuasi. This has been a difficult situation, especially with their 6 year old daughter. Nonetheless, Jessica is now focusing a great deal of her time in the administration of her small store. Thanks to her hard work she has now started the construction of her own house since she is currently living with her mom.

Jessica sees a great opportunity in the upcoming Christmas season to generate enough revenue to finish her house. She is asking for a loan to buy Christmas articles and toys for her store. We are counting on your generosity and support so that the work of this noble woman has a better opportunity.

Translated from Spanish with the help of DVG by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Jessica es una joven mujer de 28 años, su esposo es policía y trabaja en la lejana localidad de Huasahuasi, motivo por el cual no puede compartir muchos momentos de felicidad a su lado y al de su pequeña hija de 6 años debido a la gran distancia que existe entre ambas ciudades.Esta realidad fue muy difícil de superar para Jessica, sin embargo, ahora a concentrado gran parte de su tiempo a la administración de su librería y mercería, negocio que gracias a su diligencia, le ha permitido iniciar la construcción de su casa, ya que por ahora viven en la casa de su mamá. Jessica ha visto en la próxima campaña navideña una brillante oportunidad para concluir la construcción de su pequeña vivienda.Es por ello solicita un préstamo con los que podrá adquirir juguetes y artículos navideños para surtir su local y así generar los ingresos económicos que le permitan lograr sus anhelos.Contamos con vuestro apoyo y generosidad para que la labor de esta noble dama tenga mayor oportunidad.

loans.use: Purchasing of toys and other articles for her small store / Compra de juguetes y más artículos para implementar el pequeño bazar.

loans.name: Kelinda Gloria

texts.es:
Senora Gloria Q. is 39 years old. She suffered through the terrible situation in Peru during the epoch of terrorism, when her humble house was burned down before her eyes in 1991. In spite of all this, she has made great efforts to provide a good quality of life for her family.
