Together with her husband, they now run a business transporting diverse products in their small truck to sell in the many markets of the city. They sell fruits and vegetables, as well as flammable products such as oil and fuel. The great amount of experience they've acquired, along with great demand, have generated the need for another car with which they can support and improve the financial well being of their family. They are requesting a loan of $275, in order to invest in their business and begin to transport a larger quantity of products, eventually saving for that second vehicle.

La señora Gloria Q. de 39 años, vivió en carne propia el terrible panorama generado en el Perú durante la época del terrorismo, ya que personas inescrupulosas quemaron su humilde casa, ante sus propios ojos en el año 1991.Sin embargo ahora ha puesto todos sus esfuerzos, en poder brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia y con esta meta junto a su esposo se dedican a transportar diversos productos para comercializarlos en los diversos mercados de su ciudad, tanto combustible como frutas y verduras, en el pequeño vehículo que poseen como patrimonio familiar. La gran experiencia adquirida en esta actividad y la gran demanda, han generado en ella el anhelo de adquirir un carro más con el cual apoyar e incrementar aún más la economía de su querida familia.Solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares, con el cual incrementará la inversión en su negocio y empezará a transportar una mayor cantidad de productos para en poco tiempo adquirir un carro más.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO GROW THEIR BUSINESS AND TRANSPORT MORE GOODS FOR SALE, EVENTUALLY SAVING FOR A SECOND VEHICLE TO EXPAND THEIR BUSINESS EVEN FURTHER.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro, 26, is married and works as a mechanic on Ave. del Plan 3000 in the city of Santa Cruz in Sierra. During the weekends, he helps his wife in her plastic business. The B. family lives in Plan 3000 by the high school Communidad Balencia. They live in an anticrético - a place where they pay the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period instead of paying monthly rent. They also have a young daughter. As a plastic merchant, Genaro has years of experience; as a recent mechanic, only a couple of years. That's why he only helps his wife sometimes with the plastic business's expense management. The plastic business is rather competitive, which is why Genaro made the decision to become a mechanic. Ultimately, he did it to find other means of income for his family. Since Genaro is competitive, he does not neglect any part of his businesses and assumes responsibility for the plastic business's development by bringing his products to various markets. The current loan is to acquire more merchandise for later. Genaro does not have any previous negative marks in his credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Genaro es una persona casada de 26 años de edad que trabaja como mecanico en Av. del Plan 3000 de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, por otra parte los fines de semana ayuda su esposa en su negocio de comercialización de plásticos. La familia B. vive en el Plan 3000 por el colegio Comunidad Balencia, viven en una casa en anticrético, este matrinomio joven cuenta con una hija. Genaro como comerciante de plásticos tiene varios añor de experiencia, pero como mecánico recién tien un par de años, es por ello que en este negocio a veces también le ayuda su esposa con el manejo de los gastos. La comercialización de plásticos es bastante competitiva, por esta razón Genaro tomó la decisión de incursionarse en el rubro de la mecánica, esto con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos para la sustentabilidad de su familia. Debido a que Genaro es una persona competitiva no descuida ninguno de los negocios y pese a la elevada competencia con los plásticos el lleva a varios mercados su mercadería. El presente crédito es para la adquisición de más mercadería para su posterior comercialización, por otra parte Genaro no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lay out security and construct a fence

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is 46 years old and sells fruits and vegetables in the Rodriguez market in La Paz, Tuesdays through Saturdays.

For the past 7 years Betty has lived in her brother-in-law's home, located in the Ballivián neighborhood, on the corner of Founier and Jose Chacón ro 550. She has two children that attend school. Betty's husband died 10 years ago.

Betty has worked in this business for 4 years. Previously she worked with other people, and this year she is independent. There is quite a bit of competition in the selling of fruits and vegetables, even within the same market. Betty is able to depend on her own customers, because of her excellent customer service she has been able to earn her customers' loyalty. She is now a supplier to Frigolin (an ice cream company).

The current loan is for the purchase of merchandise. The prices of fruit and vegetables depend on the season, quality, and demand. Betty doesn't have any negative credit history in the finance system. Please note that the photograph was taken at her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Betty es una persona de 46 años de edad que se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en el mercado RODRIGUEZ de la Ciudad de La Paz, desde los martes hasta los sábados.

Betty vive desde hace siete años atrás en la casa de su cuñado, el inmueble se encuentra ubicado en la Zona Ballivián, Calle Jose Chacón ro 550 esquina Founier, tien dos hijos que asisten a la escuela, el esposo de Betty falleció hace 10 años atrás.

Betty trabaja en este rubro desde hace cuatro años, antes trabajaba junto a otras personas este año ya cuenta con su puesto independiente. Si bien existe bastante competencia en el rubro de comercialización de frutas y verduras, inclusive dentro el mismo mercado, Betty cuenta con clientela propia, ya que por su excelente trato logró consolidar la fidelización de sus clientes, ahora inclusive es proveedora de la Empresa Frigolin (helados).

El presente crédito es para la adquisición de mercadería, los precios de la fruta y la verdura dependen de la temporada, de la calidad y de la demanda de las mismas. Betty no tiene antecedentes crediticios negativos en el sistema financiero. Se hace notar que la fotografía sólo fué tomada al puesto de venta.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 65 years-old, she is a noble mother that lives with her husband Marcelino. Marcelino works in San Vicent, they have achieved a future full of optimism for their children and they have provided them with a good-quality life. Her two older sons already formed their own families and the youngest one is about to end his high school education. We found Graciela working very hard as usual, making her delicious little sponge and corn cakes in her modest home. She takes these cakes to the city of Carhuamayo every Thursday and Sunday to the weekly fair. She prepares them on Tuesdays on a little oven that she rents in her beautiful city and because of these comings and goings her health is starting to deteriorate. She has thought about opening a place with Internet cabins, so she can help her children go to university in their city. Having this purpose in mind she is asking for a loan to increase the quantity of her products with the goal of commercializing them in more cities and getting more returns and at the same time initiate the construction of her new longing.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Graciela D. 65 años, es una noble madre D. familia, que junto a su esposo Marcelino, que labora en la mina D. San Vicente, lograron forjar un futuro lleno D. mucho optimismo para sus hijos y así mismo brindarles una adecuada calidad D. vida. Sus dos hijos mayores ya poseen una familia propia mientras que el menor D. está próximo a acabar su educación secundaria.Encontramos a Graciela laborando como siempre diligentemente, a pesar D. su edad, en la producción D. sus deliciosos bizcochuelos y maizuelos, en las instalaciones D. su modesta morada, que lleva a la ciudad D. Carhuamayo todos los jueves y domingos para la feria semanal preparándolos todos los martes en un hornito que alquila en su bella ciudad y muchas veces a causa D. este trajín ha sufrido deterioro en su salud. Por lo que ha pensado en abrir un local con cabinas D. internet, para así poder apoyar al menor D. sus hijos con sus estudios profesionales en la universidad D. su ciudad.Teniendo en mente este propósito solicita un préstamo para incrementar la cantidad D. sus productos a fin D. comercializarlos en más ciudades para obtener mayor rentabilidad D. los mismos e iniciar pronto la construcción D. su ansiado anhelo.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of her ingredients so she can increase the amount of products (cakes).

loans.name: Mercedes Zulema

texts.es:
Mercedes R., aged 28, and her husband Héctor Alberto, aged 28, are a young married couple. Together, they have a 3 year old daughter and a tremendous desire to build a solid home and fill it with harmony.

Similarly, in the midst of their agricultural jobs they show a great deal of optimism and confidence, putting all their effort in the farming of vegetables and tuber crops, which they later offer to wholesalers.

All this effort is paying off since they have recently started the construction of their own house. This has been a great source of motivation for them and therefor wish to improve the quality of their products through a better use of raw materials and seeds. They are requesting a loan for 275 USD which will help them in their undertaking to finish the construction of their yearned dream.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Mercedes R. de 28 años y su esposo Héctor Alberto de 27 años, son una joven pareja de esposos que poseen una pequeña hija de tres años y tienen el anhelo inmenso de forjar en su compañía un hogar sólido lleno de armonía.Así sumergidos en las labores agrícolas, muestran gran optimismo y confianza, poniendo todo su empeño en el cultivo de hortalizas y tubérculos, los cuales ofertan a los comerciantes mayoristas del lugar. Todo este esfuerzo está dando frutos ya que han iniciado hace poco la construcción de su propia casa.Esto ha sido una fuente inmensa de motivación para ellos y por eso desean mejorar la calidad de sus productos a través de una mejor utilización de insumos y semillas, por lo cual solicitan un préstamo de 275 dólares que los ayudará en sus propósitos para concluir la construcción de su anhelado sueño.

loans.use: Capital investment to purchase raw materials and seeds in order to optimize production / Inversión de capital para adquirir más insumos y semillas a fin de optimizar su producción.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene is 54 years old, married, and has two children. Rene is a contract bricklayer, and his wife sells food in their guest house. With these businesses they can meet their family's needs. Rene has a lot of experience in the field of construction, and his wife has been making and selling food in their guest house for quite some time as well.

In the construction field there isn't as much competition as there is in the food business. The family is well established and well known in the area, and Rene's wife has a reputation for delicious cooking. Rene also offers excellent quality services and is known for his high quality work.

The present loan is for the purchase of a freezer and also supply the guest house with items. Rene does not have debts to any other institution other than ours.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rene es una persona de 54 años de edad, su familia se encuentra compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos. Rene presta sus servicios como albañil contratista, por otra parte su esposa vende comida en su pensión ambos atiendes estos negocios par abastercer las necesidades de la familia. Rene tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro de la construcción, así también su esposa atiende hace bastante tiempo en su pensión con el negocio de las comidas.

En el rubro de la construcción actualmente no hay tanta competencia como en el de comidas, pero debido a que la familia es antigua en la zona, son bastante conocidos y la sra. tiene reputación de cocinar muy rico. Rene por su parte se dedica a ofrecer servicios de excelente calidad y también atiende con el acabado de obra fina.

La presente solicitud es para la compra de un freezer y también para abastecer de diferentes cosas la pensión. Rene actualmente no tiene deudas en ninguna Institución ajena a la nuestra.

loans.use: Freezer and supplies for guest house.

loans.name: Gabriel Juan

texts.es:
Gabriel, 56, is a respectable man. He has shared with his wife María many life pleasures and difficulties, which only strengthened and solidified their marriage. Gabriel has suffered terrible pain in the gall bladder and even underwent several surgical procedures. Currently, he is in the process of full recovery. Everything has been possible through the little money they saved, which were used for these purposes, but this family's optimism never died out. They want to convert and adapt their home into a rustic inn due to the influx of tourists and lack of available lodging in the city. They need a loan that will allow them to realize these dreams and continue with the process of recovery so Gabriel can share it with his lovely wife. Let's cooperate so there will soon be a charming Peruvian inn for the many tourists who visit this lovely corner of the world.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Don Gabriel de 56 años de edad, es un noble señor que junto a su esposa María, compartió a lo largo de toda su vida momentos gratos y dificultades inmensas, lo que ha hecho que sus lazos matrimoniales sean muy sólidos y cada vez más fuertes.Hace mucho tiempo Don Gabriel presentaba terribles dolores en la vesícula por lo que tuvo que ser intervenido quirúrgicamente y ahora se encuentra en pleno proceso de recuperación, todo esta realidad produjo que el poco dinero que tenían ahorrado sea utilizado para estos fines, pero esto no ha quitado el optimismo a esta familia. Por lo que desean acondicionar y acoplar su casa para hacer de ella un hotel campestre debido al gran flujo de turistas y la nula capacidad hotelera de la ciudad.Necesitan un préstamo que les permitirá hacer realidad estos anhelos y así mismo continuar con el proceso de rehabilitación, para que junto a su esposa pueda seguir compartiendo su inmenso amor.Colaboremos para que pronto exista en este bello rinconcito peruano un hotel capaz de albergar a muchos turistas deseosos de conocer este bello lugar.

loans.use: Convert  and adapt home into a fabulous rustic hotel

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir P. is married and has an 8-year-old son. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine, where Vladimir works as a taxi driver. He has been in business for 8 years, and this is the only source of income for his family. His current daily income is about $30-40. Vladimir’s father, who is retired from his previous work, is actively helping his son with the business – both father and son work together as taxi drivers.

Vladimir wants to install liquefied gas equipment in his car to reduce his running costs, which is why he is requesting a loan of $1200. Vladimir willingly works day and night because he understands that he is the head of his family and the only breadwinner. He likes his job and having financial independence and believes that private entrepreneurship is by far a better option then working as a hired employee. Vladimir is planning to invest his profits into remodeling his home, where he has just finished some construction work.

loans.use: To modify fuel system for taxi

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena Y. is married with a son. Her family lives in Zaporozhye, Ukraine. Yelena runs a small business selling leather purses and wallets in the central city market of Angolenko. She has sold different types of inventory in the past. However, she decided to sell purses because there’s a lot less trouble picking the right sizes and shapes for customers than there is for clothing. Yelena has a good taste and knows how to please even the most demanding customer. That is why all her purses usually sell very fast.

Yelena has been in business for seven years. Currently, she has about $2000 in inventory, and her monthly net profit is about $400. She would like a loan of $1200 to purchase new bags and purses from wholesalers to sell this fall/winter season. Yelena has been in this trade long enough to know that fall is always a profitable season for a market vendor, as many people go shopping before the Christmas holidays. Yelena wants to make sure her son receives a decent education, which is why she invests much energy and finances into his studies. This loan will help Yelena fulfill her full business potential.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married and has a little daughter named Alina. Their family lives in Khoost, in western Ukraine. Yuliya is a private entrepreneur who sells women’s outer wear in the central city market. Her vending spot is well-known in the market for having high-quality inventory. Yuliya has had good experience working as a market vendor. She started her own venture only two years ago; presently, her turnover capital is a little over $3000, and her monthly net profit is about $1500.

Yuliya can boast of a good reputation with other market entrepreneurs and her customers. Her business is stable and profitable. Yuliya is ready to work even harder because she loves what she’s doing and it offers her family stability and confidence for the future. Yuliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her inventory, and her sales and income as a result.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina K. is married and has a 19-year-old son. Their family lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. Galina owns a vending kiosk where she sells women’s clothing in the central trade center. There are always many customers there. Her business is well known in the city for having relatively low prices and good quality clothes. Galina has been in business for 3 years. Presently, she has $10,000 in inventory and her monthly income is about $1600.

Galina has a big responsibility as the only bread-winner in the family. Moreover, she pays her son’s college fees because she wants to give him a good education and have him take over her business later.

Galina would like a loan of $1000 to increase her assortment of inventory and purchase 50 dresses. She is ready to invest more finances and time into her business to see it grow and provide a better livelihood for her family.

loans.use: Increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly Charry is a 43 year old hard working house wife. With much effort and sacrifice she tries very hard every day to provide to her loving family and the good education of her four children. Her husband goes out everyday very early and works in the transport industry, she goes to her small warehouse where she stays most of the day. Most of the money they get from the warehouse they spend it paying rent. She also spends much money buying medicine for her epileptic son, which worries her a lot. Apart from this tough reality, this noble woman still has motivation and she will keep putting all her effort in her work. This is why she needs to increase the products she sells through new investment, this way she will contribute in a more effective manner to her family’s needs. Let’s help this mother to face her loving son’s illness courageously.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Nelly Charry de 43 años de edad es una abnegada madre de familia, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, se esmera diariamente con el único propósito de brindarles un futuro mejor a su amada familia y una buena educación a sus cuatro hijos.Su esposo sale todos los días muy temprano a trabajar ya que es transportista y ella después de contribuir con sus hijos se encamina rumbo a su pequeña bodega en el que permanece la mayor parte del día. Sin embargo gran parte de los ingresos de la bodega se invierten en el pago del alquiler del local, ya que su vivienda se encuentra en una zona que no es comercial y a este pago se suma la compra diaria de medicinas que su hijo toma porque sufre de un cuadro epiléptico muy penoso y preocupante.Toda esta realidad, no ha hecho decaer el ánimo de esta noble mujer, si no que por el contrario la ha motivado a seguir esforzándose y es por ello que desea incrementar sus productos a través de una inyección de inversión, con los cuales podrá tener mayores ingresos económicos y así contribuirá de manera más efectiva con las necesidades de su familia.Ayudemos a que esta diligente madre afronte eficazmente la enfermedad de su querido hijo.

loans.use: To buy more quantity and variety of first-need products for her small warehouse.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina R. is married with two cute daughters. Her family of four lives in western Ukraine. Irina owns a bakery business located in the historic part of downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Despite the fact that her business location is very favorable and Irina could set high prices, she has decided to stick with a reasonable pricing policy. This approach, along with Irina’s passion for baking, has been a defining factor in the success of her sales.

Irina has been in this trade for 4 years. Her business has witnessed considerable growth since then. Today Irina’s working capital is about $8000 and her monthly income is about $1000-$1400. Her bakery business is now the main source of income for her family. Irina works hard to provide for all of their needs. She wants to see her business grow to guarantee her husband and kids a decent future. Irina is planning to open a small pastry factory and is already saving up to make her dream come true. Irina hopes this loan will assist in meeting her goals and achieving lasting success in business.

loans.use: Remodel vending facility

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila S. is married and has a teenage daughter. She is a private entrepreneur who works in the central city market of Melitopol selling men’s clothing. Her kiosk offers a large variety of men’s outer wear at reasonable prices. Ludmila has been in business for 10 years. Today she has about $5000 in inventory and her working capital exceeds $4000. Ludmila has benefited a lot from five years of partnering with Nadiya Ukraine. Lending services have helped her buy a new vending facility in a different part of the city, reach sustainability in her business, and have given her confidence for the future.

Ludmila needs a loan of $1200 to re-stock her inventory and purchase clothing wholesale for the fall/winter season. She believes that the sphere of market trade where she works is a promising niche and will continue to grow and develop in the future.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso #4 Group

texts.en:
Chabela lives with her three children and husband in the Seaside town of Samaná. She is the only one who consistently provides an income for her family, so she is always working hard to advance her colmado - local grocery store offering daily provisions such as rice, beans, canned foods, breads, and vegetables - and make a better life for her children and husband.

She hopes to use this loan to diversify the products that she is able to offer her neighbors. With the extra savings she expects to make, she hopes to one day build a home out of concrete blocks, on top of her colmado. She says this would be ideal because she could allow her store to stay open longer, and she would also feel that her products were better protected from burglars. Lastly, it is very important to her to have a home built out of concrete block. Because they live right on the coast, and often face strong tropical storms, concrete homes offer much more security, safety, and endurance.

She says that thankfully she has not had to overcome any significant challenges in her life, but that like every other poor person in the DR, she wants to improve the lives of her family members. Chabela is very thankful for your support in helping to make her dreams come true, and make her life more peaceful, happy, and healthful.

NOTE: This $1200 loan will fund Chabela's business as well as five other businesses in her solidarity group. She and five other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina D. is married with two children. Her family lives in the small town of Mikhailovka, Ukraine. Marina runs a small business selling cosmetics and perfumes in the local market. She is very friendly and amiable. Marina started her own venture four years ago; today she has about $4000 in inventory.

Marina is a very consistent entrepreneur. She is constantly trying to improve her business while making money in the process. She is always willing to take risks and accept rewards when they come. Marina believes that this loan of $500 will help her as she further develops her business and works to take it to the next level of long-term sustainability.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en:
Maxim is married and has one daughter, Anastasia. He and his family live in Melitopol, Ukraine. Maxim started his own small venture after his relatives suggested he should try his luck as a market vendor. Today Maxim runs a small business selling children’s clothing and accessories in the central city market. His vending facility has a very favorable location and offers a large assortment of merchandise, which attracts many customers to his kiosk. Maxim believes that financial support from Nadiya Ukraine has helped him boost his sales and grow his business. After three years in operation, his turnover capital is about $2000, his monthly gross income is around $1200, and his monthly net profit is about $300.

Maxim would like a loan of $800 to purchase inventory wholesale for the fall/winter season. He believes this loan will help him further develop his business and get additional income to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married and has two daughters. She and her family live in Kherson, Ukraine. Oksana owns a café and a small grocery store in two different locations in the central city market – a good spot to sell as it is a very busy place. With friendly customer service and delicious cooking, her café is very popular in the market. Oksana has been working in this sphere for two years. Her average monthly profit is about $600.

Oksana has perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. She has repaid ten different loans without any delinquencies. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase some new equipment for her café. Oksana hopes that modern technologies will help her business operate more efficiently and generate additional profit as a result.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for cafe

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia A. is married and has a grown daughter. She owns a small retail business in the central city market of Zaporozhye, Ukraine. She has worked as a market vendor for quite a long time and has gained rich experience in retail. Anastasia is a wise steward of her finances and is a smart manager. She works with reliable suppliers who deliver wholesale inventory directly to her vending kiosk, helping her reduce her costs.

Anastasia started her business in the mid-90s when Ukraine was going through an economic boom period. Many people took risks and became private entrepreneurs in those days. Anastasia has now been in this trade for about twelve years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $3000 and her net profit is about $600 a month.

Anastasia would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase her assortment of purses, backpacks and travel bags for winter season. Moreover, she wants to expand by starting up a second business selling women’s lingerie.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory and expand business

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married and has a two-year-old son. He works as a taxi driver in Ivano-Frankivsk, western Ukraine. He has been in this business for 6 years and his daily income is about $40. Ivan has repaid all of his loans in good time. He hasn’t had a single late payment since he started working with Nadiya Ukraine.

Ivan would like a loan of $1200 to help purchase a new vehicle. He needs the specified amount to make a down payment on the vehicle and prepare all of the necessary paperwork.

Ivan likes being independent and is a real go-getter. He wanted to start his own business and he achieved his goal. Now as he sets new goals for the future, he is hoping that additional financial assistance will help him grow business-wise and become self-sustainable and successful.

loans.use: Purchase new taxi vehicle

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza #1 - Light And Hope #1 Group

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “ Luz y Esperanza” group—meaning light and hope. She is asking for this loan so that she can continue to buy shampoos, conditioners, and other hair treatment supplies for her beauty shop. She says that this loan will help ensure that she always has enough supplies for her customers, and will also help her to offer higher quality products to attract new customers.

Maria says that her dream is to one day build her own beauty shop where she can serve her clients. Right now she rents both her beauty shop and her house from someone else, and it’s hard to keep up with rent and savings. Maria is also very involved with her Catholic church.

She and her husband are both very thankful to everyone supporting them, they are very excited to take advantage of the opportunities this loan will give them to improve their lives, and their business.

NOTE: This $1000 loan will fund Maria's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To buy hair treatment supplies

loans.name: Celia Luz

texts.es:
Celia C., 24, and her husband Edgar, 32, have two young children. Their struggle to escape poverty is one of many in Perú. They work together daily on their small land, growing and raising various crops. Thankfully, both are seasoned agricultural workers, having had experience since youth. For personal reasons, they still live with their in-law, who left the home in their care. Their great wish is to build a house of their own where they can live comfortably; they own a small plot of land where they can build their dreams. For this reason, they seek a loan that will allow them to buy a little more land to improve and quality and increase the quantity of their crops. This will allow them to start construction of their own house. Their dreams are dependent on your kind cooperation.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Celia C. tiene 24 años, junto a su esposo Edgar de 32 años tienen dos menores hijos, los cuales son su motivación para continuar con la incansable lucha por salir de la pobreza en la que están sumergidos una multitud considerable de personas en el Perú.Juntos trabajan diariamente en su pequeña parcela de tierra, cultivando diversos productos gracias a la experiencia adquirida por ambos desde pequeños, aún viven en la casa de su cuñado, que por algunas circunstancias personales, tuvo que dejar su casa a su cuidado. El gran anhelo que posee esta familia es construir una casa propia donde poder vivir cómodamente ya que poseen un pequeño terreno, donde iniciar estos sueños.Y a razón de este hecho solicitan un préstamo con los que podrán comprase una parcela más de tierra para mejorar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos de cultivo a través de una mejor implementación de semillas; esto les permitirá iniciar la construcción de su casa y también de sus sueños contando para este fin con su gentil colaboración.

loans.use: To buy a small lot of land for optimal production

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina Poluboyarinova is married with two children. She and her family live in Dneprorudnyi, Ukraine. In the past Marina had tried to start other ventures, but struggled with many challenges. She decided to work in the shoe business because it proved to be profitable and stable. Marina has been in business for over 10 years now. Her kiosk offers a large variety of footwear for every season.

Marina wants to purchase new seasonal inventory and increase her income. She believes a good variety of inventory will attract many customers and help meet their need for warmer and more comfortable footwear. Marina’s consistent and perseverant efforts will help her repay this loan and continue to grow professionally as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.en:
Mikhail T. is married with a two-year-old daughter. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine, where Mikhail works as a taxi driver and operates a fleet of four taxis. He has a whole network of loyal clients who always call on him when they need taxi services. Mikhail has been in business for 8 years now. His daily income is about $40-50.

Mikhail learned to drive when he was a kid. When he grew up his skill helped him earn his living. Mikhail enjoys being a taxi driver. He is serious and very energetic. Moreover, he is very responsible too. He has repaid all of his loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any defaults. Currently, he is requesting a loan of $800 to pay dues and fees to process all the paperwork for a new vehicle he bought abroad. After all the formal procedures are over and documents are ready, Mikhail will be able to use this car in his taxi business as well.

loans.use: Complete purchase of new taxi

loans.name: La Revolución #3 Group

texts.en:
Ramonita sells gasoline to her community members, and says that thankfully there is only one other person in Sanchez who gives her competition, but he lives on the other side of town. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger amount of gasoline, and consequently, allow her business to better meet the needs of her community members.

Her dream is to be able to finish building her house; she currently has a cement floor and a few layers of concrete block on the ground level. She says she hopes to finish it within the next two years with the help of the earnings she will generate with this loan. She also wants to send her three children, ages 20, 18, and 16 to the local university so that they can become professionals and have a better life than she has had.

Ramonita is incredibly thankful that she is being given the opportunity to take out this loan, and wants to say thank you to everyone who is helping her finish her house, and send her children to a university.

NOTE: This $1050 loan will fund Ramonita's business as well as five other businesses in her solidarity group. She and five other micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: Purchase gasoline to sell

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel M. and his wife live in Khoost, Ukraine. Pavel owns a car and works as a taxi driver. He has been in this business for 4 years. His monthly profit currently amounts to around $400.

Pavel is requesting a loan of $200 to fix his car. Without the credit, he would not be able to afford to make the repair. Pavel wants to keep his business and work as a taxi driver because he loves getting to know other people who are traveling different places.

loans.use: Repair taxi

loans.name: Angela Teresa

texts.es:
Sra. Angela belongs to "Las Triunfadoras" (The Triumphant) community bank in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 51 years old and the mother of 7 children, 3 of whom live with her. Her husband died 5 years ago, leaving her a widow with kids to support and no immediate source of income. She decided to take out a loan for a new business so that she and her children could get on with their lives. With a prior loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) from Manuela Ramos, she set up a meat-selling business in a stall at a local market. Her children have helped her with the business, organizing themselves so that they could both help their mother and complete their studies.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (about US$333), to be repaid in 4 months, Angela will be able to increase the size of her orders and buy 150 kilos of meat at only S/.6 (about US$2) per kilo and 10 "visceras" (cow entrails?), each for S/.50 (about US$16).

Angela is very pleased because she knows that her efforts will improve her quality of life and her children's.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Angela pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, su vivienda esta ubicada en la Av.Alfonso Ugarte 258 del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre de 7 hijos, de las cuales 3 aún viven con ella y 4 son mayores independientes, ella quedó viuda hace 5 años, al encontrarse sola con sus hijos y sin apoyo económico ella decide hacer un préstamo para trabajar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, entonces con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 soles, puso un negocio de venta de carne roja en un puesto del mercado. En la actualidad cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en la venta, donde cada uno de ellos se organizan para poder cumplir con sus estudios.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, incrementará las cantidades de sus productos y podrá comprar 150 Kg. de carne a S/ 6.00 c/Kg. y 10 Visceras a S/.50.00 C/uno.

Angela está muy satisfecha porque sabe que su esfuerzo mejorará la calidad de vida de ella y la de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Lomas De Yarina" and her home is located in A.H. Los Rosales MZ.4LT.19, Callería District, Ucayali State. She is 42 years old and has three children. Upon finding herself away from her city of birth, she began to see that her husband's income wasn't enough to cover the household expenses. That is when she decided to start a business and with the first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she began a business selling spices.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos for 2000 soles (approximately US $667), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will increase the quantities of her products and she will be able to buy 7 sacks of garlic, one sack (50 kg) of cumin, one sack of cinnamon, and cloves (20kg).

Aurelia is content and satisified because in addition to this business she also raises chickens and has a motocar taxi service with which she provides employment for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Aurelia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina”, su vivienda esta ubicada en el A.H. Los Rosales MZ.4LT.19 del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 3 hijos, al encontrarse fuera de su ciudad natal, ella empezó a ver que el ingreso de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos en su hogar. De allí es que ella decide poner un negocio y con el primer préstamo que le dio Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 soles, ella pone un negocio de venta de especierías.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 667.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, incrementará las cantidades de sus productos y podrá comprar 7 sacos de ajos, un saco ( de 50 Kg.) de cominos y un saco de canela y clavo de olor (20 Kg.).

Aurelia se siente contenta y satisfecha porque además de este negocio también se dedica a la crianza de pollos y tiene un vehículo de transporte de servicio publico (motocar) con el cual brinda trabajo a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase spices.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
For 4 years Juana has belonged to the Communal Bank "La Amistad." Her home is located in Jr. Huancayo Mz. A Lte. 4 AA.HH Nuevo Bolognesi, Callería District, Ucayali State. She is 34 years old and she is a single mother to one daughter.

Today she raises 300 guinea pigs, 20 sheep, and 34 chickens at her house.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos of 2000 soles (approximately US$667), which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy primarily nutritionally balanced food, vaccines, and will build pens for the animals she raises.

Juana feels very moved and thankful because she can perform the roles of both father and mother to her little girl and as a woman she feels satisfied in her personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad” desde hace 4 años, su vivienda esta ubicada en el Jr. Huancayo Mz. A Lte. 4 AA.HH Nuevo Bolognesi, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 1 niña, es madre soltera.

En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de cuyes (300 unid.), carneros (20 unid.) y gallinas(34 unid.) los cría en su casa.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 667.00 aprox.), que lo pagará en 5 meses, comprará alimentos balanceados al por mayor, comprará vacunas e implementará los corrales para los animales que cría.

Juana se siente muy emocionada y agradecida porque puede desempeñarse como padre y madre para su bebita y como mujer porque se siente satisfecha en su desarrollo personal.

loans.use: Purchase food and vaccines, and build animal pens.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" of Callería District in ucayali State. She is 32 years old and single. She began the business of selling juanes and tamales with her mother, who taught her to work and business strategies, so that in the future she could own and manage her own business. (Juanes are an Amazonian dish, consisting of rice, chicken, black olives, and eggs all wrapped tightly in a large leaf from the jungle.) Upon receiving her first loan of 300 soles in 1992, she decided to become independent and she started her own business selling Juanes and tamales in the market.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos for 1300 soles (approximately US$433), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will be able to buy the ingredients to prepare the juanes and tamales (100-150 prepared daily) and she will pay the personnel who support her, as today the demand on her business is great.

Zoila is happy because she feels she is a capable woman and accomplished personally and in business, and in the future is planning to install a soda fountain and be able to employ additional people.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es soltera, inició el negocio de venta de juanes y tamales junto a su mamá, quien le enseñó a trabajar y a conocer las estrategias del mismo, para que a futuro ella tenga el manejo y la administración de su propio negocio, ya en el año 1992 Zoila al recibir el primer préstamo que recibió de S/ 300 soles decidió independizarse, instaló su propio negocio de venta de Juanes y tamales en un mercado.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,300.00 (US$ 433.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, podrá comprar los ingredientes para la preparación de los juanes y tamales (100-150 diarios) y pagará al personal que la apoya, ya que en la actualidad la demanda que tiene en su negocio es mayor.

Zoila esta contenta porque se siente una mujer capaz y desarrollada tanto en lo personal como en lo económico, y a futuro esta proyectandose en poner una fuente de soda y así también podrá dar trabajo a otras personas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make juanes and tamales

loans.name: Nora Ricardina

texts.es:
For 8 years Nora has been a member of the Communal Bank "La Amistad," her home is located in AA. HH. Victor Manuel Maldonado Begazo Mz. D Lte.5i, Callería District, Ucayali state.

She is 53 years old and is the mother of 6 children, her spouse helps her in the making and selling of cheese. Today she sells approximately 300 cheeses per day that are distributed in the market and she is supplier to a supermarket.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos of 2300 soles (aprox. US $767.00), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy more supplies for her business (500 liters of milk). Nora is very happy and fulfilled as a woman, mother, and businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nora pertenece desde hace 8 años al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, su vivienda está ubicada en el AA. HH. Victor Manuel Maldonado Begazo Mz. D Lte.5i, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 53 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo le ayuda en la elaboración y venta de sus quesos . En la actualidad vende un aproximado de 300 quesos al día que son distribuidos en el mercado y es proveedor de un autoservicio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300 (US$ 767.00 aprox.), el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará más insumos para su negocio( 500 litros de leche). Nora se siente muy feliz y realizada como mujer, madre y empresaria.

loans.use: Purchase milk to make cheese and cheese making supplies

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
52 years old Nguyen Thi D. is a great example of how to raise above poverty. Before joining TYM fund, she only have a two-compartment cottage, while raising her children and not having any fund to start her business of raising cattle. In 2002, when TYM arrived, Mrs. D. took out a loan of 75 USD to invest in her business. Now, she has a bigger house, a television, and a motor-cycle with daily earning of 3 USD. She is requesting for an additional 325 USD loan to expand her cake-store to sell at nearby hamlets.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Đường, 52 tuổi, là một trong những tấm gương điển hình về xóa đói giảm nghèo. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị chỉ có hai gian nhà tranh, nuôi con hết sức vất vả, không có vốn sản xuất chăn nuôi. Năm 2002 khi có Quỹ về chị đã vay vốn với mức vay 75 USD dùng vào buôn bán đến nay chị đã có ba gian nhà via và mua sắm được ti vi, xe máy, với mức thu nhập mỗi ngày là 3 USD. Dự tính vòng vốn tiếp theo chi xin vay 325 USD để mở rộng cơ sở làm bánh tiêu thụ ở các xã lân cận.

loans.use: Make more cakes.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
If anyone ever go past hamlet 4 of Hung Yen village in Hung Nguyen province, they will find a small local butcher shop serving the villagers. At a very young age of 33, Mrs. Nguyen Thi S. had already beared 5 children, and apart from running the butcher stall, she also works in 5 acres of cornfield. Mrs. S. is asking for a loan of 325 USD to expand her business by having more products and variety for the people of the hamlet.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Nếu ai đi qua xóm 4 xã hưng Yên, Hưng nguyên chúng ta sẽ bắt gặp một quán nhỏ buôn bán thịt lợn phục vụ cho người dân trong xóm. Với tuổi đời còn trẻ, mới 33 tuổi, nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu đã nuôi 5 đứa con, ngoài buôn bán chị còn làm thêm 5 sào ruộng. Chị Sáu đang đề nghị TYM cho vay 325 USD để chị xây được gian hàng để mở rộng buôn bán thực phẩm và các mặt hàng phục vụ người dân trong xóm.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi K. joined TYM in 2002 with the first loan of 75 USD to start a small sale business. After some success, she gained more courage and decided to borrow an additional 200 USD to open a rice wholesaling business. Now, her business has about 6250 USD in fund and with an expected income of 200 USD per month in the near future, she would like to request a loan of 625 to expend her business even more.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Khiêm tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002 với mức vốn ban đầu chị vay 75 USD để buôn bán nhỏ sau đó chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn 200 USD, vòng vốn thứ 3 cùng với vốn tự có chị đã mở cơ sở thu mua gạo. Đến nay chị đã có cơ sở kinh doanh với số vốn là 6250 USD. Với múc thu nhập là 200 USD/tháng dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ vay của Quỹ là 625 USD để mở rộng kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy rice

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Dr. O. is an obs/ gynaecology practitioner who runs a reproductive health Centre in Nakuru, Kenya. He is 50-years old and lives with his wife and thirteen children (6 of whom are biological and 7 adopted - they are all currently in school). He trained as a medical doctor in 1981, after which he worked with the government for eleven years. He resigned from the government and started his own private facility in 1992. His facility has gradually expanded in the recent past owing to the previous microfinance loans he has received from KMET. He has been able to incorporate a number of other health services to his offering and improved the quality. Dr. O. carries a very good reputation from his many years of good work in Nakuru and his clientele base has grown from the the initial 5 per day to 15 per day. He now requires an additional US $1,200 to further expand his clinic.

loans.use: Expand his clinic

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine A. is a 31-year old widow who lives with her four school going children (she lost her husband due to an HIV-related illness) in Rongo town Kenya .  She has taken and successfully repaid two previous microfinance loans from KMET.  She sells second hand clothes along Rongo Homabay road. She initiated her business in1998 with US $15. Her business has since grown with a daily income of US $50. She is now planning to move to a more spacious place due to increased clientele.   Christine is a community-health worker trained in home-based care by KMET in 2005.  She is, thus, well-known within her community for her health-care work.  She requires US $600 to further purchase more stock of second hand clothes and pay rent for her new shop.

loans.use: Purchase stock of second hand clothes

loans.name: Hazariah

texts.en: Hazariah is a 35-year old married father of 2 living children. He has spent one and a half years running his small grocery stall in Rongo market Kenya. His hard work, perseverance, good reputation coupled with a well-established clientele base ensures that his business will continue to grow despite stiff competition. Hazariah requires US $600 to purchase an additional stock of of vegetables and supplement it with charcoal selling to generate more income

loans.use: Buy additional stock of grocerry and supplement with charcoal selling to generate more income

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose P. is a 46 year old widow who lives with her three children in Rongo, Kenya. Rose trained as a nurse in the year 1986. After her training she worked with the government  for 8 years. She opened her own clinic in 1994 in Rongo town .She offers general curative services, family planning, counseling, and maternal and child health care services, and also has integrated a pharmacy and laboratory. Rose attributes her success to hard work, perseverance and assistance from KMET’s microfinance loan.  She has been able to renovate her facility, purchase stock of drugs and improves the quality of care she provides.  Rose plans to purchase stock drugs for her pharmacy, move the facility to a more spacious place with the US $1200 she is applying for.

loans.use: Purchase stock of drugs for her community pharmacy and pay rent for a more spacious place.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 34-year old mother of six school going children. She lives with her family in Rongo town, Kenya.  She is a beneficiary of two previous microfinance loans from KMET.  She was initially employed as a dress maker until 2006 when she initiated her own business. She started this  by hiring a sewing machine at US $45 a month. Through hard work, she managed to purchase her own machine in August 2006 and now has four. She specializes in making women dresses and school uniforms. The central location of her shop in a busy town coupled with many years of doing good business within the community, has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base.  With access to KMET loans she’s able to expand her business to include training site (dressmaking) for school dropouts within the community. She intends to acquire an additional stock of dressmaking materials with a portion of the US $800 loan she has applied for.

loans.use: Buy dressmaking materials

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a dedicated 38-year old community health worker (CHW).  She is a widow and lives in Rongo town with her three children.  Through her own initiative and hard work and aided by one previous KMET microfinance loan, Linet managed to expand her business and build a successful community pharmacy.  She moved her business to a more prominent and spacious location (pictured) three years ago in order to meet growing demands.  Her friendly demeanor and approach to her clients and customers has earned her respect and a good reputation.  The community likes her work and has grown accustomed to her, thus ensuring the successful continuity of her business.  Linet requires US $800 in order to further expand her pharmacy, purchase drugs in bulk in order to boost her profits; and partly pay school fees for her children’s’ continuing education.

loans.use: Expand and purchase more stock of drugs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is a 39-year old entrepreneur and mother of five school-aged children.  She and her husband live in Rongo, Kenya.  Janet began her current business of selling second-hand and new clothes 2004.  She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, casual and formal tops.  She periodically travels to Nairobi, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices.  The prime location of her business on a busy street, her 3 years of experience and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good clientele base.  Her customers return to her shop for a wide selection or to make requests for certain styles.  Janet plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800. She will use the money to invest in a trial stock of new ready-made clothes, increase her current stock of second-hand clothes and put the remaining funds into her savings so that she may continue to purchase new stock even when cash flow slows due to delays in customers’ payments.

loans.use: Buy additional stock of new and second hand clothes

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha who is a trained nurse is a very active 52-year old member of her community.  She is married and lives with her husband and five of their children in Rongo, Kenya. Tabitha is very well-known within her community for her compassionate work. Her main business and source of income, however, is the clinic and community pharmacy, which she has managed for the past 15 year’s years.  Given her reputation and the location of her clinic/pharmacy, her business has flourished.  The most commonly purchased drugs in are those to treat malaria, diarrhea, asthma and upper respiratory infections.  Tabitha credits her success to hard work and the assistance she has received from KMET through three previous microfinance loans.  She plans to use the funds from her next loan of US $1000 to expand both her businesses.

loans.use: Purchase stock of drugs

loans.name: Vilayet

texts.en: Vilayat  A. is a 21-year-old businessman who owns his small business in Saatli in the southern region of Azerbaijan. Vilayat raises and sells onions and potatoes. He also sells tinned tomatoes made by his mother. Tinned vegetables are very popular among the Azerbaijani people and they are in very high demand, especially in autumn and winter. His mother prepares the tinned vegetables and Vilayet helps her. He just started his business in 2006 and since that time he has improve his life conditions. He has applied for 800 USD to rent a small place in the local bazaar. This would help him to increase the number of clients and sell more products than he sells now.

loans.use: Going to expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Metanet

texts.en: Metanet H. is a  31-year-old woman who owns  poultry and sells it to the local people and bazaar traders . Metanet lives with her husband and three childfren in Bilasuvar in the the southern region of Azerbaijan. She is an internally displaced person who fled from Jabrail to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.  Metanet has five years of experience, however it is the only source of income in her family and it is very hard for Metanet and her husband to cover all the family 's needs. Sometimes they have a very hard time, when they do not have any food at all, beside the poultry they sell.  Metanet has decided to purchase a diverse number of poultry which will help her to increase turn-over of her sales. For this purpose she has applied for 1000 USD to purchase more and diverse poultry.

loans.use: Going to purchase divers poultry

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en: Shamama F. is a  38-year-old woman who owns a sheep raising business in a small southern village of Azerbaijan near to the Imishli region. She started her business in 2002 when she and her husband found it necessary to start their own business, because they both were unemployed and it was very hard period for them. They borrowed some money from their friends and first purchased  two lambs. As the sheep grew, Shamama sold them to the local bazaar trader and earned money. With their first income they paid back their debts and continued raising sheep for meat production. Mutton is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use meat almost  every day . Selling sheep is the only financial source in their family. Shamama has three children. As their children grow up they havemore expenses, but the money they earn from selling is  not enough to cover big family needs. Shamama has applied for 1200 USD for purchasing 20 sheep. The estimated cost for one sheep is 50-60 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala Q. is a 23-year-old farmer who sells vegetables from her garden to the local bazaar traders. She lives in the 2nd IDPs settlement in Bilasuvar region. Kamala is an internally displaced person who fled from Jabrail region to Bilasuvar in 1993 during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict. She started her business in 2003 when she was only 20. This idea came to her mind when she felt that very soon she and her family could stay hungry. With saved money, she purchased seeds of some vegetables and during  the summer she sold most of her harvest. With the money from her first harvest she saved money for autumn and winter. She is still raising vegetables, but now she wants to expand her business and to rent land for planting and raising more vegetables. For this purpose she has applied for 800 USD.

loans.use: Going to expand her business of planting vegetables

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham Q. is a 48-year-old butcher who sells meat in the local bazaar of the Imishli region. He lives in Imishli with his family and has  owned his business since 1996. First he was raising and selling meat to the local bazaar traders, and later he opened his own store where he cut and sold meat. He has many regular clients. The money IIham earns from selling is enough tonly to cover family needs and his working place is not very good. His place of working is very small, damp and dark. He would like to improve his working conditions and for this purpose he applied for 800 USD. This loan will help him to repair his small shop. He believes good conditions in his working place will help him to attract more clients and generally improve his business.

loans.use: Going to repair his butcher shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Shamsi

texts.en: Shamsi H. is a 39-year-old man who owns a small farm and raises livestock in the southern Azerbaijani region of Sattli. Shamsi is married and has three sons. He does everything possible to improve the conditions of his family. He has more than ten years of experience in this field. But during the last two years this business brings him less and less income. Currently Shamsi has two calves. As soon as they are raised he will sell them. Selling claves for meat production is the only o financial source of income in his family and he works very hard. Beef is in very high demand among Azerbaijani people and people use meat in their everyday cuisine. Shamsi decided to expand his business and purchase three calves each for 300 USD. For this purpose he has applied for 900 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 10 bales of used clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothes business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 10 bales of used clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes for her small business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Lân, 34 years old, was a member in a difficult situation: unmarried and had no money. With the loans from the fund, she invested in retails business. She opened a general store selling footwear and beauty accessories among other things. She is now the owner of a spacious store. Her revenue is about 125 USD a month. She's applying for a loan of 500 USD to buy more stock for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lân, 34 tuổi là một thành viên có hoàn cảnh đơn thân hết sức khó khăn, không có vốn để chăn nuôi buôn bán. Từ khi có Quỹ chị đã vay tối đa các vòng vốn và đầu tư vào buôn bán. Chị đã mở quầy hàng buôn bán giày dép mỹ phẩm với mức thu nhập 125 USD/tháng chị đã có một quầy hàng khang trang. Dự tính hết vòng vốn này chị sẽ vay mức vốn 500 USD để mở rộng các mặt hàng kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining TYM fund, 33 years old Nguyễn Thị Hiền and her family could only depend on the crop from their small piece of land. After consulting with her husband, she applied for a loan from TYM fund to buy machinery to husk rice. It was a good move on her part as the rice husking business brings in 125 USD a month. She's requesting a new loan of 325 USD to buy more machinery and expand her business. Her family had raised above poverty and they are an example for other entrepreneurs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Khi chưa tham gia vào quỹ thì cả gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền, 33 tuổi, chỉ trông chờ vài sào ruộng nhưng sau đó chị đă bàn bạc với chồng và mạnh dạn vay vốn của Quỹ về đầu tư mua máy hoạt động rất hiệu quả với mức thu nhập 125 USD/tháng dự định chị xin vay 325 USD để mua thêm máy móc để mở rộng cơ sở xay xát đến nay gia đình chị đã thực sự thoát nghèo và là tấm gương điển hình của quỹ về việc làm ăn kinh tế giỏi.

loans.use: Buy machinery to husk rice.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị V., 46 years old, is unmarried but determined to to work hard for a better future. She joined TYM fund in 2002. Her first loan was only 75 USD, she bought goods to resell. After 5 years, she now owns a general store selling all kind of goods. The revenue from the store is 110 USD a month. Her plan is to apply for a loan of 375 USD to buy more stock for her store to better serve her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị V., 46 tuổi, là một thành viên đơn thân nhưng với sự vươn lên cố gắng của bản thân năm 2002 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn làm ăn. Vòng vốn ban đầu chỉ có 75 USD chị đã đầu tư vào mua những mặt hàng phục vụ nhân dân sau 5 năm kinh doanh đến nay chị đã có một gian hàng phục vụ tương đối đầy đủ các mặt hàng với mức thu nhập 110 USD/tháng. Dự định của chị là sẽ vay 375 USD để mở rộng các mặt hàng kinh doanh phục vụ nhân dân và tăng thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Hoàng Thị Nhiên is 42 years old. She lives in the village of Hưng Trung, Hưng Nguyên district. She became a member of TYM fund in September 2002. Her first loan was 75 USD and she invested in livestock. After 2 years, with her savings and another round of loan, she opened a general store selling all kind of goods: cookies, candies, shoes, beer, alcohol ...etc. Her money was well invested: the revenue from her store is 150 USD / month. She's requesting a new loan of 950 USD to buy more goods for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Nhiên, 42 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 5 con tại xã Hưng Trung, huyện Hưng Nguyên. Chị tham gia vào quỹ từ tháng 9 năm 2002 với mức vay đầu tiên là 75 USD chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Với kết quả khả quan thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, vốn vay từ năm thứ 3 chị đã đầu tư vào mở cửa hàng buôn bán các mặt hàng hóa bánh kẹo bia rượu, giày dép .v.v... chị đã sử dụng đồng vốn rất có hiệu quả với mức thu nhập 150 USD/tháng dự định chị sẽ xin vay 950 USD để mở rộng các mặt hàng kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Sra. Jenny belongs to the "Las Azucenas" (The Lillies) community bank in Peru's Ucayali region or "departamento", where she lives. She is 45 years old, separated from her husband and the mother of two children. She started her business with her mother but subsequently decided to strike out on her own.

She now relies on a drinks and food business. With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,300 (1,300 Peruvian soles or about US$433), to be repaid in 4 months, she'll be able to expand her shop and buy more drinks to stock her business.

Jenny is pleased that she's been able, along with her kids, to get ahead and to show everyone that she's an enterprising business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jenny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Azucenas” vive en el Jr Mariano Melgar 132 AA.HH - Ucayali del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Está separa de su esposo, tiene 45 años y es madre de dos hijos. Se inició en el negocio con su mamá, posteriormente ella decidió independizarse.

Actualmente cuenta con un negocio de venta de bebidas y comida rápida, con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/1,300.00 soles ($ 433), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, podrá ampliar su local y comprara más bebidas para surtir su negocio

Jenny se siente satisfecha de poder salir adelante conjuntamente con sus hijos, y así demostrar a otras personas que es una mujer emprendedora de negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Sra. Rosa joined the "Madres Coraje" (Mothers of Courage) community bank more than a year ago. She lives in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 27 years old and the mother of a 4-year old son. Her husband is a construction worker. Rosa has a small store that she set up with a prior loan from Manuela Ramos.

With a new loan of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$333) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 4 months, she is air conditioning a space in her house to put in a gym, something not now available in the neighborhood.

Rosa is pleased that she'll finally be able to set up the gym, something that she's wanted to do for some time, because she knows that the extra income will allow her to continue helping her mother and her brothers and sisters.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “ Madres Coraje “ desde hace un año y 4 meses, su casa esta ubicada en el Jr. Dos de Mayo 694 del distrito de Yarinacocha del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años y es madre de 1 pequeño de 4 años, su esposo es albañil. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega la que implementó con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, está acondicionando un espacio de su vivienda par poner un Gimnasio ya que por el lugar donde ella vive no existe ninguno.

Rosa está contenta porque al fin podrá poner el gimnasio que quería desde hace tiempo y porque sabe que podrá tener mayores ingresos para seguir ayudando a su madre y sus hermanos.

loans.use: Air conditioning for a neighborhood gym business.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Sra. Rene joined the "Madres Coraje" (Mothers of Courage) community bank 7 years ago. She lives in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 45 years old and the mother of 4 children; her husband works at a local school.

She relies on a business selling clothing door to door or, occasionally, at a riverside market.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,100 (1,100 Peruvian soles or about US$367), to be repaid in 4 months, she'll be able to buy a "fardo" (a bundled container) of clothes to maintain her business.

Rene is a woman fulfilled. Though her husband doesn't want her to work, she is working and contributing to the family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rene pertenece al Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje ” desde hace 7 años, su vivienda esta ubicada en el Jr. 16 de Octubre del distrito de Yarinacocha del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 4 hijo, su esposo trabaja en un colegio.

En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio, que es la venta de ropa la cual lleva a vender de casa en casa y en algunas ocasiones por el río.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,100 (US$ 367.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, podrá comprar un fardo de ropa para poder continuar con su negocio.

Rene se siente realizada, aunque su esposo no quería que trabajara, ella ahora es una mujer que trabaja y ayuda económicamente en hogar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Doi Thi

texts.vi:
Since Mrs. Doi Thi L. has always been working hard as a fisherman, she looks older than other people at her age, 52. Before joining TYM Fund in 2003, she was always at sea, and only came home once in awhile. Thanks to TYM Fund, she can stay home to breed pigs and poultry. She also sells fish which her husband catches each time he comes ashore. Part of her loan from TYM Fund is spent towards fish net and other fishing tools. Her family income has significant increase. After subtracting the cost, her profit is about 50USD to 60USD. This time she would love to borrow 325USD to repair raft to catch fish.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Là người dân vùng biển, quanh năm đánh bắt hải sản trông chị Đới Thị Lưu già hơn tuổi 52. Thời gian trước chị cùng chồng thường xuyên đi biển ít khi về nhà. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vào năm 2003 chị nghỉ đi biển, ở nhà tập trung vào việc chăn nuôi lợn gà. Mỗi lần chồng đi biển về, chị lại mang số cá anh đánh được ra chợ bán. Nhờ vay vốn Quỹ gia đình đầu tư vào việc mua sắm lưới, dụng cụ đánh cá khiến thu nhập tăng lên. Mỗi tuần đi biển trừ chi phí gia đình thu lãi từ 50 USD đến 60 USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD để tiếp tục đầu tư cho chồng sửa sang bè đánh cá tiếp tục công việc làm ăn của gia đình.

loans.use: Repair raft to catch fish

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi B., 56 years old, and her husband Pham Cong Dung, live in Quang Xuong district of Thanh Hoa province. They have 4 children and while their oldest son is already married, his family still lives with them. Since she joined TYM Fund, she has had funds to expand her business. Mrs. B.’s husband trades birds, and she stay home to raise pig and poultry as well as helping her daughter-in-law with her sewing. This term, she requests for a loan of 375 USD to buy more garment for her daughter-in-law. Due to her good needlework, her sewing stall is in good business and the average income per member of her family is about 35 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Gia đình chị Lê Thị Bạo, 56 tuổi, và anh Phạm Công Dụng hiện đang sinh sống tại huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Anh chị có 4 người con, hiện con trai lớn xây dựng gia đình nhưng vẫn ở cùng bố mẹ. Từ ngày tham gia Quỹ đến nay gia đình chị đã có thêm vốn để mở rộng loại hình buôn bán. Chồng đi buôn chim cảnh, chị Bạo ở nhà chăn nuôi và phụ giúp con dâu may mặc. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375 USD để sử dụng vào mục đích mua thêm vải cho con may tại nhà. Cũng nhờ có bàn tay khéo léo mà quầy may nhà chị lúc nào cũng đông đúc. Thu nhập bình quân đầu người của gia đình chị Bạo là 35 USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lê Thị Hiền, 31 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children in a shoreside village near Quảng Hùng, Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hoá. It was very difficult for her family to get a loan. All the banks required collateral. Since her family was in a difficult financial situation, it was impossible to qualify for a loan. When TYM fund opened a branch in Quảng Xương, she could qualify for loans from TYM because it was based on trust and support between women. With the loans, she buys fishes and resells at the market. The living condition of her family is not high standard but it had improved a lot. Everyday, she sells fishes at the market, she brings home about 125 USD a month. Her wish is to qualify for bigger loans. This time she's requesting a loan of 325 USD to buy fishing nets and fishes to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Hiền, 31 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ ở vùng quê ven biển thuộc xã Quảng Hùng, huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hoá. Việc vay vốn đối với gia đình chị trước đây gặp rất nhiều trở ngại. Các ngân hàng cho vay đều đòi hỏi phải có tài sản thế chấp nên để một gia đình có hoàn cảnh kinh tế khó khăn như nhà chị Hiền vay được vốn là điều gần như không thể. Từ ngày quỹ TYM về với Quảng Xương hoạt động với hình thức cho vay dựa trên sự tín chấp, bảo lãnh giữa phụ nữ vay vốn với nhau, chị đã có vốn để làm ăn, mức sống tuy chưa phải là cao nhưng đã có chiều hướng đi lên. Hàng ngày đi chợ bán cá thu nhập khoảng 125 USD/tháng, chị Hiền vẫn luôn mong muốn được vay những mức vốn cao hơn. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD thêm vốn vào mua lưới đánh cá và mua thêm cá để bán.

loans.use: Buy fishes and fishing-net

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi H., 46 years old, has been in TYM for 4 years now. Her husband is a fisherman so he is frequently away from home. The work off-shore requires the fisherman to be away for a whole month each trip. During these trips, Mrs. H. stays at home to brew rice wine and sell fishes at the local market. Her sources come from her husband as well as other fishermen. Even though life is still hard, it has been much better than how it used to be prior to joining TYM. Now, they have an additional source of funds to buy fishing equipments and increase the efficiency. The average income is about 200 USD per month for each of them. They also have 5 children, 2 of which are still going to school. Mrs. H. would like to take out a loan of 325 USD to buy new fishing-net and more rice to brew wine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị H., 46 tuổi đã vào Quỹ được 4 năm. Chồng chị là người dân vùng biển nên việc vắng nhà thường xuyên đã trở thành thông lệ. Việc đánh bắt cá xa bờ đòi hỏi người đi biển phải ở trên thuyền có khi cả tháng trời. Chị H. ở nhà nấu rượu và đi chợ buôn bán cá. Mỗi lần anh về chị mang số cá anh đánh được đi bán còn thường chị lấy hàng từ những người đánh cá khác. Cuộc sống tuy còn nhiều vất vả nhưng đã khá hơn so với khi chưa tham gia Quỹ, anh chị đã có thêm nguồn vốn vay dùng cho việc đầu tư mua thiết bị đánh cá nhờ đó hiệu quả lao động tăng lên. Thu nhập của gia đình mỗi tháng khoảng 200 USD chia đều cho 2 vợ chồng. Anh chị có 5 người con trong đó hai người còn đang đi học. Chị H. đang xin vay 325 USD để đầu tư vào mua lưới đánh cá và mua lúa về nấu rượu.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net, rice for brew rice wine

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Mai Thị Hợi is 54 years old. She and her husband have 4 children. Since they live in a shore side village, selling fish at the market is a natural occupation for her. When her husband was still in the army and on duty away from home, Hợi had to make a living and raised their children by herself. The main fish suppliers for her inventory are the fishermen in her village. When her oldest child bought a fishing boat and started working for his own, Hợi joined TYM fund and invested her loan in the fishing equipment. Now that her son supplies her fishes, she makes bigger profit. Everyday, she and her daughter in law go to the market to sell fishes, their revenue is about 130 USD a month. Her husband is now a retiree and receives 125 USD a month from the state pension. Ms Hợi is applying for a new loan of 325 USD to buy new fish nets and invest in her son's fishing boat.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Mai Thị Hợi năm nay đã bước sang tuổi 54. Vợ chồng chị sinh được 4 người con. Là người dân vùng biển, bán cá ngoài chợ đã trở thành công việc quen thuộc với chị Hợi. Thời gian trước anh Hoa chồng chị công tác trong quân đội ít khi ở nhà, một mình chị Hợi buôn bán nuôi dạy các con. Nguồn cung cấp chủ yếu cho hàng cá của chị vẫn là từ những người đánh cá trong làng.
