Sau khi con trai đầu mua thuyền và tự đứng ra tổ chức công việc đánh bắt cá, chị Hợi đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn đầu tư vào việc mua trang thiết bị đánh bắt. Nguồn thu nhập nhờ đó cũng tăng lên do có nguồn hàng trực tiếp trong gia đình. Chị và con dâu đi chợ bán cá hàng ngày thu nhập 130 USD/tháng. Chồng chị là hiện đã nghỉ hưu lương hàng tháng trên 125 USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD về đầu tư cho con trai mua lưới đánh cá.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Tám, 51 years old, lives in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa. She has been a member of TYM for 4 years. The loans had been very helpful to her and her family because they had accumulated lots of debts previously. Now things are for the better. Her husband is a fisherman and he brings home a decent revenue. Their financial situation had much improved. Ms Tám is applying for a loan of 325 USD to buy new fish nets for her husband with hopes that it would help her husband catch more fishes then her family financial condition would be better.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva vonlunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tám, 51 tuổi, sống tại huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa vào Quỹ được 4 năm. Việc vay vốn trả dần đã giúp chị Lê Thị Tám đã đỡ vất vả vì thời điểm trước gia đình chị còn nợ nhiều lắm. Chồng đi biển thu nhập khá, đến nay đời sống gia đình chị cũng đỡ vất vả. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD để đầu tư vào mua sắm lưới đi biển cho chồng. Hy vọng với bộ lưới mới năng suất thu được sẽ cao hơn nhiều, gia đình chị sễ khá lên trong thời gian tới.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander supports his wife, Nina, and their child with a small business selling men’s and women’s coats. He operates from a little space at the central market in Ordzhikanidze, Ukraine, where he maintains a nice variety of coats to choose from. Alexander has been in business for eleven years. With good quality products and affordable prices, he has developed a solid customer base, and his business continues to grow.

Alexander has requested a loan to increase his working capital and allow him to purchase new inventory. The fast approaching colder season means higher demand for his warm coats. This loan will help Alexander be prepared for the busy season so he can maximize his profits and provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has a small business selling women’s coats and shoes at a busy market in Pavlograd, Ukraine. She decided to start her own business because of a low salary at her previous job. In business now for ten years, she makes about $400 in profit per month. Nataliya sells products that are in good demand in Ukraine. This past year she decided to diversify her inventory and increase her income by selling shoes. Nataliya and her husband Alexander have two daughters. One daughter was married not long ago. Nataliya would like to use some of her income to help them buy a place to live.

Nataliya has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase new inventory. As the cold season approaches, this loan will help her increase her profits and be prepared for a busy time of year.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina started her own small grocery business about a year ago in the village of Teisariv near Stryi, Ukraine. She operates her store from a building on property she and her husband, Andrei, own. Prior to becoming an entrepreneur, Galina worked as a cashier in another store, gaining valuable experience for being out on her own. Her business has done quite well thus far. She maintains about $1500 worth of inventory on hand sells around $3000 worth of groceries in a typical month.

Galina has requested a loan of $700 to make some improvements to her store. She’d like to purchase some shelving material and buy a scale to use for weighing food items. These investments will help Galina as she continues to develop and expand her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay off some bills as well as help her daughter with her college tuition. In the future, she would also like to do some remodeling to her store so that she can increase her retail space. This is Galina’s fifth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for another opportunity to assist her in developing a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase shelving and a scale

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a hard-working entrepreneur from Pavlograd, Ukraine. Pictured here with her clothing business at the large Central Market in Pavlograd, she also has a second business – a hair salon. An experienced business owner, Lubov has been self-employed for the past eighteen years. Her honesty, polite manner, and attentiveness help attract and maintain customers. Lubov is married and has two children. Her daughter is currently in college. With income from her businesses, Lubov is able to pay for her daughter’s schooling.

Lubov has requested a short term loan of $2000 to do some remodeling in her hair salon. Her goal is to increase the variety of services offered at the salon. Having two businesses increases the financial stability of Lubov and her family. We are happy for this opportunity to help her as she continues to develop her businesses and meet her long-term goals.

loans.use: Remodel hair salon

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya has a small business selling a colorful variety of delicious candies and sweets from a little stand at the Central market in Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. In business for four years, Uliya has developed a profitable venture selling products that are always in good demand and that keep her sales rate high. Uliya is married and has two children. With monthly earnings of around $400, Uliya’s business is a valuable source of income for her family.

Uliya has requested a loan of $600 to help her purchase a new supply of candy and sweets. Using credit helps her increase profits by allowing her to purchase additional inventory to keep up with a rapid turnover rate. We are grateful for this new opportunity to support Uliya as she works to provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is divorced and lives with her son. She works as a private entrepreneur selling children’s clothing at the Dneprovskyi market in the city of Kherson, Ukraine. Lidiya decided to try her luck in business when she lost her previous job and had to find ways to support herself and her son. She first registered as an entrepreneur six years ago. Since then her working capital has increased to $3000 and her monthly net profit is about $350.

Lidiya has perfect credit history as a client with Nadiya Ukraine. She has promptly repaid three previous loans. Lidiya understands financial assistance is a valuable tool to promote the expansion of her business. That is why she has applied for a loan of $1000 that will provide her with ample capital and resources to develop her business venture and generate more profit.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina K. is married with grown children. She and her husband live in Dneprorudnyi, Ukraine, where Valentina sells office supplies in the local market. The demand for this type of product is high in Dneprorudnyi because there are many new schools and offices in the town.

Valentina has a good reputation as a responsible and serious entrepreneur. She has gained rich experience expanding her business. Today her net profit is about $600 a month, which is a good financial support for her family. Valentina is happy that the business risk she took five years ago has worked out for her. Moreover, she likes to earn money and contribute to the family budget along with her husband, who works as a miner. We believe her natural ability to deal with challenging situations and stay focused on the future will help her continue to succeed and expand her business even further.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has a daughter. She and her family live in Kherson, Ukraine. Tatyana sells women’s clothing and light footwear in the Dneprovskyi market. Her business has a big advantage – its favorable location in the busy market. Tatyana started out as an entrepreneur six years ago. She strives to buy high-quality goods and to give excellent service, and she has made a favorable impression on her customers. Today Tatyana has about $3500 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $400. She has fully repaid the two loans she previously received from Nadiya Ukraine.

In spite of her excellent reputation and satisfied customers, she doesn’t want to stop at this stage. She wants to continue growing and developing both professionally and personally. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to re-stock her inventory for the winter season. We believe that Tatyana’s perseverance and careful planning will help her to repay this current loan while honing her business skills.

loans.use: Increase inventory of winter clothing

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Mrs. Hen S., aged 32, runs a business renting wedding clothes and doing make up for wedding parties, earning about $11 each day. Her husband works as a soldier, making less than $1 per day. They do not have children. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fashionable clothes, decorations and custom-made items for weddings in order to fulfill her clients’ demands. She plans to use the remainder of the money to buy grocery products to resell to the people in her area to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of clothes and decorations to rent out for weddings.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mrs. Duong N., aged 52, works as a grocer at a stall in the local market, earning around $4.80 per day in revenue. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning about $3.60 per day. They have three children who are employed in a private company. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to use as transportation to work. She plans to use the remainder of the funds to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: To pay for repairs to her kitchen as well as purchase a motor-bike to transport her children to work.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Habiba is 56. She is a single mother of five children. The elder children already have families of their own. The eldest daughter is married and has a business of her own. Habiba has provided her daughter with valuable advice that allowed her to start her own business. Habiba's youngest son is currently helping her with the business. Habiba was one of the first clients of MicroInvest in the city of Spitamen. Over the time that she has been a client of MicroInvest, she was able to significantly increase turnover. She is planing to continue being a MicroInvest client.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Хабибе 56 лет. У нее нет мужа и она самостоятельно воспитывает 5 детей. Старшие дети уже имеют свои семьи. Старшая дочь вышла замуж и имеет свой собственный бизнес. В этом есть заслуга и Хабибы, которая во многом помогла ей своими советами. Сейчас Хабибе помогает ее младший сын. Хабиба одна из первых клиенток Микроинвест в Спитамене. За то время, которое она сотрудничает с Микроинвест, ее товарооборот возрос намного. Хабиба и дальше собирается сотрудничать с Микроинвест.

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Mrs. Hin S., aged 42, makes medicinal rice wine to sell to people in her area, earning about $3.60 per day. Her husband works as a laborer, earning about $2.90 per day. They have two children who are in school. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase more tools for her husband’s construction work. She plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase pigs to rear and resell in the market for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng K., aged 36, is a market vendor selling rice and beans, earning about $4 per day in revenue. Her husband works milling rice crops, earning about $2.50 per day. They have three children, two who are in school and one who is not yet of school-going age.

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory of rice and beans to meet customer demand. She will reduce her costs by purchasing the inventory in bulk, thereby increasing her profit margins and raising her family’s income level.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice and beans to sell in the market.

loans.name: In

texts.en: Mrs. In S., aged 38, is a widow who sells rubber, earning around $12.50 per day in revenue. She has one child who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase two calves to raise and resell at the local market for a profit. She hopes that the proft will bring in additional income to support her and her child.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and resell for a profit.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Mrs. Phen V., aged 51, rears pigs and sells the piglets in the market. Her husband works as a horse-cart driver, transporting passengers and cargo around the neighbourhood, earning around $4.20 per day. They have one child who helps his mother raise pigs.

Mrs Verdy would like to request a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a machine to charge batteries, such as vehicle batteries. The increased income generated by fees charged for the use of the machine will help her family financially and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a battery charging machine to operate a battery charging business.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: Mrs. Mat S., aged 45, works with her husband rearing fish and milling rice crops to sell to the market-wholesaler, earning around $4.80 each day. They have seven children, two who are students and five who work in Malaysia. To take advantage of bulk purchase discounts, she would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase a greater inventory of rice crops to mill. She also plans to use the loan to fund an electric machine to produce sugar cane juice to sell for an additional income stream. She plans to used the increased income to fund her children’s education and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice crops to mill and an electric machine to produce sugar cane juice.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van N., aged 48, works with her husband buying rice crops to mill and resell to a wholesaler, making about $8.50 per day in revenue. They have three children, two who are garment factory workers and one who is a laborer in Thailand. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase additional rice in bulk  to lower her inventory costs and increase sales margins.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk to mill and resell.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem S., aged 32, works with her husband to farm a plot of land growing rice crops, earning about $3.20 per day. They have one child, who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase a hand-tractor to increase the efficiency of their rice cultivation and increase crop output. This will increase the family’s income, which they plan to use to fund their child’s education and reinvest in their farm.

loans.use: To purchase a hand-tractor to increase crop cultivation.

loans.name: Thek

texts.en:
Mrs. Thek K. L., aged 50, works with her husband running a battery charging business. She charges batteries such as vehicle batteries and earns about $7.30 per day. They have three children, one who is a goldsmith and two are married and live separately with their own families.

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation. Mrs Thek's husband is pictured in the photo in front of their shop as she was not available at the time the photo was being taken.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use for the family's transportation.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Mrs. Kol S., aged 35, purchases and resells beans, earning around $2.40 per day. Her husband is a carpenter creating furniture, earning about $9.75 per day in revenue. They have four children, two who are students, one who lives in China, and one who is married and lives away from the family.

She is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase an inventory of beans in bulk to take advantage of bulk discounts, lowering costs and the increasing margins of her business.

loans.use: To purchase beans in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim N., aged 55, is a farmer who earns $2 per day selling her produce. Her husband is a teacher as well as a farmer, earning $7 per day. They have eight children, five who are students, two who are farmers, and one who is a laborer.

She is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase yams in bulk from a plantation so that she can resell them for a profit in the market. She plans to use the increased income to fund her children’s education. Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time the photo was taken.

loans.use: To purchase yams to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som M., aged 32, sells vegetables to earn $2 per day. Her husband works for a private company as a driver, earning $4 per day. They have two children, one who is a student and one who is unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase a rice grinding mill to grind other farmers' rice for a fee. She plans to use the increased income to reinvest in her business, reinforce her house and support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a rice grind mill to start a milling business.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San C., aged 34, raises ducks and sells the eggs, earning $5 per day. Her husband, aged 43, is a fisherman, earning less than $1 per day. They have two children, one who is a student and one who is married and living away from home.

In order to expand her business, she would like to request a loan of $1,200 to purchase more ducks in order to generate additional income for her family. She plans to use any remaining loan funds to purchase feed for the additional ducks. In the future, she plans to reinvest to expand her business further and fund her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional ducks and duck feed to expand her duck  business.

payments.comment: Congratulations! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thanks to your support of entrepreneurs like San Chanthy, small businesses from around the world have access to low-interest capital to help with their operations. We hope that you will continue loaning on Kiva through CREDIT MFI in the future. Sincerely, Jordya Edmiston. Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch K., aged 41, is a farmer and vegetable vendor, earning $8 a day in revenue. Her husband is a farmer, earning $3 per day. They have five children, two who are construction workers, one who is a garment worker earning about $70 per month, and two are students. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase ducks and feed to start a duck breeding business.

loans.use: To purchase ducks and feed to start a duck breeding business.

loans.name: Soth

texts.en: Mrs. Soth L. E., aged 36, is a construction worker earning $10 per day. Her husband, aged 39, is a construction foreman, earning $12 per day. They have three children, one who helps his parents at work and two who are students. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase construction tools for her work as well as pay worker's fees to the contractor.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her work.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang K., aged 49, is a widow who works as a garment worker, earning about $4 per day. She has three children who are also garment workers. Her mother lives with her and her children. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for herself and her children to commute to work at the garment factory.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara has belonged to the Banco Comunal "Las Azucenas II" for one year now. Her home is located on 550 Jr. Los Naranjos in San Fernando in the Callería district in Ucayali. She is 47 years old, she has been separated for 5 years, and she is the mother of 3 children. When she got separated, she began to sell fruits at a market while she studied cosmetology. Presently, she has a hair salon where she works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night.

With the recent loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 1,000 nuevos soles (approximately $350), which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy a mirror, 2 hair clippers, 3 display cabinets, shampoos, and conditioners.Clara feels excited and fulfilled because her business is going well and her clientele is increasing every day.<

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clara pertenece desde hace un año al Banco Comunal “Las Azucenas II”, su vivienda está ubicada en el Jr. Los Naranjos 550, San Fernando del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 47 años, está separada desde hace 5 años y es madre de 3 hijos, desde entonces empezó a vender en el mercado frutas y paralelamente estudió cosmetología.

En la actualidad cuenta con una peluquería donde ella atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual serà pagado en 4 meses, comprará un espejo, 2 máquinas peluqueras, 3 vitrinas y 4 liquidos.

La señora Clara se siente emocionada y realizada porque le va muy bien y su clientela esta aumentando cada día más.

loans.use: Implementation of equipment and purchase of supplies

loans.name: Abdón

texts.en:
Abdón is 44 years old; he lives with his partner Rosa Franco in Paraguarí, Paraguay. Abdón currently manages a company that offers private security services.

Abdón began this business two years ago. Before, he worked as a security guard at a service station. The money he earned in this capacity was very small, and after working there for some time saw the need for security services in other areas. In this way Abdón decided to open his own private security company. His services are currently being contracted by one of the private high schools in the town of Paraguarí. Additionally, he works weekends at special events and parties.

Abdón has requested credit so that he can buy new uniforms. He is planning to employ three new security guards, due to the high demand for his services.

loans.use: To buy new uniforms

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria V., 45, is married to Carlos V., 50, and lives in Paraguarí, Paraguay where she owns a small grocery. Together she and Carlos have two children who already have jobs and homes of their own. Though her husband has a job as a construction worker, Maria decided she also wanted to contribute to the household income by opening her own store.

Maria began her grocery in her house several years ago. As business grew, she decided to move her store closer to the municipal market. Proceeding with this plan and with the willing hands of her sons, who had finished school, she was able to open her store with success.

With the credit she will obtain, Maria plans to buy greater quantities of merchandise, including breads, dairy products and drinks. All of these items are in high demand. She wishes to satisfy her growing customer base as well as increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of merchandise, including breads, dairy products and drinks.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E. is 39 years old, married to Enrique E., living in Paraguari, Paraguay. Together they have two children, ages 17 and 14. Both children are currently in high school thanks to the hard work of their parents.

Norma has a small grocery, which she has been running for several years. She began the store after realizing that her neighborhood was in need of a store selling basic necessities. With the help of her husband she has been able to keep the grocery running. She has been fairly successful and established a strong client base in her neighborhood.

With the credit she has requested, Norma will purchase the staples of her business. These items include: sugar, oil, flour, cookies and other merchandise. The demand for these items already exists, and Norma seeks to satisfy it as well as keep her clientele growing.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, oil, flour, cookies and other merchandise.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: I am Kalsoom B. from Lahore, a large metropolis in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of six: two daughters and four sons. I have been sewing clothes on order from my neighborhood clientele for the last ten years. My husband is a rickshaw driver. He used to drive a rented rickshaw, but last year he bought a rickshaw with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The income rose significantly and we repaid the installments on time. I also managed to send my younger kids to school. Now my eldest son has also learned how to drive a rickshaw, and he wants to help us with our daily household expenses. Please lend me US$500 to buy my son a rickshaw. I will repay your loan on time with due responsibility.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro #3 - Working For The Future #3 Group

texts.en:
Teresa is asking for this loan so she can buy large sacks of sugar and sacks of rice. She says that by being able to buy sugar and rice (two common staples) at wholesale prices, she will be able to both save and earn more money.

She works hard because she wants nothing more than to be able to send her three children to the local university so that they can one day become professionals in whatever field they choose. She plans to use half of her income to continue improving her store, and half for tuition expenses for her children.

She says that she knows her life will be able to advance more with this loan, and she will be able to save a larger amount towards sending her children to the university here in Samaná. Teresa also wants to say thank you to everyone who is helping her make her dream come true and giving her children a brighter future.

NOTE: This $1500 loan will fund Teresa's business as well as five other businesses in her solidarity group. She and five other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through the Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be maD.. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: I am Mussarat B. .I am married and I live in a small rented house with my husband and eight children. My husband works at a local steel factory for a meager income. We were making very hard to manage our living in such a scanty pay.  In order to increase the household income my son started a used clothing business, a couple of years ago with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The business is flourishing slowly since then and has enabled us to uplift our financial status substantially. With the increased income   I was also able to get my daughter a medical treatment for a chronic disease of intestines. My son now requires a loan of US$500 to buy used clothes in bulk which will be cheaper and will enable to earn more profits. We plan to save the extra profits and buy a house of our own.

loans.use: Buy used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: I am Mussarat B. .I am married and I live in a small rented house with my husband and eight children. My husband works at a local steel factory for a meager income. We were making very hard to manage our living in such a scanty pay.  In order to increase the household income my son started a used clothing business, a couple of years ago with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The business is flourishing slowly since then and has enabled us to uplift our financial status substantially. With the increased income   I was also able to get my daughter a medical treatment for a chronic disease of intestines. My son now requires a loan of US$500 to buy used clothes in bulk which will be cheaper and will enable to earn more profits. We plan to save the extra profits and buy a house of our own.

loans.use: Buy used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: I  am Razia S.. I moved to Lahore with my parents from Pattoki, a small town, when I was only six. I am married and have five children. I make jewelry tassels and my husband operates a ready made garments business. He buys these garmernts from a nearby small factory and sells them to different shops in the city. The wedding season is around the corner and I need to buy ready made garments in a large quantity. I will be able to double my income from this business expansion. I will save the extra profits and in future I plan to start a small garments factory of my own. We need a loan.

loans.use: Buy garments in bulk.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: I am Nida B.. I was born and brought up in Karachi, but moved to Lahore after I got married. I embroider clothes for my neighborhood clients, whereas my husband is a scrap dealer. He buys second hand spare parts of various machines and sells them in different cities. Now he wants to open up a store and start selling these spare parts in it. In this way, he will earn more and will not have to travel to other cities to sell his products. I will save the extra profits for my child who has yet to come into this world. We need a loan .

loans.use: Buy used spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Mohammad Dawood

texts.en: Mohammad Dawood lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is in university, and he also has a car parts shop. He works part time in his shop, and he is the only one supporting his family. He wants to expand his business. He wants to take an individual loan to buy extra stock for his shop to attract more clients and make a good monthly income. He wants to support his family better and make a better future for himself. He is happy now.

loans.use: To buy extra stock for his shop

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: I am a widow and the mother of four children. I sell rugs and carpets door to door, whereas my son operates a ready made garments business. He had to quit his studies after his father’s death to support the family and help his younger brother and sisters continue with their studies. We need a loan of US$350 to expand the ready made garments business. My son will buy garments in bulk and will save on the cost per item.

loans.use: Buy ready made garments in bulk

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: I am Gulzar B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am the mother of eight children. My husband is old and weak and therefore does not work. My eldest son is the only bread winner of the family, and he runs an auto lubricants store. The business yields just enough to clothe and feed the family members. Our expenses are growing along with our children. My son now feels the need to expand the store by adding various automotive products to the existing product range. We are hopeful that this expansion will increase our household income substantially. Please give us a loan.

loans.use: Expand auto lubricants business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: My name is Nasreen J., and I am married and have five children. My husband trades used clothes. He buys these clothes from a used clothes wholesale market and sells them at various shops in the city. We find it very hard to make ends meet. We need to increase our income by investing in our current business. My husband will buy in bulk and therefore sell more, which will eventually lead to higher profits. Please lend us US$500.

loans.use: Buy used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: I am Noreen A.. My husband works at a local steel factory for a meagre pay that is insufficient for us to manage our day to day expenses. Thus, in order to better meet the expenses and send the children to school I started a jewelry business. I get artificial jewelry from the local wholesale market on order and embed required gems in it. I am able to get three to four orders a month and for every order I get a profit of $35. I want to expand my business and buy a machine on which jewelry is made. This way I will no longer have to work for someone else and my profits will increase significantly. With the increased profits I hope to change the current school and send my children to a better one.

loans.use: Buy a jewelry machine

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: I am Naseem B. from Lahore, the second-largest city in Pakistan. I am the mother of an only daughter who studies in grade four. I knit sweaters, and my husband works at a local factory for a small salary. Winter is around the corner, and the demand for woolen sweaters will increase significantly. I need a loan to expand my business and buy wool in bulk. With the increase in profits, I plan to buy another knitting machine and hire a worker.

loans.use: Buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: I am Shaheen A., and I was born and brought up in Abbotabad, a small mountainous town. After my marriage I had to move to Lahore with my husband. I have eight children, two daughters and six sons. All of my sons together operate an embroidered clothes business except the youngest one who studies in grade ten. They started this business with the loan I took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. My sons need to expand their business so that they can take on bigger orders and earn more. They will buy an embroidery frame and a peco machine. We need a loan.

loans.use: Expand embroidered clothes business

loans.name: Naz

texts.en: I am Naz B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I live in a small rented house with my husband and three children. I used to make decorative tassels but now due to my weak eyesight I have had to quit that business. My husband operates a fruit cart. My eldest son is an apprentice at an auto workshop, whereas the younger one is an apprentice at a blacksmith shop. My eldest son has now attained a suitable level of expertise and he wishes to open up his own auto workshop. We are poor people and we do not have the required start up finances. Please lend us US$350 .

loans.use: Open up an auto workshop.

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en: Mrs. Krishna Kumari M. is a 32 year old woman who lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district of Kathmandu valley. Thecho is one of the backward areas of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband, a son and a daughter. Her son is studying in grade 5 and her daughter is in primary school. Her husband's name is Ganu Ratna M.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop a year ago. All the requirements of the family are fulfilled by the shop's income. Therefore Mrs. M. seeks a Rs25000 loan to buy timber to meet the demand for the furniture. Her husband makes different varities of furniture like beds, tables and chairs to sell.

loans.use: Krishna Kumari would like to buy timber for furniture work.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: I am Shaheen B., and I am married with two children. My husband operates a snack stall in a nearby market. I remain at home and prepare snacks for his stall. We make very little money from the business, although the business does well. It is because we do not have money to prepare more and sell more. We need to buy raw materials in bulk for the business so that we can serve a larger number of customers and earn more money. We need a loan.

loans.use: Expand food stall items

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en: I am Asifa R. from Lahore, a big metropolis, and I have been married for three years. My husband and I operate a food stall in the nearby market, where we make and sell fried chicken pieces. Our customers really like the taste of our food. Therefore, day by day the number of customers is increasing. But we do not have the necessary funds to buy raw materials in bulk and respond to a greater number of customers. We need a loan to expand our business .

loans.use: Expand food business

loans.name: Gun Kumari

texts.en:
Gun Kumari M. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. She lives in Thecho of Lalitpur district. Thecho is also famous for vegetable farming. Her older son makes traditional idols and her younger son is studying in grade 5. Her husband Mr. Santa lal M. is a carpenter. Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making ladies' dresses. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouse, Ladies long dress, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. M. took a 4 month training course in tailoring. 
Now she seeks Rs30000 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work like clothes, string and a cutting machine.

loans.use: Gun Kumari would like to buy raw materials for her tailoring shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Bina

texts.en: Bina M. is a 39 year old woman and she lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Ashok M. works in the peon post in a bank. Her older son is studying in grade 5 and her younger son is in primary school. Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop 4 years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. Now she needs a loan of Rs20000 to increase the necessary stock of food for her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits and others. She wishes to use her income to give better education to her children.

loans.use: Bina would like to buy grocery goods to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Estevao Rafael

texts.pt:
Estevao lives with the woman with whom he had two children. He works for a private company. His salary alone was not enough to pay for the cost of building their house; thus, he applied for the loan. Estevao's children are not going to school yet, but as soon as they reach the required age, they will be enrolled in a regular school. His wife is a housewife..

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Estevao e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 2 filhos. Ele trabalha numa Empresa Privada.O seu salario nao e suficiente para poder investir na construccao de sua residencia. Por isso ele recorreu ao emprestimo para tal. Os filhos de Estevao ainda nao estudam. mas quando atingirem a idade serao matriculados num estabelecimento de ensino.A esposa de estevao e domestica.

loans.use: Estevao wants to use the money to purchase material to build his house.

loans.name: Chandra Bedi

texts.en: Mrs. Chandra Bedi M. is a 40 year old woman and she lives in Thecho. She lives in a single family with her husband, a daughter and a son. Her husband Mr. Asta M. works as a laborer in housing construction. The income of her family is so low their life is very miserable. They hardly can fulfill their needs. She can't provide good education to her children. Mrs. M. is a farmer. She has her own land. She grows different vegetables like cauliflower and green vegetables. She sells vegetables in a local market in the morning and in the evening every day. Now she seeks a loan of Rs10,000.00  to buy fertilizers and seeds for her work.

loans.use: Chandra would like to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Teresa Da Conceicao

texts.pt:
Teresa is a single mother of one child. She works for a private company. She wishes to invest the loan in her clothing retail business. She lives with her son who currently goes to a day care, but once he is old enough he will be enrolled in a public school.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa e solteira mas tem 1 filho pequeno. Ela trabalha numa Empresa Privada. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para investir no seu negocio de venda de roupa. Teresa vive sozinha com o seu filho. Ela apenas vai a uma creche. Mas logo que tiver idade sera matriculado numa escola Publica.

loans.use: Teresa wants to use the money to purchase more clothing for her retail business.

loans.name: Zaida Marcelo

texts.pt:
Zaida is a single mother of three children. The eldest is on the second grade while the other two have not reached the minimum required age yet. She will enroll them as soon as they do. She wants to use the money to purchase vaccines and feed for her chickens. She foresees appplying the profits to build a house for herself and her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Zaida e mae solteira. Ela tem 3 filhos. O mais velho estuda na segunda classe, enquanto os dois mais novos ainda nao tem idade para ir a escola. mas logo que les atinjam idade escolar ela os ira matricular. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de vacinas e racao para os frangos. Com os rendimentos ela pensa investir na construcao de uma casa para ela e para os seus filhos. .

loans.use: Zaida wants to use the money to purchase vaccines and feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda H. owns a shop from which she sells cleaning supplies and perfumes. She started her business in 2001, when she and her husband rented a stall and began selling perfume. Umeda soon noticed that that there was a strong demand for cleaning supplies, and decided to add them to her line of goods. This turned out to be a good decision, because today she sells a wide range of cleaning supplies to a large number of regular customers. Because sales are strong, Umeda is able to use her loans to expand her business and increase her income. She has come to us for a loan of $875 to buy additional goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Xadreque Mungoi

texts.pt:
Xadreque is single and lives with a woman with whom he has two daughters. Both of his daughters are attending school. His wife takes care of their smallholding and the household duties. He intends to invest the money in the purchase of products to adorn cakes at the bakery. He plans to finish up remodeling their house. He lives in the Macia village.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Xadreque e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem duas filhas.As filhas de xadreque estao a estudar. A mulher trabalha na machamba e nos restantes afazeres domesticos. Ele quer usar o dinheiro para investir na pastelaria na compra de produtos para a confeccao de bolos etc. Com os rendimentos, mais arde ele pensa concluir a construccao de sua residencia. Ele vive na vila da Macia.

loans.use: Xadreque wants to use the money to purchase products for the bakey.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 39 year old single man. He sells clothes, shoes and even mobile phones in the region of Borj Barajneh. Abbass has some samples at home of the products he sells. He presents them to the neighboring shops and once he gets an order, he buys the required quantity from the wholesaler and gives it directly to the retailer. You can see him in this picture at home with a couple of clothing samples. Abbass needs a loan to buy the merchandise of the orders. This is the second time Abbass has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is constantly investing in his business and trying to improve it.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is 18 years old. He lives in the region of Borj El Barajneh where he offers phone connections to the inhabitants. Walid does not limit himself to this networking service; he also sells magazines and newspapers, etc. He therefore needs $600 to buy enough merchandise for the coming year. Walid wants to be independent and is working hard for that. He is determined for the success of his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
Mahfuza H. , one of the best clients we have at Microinvest, has come to us for a loan of $350 to buy new soft drinks to sell to her customers.

Mahfuza always makes very productive use of her loans, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Her business is located in the popular Panjshanbe market in Khujand, the second largest city in Tajikistan. At this market, she rents a container which she uses to keep her products cold.

Mahfuza is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and provide for their education.

loans.use: Purchase of additional drinks to sell

loans.name: Nader

texts.en: Nader is 28 years old and is engaged to get married. Nader supports himself and plans to support his future family with the income of his taxi driver occupation. Nevertheless, Nader needs a loan to help him start that new family he and his fiancée are planning to build. They will be living in the region of Borj El Barajneh. We wish them all the best.

loans.use: For his marriage expenses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Halid

texts.ru:
Halid Mirzoeyv was born in 1985. He lives in the city of Agsu. He is married and has a child. He is a highly-skilled barber and has been working in this business for four years. He wants to buy new equipment for his barber shop. He seeks to obtain a loan from the Agsun branch of Normico to purchase a generator and other electrical equipment.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мирзоев Халид 1965 года рождения. Родилсья и проживает в городе Ахсу. Семейный, имеет одного ребенка. Этот прекрасный мастер уже четвертый год подряд работает в этой сфере. Халид хотел купить новые оборудование для своей мастерской. Он взял кредит в Нормикро Ахсуниского филиала. Купил генератор и другие электротовары.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22837

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein fixes car tires in the region of Borj El Barajneh. He also sells car products in his workshop. He therefore needs a loan of $1200 to purchase the required products and material for the sustainability of his business. His clients come from the neighboring area. Hussein is an old beneficiary of Al Majmoua. This is his 7th loan with the Institution, and he has a very good on-time repayment credit history. Hussein is a very hard-working and reliable 28-year-old young man.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru:
Aydin Ismailov was born in the city of Agsu in 1980. He is single. He has been raising bees for more than seven years. It is a very profitable business. Aydin is in need of additional funds in order to expand his business. He came to the Agsu branch of Normicro for a loan. He hopes to be able to borrow $500 to allow him to buy five boxes and increase the amount of bees he owns.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Исмаилов Айдын 1980 года рождения. Холост . Родился и проживает в городе Ахсу. Более семи лет занимается пчеловодством. Бизнес очень прибыльный. Айдын хочет расширить свой бизнес и для этого ему требовалось дополнительные средства.После обрашения в Нормикро Ахсинского филиала он получил кредит на сумму пятьсот долларов. На эту сумму он купил несколько ящиков чтобы размножить семейство пчел.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22839

loans.name: Kubra

texts.ru:
Kubra Q. was born in the city of Agsu in 1956. She is married and has three children. She has been working in this business for more the 10 years. The pharmacy, however, needed repairs. This is why Kubra has come to Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) in search for help. Her first loan allowed her to fix her pharmacy. She is looking to secure a second loan to be able to increase the selection of products she has to offer.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Караева Кубра уроженка города Ахсу. Родилась в 1956 году.Замужем . Имеет троих детей. Стаж работы в этой сфере уже более десяти лет. Аптека нуждалась в ремонте. Кубра обратилась за помощью в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала . Взяв кредит она отремонтировала свою аптеку. Она вторично обратилась в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала чтобы расширить ассортимент товаров.

loans.use: To increase the selection of goods

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22840

loans.name: Mirvahid

texts.ru:
Mirvahid K. was born in the city of Agsu 1958. He is married and has three children. He diligently takes care of his business. He is very hardworking and takes good care of his clients. However his car is in need of repairs. Mirvahid came to the Agsu branch of Normico LLC in order to obtain a loan that will allow him to fix his car.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Камилов Мирвахид .Родился 1958 году. Женат.Имеет троих детей. Уроженец города Ахсу. Активно занимается своей работой.Этот милый и трудолюбивый человек бережно обслуживает своих клиентов.Но автомашина частично нуждается в ремонте. Чтобы отремонтировать автомашину Мирвахид обратился Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала для получения кредита.Получив кредит он отремонтировал свою машину.

loans.use: To repair his car

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 22841

loans.name: Maharram

texts.ru:
Maharram H. was born in 1955, is married and has 2 children. He serves clients with his own car. Maharram needed a loan to fix his car and turned to the Agsu division of Normicro for a loan. By getting a loan in a timely manner he was able to fix his car and to serve his passengers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнов Магеррам.Родился 1955 году. Женат . Имеет двоих детей. Занимается обслуживанием клиентов на своем личном автомобиле. Нуждался в кредите чтобы отремонтировать свою машину. Обратился по поводу кредита в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала.Вовремя получив кредит на сумму пятьсот манатов сделал ремон автомабиля. В данный момент занимается обслуживанием поссажиров.

loans.use: To repair his car

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 22842

loans.name: Kamran

texts.ru:
Kamran M. was born in 1982. He was born and lives in the city of Agsu and is recently married. He owns an Internet Café. Kamran turned to the Agsu division of Normicro in order to get a loan. He plans to use the loan to purchase equipment for the Internet Café and additional computers to meet the demand of his clients.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Маджидов Камран. 1982-го года рождения. Родился и проживает в городе Ахсу. Женился недовно. Его бизнес- Интернет клуб. Обратился в Нормиакро Ахсуинского филиала для получения кредита. Получив кредит на сумму тристо манатов купил оборудоваание для клуба. Активное посишение клиетов вынуждает покупку дополнительных компьютеров. Поэтому Камран намерен взять еще кредит.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente V. is 35 years old living in Paraguay with his wife, Derlina. They do not have children and are currently focused on their business. Derlina and Vicente make a variety of breads, which they sell to various businesses in their neighborhood. 
For Vicente deciding to work as a baker was a natural progression. When he was a child Vicente lived in Argentina where he worked in a bakery. It was there that he learned how to make bread. He worked in this bakery for 10 years. Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit Vicente was finally able to open his own bakery. Today, his clientele is growing dramatically. He sells his bread to individual clients, as well as grocery stores, diners, bars and restaurants. 
With the credit he has solicited, Mr. V. will buy the ingredients need to make his bread. These items include: flour, butter, yeast and oil. He hopes by obtaining additional stock he will be able to increase his production and his income.

loans.use: TO PURHCASE FLOUR, YEAST, BUTTER AND OIL FOR HIS BAKERY

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 55 year old refugee from the Zangilan region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now part of the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  Right now she lives in Baku with her family of her husband and six children.  She started her business of food stuff trade in 1992, right after being relocated because she had to earn a living for her family as her husband is jobless and it is difficult to find a job.  She rents a small space near the location where she lives.  At the beginning, she applied to Normicro Baku branch and borrowed her first loan to start her small business.  Now she wants to expand her business by buying a better booth or shop.  To do this, she has applied for a loan of $700.

loans.use: To buy a new booth or shop to expand her business

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22846

loans.name: Azizov

texts.en: E. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  He and his family were relocated to the Binagadi settlement of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  He rents a shop and trades vegetables, fruits and spices.  He has been in this business for more than 4 years. He now wants to increase his volume of sales as turnover is rather small, invest more in the business and increase his income.  He has now applied to Normicro Baku branch for the first time to borrow $1200 to invest in and expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 22847

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga O., 39, is married to Mario O., 47.  They live in Paraguarí, Paraguay. They have one daughter who helps them in their hair salon during the day, and studies at the University at night. 
Olga has been working in this profession for more than 20 years. As a girl,  a lack of opportunities forced Olga to end her studies and move to Argentina in search of work. In Argentina she assisted in a beauty shop. Shortly thereafter, she was able to work independently and opened her own beauty salon in Argentina. After two years she decided to return to her home country where she opened another hair salon in Asunción.
With the credit she has requested, Olga plans to buy products used every day in her salon. These include hair dye, bleach, shampoo and conditioner. Obtaining these products will allow her to satisfy the high demand for her services as well as increase her income. In this way she will be able to serve her community and her family.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE HAIR DYE, BLEACH, SHAMPOO AND CONDITIONER FOR HER SALON.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Olive would like to buy more tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Garyaghdi

texts.en: Garyaghdi is 44 years old.  He is a refugee from the Lachin region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now part of the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  He and his family were relocated to Baku in 1991.  At that time he started to work as a taxi driver with his own car to earn income for his family of his wife and two children.  He works inside the town and sometimes goes long distances to other regions.  He now wants to buy new tires for his car.  As he has little of his own funds to do this, he has applied to Normicro Baku branch to borrow $600 to buy new tires and to do some repairs as well. This is his first loan from Normicro.

loans.use: To repair his taxi and buy new tires

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 22850

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro Coronoal is a 35-year-old physical education teacher and nutritionist. He is single and lives with his mother and four brothers. He and his brothers work hard to ensure their independence from their mother. 
After finishing his studies to become a physical education teacher and nutritionist, Pedro has begun his work in this field. He has been able to achieve this level of success with the ongoing support of his family. He has been working in this field for the last seven years. His business is growing and he has established a number of regular clients. 
Pedro has asked for a small loan to allow him to buy new weights for his gym, which will open early this summer as people try to get in shape for the warm weather. The loan will allow him to continue successfully in this line of work.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN NEW WEIGHTS FOR HIS GYM, AND HELP GROW HIS BUSINESS AS A PHYSICAL EDUCATION TEACHER AND NUTRITIONIST

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora C., 57, is married to Fernando Casco, 64, a retired soldier. Together they have three children; all of them are married with their own homes and jobs. 
Teodora has been running her grocery store for the past 13 years. Now that she is retired she has more time to focus on her store. She decided to continue with this business in order to ensure her personal progress as well as better the lives of her children. 
With the credit she has asked for Teodora plans to buy merchandise for her store. This includes: rice, sugar, breads, yerba mate, dairy products and drinks. These products will help meet demand, as well as increase her monthly profit.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE RICE, SUGAR, BREAD, TEA, DAIRY PRODUCTS AND DRINKS FOR HER GROCERY STORE.

loans.name: Gulkhanim

texts.en: Gulkhanim is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She and her family were relocated to the Ahmadli settlement of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  She is married and has four children.  In 1997 she started selling household items such as small carpets, table covers, etc to overcome the hardships of life as an IDP.  She travels with goods or she receives orders from her clients and takes goods directly to those clients.  She sells goods from her house as well.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She now wants to increase her volume of sales, invest more in her business and increase her income.  She has had two previous loans from Normicro Baku branch.  Now she has applied for a loan of $850 to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy new goods for sale

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22853

loans.name: Ion

texts.en:
Ion N. is 33 years old, married, and raising three children, one boy and two girls. He has traveled widely and worked abroad for several years, where he earned a good income. But his desire to be with his family led him to return to Moldova, where he now hopes to be able to make ends meet by working hard on his farm.

Ion knows agriculture very well, having grown up in a family of farmers. On his land today, he grows wheat, corn, rye and peas, all of which he sells at a local market. He also has a small vineyard in which he grows Moldova grapes, which are very popular in this part of the world. Ion has come to us for a loan of $1,050 to cover the cost of planting a fall crop and ground cover for the winter. Poor weather and other problems have made 2007 a difficult year so far, but Ion hopes that with careful planning he will do better this fall and next year.

loans.use: Cultivate soil and purchase seeds

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Ganvoy is a 58 year old refugee from the Aghdam region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now part of the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  Right now she lives with her family of her husband and four children in the Garachukhur settlement in suburbs of Baku.  She started her business of food trade in 1993, right after being relocated, because she had to earn a living for her family.  Her husband does now work and helps in her business with things such as transporting goods to the store.  At the beginning, she applied to Normicro Baku branch and borrowed her first loan to buy goods for the store.  Her husband has also built a booth for her.  Now she wants to buy a counter-refrigerator to store meat, ice cream and diary products.  To do this, she has applied for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for her store

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22855

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Helena would like to expand her grocery business.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en: Zahid is a 46 year old Internally Displaced Person from the Khojavand region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  He and his family were relocated to the Binagadi settlement of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  He is married and has three children.  He works as a taxi driver with his own car.  He works inside the town and sometimes goes long distances to other regions.  He now wants to buy new tires for his car.  As he has little of his own funds to do this, he has applied to Normicro Baku branch to borrow $500 to buy new tires and to do some repairs as well.

loans.use: To buy tires and to repair the car for his taxi service

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22857

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en: Tatiana operates two adjacent kiosks at an outdoor market in Buiucani, a suburb of Moldova's capital city, Chisinau. She sells clothing and accessories for women and girls, who come to her kiosks because they offer a nice selection of goods. When it’s time to restock, Tatiana makes her purchases from a wholesale warehouse that has low-priced imported and domestically-manufactured products. Tatiana would like to increase her sales by opening another booth in a different part of the market, but obtaining the necessary space is not cheap. She needs a loan of $1,150 to pay for a permit and a small piece of land located in a high-visibility, high-traffic part of the market that will attract lots of new customers. If she gets the loan, she expects to be so busy in peak season that she will need help from her daughters to tend shop.

loans.use: Working capital to expand her business and increase sales

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is 34 years old, single, and lives in a house with his parents. He has had his own glass business for more than 6 years. He began to work in Asuncion in a glass company, where he gained the knowledge and techniques to cut and shape glass. Later, he decided to open his own small company, which is going very well. Today, he counts on two other people who work with him, whom he taught and now employs, providing work in his community. He will use the loan to buy materials such as smooth glass of different sizes. He has a high demand from his customers, and he hopes to grow his business, create work and increase his income.

El señor Antonio tiene 34 años, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres quienes estan a su cuidado. Antonio tiene su propio negocio, una vidrieria hace ya mas de 6 años. Empezó a tabajar en Asunción en una empresa de vidrios donde adquirió los conocimientos y técnicas del manejo de vidrios como cortes, encurvados, moldes y otros, posteriormente se decidió y emprendió su propia microempresa, donde le va muy bién, actualmente cuenta con dos personas quienes trabajan con él, les enseña el oficio y tembién les remunera, dando trabajo en su comunidad.. Planea con el crédito comprar de materia prima como vidrios templados, lisos de diferentes medidas, tiene una alta demanda, desea seguir agrandando su negocio, generar mano de obra y aumentar sus ingresos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE GLASS FOR HIS BUSINESS

loans.name: Ayna

texts.en: Ayna is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She and her family were relocated to the Yeni Surakhani settlement in the suburbs of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  She rents a booth in the local market and trades vegetables, dry fruits and spices.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She now wants to increase her volume of sales as they are down, invest more in her business and increase her income.  She has had two previous loans from Normicro Baku branch.  Now she has applied again for $500 to invest in her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22860

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Samuel would like to expand his clothing business by buying more clothes to sell and putting up a shade on his stall.

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Almaz is 42 years old. She is a refugee from the Aghdam region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now part of the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  She and her family fled to Baku in 1992 and right now she lives with her family of two children in the Binagadi settlement, in the southern suburbs of Baku.  Her husband has died.  She started her business of food trade in 1993, right after being relocated because she had to earn a living for her family.  At the beginning, she applied to Normicro Baku branch and borrowed her first loan to start her business.  She has borrowed seven loans before and she is one of the best clients.  She hasn't had any late payments.  Now she wants to buy a small freezer to store ice cream, meat and diary products.  To do this, she has applied for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy a small freezer to grow her business

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22862

loans.name: Aldevina Chipachane

texts.pt:
Aldevina is single and she has 2 children. She lives with them and they are both in school. Aldevina joined the program in 2002, but due to circumstances beyond her control, she got away from it for a while. Now, she is ready to return. She works for a private security company in the touristic area of Zongoene, located in the district Xai-Xai. If business goes well she will build an addition to her home to better accommodate her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Aldevina e solteira e tem 2 filhos. Ela vive sozinha com os seus filhos. Todos eles estao a estudar. Aldevina entrou parao Programa de credito em 2002, mas por razoes alheias a sua vontade ela parou por uns tempos. Agora ela esta a recomecar. Ela trabalha numa empresa de Seguranca Provada, numa itancia turistica chamada Zongoene lodge no distrito de Xai-Xai.. Se o negocio correr bem ela que ampliar a sua residencia, uma vez que os filhos estao a crescer.

loans.use: Aldevina wants to use the money to purchase bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana V., is a 37 year old micro-entrepreneur living with her husband Carlos Antonio Vera, who works in construction. Together they have seven children. They live and work in Barrio Villa Policial – Lombaré, Paraguay. 
Mrs. V. has sold fruits and vegetables from a small stand since she was a young child. She goes to the general market every morning to buy the fruits and vegetables for her stand. She has asked for a loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables of a better quality and variety, such as: oranges, watermelons, melons, bananas, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar is an Internally Displaced Person from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory of the Gubadli region, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  Right now he lives with his family in the Surakhani settlement in the eastern suburbs of Baku.  He has a car and provides taxi service.  He is married and has four childen.  He has been in this business for four years.  He drives inside Baku, goes to the suburbs and sometimes to other regions.  Going far distances wears the car out and he now needs to get the engine of his car reassembled.  As he has little of his own funds to do this, he has applied to Normicro Baku branch to borrow $400 to repair his car. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To repair his car's engine for his taxi service

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 22865

loans.name: De Las Nieves

texts.es:
Senora De las Nievas A. de Caballero is married and has one son. He is in his third year studying science at the National University. Her husband also works and they live in a house they own.

Senora De las Nievas is the owner of a dispensary in her house. She began it as a small project, selling a few basic products. But with time, the business kept growing thanks to the increase in customers and the fact that she lives in a busy and highly populated zone.

De las Nievas is requesting this loan to buy various merchandise for her shop, such as tea, sugar, various drinks, bakery items, dairy products, household cleaning products and novelties.

One of her goals is to be able to grow her business to the next stage, acquire new equipment and furniture to open an eatery in the future. She would like to offer breakfasts and lunches to the people who work in the area.

La Sra. De las Nieves A. de Caballero, es casada y tienen un hij. Su hijo está estudiando en la Universidad Nacional, está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Ciencias Exacta; su marido trabaja es herreroy trabaja de forma indepndiente; la familia vive en casa propia. La señora es dueña de una despensa en su casa. Empezo como un proyecto pequeño, vendiendo algunos productos básicos; con el tiempo fue ampliandose gracias a la amplia clientela, pues la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida. La señora De las Nieves solicita el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén como yerba, azúcar, bebidas varios, panificados, productos lácteos, de limpieza para el hogar, bazar y artículos de mercería. Uno de sus apiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, adquirir nuevos equipamientos o mobiliarios para poder abrir un comedor en el futuro, ella desea ofrecer desayunos y almuerzos a las personas que trabajan en la zona.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TEA, SUGAR,  BAKERY GOODS AND DRINKS FOR HER SHOP.

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region located in south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She and her family were relocated to the Garachukhur settlement in the eastern suburbs of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict.  She is married and has two childen.  She and her husband have built a small shop and she started their business of trading food stuff in 1997.  She has had a previous loan from Normicro Baku branch in the amount of $450.  Now her stock of goods is down and she has little of her own funds.  She has applied to Normicro again to borrow $700 to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To increase the number and variety of goods

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22867

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice would like to increase her stock and rent a permanent premise for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Senora Wilma C. de Benitez and her husband have a young child who attends the public school. Her husband works in one of the best known shops in the zone called Municipal Market #4, one of the the main commercial zones of the city. Wilma has a business located in the center of Market #4, where she sells clothing for women, men and children. It has been growing as the years pass, thanks to the affluence of the people who come through the market.

Wilma is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise, such as seasonal clothing for summer to better meet the demand of all of her customers.

La Sra. Wilma C. de Benítez, es casada, el marido trabaja en uno de los comercios más conocidos de la zona del Mercado Municipal Nº 4 (uno de las principales zonas comerciales de la ciudad), tienen un hijo menor de edad, quien asiste a una escuela pública. Wilma posee un negocio ubicado en el centro del mercado 4, en el mismo se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, y que fue creciendo con el correr de los años, gracias a la gran afluencia de personas que posee el mercado. La señora Wilma, desea adquirir un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como ropas para la temporada de verano ya que se inicia y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de todos sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SEASONAL CLOTHING SUCH AS SHORTS, PANTS AND BLOUSES TO RESELL IN HER SHOP

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Senora Carmen N. de Martinez is separated from her husband. He left her years ago, leaving her to care for and raise their two children alone. Today her children are 33 and 22 years old.

Carmen has a dispensary in her house, where she sells all kinds of every day items such as milk, sugar, eggs, meat and vegetables. From the beginning, and up until now, the business has been growing gradually thanks to the good quantity of customers that she has.

Carmen is requesting the loan to buy stock for her store, including tea, sugar, sodas, juices, bakery items, canned goods and dairy products, as well as household cleaning products.

La Sra. Carmen N. de Martínez, es separada, el marido la abandonó hacevarios años y desde aquel momento enfrentó sola el cuidado y crianza de sus dos hijos que actualmente tienen 33 y 22 años respectivamente. Carmen posee una despensa en su casa, donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, como leche, azúcar, huevos, carne, vegetales, etc. Desde el comienzo y hasta hoy día, el negocio fue creciendo paulatinamente, gracias a la buena cantidad de clientes que tiene. La señora Carmen desea un préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén como yerba, azúcar, gaseosas, jugos, panificados, productos lácteos, productos de limpieza para el hogar, productos enlatados, etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY STOCK FOR HER BUSINESS, SUCH AS TEA, SUGAR, SODAS, JUICES, DAIRY PRODUCTS,  BAKERY ITEMS, CANNED GOODS AND HOUSEHOLD CLEANING PRODUCTS.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto C. is a 45-year-old micro-entrepreneur living with his partner in Asunción, Paraguay. Together they have one child. During the day Ernesto and his partner work together selling various merchandise out of a mobile stand like watches, glasses and wallets. The Foundation has helped them by providing the capital they need so that they may buy more merchandise. They are continuing to work hard to better their standard of living. 
	Initially, Ernesto, took out a very small loan from the Foundation. At this time he was also working with an alternate lender who was charging very high interest rates. Ernesto had to make payments on a daily basis. As a result there was not enough capital to allow them to build their micro-enterprise. Ernesto and his partner are now very happy to accept the help of the Foundation, which lends to the informal sector at very affordable rates.

loans.use: to purchase  merchandise.

loans.name: Ivone

texts.en:
Ivone F. Benitez, 29, is the single mother of her three-year-old daughter living in Asunción, Paraguay.  Its hard work for Ivone to take care of her daughter, however, thanks to the help she receives from the Foundation she is able to buy new merchandise for her store and continue progressing in her business. The Foundation prevents Ivone from having to take out loans from less reputable institutions with high interest rates. Ivone has told the Foundation that with the money she borrowed she was able to purchase a refrigerator and some household appliances for her family. Without this credit she never would have been able to do so.  She has already improved her life. 
The little credit she takes from the Foundation keeps her from having to take on credit from less trust-worthy lenders. The rates she had previously paid with those lenders kept her paying a daily fee and high interest. This also kept her from being able to grow her business. She is very happy with the help she receives from the Foundation. 
Now she is seeking a new loan in order to buy more merchandise like informal clothing and lingerie

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INFORMAL CLOTHING AND LINGERIE FOR HER STORE, AND CONTINUE TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HERSELF AND HER YOUNG DAUGHTER.

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en: Tofig I. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan.  He has been living in Beylagan since 1993. He is 40 years old, is married and has 3 children.  Tofig is a taxi driver.  He has applied to Normicro for a loan in the amount of $900 in order to repair his car and continue his business.

loans.use: To repair his car for his taxi service

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 22873

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda D. Pinto is the single mother of 3-year-old daughter Jazmin.  They live in Luque, Paraguay. She has been a client of the Fundación Paraguaya since 2002 when she was granted a loan of Gs. 800.000 or the equivalent of $160. Before opening her store she was a shopkeeper at a store selling Korean goods. With her money she bought a sizable space in a large local market in Asunción.  From here she sells wallets, purses, jewelry and accessories. She has had this space for two years and invested much time and money into maintaining it well. Nilda is a born fighter and her indomitable spirit has brought her success. Also, thanks to the help of the Foundation, Nilda was able to buy a car as well as build her own house in Luque, an area just outside of the Capital. Nilda continues to move forward. Since January 2007 she has been able to open another branch of her store in Luque, closer to her home. Now she is seeking a new loan in order to purchase large quantities of merchandise, which includes wallets, purses and jewelry.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SHOP, SUCH AS WALLETS, PURSES, JEWELRY AND ACCESSORIES

loans.name: Zahir
