texts.en: Zahir O. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan - a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan.  He is 42 years old, is married and has 2 children.  He is engaged in sheep-breeding.  To grow his business, he is requesting a loan of $800 to buy 10 more sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 22875

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Zarifa S. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in the south-west of Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old,  married and has 3 children. She is engaged in cattle-breeding. She borrowed 3 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch totaling $1700 and increased the number of her cows. Now she needs a $300 loan to buy grass for her cows for the winter months.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her cattle.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22876

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas H. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in the south-west of Azerbaijan. He is 35 years old is married and has 2 children. Abbas is engaged in cattle-breeding. He has 10 years experience in this business. Abbas requests $800 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 22877

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif K. is an Internally Displaced Person from Khojavend city of Azerbaijan. Now he has settled in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is 42 years old is married and has 3 children. Arif is a taxi driver and would like a loan of $900.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22878

loans.name: Ziya

texts.en: Ziya R. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is 37 years old,  married and has 2 children. Ziya rents a food-market in the Beylagan city bazaar. He has one employee. Ziya wants to borrow $1200 so that he can buy more kind of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his food market business

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22879

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma has been working as a hair stylist for 7 years. She is separated from her husband, and she has an 11 year old daughter named Macarena whom she supports and helps with her studies. Zulma began as an employee in a salon, and then later became the owner of her own salon in the zone of Villa Morra. She has been a client since 2004, when we granted her a loan to buy her business. After acquiring modern technology in her salon, she won many good clients. She has greatly improved her services and the quality of life for her and her daughter.

La Sra Zulma P. es peluquera hace 7 años , es separada , tiene una hija de 11 año que se llama Macarena a la que mantiene y le da sus estudios correspondientes, empezó siendo empleada y luego fue propietaria de su propio salón en la zona de Villa Morra , es cliente desde el 2004 , donde le dimos 15.000.000 para comprar una propiedad , después adquirió para su vehiculo y mucha tecnología moderna en su local con lo que gano muy buena clientela , gracias a nuestro apoyo mejoro notablemente sus servicios y su nivel de vida erias para así mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos . Manifestó que esta muy contenta de trabajar con nosotros por la atención y buenos servicios-

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her shop, including hair dye, bleach, shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en: Aynur M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 children. She and her husband engage in cattle-breeding. They started their business 3 years ago. Aynur requests $900 to buy one cow.

loans.use: To purchase one cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 22881

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Sra Carina Treposwski, 59, is married to Sr. Justo, 66, together they have three adult children. Their children remain grateful to them and have not forgotten how Carina and Justo sacrificed to bring them up and pay for their studies, for this they give them a little money each month. 
Carina began her business in 1989 with the help of her husband. It cost them much to open their small shop. When Justo’s Father died Carina and Justo inherited a small piece of land. With this land, they care for three cows, which provide the milk they sell in their store. This supplement has allowed them to pay for their children’s education. 
Today, they have more money but their age prevents them from doing other activities. From time to time they have to pay for visits to the doctor as well as other obligations.
The store is their sole source of income. It is for this reason that Carina wishes to vary the products she offers as well as bring in items included in a notions store. Regarding the latter, no such store exists in her areas and she is sure that she will be successful.

loans.use: Purchase  ítems for a general store: clothing, gifts, perfumes, shoes and other

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.en:
Sra. Crecencia Oritiz, 46, is married with four children. The older two are now married and live with their spouses. The younger two are in school, one of them studies at the local high school and the other is in college. Juan Matto, Crecencia´s husband, has contributed to the household income through his job at a poultry farm. In 2003 they decided to begin raising chickens and have been doing well since that time. 
The process of raising and feeding the chickens takes much work and patience. With the sacrifice of Crecencia and conditions permitting the chickens are ready to be sold after 40 days of labor. 
In addition to her household chores and caring for the chicken coups, Crecencia makes a regular trip into the city to sell the chickens.
Sometimes, the hot climate of the Chaco, a desert-like area of Paraguay, presents difficulty in caring for the chickens and often makes them too delicate to take to market. For this reason Crecencia needs to put a new roof on the chicken house as the current roof has deteriorated over the years. It is for this reason that Crecencia has asked for a small loan.

loans.use: to put a new roof on the chicken house

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Sra. Elida P. is 56 years old living in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay. She has two children. One of her children is married. The other is 15 years old and lives at home while attending high school. Elida pays for her education. Elida sells fruits and vegetables on a rolling cart that she was able to obtain bit by bit through much hard work and sacrifice. Before she had this cart she used a metal basket, which she had attached to motorcycle wheels. Elida is able to sell many fruits and vegetables, and is always warm and optimistic with her customers.

Elida also runs a small kiosk out of her house, which she established after the death of her husband. Her daughter takes care of the kiosk while Elida is selling her fruits and vegetables around the neighborhood. When her daughter is at school Elida returns to her house to manage the kiosk as well as take care of household chores. Elida has an indomitable spirit that allows her to move forward and succeed in her life. Other than the money she earns from selling her fruit and through the kiosk, she also receives a monthly stipend of $58, which was allotted to her due to the death of her husband. Elida wishes to enlarge her stock and activities by purchasing various items for her store.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise including: Fruit, vegetables, rice, sugar, herbs, noodles, cookies, cigarettes, spices and others.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Sr. Inocencio A. is 48 years old and lives in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay, with his wife, Jorgina Garay, 54. The couple has three children, two of which live with them while attending school. 
Inocencio sells fruits and vegetables in a unique way. Ever since 1986, bicycle has been his sole means of transportation. Every day early in the morning, Inocencio bikes to the city of V. Hayes, where he meets with merchants and other regular clients. They depend on Inocencio for daily fresh fruits and vegetables. 
Inocencio also supplies the markets of Clorinda, Rca., Argentina, with his produce. He travels there in the afternoon four times a week and returns later, ready to begin his journey again the following day. The sacrifice he makes by making this long journey on a routine basis is worthwile, since fruit and vegetable sales is Inocencio's sole work and source of income. 
Sr. Inocencio has asked for a small credit of US$225 to allow him to buy more and better quality produce to respond to his loyal clients' needs.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha D. is a 40-year-old mother of three living in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay. She is currently separated from her husband, but receives some financial support from one of her children who works on a farm. The other two children are in school and help take care of the family-owned store. After her husband left, Martha took on full responsibility for supporting her children, and managed to successfully move forward with her life. 
 Martha runs a small convenience store that she opened in 1998 with what little money she inherited from her parents. She opened the store with the intention to continuously improve the business over time. In her neighborhood, Martha is well-known and liked as a particularly friendly shopkeeper. 
With the income from her store, Martha has been able to buy a pool table as well as a foosball table, both of which she lets the kids from the neighborhood use for a small fee. This money is yet another source of income for Martha and her family. 
Martha lives in a growing neighborhood, and her store is located next to a local school. Therefore, Martha has asked for a loan of US$425 to increase the number of products she offers to include toys and school supplies for the children.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, including toys, school supplies, candy, soda, and juice

loans.name: Pablina

texts.en:
Sra. Pablina is a widowed 52-year-old with four children. The two older children live with her and attend college, for which Paulina has taken responsibility of paying. The family has a small home-based kiosk, located across from the health center of the city. With much effort, Pablina and her family have maintained the store for 12 years. When her husband died, she had to become able to fully support herself and her children, and therefore became further dedicated to improving her business. For example, over time, she added new products for sale, including cleaning supplies such as detergent, deodorant, fabric softener and soap. 
Pablina starts work early in the morning, and, twice a week, makes a trip to Clorinda, Rca. Argentina, where she buys the products she sells in her store. According to Pablina's experience, it is possible to buy products for cheaper in Clorinda. 
Pablina’s business has been growing since the opening of the store. Also her clientele has grown, and, as a result, she needs to buy a greater quantity and variety of products, including sugar, flour, rice, noodles, oil, herbs, and other articles. To be able to purchase the additional products, and to make her business more profitable, Pablina is asking for a loan of US$225.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (sugar, rice, noodles, herbs, eggs, etc.) for sale

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Giménez is 62 years old, married, and has three children. All of his children are grown up and married. Pedro lives in a small house with his wife Maria, who is 58. Maria contributes to the household income by working as a seamstress;  in addition, she works in the family store. The couple is also currently building an addition to their house for their youngest son and his wife. 
In 2001, Pedro opened a small despensa, or convenience store, in addition to working as a construction contractor. His store primarily sells drinks and, due to local demand, has continuously grown over time. Pedro currently cooperates with a wholesale supplier to stock his store.
In addition to running his store, Pedro still works as a contractor. Also Pedro's son Reddy, who lives with his father, is a contractor - they work together every day on a variety of construction projects. During this time, Pedro’s wife Maria attends to the store. 
Whenever times were difficult, Pedro managed to learn new skills in order to support his family. For example, he taught himself how to do electrical work and plumbing, and can therefore now offer a variety of services to his clients. 
Pedro has asked for a loan of US$325 in order to expand the variety of stock in his shop. With the greater variety, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, oil, flour, cookies, and other merchandise

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Sr. Valentín A. is 37 years old.  His wife, Valentina is 34, and together they have three young children. They live in their own house in Benjamín Aceval, Paraguay. They were able to buy this house through the sacrifice of Sr. Valentín and his auto-repair shop. Valentina also contributes to the household income by selling sodas out of their home. 
Before establishing his own business, Valentín worked in a transportation company where he acquired knowledge and experience as a mechanic. It is this work that led Valentín to establish his own shop in 2004. He opened his business with very little but after 3 years of hard work it has grown. 
He provides his services to a number of bus drivers, because he receives so many buses as part of his work he needs more space in which to work on them. Thus, it is his desire to build an additional space closer to the bus Terminal. He has requested this loan to buy the materials needed for this new construction.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS TO CONSTRUCT A LARGER SPACE FOR HIS AUTO REPAIR BUSINESS

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza / Faith And Hope Group

texts.en:
Ruben is a hard working and honest man; he does the best he can to proviD. for his 96-year-old mother in law (who is very ill), as well as his own wife and their seven children.

He is asking for this loan so that he can continue to buy larger amounts of viviera (vegetables, fruits, etc.) to sell to his community. With the loan he is able to buy in bulk more, and thus save some money.

His dream is to one day build his store out of concrete blocks, with a concrete counter, roof, and floor. He is also building a house out of concrete right now, each month he is able to buy a few more blocks to add on. He hopes that in a year or two his house will be finished.

Ruben is very thankful to everyone for helping him with this loan, and says that without it, his life would not have advanced nearly so much.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables and other food staples

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 43 years old and has been married to his wife, Ramona, for the past 14 years. Together they have 5 children, three of whom are grown and married and two who are still in primary school. 

Carlos works as a tailor and is skilled in all areas of the trade. He first learned this trade from his uncle at a very young age. He is especially talented at making overalls, underwear, t-shirts and cowboy boots.  After making these items in his home he travels a great distance to sell his wares in the commerical markets in Encarnación, Paraguay. Encarnación is more than 270 km from the town of Itá, where Carlos lives.
	
Carlos has told us that in the past he traveled to Argentina and Brazil to obtain work experience and perfect his skills. After working in these places for several years he decided to return to Paraguay and work in a factory. Having worked in this position for some time, Carlos decided to leave this job and begin his own business. 

With the money he has gained from his store, Carlos, has been able to give his family a good life. He has requested a loan in order to buy the materials he uses to make clothing, including: cloth, needles and zipper.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS FOR HIS TAILORING BUSINESS, SUCH AS CLOTH, NEEDLES AND ZIPPERS.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia, 55, is the owner of a luncheonette in Itá, Paraguay. She serves the workers in her area a variety of foods, including empanadas, croquettes, sandwiches, drinks and ice cream. She has faced a number of challenges throughout her life and works very hard to maintain her store. 

When she was just nine years old, Inocencia lost her mother and went to live with her grandmother. At the age of 15, she moved to the capital to work as a maid. Inocencia lived alone, renting apartments in the capital city of Asuncion, far from her birth place. 

When she was 21 years old, she met her future husband Mario Delgado. Mario, now 53, has a job in construction. He works day and night to support his family. 
After living in the capital for many years, Mario and Inocencia moved to the city of J.A. Saldivar in 1981. It is there that Inocencia began her experience as a business woman. She sold chickens, eggs and milk, and was engaged in this business for eight years. She sold the produce during the day, while her older daughter watched the younger children. 

Today, Inocencia no longer sells goods in the streets, but owns her own shop, where she sells a variety of ready-to-eat foods. She has asked for a loan of US$125 in order to buy more products (flour, eggs, meat, and drinks), and to continue to develop her business, thereby securing a future for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, eggs, meat, and drinks for sale

loans.name: Mirimar Femenina #5 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is requesting her sixth loan! She has made remarkable strides in improving her business, and also in improving the health and welfare of her children. Her goal is to keep working harder and harder in the future, and to keep advancing forward.

She is asking for this loan so that she can build a cement counter top in her store, and make it more attractive and clean for her customers. She has also recently started selling calling cards for the local telecommunications company, Claro—she plans to use part of the loan to continue purchasing these cards.

Josefina is very thankful that she is being given another chance to improve her life, and on behalf of her children and family, wants everyone to know that she is very thankful for this loan.

Josefina is part of the solidarity group, Miramar Feminina #5. The loan requested will be divided among the group members listed here, and each member will be jointly liable for their peers' repayments.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory items and invest in supplies to improve her store

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, 54, and her partner of 20 years, Isidro, live together in Itá, Paraguay, with their four children aged 28, 25, 22 and 19.

Irma’s oldest child has left Paraguay in search of better employment opportunities. Another one of her sons is now married, while her two younger daughters are still in school and live at home. 

Irma owns a small, home-based grocery store. In the past, the family relied on Isidro for the family income. Isidoro worked at a company in Itá, while Irma stayed at home and took care of the children. Unfortunately, due to the uncertain work conditions in the area, Isidoro lost his job. It was at this time that the couple decided to open their own grocery store. 

In the beginning they only sold meat and milk; however, as their business grew, they expanded the variety of goods offered to such items as noodles, sugar and rice. 

Also today, the shop continues to grow, and is well known and popular in the neighborhood. 

Irma has requested a loan of US$625 to be able to buy larger quantities of merchandise for sale. Specifically, she plans to purchase chicken, cold cuts and beef.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of merchandise, including chicken, cold cuts and beef

loans.name: María Ana

texts.en:
Maria Ana A. was born and raised in the city of Itá. She has worked since she was very young, and, together with her mother, started her own business, selling chickens and milk. 

Now, at the age of 63, she still continues working, managing the business together with her husband Miguel Antonio. He is also a vendor, selling mandioca, corn, beans, watermelon and strawberries. Miguel and Maria have two children, both of whom are married and have three children between them. 

All of her life Maria has worked very hard to assist her husband with covering household expenses as well as with raising a healthy family. 
	
	Through a friend, Maria Ana found out about the program offered by the Fundacion Paraguaya. She is now a member of various committees of micro-entrepreneurs. Maria Ana is extremely happy with the support and success she has had as a result of being a member of this group. 

	Maria Ana has asked for a small loan of US$250 to purchase chickens for sale, and thereby meet the growing demand from her clientele.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 26 years old and lives with her older sister. When she was 13 years old, Maria began her studies as a hair stylist at the same institute where her older sister worked. 

After graduating from school, Maria began working as a hair-stylist in her birth city Itá. During that time, she acquired a lot of experience, and decided to move to the capital, Asuncion, because it offered better employment opportunities. 

At 19, she married Néstor Hugo, who is a metal worker. They have now been married for seven years, and have a little boy also named Néstor. Maria has had many challenges in her life, mostly financial. However, she has learned to support herself and her family.

When she began studying and working at the same time, Maria recalls that many sacrifices had to be made in order to maintain the business. Due to the little free capital available, she found it very difficult to live independently. However, thanks to the help of her husband, she has been able to move forward. 

Today Maria has her own salon with adequate furniture and supplies to serve a number of clients. In addition to her store, she also offers her hair-stylist services at home. Maria has asked for a loan of US$125 in order to purchase shampoo, conditioner and dyes.

loans.use: Purchase of shampoo, dyes and conditioner for a beauty salon

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro, 28, lives with his partner of eleven years, Beatriz, and their three lovely children aged 11, 6 and 4. They live in the city of Itá where their children attend primary school.

Pedro is a tailor who specialises in making suits. He learned how to tailor when he was very young. He decided to take on this business in order to provide his family with an additional source of income. He worked for many years as an employee in other tailoring shops. After four years, he was able to move on and become independent. Today he runs his own store, a small tailoring shop with his partner Beatriz. They work together to make the suits, which they sell in their store. Although the two initially faced many difficulties in sustaining their business, they are doing well today.They make suits exclusively for a well-known store called L’UOMO, which has a branch in the capital.

Pedro’s dream is to continue expanding his store and is thus requesting a loan to invest in construction and put him on the road to realising his dream.

loans.use: To invest in construction (expanding his store)

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente Ricardo C. is 44 years old and living with María C., they have been married for 13 years and they still love each other like the first day. They have two children aged 24 and 20. Vicente sells cleaning supplies such as detergent, fabric softener, bleach, brooms and other articles.

Before beginning in this line 4 years ago, Vicente worked with a brother-in-law who taught him how to make cleaning products. He began making small quantities and demand for his products grew. Today his business is flourishing. He sells his cleaning products to many stores in his city and generally sells his merchandise by going door-to-door.

Vicente has asked for a loan so that he can buy the ingredients necessary to make his cleaning products. These ingredients include chlorine, distilled water and baking soda.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as  chlorine, distilled water and baking soda.

loans.name: Ana De

texts.es:
Ana is a 45 year old woman, who lends her services as a dressmaker (on request) and also receives income from renting rooms in her home. Ana's family includes her husband and one son, who all live in a home together. Ana has 23 years of experience as a dressmaker and during that same time has been renting out rooms. There is a good deal of competition for both things, but her clientele is so well established that she is at an advantage. Since she is so well known, she is recommended by her neighbors, who also are frequent clients themselves. She is always looking for new clients, too, for both of her businesses. The current loan is to finish work on an addition to her home, a project which began with a previous loan from the same institution. Right now Ana only borrows with Agrocapital, and does not have any other debts and her credit history is very good.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana es una señora de 45 años de edad, que se dedica a prestar sus servicios como modista (a pedido) y también percibe ingresos por alquileres. La familia de Ana está compuesta por su esposo y un hijo, mismos que viven en una vivienda propia. Ana tiene más de 23 años de experiencia como modista y el mismo tiempo aproximadamente renta cuartos en su casa. Existe bastante competencia en ambos rubros, pero la antiguedad de la cliente le permite tener una ventaja, ya que es conocida, entonces es recomendada por los vecinos, también cuenta con clientes fijos y siempre trata de captar nueva clientela para cualquiera de sus negocios. La presente solicitud es para terminar la obra fina de la ampliación de su domicilio, misma que empezó con un crédito anterior en nuestra institución. Actualmente Ana sólo tiene crédito con Agrocapital, no tiene otras deudas y sus antecedentes crediticios son bastante buenos.

loans.use: To increase and improve her home

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.en:
It’s impossible to hide the 15 years of wisdom Nelly has gained from running her own beauty salon. She gently speaks with passion about her clients (who are also her friends), services she provides, and the possibility of expanding her business. Nelly found her village bank through her friends and is very excited about receiving her first loan. With this loan of $100 she hopes to expand her product base to offer more variety to satisfy all of her customers’ needs.

Nelly's long-term goal is to go back to school to specialize in a particular area of cosmetology so she can offer specialized services. When expressing her long-term goal of more schooling, Nelly says this is because “without learning, you can't progress”. She and her husband are also hard at work raising their three children, ages 10, 5, and 3.

loans.use: expand her product base to offer more variety

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the village bank Las Palmeras, Spanish for ‘The Palm Trees’. She has two grown children and five grandchildren that she helps care for. Up until about five years ago Vilma had a restaurant in Lima, but she had to leave this work when her landlord sold the building due to a major rent increase. She then opened a small stand that is very popular with the women of her neighborhood. Vilma runs a ‘ropa interior’ stand, selling everything from socks and underwear to nylons and nightgowns.

Vilma's daughter recommended that she join her village bank, and now Vilma is grateful to belong to it. She says belonging to Las Palmeras has inspired her and given her a new work ethic, a dedication to do well for herself. Vilma will use this loan of $100 to expand the variety of the ‘ropa interior’ that she sells, so she can satisfy the growing requests of her customers.

loans.use: expand the variety of the ‘ropa interior’ she sells

loans.name: Melfy

texts.es:
Melfy is a married woman of 44 years, who has a stand where she sells many types of beverages and ice, and also has a motorcycle which she uses for a taxi service. Beyond those activities, she crochets and sells tablecloths, and her husband works as a clerk. Melfy has 4 years of experience in her commercial business, and she sees a lot of competition. However, demand is also growing. This current loan is to instal a call center (where people can make phone calls for 35 cents) and to increase the merchandise she sells at her stand to include the sale of beer. She has previous loans with this institution, and has repaid them all in a timely and responsible fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Melfy es una señora casada de 44 años de edad, tiene un puesto donde vende todo tipo de bebidas y hielo, por otra parte tambien cuenta con una moto que la hace trabajar como moto-taxi, paralelamente a todas estas actividades confecciona y vende manteles que los elabora a croche, su esposo trabaja como empleado en industrias del Norte. Melfy cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el negocio de comerciante, la competencia es bastante elevada pero así también la demanda es creciente. La presente solicitud es para instalar un Punto VIVA (call center) para lo cual requiere $us. 350.- y para incrementar su mercadería en su puesto de venta (cerveza) $us. 650.- Anteriormete ya saco créditos en nuestra Institución, mismos que los pago de manera responsable y puntual.

loans.use: VENTA DE CERVEZA Y PUNTO VIVA

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Gonzalez lives in San Juan, Paraguay with his wife and four year old son. They are fortunate to have their own house in addition to a small store out of which they sell movies and music. The store, which they have run for the past five years, is located in the commercial district of Encarnación, Paraguay. With the money he earns from the store he is able to support his wife and children.

His wife is currently in charge of running the house and caring for their children. Before this she worked in a well-known clinic in the city of Encarnación.

Mr. Gonzalez has asked for $625 to buy new merchandise for his store, such as movie and music CDs, which are in high demand at this time. Being able to purchase the most up-to-date items now will greatly increase Mr. Gonzalez ability to continue successfully with his store in future.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise such as movie and mucis CDs for his store.

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.en:
Martha brings true joy to all who are lucky enough to cross her path. Her mother, who owned a ‘panadería’, was Martha’s inspiration for her ‘Dulces’ business. Martha can be found walking the crowded sidewalks of her neighborhood in Lima all hours of the day, toting her box full of breads and sweets to sell. She has several regulars that come by the same time each day to satiate their sweet tooth.

Martha has been selling dulces on the street for six years now, and it can be very exhausting carrying all of her inventory with her all day. With this loan she will expand her inventory so she can work towards her long-term goal of renting her own store, which would be much less stressful.

Martha is married and they have three children, ages 18, 17, and 16. Martha’s dreams for her children are coming true and she couldn’t be happier; she has always dreamt that they would become self-sustaining professionals. Her oldest is now in college studying law, her youngest still in high school, and her middle child will graduate this year and plans to go to college to become a teacher. Martha says that being self-sustaining is the greatest “herencia”, or inheritance, you can leave your children, because you never know what life will bring you, and it’s best to be prepared for it.

loans.use: expand her inventory with the long-term goal of renting her own store

loans.name: Maruja

texts.en: Maruja has owned a little restaurant in Lima for five years, serving popular Peruvian dishes like “Pollo a la Brasa” (a rotisserie-style chicken) on her menú del día, a set menu that lets you choose between a few starters and a few main dishes for a lower price than ordering from the regular menu.  She works very long hours, from 6:30 in the morning until 9:00 or 10:00 at night.  Maruja’s husband also works, and helps her in the restaurant when he can.  Their grown daughters also help out as much as possible.  Maruja recently joined her village bank and is excited about this loan to ‘complement the business’.  She will use it to purchase ingredients and food to prepare for her restaurant.

loans.use: purchase ingredients and food to prepare for her restaurant

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Mr. Celso D., 58, lives with his wife of 30 years with whom he has five children in Encarnación, Paraguay. All of his children are now grown and have moved away from the home. Celso owns a variety of properties around Encarnación, which he gave to his children as they came of age.

Celso is also the owner of a grocery and butcher shop which offers a variety of commonly used products including: noodles, sugar, canned goods, dairy products, breads, fruit and vegetables as well as a wide variety of meats. His business is doing very well and is expertly run. As one of the older and better-stocked stores in the area he has garnered favor with persons in his community. He has been able to manage his store well with the help of one of his older sons.

Celso offers home delivery of his store's products. To help him in offering this service, he has asked for a loan to buy a motorcycle with which he will be able to deliver more goods to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport goods for his store

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.en:
After high school Carmen studied cosmetology and for the past 13 years has had her own beauty salon in her house. She also has several regular clients she travels to see. Her husband is a chauffeur, and together they have three children, ages 11, 5, and 2 (her youngest is pictured with her).

With this loan Carmen will expand her inventory so she can work towards her long-term goal of opening her own beauty salon in a building outside of her home, though she will have to wait until her youngest child is in school. She also would like to study more and specialize in some area of cosmetology. Carmen also loves to sew and would someday like to combine her beauty salon with a clothing business.

loans.use: expand her inventory to work towards her long-term goal of opening her own beauty salon outside her home

loans.name: José Asunción

texts.en:
Mr. José A., aged 53, lives with his wife Celia González, aged 38, in Encarnación, Paraguay. Together they have three children, two of whom study in the public high school while the oldest works and earns enough money to help with household expenses. In a little more than three years, he was able to buy a house in the neighborhood of Arroyo Porá. Jose and his family used to live in a neighborhood near a dam built to generate hydro-electric power. When the dam was built, many neighborhoods had to be moved and people were given money for their homes in order to acquire new ones. The A. family was one of these families.

Today, José is the owner of a metal shop located in his own house. He has had this business for a little more than two years. His wife works as a domestic servant in a company in Encarnación, which allows her to contribute to the household income. They are a hardworking family and have been able to improve the quality of their daily life by always putting the family's welfare first.

José has asked for a loan of $600 to buy electrical supplies he needs for his shop. Some of the articles he hopes to acquire include: paint, sandpaper, hammers, nails, screws and a hose.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies, paint, sandpaper, hammers, nails, screws and a hose.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel is married, 27 years old and has two children. His wife is currently working overseas in Spain. He lives in Santa Cruz with his two small boys.

Miguel owns a fleet of 3 motorcycles that he rents as motorcycle taxis in the city of Montero. He needs the loan to purchase a fourth motorcycle. Since he is purchasing a second hand motorcycle the price of the unit will depend on its condition.

His credit rating is good and he fulfills his credit obligations with Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Miguel Angel es una persona casada de 27 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos. Actualmente su conyugue se encuentra trabajando en España, él vive en Santa Cruz con sus dos hijitos. Miguel cuenta con tres motos las cuales las renta para que las mismas sean utilizadas como moto taxis, debido a la gran demanda de este medio de transporte, sobre todo en la ciudad de Montero, es que el solicita el presente crédito para adquirir una moto más. El precio de esta moto dependerá del tiempo de uso que tenga la misma. Los antecedentes crediticios de Miguel son buenos, no reporta aspectos negativos en el sistema financiero y tiene un buen cumplimiento con sus créditos en Agrocapital.

loans.use: MOTORCYCLE PURCHASE

loans.name: Leonor Magdalena

texts.en:
Leonor (Leo) runs a store where you can find pretty much anything. She sells new CDs and DVDs, as well as secondhand clothes, shoes, accessories, toys, and more. If a store that sells new products has certain items that cannot be sold due to stains or other slight damages, they bring them to Leo. She then fixes the flaw to where the item is good as new and sells it in her store.

Leo’s husband is a security guard at night and drives a taxi during the day. They have three children, ages 16, 13, and 10. Her dream for them is that they graduate high school and have careers. Her dream for her business is to relocate to a less dusty location, but this would be more expensive. With this loan Leo’s goal is to purchase Christmas toys now, before the prices rise too much in December and they become unattainable.

loans.use: purchase Christmas toys now, before the prices rise too much in December

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Ms. Mabel A., 36, is married with two children: a boy who is 10 years old and a girl of 12. They live in their own house in the Barrio Maria Auxiliadora in Encarnación, Paraguay.

Mabel originally worked as a street vendor for many years. However, this work did not generate much income so she decided to purchase her own shop and open a shoe store. Now, after three years as a shoe retailer, she is doing very well. Her husband also works selling basic groceries from his van to the small communities around the city of Encarnación.

The Azconas are a very close-knit family who work hard to achieve their goals. It is their dream that both their children will be able to complete school and lead a more dignified life.

Mabel has asked for a loan to purchase shoes from Brazil. She has opened a new store and wishes to take advantage of the low price at which shoes are currently selling in Brazil by purchasing them early, in order to resell them in her store in Paraguay.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for her store

loans.name: Nancy Elizabeth

texts.en:
Nancy is full of energy despite working from 9:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night, seven days a week. For four years Nancy has owned two laundromats in her neighborhood in Lima. She has two employees that run one of the ‘lavanderías’, and she alone works at the other one.

Nancy’s husband is in the military and in addition to both working full time, they are busy raising their two young children, ages seven and eight. Nancy’s goal with this loan is to purchase another washing machine so she can increase business in her laundromat so she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: purchase another washing machine so she can increase business in her laundromat

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Mr. Marcelino G., 55, is married and lives with his partner, with whom he has three children. Of the three children, two are married, so only the youngest still lives at home. Marcelino also looks after a niece of hers who is still in school and financially dependent on the Gonzalezes. His family is originally from the neighborhood of Artigas, which was abandoned one and a half years ago to make way for a dam to be built nearby. Her family had to leave everything in order to look for a better life elsewhere.

Marcelino owns a small grocery and butcher shop. Since he married and had children, Marcelino has fought to put his family first and provide them with the life they deserve. Today, his two older children are married and have families of their own. Thanks to his hard work, his store hs been successful. His store is located in a good neighborhood, which also helps the store do well.

He has asked for a loan so that he may buy a better quality and greater quantity of foods to sell in his store. These include sugar, flour, oil, noodles, meat, sodas and dairy products. In the last month, he has seen a greater demand for these products from his customers.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, oil, noodles, meat, sodas and dairy products.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira belongs to the village bank Nuevo Amanecer, ‘New Dawn’. She is in the popular business of renting taxis. Elvira owns two taxis that she rents out every day, from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. She rents each taxi for 75 Soles a day, about $25. The drivers are responsible for paying for the gas and returning the taxi on a full tank.

Both taxis are getting quite run down, driving constantly through the crowded streets of Lima, so Elvira's goal with this loan of $100 is to perform standard maintenance on each car to make them safer and more reliable. Elvira has two children, ages 7 and 2.

loans.use: perform standard maintenance on the two taxis she rents out

loans.name: Romualda De

texts.es:
Romualda is a married woman. Her family is composed of her husband and daughter who is 22 years old. Romualda makes her living selling brand new clothes. She works during the weekends as a street vendor. Because of the 10 years of experience on this business, Romualda has steady clients in the area and in some other places where she takes her clothes, so this way she diminishes the high level competition. She is planning to start a lodge or restaurant at her place so she will take advantage of the construction of, “Estadio de Minero” a place that will bring all kind of clients.

Romualda has been working for long time with “Agrocapital” This is the 10th loan that she has requested. During all this time of relation with the Institution, she has demonstrated to be a responsible client and has paid it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Romualda es una señora casada, su familia está compuesta por su esposo e hija de 22 años de edad. Se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva, saliendo los fines de semana y ofreciendo como ambulante. Debido a los 10 años de experiencia con los que cuenta en este rubro, Romualda cuenta con clientela fija en el campo y en otros lugares donde lleva la ropa, haciendo frente de esta manera a la elevada comprtencia que existe en este negocio. Tiene planificado implementar una pensión o restaurante en su domicilio, a fin de aprovechar que cerca del mismo se está construyendo el Estadio de Minero, lugar que tendrá bastante afluencia de clientes de todo tipo. Romualda trabaja bastante tiempo en Agrocapital, esta solicitud es la secuencia número 10 de microcrédito que utiliza, en todo ese tiempo de relación con la Institución, ella demostró ser una cliente responsable y puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: START A LODGE

loans.name: Marisol Celeste

texts.en:
Marisol and her husband own a taxi that he drives seven days a week in Lima. Unfortunately, he was hit by another car and, although the person responsible for the accident paid to have the car fixed, Marisol and her husband had to go 20 days without the income he takes in as a ‘taxista’. Marisol was then the sole income generator, and she did this by selling sweets on the weekends in the streets of her neighborhood.

Marisol and her husband have an eight-year-old daughter they love very much. Marisol says she would have liked to have had more children but it is too expensive and they cannot afford it. Her dream for her daughter is that she study and become a professional. Her daughter loves English and wants to be an English teacher. With this loan Marisol will be able to perform much needed maintenance on their taxi, starting with getting the oil changed.

loans.use: perform much needed maintenance on their taxi

loans.name: Salomé

texts.en:
Salomé has a multi-faceted business to which she is very dedicated. She has a shop in Lima where she works from 7am to 9pm seven days a week selling jumpers, wool hats, dresses for girls and other clothing that she makes. She also sells wool, which she buys twice a week. On top of this she now teaches people how to sew and weave and currently has six students.

Salomé’s husband is a farmer and they have four children, ages 25, 21, 18, and 12. Her oldest is a nurse and studying education, her 21-year-old is studying mechanics, her 18-year-old is studying education, and her youngest is still in school. She says her family helps each other out in everything they do; they share the cooking and cleaning and support one another in their studies and jobs. Her husband and children help Salomé out by watching her store twice a week when she goes to purchase more supplies. Her goal with this loan of $200 is to purchase a larger inventory of wool.

loans.use: purchase a larger inventory of wool

loans.name: María Elena

texts.en:
Ms. Maria A., 38, is a single mother of two living in her own house. Her children are aged 16 and 12 and both are currently in school. She feels very happy to be able to afford her own home.

Maria owns a clothing store in the commercial zone in Encarnación, Paraguay. Her store sells products such as t-shirts, jerseys, blouses, shoes, skirts and pants. The quality of her products is quite good and she has acquired a number of regular customers since opening her store 10 years ago.

Maria has asked for a loan so that she may buy a greater quantity of merchandise currently on being sold at discount prices. With more merchandise to sell, she will be able to increase her monthly earnings and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a strong-minded woman who has a taxi-rental business in Lima, a city with a very high demand for taxis. She owns three taxis that she rents out to her regular drivers twice a day (a morning shift and an evening shift).

Maria is separated from her husband and has six children, ages 16-35, five of whom live with her. Maria has been with her village bank for five years now and likes the community it brings her. With this loan of $1000 she plans to perform some basic maintenance on her taxis that will help them to be safer and more reliable.

loans.use: perform some basic maintenance on her taxis

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a single mother of two, a nine-year-old daughter and a twenty-year-old son. She makes a living by renting out rooms in her house, and she also owns a taxi that her son drives.

Jacinta has recently developed very severe and painful arthritis, which makes it difficult for her to take care of her guests in the rooms she rents. Jacinta has found an electromagnetic treatment for her arthritis, but it is very expensive and she has to pay for the treatment out of her own pocket. This loan will go towards Jacinta’s treatment, which will enable her to continue working to support her family.

loans.use: pay for arthritis treatment

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mrs. Myriam C., 49, owns her home, where she lives with her husband of 20 years and her three daughters. All her daughters are currently in school. Two are adults and the youngest is 16. Myriam runs a small luncheonette out of her house, selling drinks and food to persons in her neighborhood. By running her business in this way, she is able to sell her food and drinks and take care of chores around the house at the same time. Her husband also helps her with sales and household work.

Myriam’s lunch counter is doing well and earns her enough money to cover the daily expenses of running the business and her home.

Myriam has worked with Fundacion Paraguaya before, achieving a degree of success through micro-loans. She is a dedicated worker who continues to strive to improve her daily standard of living.

She has asked for a loan to buy drinks of all kinds for her store. She hopes to purchase sodas, juice and beer as well as materials to improve her business. With these items, she hopes to be able to serve a greater number of clients.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of drinks for her store

loans.name: Brígida

texts.en:
Brigida and her husband have recently become empty-nesters, with two of their three children married and the other one now in college studying mechanical engineering. They are now devoting all their time to running their taxi-rental business in Lima. They own three taxis, one that her husband drives and the other two that they rent out daily for 50 Soles (about $16) each.

Brigida’s dream for her family is simply that they are happy, which she says is more important than anything else. Brigida is pleased to have been with her village bank for two years now and is very excited for this loan, with which she will fix the engine on one of the taxis.

loans.use: fix the engine on one of her taxis

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is a married 34 year old woman. She has been married to her husband for about 15 years and they have a son. Elena dedicates to the preparation and sale of meals at a taxi-trufis central base. Her husband has a car which he works in the same line of taxi-trufi. It is the most important one of Villa.Pagador

She has been selling food for many years and she and her husband are very well known in the area, especially by the people of the line of taxi-trufis. They have very good personal references. There is a low competition for Elena’s business because of it’s location. It is located in the taxi-trufis central, so it is easier for all the taxi-trufi drivers to consume her products. In addition that she has an excellent and extroverted character that helps to have lots of clients, even from other taxi lines.

She is asking for a loan of U$550 to buy supplies for her business such as rice, spaghettis, potatoes, etc. She has had two previous loans with an average of low delay, in general she demonstrated to have good behavior so a second loan was granted to her.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es una señora casada de 34 años de edad, su familia la compone su esposo y un hijo, ambos llevan casados aproximadamente 15 años. Elena se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas en una parada de taxi-trufis y el esposo tiene un auto con el que trabaja como chofer en la misma línea de taxi-trufi que el la más importante de Villa Pagador. La venta de comida tiene muchos años funcionando, aparte que tanto Elena como su esposo son muy conocidos en la zona y sobre todo con las personas de la línea de taxi-trufis, ya que tienen muy buenas referencias personales de esta pareja. El nivel de competencia de Elena es relativamente bajo ya que su puesto se encuentra justo en la parada de taxi-trufis, entonces es suceptible a que todos los choferes consuman sus productos, además que el excelente caracter extrovertido de Elena hace que su puesto esté lleno de clientes, sean estos de la misma línea u otros. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición al por mayor de productos para su negocio, productos que son categorizados de primera necesidad, como ser arroz (quintales), fideo, carga de papa, etc. La cliente tiene dos créditos anteriores en la institución con un promedio de retraso bajo, en general demostró tener un buen comportamiento por lo que se le otorgó un crédito paralelo.

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Mr. Roque J., 39, and his wife, Olinda Galeano, 27, live in the city of Encarnación, Paraguay in a rented house. Together they have one four-year-old son who is preparing to enter school next year.

Roque owns a grocery which sells basic food staples. He has also dedicated a section in his store to the sale of clothing. He has had this store for four years. Luckily, Roque, was able to find a location close to downtown which is generally quite busy.

Everyday, Roque and Olinda work in the store with the idea of bettering their lives and eventually having enough money to purchase their own home. They hope to buy a home in a neighborhood not too far outside of Encarnación where they can easily keep an eye on the store.

They have asked for a loan, which they will use to buy merchandise currently on sale. By obtaining these items for a better price now they will be able to earn a better profit from them later. From a town in neighboring Argentina, Roque will be able to buy beer, sweets, cookies, oil and flour in bulk for a better price. With these items he will be able to augment the number of clients he can serve as well as his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy sweets, cookies, alcoholic beverages (beer), oil and flour.

loans.name: Gloria Rosa

texts.en:
Up until a couple of years ago, Gloria helped her fisherman husband by taking care of their home and family. However, her husband has now retired and the meager retirement benefits he receives are not enough to support them any longer. So with Gloria’s strength of character and determination, three years ago she joined her village bank, took out a small loan, and opened a liquor store from a room in her house. She is open until 6:00 in the evening and sells only “para llevar”, or, to go. Gloria is fortunate (and very thankful) that she does not have to travel far to stock her inventory; she has ‘proveedores’, suppliers, who deliver right to her house.

Gloria has many regulars who count on her for delicious wines for weddings, birthdays, holidays, and other celebrations, plus new custumers she generates through word of mouth, with old customers raving about the inviting business she has built. When asked what her goal is with this loan, Gloria looks up, smiles, and says ‘seguir trabajando!’- to keep on working! She also hopes to increase and expand her inventory so she can offer more variety to her customers and always have enough on hand.

loans.use: expand her inventory so she can offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida C. is a 40 year old mother of three who has been married for the past 20 years. Her oldest daughter is currently enrolled in college and her two sons are in high school.

Adelaida prepares beautiful cakes and sometimes works in the cafeteria preparing all types of food. She also caters all types of social events such as birthdays and weddings where she is responsible for all the food and desserts. Moreover, her husband, Carlos, a chauffeur, is considering leaving his job to help Adelaida with the food preparation.

Adelaida has the firm support of her family and the experience necessary to prepare a diverse array of high quality foods and cakes. However, she needs loan to invest in a freezer to increase the shelf time of her desserts made from ice cream. She already has all the equipment necessary for her work with the exception of the freezer. She hopes in the future to move her business from her parents' house to her own.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa C. is 43 years old and has been married for 22 years. She and her husband have four lovely children, 3 of whom are in high school and one who is currently completing college.

Using her family's traditional printing press, Andresa began a small printing business. With the support of her husband and both their families, they slowly built up the business and eventually installed a bigger printer. For the past 10 years the printing business has been family run. Every member of the family has worked and contributed to the business's success

Andresa needs a $225 loan to buy materials such as paper, ink and printer parts so that she can increase her production capacity.

loans.use: To buy printing materials such as paper, ink and printer parts

loans.name: Beronica

texts.es:
Beronica is 34 years old, is married and has two children whom she is responsible for since the father of the children travels. At the moment she is renting a room in her mother in-law’s house, who gave Beronica the opportunity to put her business of selling Patasca (a meal) at the house. Simultaneously Beronica sells cosmetics.

A year before her main business was the sale of Yanbal cosmetics. It is not longer her main business since selling the meal Patasca is doing better. The business has a high demand because of the excellent location,( it is close to a bus stop) That’s why she has clients always. In addition,not many people dedicate themselves to the make this typical plate.

Beronica is asking for a loan of U$ 300. She is planning to buy 3 sets of tables for her business (U$80 per set) and wants to invest the rest of the money in ingredients .

She has had two loans from Kiva and she has paid it excellently. This is her third loan. She also has a loan with CRECER which she has been paying on time.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Beronica es una mujer de 34 años de edad que está casada y tiene dos hijos que están totalmente a su cargo ya que el padre de los niños se encuentra de viaje. Actualmente vive en alquiler y la dueña de casa, que es su suegra, le dió la oportunidad de poner su negocio de venta de Patasca en el mismo lugar, paralelamente Beronicase dedica a la venta de cosmeticos. Desde hace un año aproximadamente es que Beronica se dedica al 100% al negocio de la venta de comidas (Patasca), ya que antes su principal negocio era la venta de los cosméticos, ofrecía y promocionaba productos de Yanbal, ahora este negocio paso a un segundo plano. Todo negocio de comidas es bien demandado sobre todo por la excelente ubicación que tiene el puesto de Beronica, se encuentra cerca a una parada de transporte público de pasajeros, es por esta razón que siempre cuenta con clientela, además que no muchas personas se dedican a la elaboración de este plato típico. Con la presente solicitud Beronica se comprará tres juegos de mesa para su negocio de comida aun precio de $us. 80.- cada uno, el resto del dinero piensa invertirlo en ingredientes para la elaboración de la Patasca. Anteriormente ha tenido dos créditos en nuestra Institución, los cuales a cancelado excelentemente, este es su tercer préstamo. También tiene una deuda en Crecer que está pagando puntualmente.

loans.use: TO BUY 3 SETS OF TABLES

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana Lucia D. is 50 years old and has 3 children. Two of her children are currently in grade school and one is in high school. Juana creates and sells cleaning supplies such as detergents, air fresheners, fabric softeners and soaps. Her products come in an array of aromas and sizes. She also buys powdered and liquid bleach in bulk to sell to different businesses.

Juana is requesting a loan of $1,025 to invest in containers of varying sizes so that she can make and store a greater quantity of cleaning supplies. She is a trustworthy and honest vendor of cleaning supplies who is well liked by her clients.

loans.use: To purchase containers of various sizes in which to store her products

loans.name: Silvino

texts.en:
Silvino Rios is 35 and married to Mirta Gonzalez. They have two children who are both enrolled in grade school. Since 1999 Silvino has run a kiosk from his house with the help of his lovely wife. They also opened a bakery two years ago where thay make all types of baked goods such as cookies, hamburger, hot dog rolls and so on.

Silvino is asking for a $1,025 loan in order to buy a industrial mixer. He also wishes to buy his flour products in bulk to lower his business expenses and earn a larger profit margin. His businesses are well-managed and with this loan he will be able to continue improving them.

loans.use: To buy an industrial mixer

loans.name: Cristina De

texts.es:
Cristina is a 42 year old woman that makes her living selling food in a stand that is located at Tres esquina avenue Rodolfo Palenque in the city of El Alto.. She lives in the house that she owns from Monday to Saturday , which is located in the Lucio Perez Velasco street in the zone of General Pando (Senkata Sector). She lives there with her two sons. One of them is in college and the other one goes to school

Her husband works some works at a lodge. Cristina works making meals. Even though there is a big competition in this market, her long trajectory allows her to have fixed clients, since it is characterized being very hygienic and to have an excellent treatment to her clients. She always ends up selling the food that prepares for the day. All the meals that she makes have different prices that are different by the amount and variety.

The present request is for the acquisition of construction material, since they will make improvements and extensions to his house. Cristina does not have negative antecedents in the financial system

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina, de 42 años de edad es una señora que se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto que se encuentra ubicado en la Calle Tres esquina Av. Rodolfo Palenque de la ciudad de El Alto de lunes a sábado. La cliente vive en su domicilio propio, que se encuentra ubicado en la calle Lucio Perez Velasco en la zona de General Pando (Sector Senkata), en el mismo vive con sus dos hijos uno se encuenta en la universidad y el otro sigue asistiendo al colegio, su esposo trabaja de formal eventual en un alojamiento. Cristina trabaja como comerciante de comida desde hace seis años, si bien existe competencia en este mercado, su larga trayectoria le permite tener clientes fijos, ya que se caracteriza por ser muy higiénica y tener un excelente trato a los comensales, siempre termina de vender la comida que elabora para el día. Todos los platos que elabora tiene diferentes precios que se diferencian por la cantidad y variedad, además también influye la demanda que tengasn los mismos. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de material de construcción, ya que efectuarán mejoras y ampliaciones a su vivienda. Cristina no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Ms. Karina M. is 26 years old, single and lives with her family. Karina´s parents emigrated to Argentina when they realized that their intended line of work required experience in construction, metal work and other such activities. After 20 years of living in Argentina, her parents were able to save enough and were able to return to their home country. They moved to the city where they now live and began their business with a mixture of apprehension and hope. With the support of their family, they are confident in their ability to make the business a success.

Karina is requesting a $1025 loan to buy a van which can be used to transport their goods. The dream of micro entrepreneurs like Karina is that they will be able to continue living in their country and offer work opportunities to others. The Melgarejos began their business and maintain this dream because of their experience earning a living in another country.

loans.use: To buy a van for transporting goods and supplies

loans.name: Estela De

texts.es:
Estela is 40 years old and works as a seamstress making all kinds of clothing. Her husband works as a welder and electrician for a small enterprise called SEW and occasionally does work for a large dairy and a cooking-oil refinery. They share a home with their son through an anticrético. [Translators note: an antichretic, or land-pawn, contract is an interesting rental arrangement common in Bolivia. You can read more about it here: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html] Estela has a small workshop in their home and has been sewing for at least five years. No one else in her neighborhood does tailoring so Estela has little competion. She also benefits from an excellent location near the Warnes Stadium. She always has work to do. Estela hopes to use this loan to buy ten bolts of cloth at about $40 each. In addition to making clothes on order for the general public, she sews uniforms for two local businesses: Pil Andina, a dairy, and Fino, a vegetable oil refinery. This is her third loan from this institution. She repaid her previous loan punctually. Estela also has a small loan outstanding from Crecer which she is repaying now.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Estela es una señora de 40 años de edad, que se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir. actualmente vive en contrat de anticrético en la casa de su garante, su esposo trabaja como soldador y electricista en la Micro empresa SEW, misma que presta servicios a PIL ANDINA y a FINO, sólo tienen un hijo.

Estela tiene su pequeño taller de sastrería tipo artesanal en su misma casa, lleva por lo menos unos cinco años de experiencia en dicha actividad.

La competencia es baja, ya que por su zona es la única que realiza u ofrece sus servicios como modista, más aún que se encuentra excelentemente ubicada, al lado de una plazuela cerca del Stadium de Warnes, por lo que siempre se encuentra con trabajos para realizar.

Con la presente solicitud tiene planificado comprar unos diez rollos de tela más o menos a un precio promedio de $us. 40.- cada uno, pues aparte de hacer prendas para el público común, confecciona uniformes para la PIL ANDINA, FINO y otras empresas.

Este es su tercer préstamo en nuestra Institución, los anteriores créditos los ha pagado de manera puntual, paralelamente también cuenta con un pequeño crédito en Crecer que lo mantiene vigente.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en: Mrs. Chiv E., age 46, and her husband, age 49, are farmers on a rented plot of land, earning $3 per day collectively. ThE. have eight children: two make incense sticks used for worship at the Buddhist temple, two work at a pharmacy in Phnom Penh making $7 per day together, two are students, and two are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase a plot of farmland so that thE. no longer have to pay rent out of their monthly earnings. In the future, she would like to save her earnings to start a business raising and selling pigs.

loans.use: To purchase farmland so that they no longer have to rent.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chiv Ey has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Mahlie

texts.ru:
Mahlie purchases and sells dried fruits on the local markets of Isfara. She works in her business with her friend who is also a client of MicroInvest. She purchases products at local markets and from private individuals at wholesale and then sells them at retail. After getting her first loan from MicroInvest, Mahlie increased her inventory. Recently Mahlie got married. Today, her husband helps her to expand her business.

Mahlie plans to use her new loan to purchase dried apricots, which can be purchased cheaply right now.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Махлие занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов на местных рынках города Исфары. Она занимается этим со своей подругой, которая тоже является клиенткой Микроинвест. Закупает товар по местным рынкам и у частных лиц оптом и затем продает в розницу. Получив свой первый займ в Микроинвест Махлие получила возможность увеличить товарооборот своего бизнеса. Недавно Махлие вышла замуж. Теперь ее муж помогает ей в развитии бизнеса. На свой новый займ она собирается закупить сушенные абрикосы, которые сейчас имеют низкую цену.

loans.use: To increae inventory

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru:
When Muyassar got her first loan from MicroInvest, she was not sure that the loan would help her to work profitably. But by gradually increasing the amount of her loan, she was able to increase her inventory.

Muyassar is 51 years old, her husband works, her son is earning money in Russia and her daughter in law helps her in her business. She sells children’s clothing and footwear. Muyassar purchases her products at wholesale markets once a week. She plans on using her new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Когда сестра Муяссар свой первый займ в Микроинвест она не очень верила что с его помощью можно плодотворно работать. Но постепенно увеличивая сумму займа она добилась увеличения своего товарооборота. Муяссар 51 год, ее муж работает, сын на заработках в России, а невестка помогает по бизнесу. Ассортимент ее товаров составляет детские одежда и обувь. Товар приобретает на оптовых рынках раз в неделю. Муяссар и дальше собирается получать займы в Микроинвест для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 46 years old,  married and has four children. For the last two years, she has operated a grocery stall in the Rongo market. She specializes in selling popular items that are widely used in her community, such as sukuma wiki (kale), onions and tomatoes. She also sells cereals to generate additional income. Hard work, perseverance and a good reputation have allowed her business to grow despite competition. Rose has applied for a loan of  $600, $450 of which she will use to buy additional cereals and vegetables to sell. She will set the remaining $150 aside as savings to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Purchase additional groceries and cereals to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina A. is 50 years old and has eight children. She started selling cereal 11 years ago and, despite stiff competition, has seen her business grow over the years because of her hard work, experience and ability to attract a well-established client base. Dina sells a wide range of cereals, including beans, dry maize, rice, millet and sorghum. The profit from the sale of these food staples, which are easy to store and handle, help her pay school fees for her children and other household expenses, as well as set aside money she can use when business is slow.  Dina plans to use three quarters of her loan to purchase beans and rice to sell to her customers, and put the remainder aside as savings to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: Purchase stock of cereals

loans.name: Unidas Para Seguir / United To Move On Group

texts.en:
Eustaqui is 34 years old, she has two children (ages 13 and 15) who both go to the local high school. She is married and her husband drives an agricultural delivery truck. Her mother, Celida, is also an Esperanza client and has successfully established a small local grocery store with her loans.

With previous loans from Esperanza, Eustaqui was able to construct a small building out of concrete which she painted pink, from here she is able to sell clothes (jeans, blouses, skirts and shoes). She buys her clothes in the nearby larger town of Santiago once a month and is able to sell them for a small profit to her community, who are happy not to have to go several hours away to Santiago to do their shopping.

She wants to use this next loan to buy display cases to better market her clothes. Eustaqui has successfully paid off three previous loans from Esperanza and has been a client for two years. Her first loan was for 43 USD.

Eustaqui is the “coordinator” for her group of five women in the larger Bank of Hope. Together with the coordinators from the other groups, they form a “leadership council”, whose responsibilities incluD. involvement in community activities, such as “mother’s clubs” and the local health clinics.

loans.use: Purchase display cases

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 35-year old widow who lives with her three children in the town of Rongo, Kenya. She is well-known in this area because she has been trained in providing home-based health-care services. She is also a successful businesswoman who started selling clothes door-to-door in 1992. She used the funds from her first loan to start her own shop.  Business is so good that she has hired one person to help her run the shop and meet the demands of her many customers.  Beatrice has applied for a loan of $500 to purchase additional second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla A. is a 48-year-old mother of five. She lives with her husband in Bware Migori, Kenya, where she is well known as a japur (or farmer) because she owns a large plot of land where she grows sugarcane. She also raises cattle that produce between 8 to 10 liters of milk a day, which she sells to the people of her community  for $0.45 a liter. Priscilla has come to us for a loan of $800 to buy enough new cattle to increase her output of milk to 15 liters a day.

loans.use: Buy additional cattle to produce more milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more electronic goods and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses C. is a 24 year old trader. He resides in a slum area just outside Mombasa. He started the business six years ago because he was unable to raise funds to pay for senior school expenses. The trade involves moving around the city center on foot selling an assortment of electronic appliances and clothes. He also has a small stall where he operates. The merchandise he sells is cheap and the electronics are of the latest technology hence appealing to the customers who buy from him. His earning are however barely sufficient to cater satisfactorily for his basic needs since he is required to pay for license fees on a daily basis thus reducing his income. Also, during the rainy season, his movement is restricted thus he cannot make good sales. He would like to increase his income base so that he can uplift his lifestyle as well as advance his business towards growth. He is therefore requesting for a loan of US $ 600 to assist him in boosting his business. His budget is US $300 to purchase more electronic goods and US$300 to purchase clothes for sale. Moses is an industrious businessman and is quite experienced in his line of trade hence he is certain to make good gains out of it enabling him to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic goods and clothes for sale.

loans.name: I Nyoman Kartikayasa

texts.id:
Breeding Kereman cows (cows that are raised in the barn) is very popular at Jembrana district, west of Bali. Besides saving man-power, it's also more efficient. We can raise Kereman cows faster so that we can sell it in 4 to 6 months. Therefore, I Nyoman Kartikayasa used the loan from Dinari to buy 1 cow (2-3 years old) which cost Rp. 3,500,000 (about $386). The rest of the loan was used to cover the cow's food expense. I Nyoman Kartikayasa feeds the cow twice a day in the morning and in the evening. The basic food is processed food made from the mixture of rice chaff, corn and ground soyabean dregs. The estimated cow's food per kg is Rp. 1,500 (about $0.16) (Rp.1,500 x 120 days = Rp. 180,000 -- about $20). This processed cow's food is given every morning. In the afternoon, he feeds the cow with natural food such as grass, jackfruit leaves, and cocoa skin which contained good protein for cow. When the harvest time comes, the cow's weight was 415 kg and its price is Rp. 15,000 (about $1.65) per kg. Hence, the net income (after subtracted with the initial capital and cow's food expense) was Rp. 2,545,000 (about $281). I Nyoman Kartikayasa is very pleased with this business. He hopes to get more loans from Dinari so that he can raise more cows. He can use the income to cover his family's daily expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Di Kabupaten Jembrana, Bali Barat, pemeliharaan sapi Kereman ( sapi yang dikandangkan ) sangat diminati oleh masyarakat . Selain menghemat tenaga, juga lebih efisien. Dengan adanya sapi kereman yang pemeliharaannya cepat, jangka waktu 4 - 6 bulan sudah siap untuk dijual. Oleh sebab itu lewat Dinari, I Nyoman Kartikayasa memperoleh modal pinjaman Modal ini dipergunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor sapi yang sudah cukup besar ( umur 2 – 3 tahun ) dengan harga Rp. 3.500.000,-. Sisanya dipakai untuk biaya pakan.. Sapi kereman I Nyoman Kartikayasa diberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore hari. Makanan pokoknya makanan olahan ( konsentrat ) yang terbuat dari dedak padi yang kasar, jagung, ampas kedelai yang dihaluskan kemudian dicampur menjadi satu. Perkiraan harga pakan per kilogram adalah Rp.1.500,- ( Rp. 1.500.- X 120 hari = Rp. 180.000.- ) Pakan olahan diberikan pada pagi hari dan untuk siang hari diberi makanan alami sebagai makanan tambahan seperti rumput, daun nangka dan kulit coklat ( kakao ) yang proteinnya bagus untuk sapi. Pada saat panen berat sapi I Nyoman Kartikayasa 415 kg dengan harga per kg Rp.15,000,-. Jadi pendapatan bersih setelah dipotong modal sapi dan pakan yang menjadi Rp. 2.545.000,- selama empat bulan. I Nyoman Kartikayasa sangat senang dengan usahanya ini . Harapannya supaya pinjaman dari Dinari bisa meningkat agar bisa pelihara lebih dari 1 ekor. Dengan keuntungan ini bisa dipakai untuk keperluan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: To purchase cow and cow food

loans.name: Llama De Amor Group

texts.en:
About the Group Leader

Maria is 28 years old and has two children (a girl who is three and a boy who is five). Her mother and her brother both help out working in her small store, which is next door to her house. The name of her small grocery store is “Colmado Yahira” after her nickname, “Yahira”. She sells bread, rice, bottled water, cooking oil, milk, candies for the kids, sugar and soda. Maria started her small business with her first loan from Esperanza.

She uses the profits from her shop to continue stocking her shelves. She is also able to tuck a little away each month to save for the future. She has been able to store up voluntary savings in addition to the obligatory savings that Esperanza requires. She hopes to be able to save enough money from her business to finish building her house out of concrete.

About the Group
