During training sessions with Esperanza, their loan officer, Marcelina Marte, leads group discussions about the importance of solidarity and discipline in taking out a loan. The group talks about the true meaning of solidarity and the need to truly stand by each other in the event one of the group members doesn’t fare well in her business ventures. She points out the difference between choosing neighbors and friends who you like as business partners versus choosing ones who you know will pay back their loans.

Maria is the coordinator for her group of six women within the larger Bank of Hope. Together with the coordinators from the other four groups, they form a leadership council, whose responsibilities include involvement in community activities such as mothers' clubs and the local health clinics.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of bread, rice, bottled water, cooking oil, milk and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing more electronic appliances for sale.

loans.name: Abdukohir

texts.ru:
Abdukohir K. is 26 years old, he is single and has a secondary education. He has been selling food for 3 years. Since childhood he has helped his mother in her business in order to support the family’s standard of living. Later, he used local illegal creditors to get loans at high interest rates, which did not help in increasing his inventory.

Abdukohir became a client of MicroInvest in 2006 and borrowed $600. Gradual borrowing and reliability allowed him to increase his inventory, to purchase products for cash and to save for study at the University. In the future, Abdukohir plans to transition to wholesaling.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каландаров Абдукохир- 26 лет .Холост, образование среднее. Вот уже три года занимается продажей продуктами питания. С детства помогал маме в торговле для поддержания уровня жизни. Позже становясь совершеннолетним начал кредитоваться у местных нелегальных кредиторов под большие проценты, что не способствовало увеличить товарооборот. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест в 2006 –ом году с активами на 600 долларов. Шаговое кредитование и ответственность перед программой МЗФ позволило ему увеличить товарооборот, приобретать товар за наличные и накопить на учебу в Университете. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: to transition to wholesaling and save up for study in University

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru:
Saboat A. is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a high school education. She has been selling children's clothing for the past 3 years. Because her husband is in Russia earning money for the family it is up to her to take care of the children. After the Soviet Union fell apart, she has lost her job and decided to try working in sales. In order to increase turnover and purchase more goods, she became a client of MicroInvest. Back in 2005 her assets amounted to $600. Currently she has a permanent point of sales in one of the main markets of the region. In the future she is planing to increase the selection of goods she has to offer and start selling adult clothing as well.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдуллоева Сабоат- 44 лет. Замужем, счастливая мать четверых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается продажей детской одежды 3 года. Муж в Российской Федерации на заработках. Все заботы о семье лежат на ее хрупких женских плечах. После распада Советского Союза она осталась без работы и начала пробовать себя в сфере торговли. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот и приобрести товар за наличные средства она стала клиенткой МЗФ Микроинвест в 2005 году с активами на 600 $. В настоящее время у нее постоянная точка деятельности в одном из центральных рынков района в области. В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент товара и добавить в свою деятельность и взрослые одежды

loans.use: to diversify the selection of goods

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru:
Abdurashit V. is 33 years old. He has a college education, is married and has 4 children. He has extensive experience in the field of cattle raising because he was helping his parents raise cattle since early childhood. He has his own house with all the necessary conditions needed to raise cattle. He became a client of MicroInvest back in 2006. Back then his assets amounted to $400 and he had only two calves in his possession. Thanks to MicroInvest he was able to increase the amount of cattle he owns and stock up on cattle feed for the winter. In the future he is planing to acquire more milk cows and better the conditions the animals are held in.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Вохидов Абдурашит- 33 года .Образование высшее. Женат отец 4-х детей. Имеет большой опыт в сфере животноводства так как с детства помогал своим родителям в откармливании крупно рогатого скота. У него свой личный дом с хорошими условиями откорма. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвесте с 2006-го года с активами на 400 долларов. В хлеву в то время у него имелось только пару телят .Хорошие условия кредитования программы МЗФ для животноводов позволило ему увеличить наличие скота и запасаться кормом на зиму. В будущем планирует увеличить численность дойных коров и улучшить условия содержания.

loans.use: to increase a number of livestock

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif I. (his employee is pictured) owns and operates a market in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Arif is 45 years old and is a single man. He was born and raised in Khachmaz and has been running his store for 10 years. Arif is looking for funding in the amount of $1,750 in order to increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en: Ilyas Z. owns and operates a shop that produces windows and doors in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Ilyas is a single 29 year old man who has been working in this trade for a number of years. He has already successfully re-paid a loan in the amount of $1,175 with Norwegian Microcredit thus showing that he is a trustworthy customer. Ilyas is looking for funding in the amount of $1200 in order to invest in the improvement of his shop.

loans.use: To make improvements to his shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.ru:
Abduhrakim A. is 22. He is single and has a partial college education. Despite his age he has extensive experience in sales because it is the main source of his family's income. He is in business of selling headdresses for children, belts and ties. Previously he would sell from different locations within the market. His assets amounted to $700. Thanks to MicroInvset he was able to secure a permanent point of sales, increase turnover, pay for all of his family expenses and his college education. In the future he is planing to make a trip to purchase more goods and start selling wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдурахмонов Абдухаким – 22 года. Холост, образование высшее неоконченное. Не смотря на свой возраст, имеет большой опыт в сфере торговли, так как эта деятельность является основным источником дохода семьи. Занимается торговлей головного убора для детей, ремней и галстуками. Раньше торговал в разных местах рынка с товарооборотом на 700 $. Кредитование в МЗФ Микроинвест позволило ему приобрести постоянную точку торговли, увеличить товарооборот, покрывать все расходы семьи и оплачивать учебу в университете. В будущем планирует ездить за товаром сам и перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: to start selling goods wholesale

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en: Mukhtar E. owns and operates a uniform store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He mainly sells police and military uniforms. Mukhtar is 52 years old and is married with two children. He has been involved with his business for a number of years and is looking for funding in the amount of $600 so that he can increase his inventory stock. Mukhtar has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Normicro proving that he is a customer that can be trusted.

loans.use: To increase his inventory stock

loans.name: Dilbaroy

texts.ru:
Dilbaroy Aminochonova is 42, married and has 2 children. She has a high-school education. Her husband is currently in Russia earning money for the family. Her children help her out with the business after they are done with school for the day. She has been selling groceries for the past 3 years. Over this time she has extensive experience in the field and became a reliable client of MicroInvest. She used to not have a permanent point of sale and had to buy her goods for credit, which significantly reduced the profitability of her business. After becoming a client of MicroInvest her assets increased to $700. She was also able to increase turnover. In the future she is planing to secure a permanent sales location on the central market.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volnuteer

Аминчонова Дилбарой- 42 лет. Замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование среднее. Муж находится в РФ на заработках а дети помогают ей,после учебы в школе. Занимается продажей продуктами питания вот уже 3 года. Наработала достаточный опыт в этой сфере ,чего может показать ее дисциплинированность пред программой МЗФ Микроинвест. Раньше не имела постоянную точку и покупала товар в кредит, что сильно влияло уменьшению дохода. После постоянного кредитования в МЗФ ее активы достигли 700 $ и увеличился товарооборот. В будущем планирует приобрести постоянную точку торговли в центральном рынке.

loans.use: to open another activity place

loans.name: Nazkhanim

texts.en: Nazkhanim R. operates a fruit and vegetable stand at the bazaar in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She is a 46 year old single woman who has been working at the bazaar for the last 15 years. This will be her fourth loan with Norwegian Microcredit which shows that she is a customer that can be trusted to make her payments on time. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 in order to increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Penah

texts.en: Penah A. owns and operates a home goods store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 51 years old and is married with four children. He has been working in this business for a number of years and has come to Norwegian Microcredit looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 22956

loans.name: Gehreman

texts.en: Gehreman I. is a taxi driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 33 years old and is married with two children. He has been working as a taxi driver in his community for a number of years and is looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that he can make some much needed repairs to his cab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo A. is 37 years old and has three children. She has a high-school education. After the USSR fell apart, Marhabo and her husband both lost their jobs. This is when they decided to try starting up a business making and selling traditional flat bred. According to Eastern traditions, women are expected to know how to make beautiful and tasty flat bread. Marhabo is really good at it. She became a client of MicroInvest back in 2007 in order to be able to purchase flower. In the future she is planing to secure another sales location at the central market.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Ахмедова Мархабо – 37 лет. Мать троих детей. Образование среднее специальное. После развала СССР они с мужем остались без работы и в это время им пришла ,мысль пробовать себя в производстве и продаже национальных лепешек. По восточным стандартам женщина должна уметь испечь красивые и аппетитные лепешки, с чем Мархабо очень хорошо справляется. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест для приобретения муки за наличные в начале 2007 –го года. В будущем планирует приобрести еще одну точку деятельности в центральном рынке.

loans.use: to obtain another activity place in central market

loans.name: Geribkhan

texts.en: Geribkhan B. owns and operates a fruit and vegetable stand in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. His stand is actually located right in front of Norwegian Microcredit’s Khachmaz branch. He is 57 years old and is married with two children. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $600 in order increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sedaget

texts.en: Sedaget Z. and her husand (husband is pictured) own and operate a furniture store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Sedeget is 57 years old and is married with four children. She and her husband have been involved with this business for a number of years and have already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit proving that she is a trustworthy customer. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $725 that she will combine with some of her and her husbands own funds to purchase new inventory for the store.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sahid

texts.en: Sahid E. is a taxi cab driver in the northeasterly town Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 56 years old, married with two children and has been driving a taxi for the last five years. He has already successfully paid back three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit and is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 in order to make some much needed repairs to his cab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.name: Tajeddin

texts.en: Tajeddin B. is a meat and fish vendor at the bazaar in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 51 years old, married with three children and has been a vendor for the last 12 years. He has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit proving that he is a trustworthy customer. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $725 in order to purchase a refrigerator for his business as well as make some minor repairs to his business.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and make minor repairs to business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 22962

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar G. owns and operates a molding shop in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 23 years old and has been working in this business for the last three years. Before his current occupation he worked as a vendor at the local bazaar. He is looking for funding in the amount $475 so that he can purchase new equipment for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his molding shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.pt:
Gabriel is single and lives with a woman. He works for a private company. Gabriel’s girlfriend does not work outside the home. She takes care of the housework. Gabriel was born in a northern province of Mozambique. The only family he has in Xai-Xai is the woman he lives with. In the future, he plans to legalize his marital status.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriel e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher. Ele e trabalhador de uma Empresa Privada. A mulher de Gabriel nao trabalha fora de casa. Ela cuida dos afazeres domesticos. Gabriel nasceu numa Provincia ao Norte de Mocambique. Em Xai-Xai a unica familia que ele tem e a mulher com quem vive. No futuro ele pensa legalizar a sua situacao matrimonial.

loans.use: Gabriel would like to use the loan money to buy construction materials

loans.name: Georgina Altino

texts.pt:
Georgina is a widow. She has 5 children. Georgina’s children attend school. She would like to use the money to buy products for stocking her store. Georgina runs her business out of her home, in which she built a small shop where she sells her products. If the business does well, she plans to renovate her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Georgina e viuva. Ela tem 5 filhos. Os filhos de Georgina estao a estudar. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para comprar produtos para rechear a sua tenda. Georgina fza o seu negocio na sua residencia onde construiu a pequena tenda onde vende os produtos. Se o negocio correr bem, ela pensa reabilitar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Georgina would like use the money to buy products for her store

loans.name: Hien Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Hien is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She has been running her business for only one year and intends to use her loan to buy more goods to expand her growing business. In addition, her husband can help generate income for the family through his job as a worker in factory.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Melita Levi

texts.pt:
Melita is a single mom. She has 4 children. All of Melita’s children attend school. She started the business to pay for her children’s schooling as well as other household expenses. If the business does well, she plans to expand her house to accommodate her growing children. She entered the program in 2004.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Melita e mae solteira. Ela tem 4 filhos. Todos os filhos de Melita estao a estudar. Por isso ela faz este negocio para poder pagar os estudos dos seus filhos e pagar outras despesas de sua casa.Se o negocio correr bem ela pensa no futuro ampliar a sua residencia uma vez que os filhos estao a crescer. Ela entrou para o Program em 2004.

loans.use: Melita would like to use the money to buy more wrap skirts for the business

loans.name: Marta Angelo

texts.pt:
Marta is a single mother of 2. She lives alone with her children. Her husband abandoned her. Martha entered the program in 2005 as a member of a group. Meanwhile the group has disbanded and she has decided to take out a loan on her own. She has many customers. If the business continues to do well, she plans to build a better house. Marta’s children are still too young to attend school. She plans to register them as soon as they are old enough.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Marta e solteira e tem 2 filhos. Ela vive sozinha com os filhos. O marido abandonou-a. Marta entrou para o programa em 2005 como membro de um grupo. Todavia o grupo desfez-se e ela resolveu tomar dinheiro emprestado individualmente.Ela tem muitos clientes. Se o negocio continuar a correr-lhe bem ela pensa construir uma casa melhorada. Os filhos de Marta ainda nao vao a escola porque nao tem idade. Mas logo que estiverem com idade ela os ira matricular.

loans.use: Marta would like to use the money to buy more fish for the business

loans.name: Gloria David

texts.pt:
Gloria is a single mother of 2. She lives with her children and a few nephews. She is now entering the loan program. She would like to use the loan money to strengthen her business selling wrap skirts and children’s clothing. Gloria’s children attend school. She would like to save money to invest in their education. The father of one of her children built her a small house, and she would like to expand it a bit with her future earnings. However, her children’s schooling is a priority.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria e solteira e tem 2 filhos. Ela vive com os seus filhos e alguns sobrinhos. Ela esta a entrar agora para o Programa de credito.Ela quer aplicar o dinheiro do emprestimo para reforcar o seu negocio de venda de capulanas e roupa para criancas. Os filhos de Gloria estao a estudar. Ela quer juntar dinheiro para investir na educacao dos filhos. Uma vez que o pai de um dos filhos lhe construiu uma casinha ela ira amplia-la aos poucos com os futuros rendimentos . Mas a prioridade e a escola dos filhos.

loans.use: Gloria would like to use the money to buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Leonor Jeque

texts.pt:
Leonor is single, but lives with a man who has 4 children. Her husband is not employed. She makes her living with small jobs. Leonor entered the program in 2001. She's a very enterprising woman. With her earnings, she was able to expand the stand where she sells products and also help her husband with home expenses and school expenses for their children. She is able to ensure that her family members receive a balanced diet.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Leonor e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 4 filhos. O marido de Leonor nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos negocios.Leonor entrou para o programa em 2001. E uma mulher muito empreendedora. Ela vende roupa.Com os rendimentos conseguiu ampliar a sua barraca onde tambem vende produtos de primeira necessidade e ainda ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa e nas despesas da escola dos seus filhos. Ela consegue assegurar uma dieta equilibrada para os membros de sua familia.

loans.use: Leonor wants to use the money to buy more clothing to sell  but also to buy products to fill up her store.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman V. is a 25-year-old farmer who owns a sheep breeding business in the southern Azerbaijani village of Bilasuvar. Suleyman is an internally displaced person who fled from the Jabrail region to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Suleyman is married and has two children. Suleyman has two years of experience in raising sheep. Mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijani and people use meat in their everyday cuisine. Life inthe  village is very hard, and much harder if you have two baby kids. Sometime orders for purchasing sheep are much higher than Seulyman has in his herd. Selling sheep to the locals  and to the Baku (capital of Azerbaijan) bazaar traders is the only source of income for his family. Suleyman has applied for 800 USD to purchase 15 sheep for estimated price 50-60 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: Mammadkhan

texts.en:
Mammadkhan Suleymanova is a 32-year-old farmer who owns a sheep herd in the southern Azerbaijani region of Bilasuvar. He is an internally displaced person from the Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Mammadkhan is married and has four daughters. Since he and his wife are unemployed, selling sheep is the only  source of income in his family. Mutton is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use meat in their daily life. During all summer Mammadkhan grazes his herd on the mountain. He lives on mountain alone from June to August. During those three months the sheep are getting fat and they can be sold for a higher price than they were purchased. 
Mammadkhan works very hard to cover all his family's  needs. However it is getting harder to keep such a big family each year. Now he has decided to establish financial income for  his family and increase the number of sheep in his herd. For this purpose he has applied for 600 USD. He is going to purchase 12 baby sheep for estimated cost 50 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 12 sheep

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla A. is 48 year old mother of five children. She lives with her husband in Bware Migori Kenya. She is well known in her the community as japur (local language meaning  farmer). She has a big chunk of land where she grows sugarcane. She also rears local cattle breeds that produce between 8 to 10 litres of milk a day which she sells to the community at US $ 0.45 a litre. She plans to buy a dairy cattle breed that can produce not less 15 litres a day with US $ 800 she has applied for.

loans.use: Buy hybrid dairy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more eggs for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a single mother four, with her youngest daughter still at home. She became single when her children were still very young. Despite being alone, Esther has been able to support them and see most of them become independent and move on to their own homes. She began her enterprise selling local foods from her own house, an endeavor that is thriving to this day. Her goal is still to generate income for her youngest child’s education, as well as for her own general household expenses. She is assisted by her daughter during breaks from her studies. Thanks to the success of her business, she has been able to expand the types of products she offers and generate sufficient income to help support her and her family. Esther is looking for additional funds to increase her inventory and the items she offers for sale, and she hopes to get her own kiosk where she can sell her products from. She is asking for a loan to help her meet her customers’ demands, with a commitment to repay the loan in six months. Let’s help support Esther’s hard work and dreams for her daughter, and to achieve her goal of her own kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther es madre soltera y vive en compañía de la última de sus hijas, de un total de cuatro; ya que cada uno se independizó y formó su propio hogar, a pesar de que se quedó sola cuando sus hijos eran muy pequeños pudo sacarlos adelante y procurarles bienestar sin ayuda alguna.Inició su etapa laboral vendiendo en su pequeña casita comida regional, actividad que aún hasta el día de hoy viene desarrollando con gran éxito, con el propósito de cubrir los gastos de educación de su pequeña hija además de los que genera su hogar; debido a la acogida amplia acogida que tuvo su negocio ha incrementado su variada oferta con la venta de golosinas, bebidas y plátanos cimentando aún más sus ingresos económicos con la ayuda de su hija que colabora con ella alternando sus estudios en un Instituto Pedagógico de la ciudad con la atención y servicio de su centro de ventas.Ahora se encuentra en la necesidad de seguir acrecentando la cantidad y variedad de sus productos para cubrir los gastos familiares con el objetivo de apoyar a su diligente hija para que se convierta en una profesional muy competente, además cuenta con el proyecto de tener un kiosco para expender sus productos también en este lugar.Solicita un préstamo para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, con un compromiso de devolución de seis meses. Colaboremos con el esfuerzo de Esther para que siga progresando junto a su hija y logre el sueño de tener un kiosco.

loans.use: Purchase additional products/inventory.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Mr. Luis Arturo Dejesus G. is 28 years old, he is still currently single and lives with his parents in San Ignacio, Paraguay. For the last seven years, Luis has run an auto repair business out of his parents' home. He began learning auto repair by helping in a variety of shops in his hometown. By working in these shops he obtained all the necessary tools and knowledge to start his own business. Now, he has established a number of regular clients who know he can be relied on to provide knowledgeable service at a good price.

The credit Luis has requested will go toward purchasing an air compressor for his shop. The compressor he had had previously broke down and has made his daily workload considerably more difficult. The lack of a compressor limits the number of clients he is able to assist. The acquisition of a new compressor will allow Luis to continue with his work and augment the income of his family.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor for his shop

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Mr. Diego Martinez, 25, is single and lives with his parents in San Ignacio, Paraguay. Since 2005, Diego has had a shop that rents DVDs. Additionally, Diego has a small recording studio where he makes CDs and DVDs. He began in this area by working as a DJ for the local radio station. After gaining some experience as a DJ he was able to move up and become a DJ at a club. Today he is a DJ at one of the bigger clubs in the zone.

He has worked hard to learn everything he can about recording and sales. He already owns all of the equipment necessary to have a well-run recording studio, including computers, a soundboard, and a multiplicity of international films, which he rents through his store.

He has asked for a loan so that he can buy a new computer for his mixing studio. The computer he has currently is quite old and breaks frequently. The large demand for his services requires that he have a machine that functions smoothly. At this time his goal is to continue growing his business and increase the number of clients he can serve on a weekly basis. A new computer will allow Diego to pursue his goals and better his daily life.

loans.use: To buy a new computer

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria’s family consists of four children, three of whom are now on their own. One daughter, a student, remains in her care and helps her with her business on a daily basis. Her husband sells grain/cereals and, together, they help bring in income to pay for living expenses. Some time ago, Maria started out selling in the market, but due to relocation issues she had to find a location of her own to continue her business and helping to support her family. She asked the director of a medical center if she could market her goods outside on the sidewalk, which turned out very positively as it is a high-traffic area. Given the success of her business, she needs to make some purchases to help her meet her customer demand. She is asking for a loan that she will repay in six months. She hopes for your generous support toward the continued well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El hogar de María está compuesto por cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres viven fuera con sus respectivas familias y obligaciones, quedando sólo una hija bajo su protección que está en el colegio y apoya diariamente en la atención del negocio; vive con su esposo que se dedica a comprar y a rematar granos viajando por la carretera y por los ríos de su bella ciudad de esta manera ambos contribuyen satisfactoriamente con los gastos del hogar.Maria empezó vendiendo en el mercado del jirón Bellavista hace mucho tiempo, desde joven a raíz de los problemas de reubicación es que tuvo que ver la forma de poder continuar con su labor para solventar los gastos de su querida familia, como fue impronta la reubicación y no contaba con un local propio, se le ocurrió solicitar al director de la Posta Médica si podría ocupar la vereda para trabajar, cosa que le resultó positivo dándole más expectativas al crecimiento de su negocio por ser una zona muy transitada.Debido ahora al gran giro que dió su negocio al aumentar sus ventas, se encuentra en la necesidad de cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, solicitando un préstamo que será devuelto en un lapso de seis meses.María espera contar con el apoyo generoso de vuestra parte, para poder asegurar el desarrollo y bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase utensils/cookware, provisions for food preparation enterprise.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Mr. Eduardo A., 26, is a father of one four year old boy. He lives in San Ignacio, Paraguay with his mother of 60. His wife helps care for his ill and aging mother as well as for their young son. The boy’s young age and mother’s unstable condition require that someone be in the house at all times. Eduardo currently supports his family by working as a street vendor of CDs, DVDs, MP4s and lottery tickets. Eduardo has been doing this work for seven years. He buys his merchandise in the city of Encarnacion where he is able to purchase it for a very low price. He then sells this merchandise in the surrounding cities of Santa Rosa, San Ignacio and San Juan Bautista.  He has asked for a loan to buy watches and jewelry. He hopes by increasing his stock he can reach a wider array of people and make a greater profit.

loans.use: To buy watches and jewelry

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda, in addition to working and maintaining a home, is also studying at the university to become an English teacher. She lives with her husband and two children, the oldest an engineering student at the university and the youngest is also in school. She started selling in the market, but due to location problems she ended up setting up her business on the patio of her home. Her customers quickly became aware of the great flavor and variety of the foods that she prepares. She counts on the assistance of her children, who help her with purchases of ingredients and serving customers. Her husband, a teacher, also helps out – making the success of the business a family affair! Because she is located in a high-traffic area, it is necessary to improve her location with a tarp/cover to make her customers more comfortable and sheltered from the strong sun. She asks for a loan to assist her in meeting this goal. Improving her business and earnings prospects in this way will also help her finish her studies and to continue working to improve her family’s quality of life. They would all be very grateful for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodolinda a pesar de trabajar y mantener su hogar estudia en la universidad para ser profesora de inglés, vive con su esposo y sus dos queridos hijos, el mayor estudia en la universidad la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas y el hijo menor está en el colegio; ella empezó vendiendo en el mercado debido al problema de la reubicación por el que atravesaron muchas personas tuvo la premura de buscar un local y sin dudar acondicionó el patio de su casa, de esta manera en forma rápida se hizo de clientes debido al buen sabor y a la gran variedad de platos que ofrece; cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en la compra de insumos y la atención al público, así como de su esposo que es profesor, quién comparte su tiempo para ayudar y compartir los gastos familiares.A razón de que está en una zona transitada y por estar frente a la plaza del distrito es que su negocio empezó a tener la necesidad de ser acondicionado con una carpa por el fuerte sol y para comodidad de los clientes que gustan del buen sabor de Teodolinda.Solicita un préstamo para llevar adelante su objetivo; así mismo este hecho le permitirá concluir su carrera de maestra, continuar trabajando y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia quienes desde ya se encuentran muy contentos por vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase tent/tarp and ingredients for food sales.

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.es:
Luz is a single mother of six and currently living with one of her daughters who is pursuing a career in education at the university. Despite having been left alone to raise six small children, Luz never lost hope of improving their lives and of dedicating herself to some endeavor that would help to support them all and secure their educations. She decided to focus on making local crafts, learning from her mother what a great art form this could be. This became her passion, and the means by which she could better her family’s quality of life. She travels to many places to market her products, supported in her endeavor at home by her daughter. She has generated earnings by taking the products around with her to sell, or to exchange for other goods with the farmers she meets in her travels. With the growth of her business, Luz is hoping to create more opportunities to increase sales by making more crafts and purchasing clothing to offer for sale. She is looking for a loan to make her plans into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz es madre soltera y tuvo seis hijos, actualmente vive con una D. sus hijas, que esta cursando la carrera D. educación en la universidad, a pesar D. haberse quedado sola cuando sus hijos aún eran pequeños jamás perdió las esperanzas D. sobresalir y desempeñarse satisfactoriamente en alguna actividad para generarles bienestar y educación.Decidió dedicarse a la elaboración D. artículos artesanales aprendiendo D. su mamá este bello arte. Convirtiéndose en lo que sería su pasión y fuente D. trabajo con que el que pudo sacar adelante a su familia; ella actualmente trabaja viajandopermanentemente por los ríos, chacras y por la carretera ofertando sus productos, mientras que en su casa es la hija quién la apoya en la elaboración D. los productos, convirtiéndose en un elemento D. gran ayuda para ella; paralelamente lleva consigo mercadería para vender o canjearlas por animales que puedan ofrecer los moradores D. las chacras, generando una muy buena fuente D. ingresos para su hogar.Como se le presentan las oportunidades D. aumentar sus ventas gracias a las novedades que ofrece se encuentra en la necesidad D. producir más artículos y D. paso comprar ropa para ofertarla y así seguir trabajando.Solicita un préstamo con el objetivo D. concretar sus planes y ayudar con el término D. su carrera D. su gran socia.

loans.use: Purchase accessories for crafts/clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa has four children: three are in school and the oldest, a daughter, studies accounting at a well-known institution in the city. She lives with her husband who works cutting and working wood. His occupation cannot always be relied on for income to support the family, and can lead to months at a time away from home. Because of this, and losing her job, Rosa began raising chickens to generate income. She was able to build a small shed in her garden and start with 50 baby chicks. Seeing good results in a short time period, she decided to continue with her endeavor. She has developed a loyal customer base, including some who place orders ahead of time giving her assured future sales. To keep up with the needs of her flock, Rosa is looking for a loan to help her feed and care for them until they are ready for sale. She would look to pay the loan back in six months’ time. Let’s help Rosa keep working, and bring her the economic support she needs to help secure the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es madre de cuatro hijos, tres están en el colegio y la hija mayor estudia contabilidad en un instituto reconocido de la ciudad, vive con su esposo quién se dedica a la extracción de madera viajando por meses y ausentándose fuera del hogar sin descuidar los gastos de la familia, ni la educación de sus hijos. Ella empezó el negocio de la crianza de pollos cuando se quedó sin trabajo y la liquidaron; logró construir un pequeño galpón en la huerta de su casa y empezó con 50 pollitos bebés, obteniendo resultados muy favorables en poco tiempo, hecho que la motivó a seguir trabajando e invirtiendo; debido al carisma con el que cuenta se hizo de clientes muy buenos que con anticipación separan sus pedidos, de esta manera ella ya cuenta con una venta asegurada y con clientes satisfechos.Para poder cubrir con la demanda de pollos se encuentra en la necesidad de alimentarlos y cuidarlos hasta que estén listos para su venta, requiriendo un préstamo con un pacto de cancelación de seis meses. Ayudemos a Rosa a seguir trabajando brindándole el apoyo económico que necesita, con el que logrará el desarrollo y bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for poultry flock.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.es:
Mirza was born to be become a great stylist. For this reason Mirza studied cosmetology in the afternoons while she was still in grade school. Now she is the mother of five children, three of which still live with her in their small dwelling and attend high school. The other two children live and work independently thanks to the profession that Mirza instilled in them. Mirza lives with her husband who does carpentry and metal work in the small workshop in the patio of their home.

Long ago Mirza began with a small mirror and a pair of scissors. First she cut the hair of grade school students in the living room of her modest home. Obtaining good results she has entered the market even without using the tools, accessories or beauty products used for certain jobs/styles. Now, thanks to the good response she has had, she hopes to continue growing her salon. It is for this reason that she urgently needs a loan to buy more tools of the trade. She agrees to pay the loan back in six months. With the help of the loan she will be able to fulfill the needs of here exclusive customer base and to continue the development of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Mirza estudió cosmetología, cuando aún estaba en el colegio, por las tardes debido a que le nacía la vocación de convertirse en una gran estilista, es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales tres viven con ella en su pequeña morada y estudian en el colegio secundario; los otros dos hijos trabajan y son independientes gracias a la profesión que ella supo inculcarles; vive con su esposo quién se dedica a las labores de carpintería y metálica en un pequeño taller acondicionado en el patio de su casa.Hace mucho tiempo Mirza empezó modestamente con un espejo mediano y un par de tijeras; cortando primero a los chicos en edad escolar en la sala de su modesta casa obteniendo buenos resultados, su incursión se inició de este modo ya que no contaba con las herramientas, accesorios y productos de belleza para la realización de otros trabajos. Ahora espera seguir creciendo en su salón de belleza gracias a la buena aceptación que tiene. Es por eso que necesita de manera muy urgente un préstamo para comprar los implementos de su negocio con un compromiso de cancelación de seis meses.Con esta ayuda podrá cumplir con su selecto público y consolidar el desarrollo de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of salon accessories and beauty products.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
Maria has been a widow for a long time and charged herself with the duty of caring for her children. When her husband disappeared she was left with only one form of income, a pension from the minister of education. This money was not sufficient since her children study in a modest school in the city center. Therefore Maria began to sell different market goods such as clothing which she brought from the capital city. This business has yielded good result and she will continue selling. Thanks to her efforts and skillful management of the funds that her work generates Maria was able to save up and purchase a motorcycle taxi which her son drives. Despite the good care that her son has taken with the motorcycle since she purchased it, the motorcycle has reached the end of its life and they need to purchase a new one. Maria also desires to change the accessories so that she can continue working and fulfill her plans to purchase another motorcycle taxi.

Maria needs a sum of $500 in order to move her plans forward. This amount will permit her to continue to receive income and save for the well planned investment.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

María se quedó viuda hace mucho tiempo, haciéndose cargo D. sus cinco hijos con el único ingreso, la pensión que recibía del ministerio D. educación a raíz D. la desaparición D. su esposo, este dinero no le era suficiente para mantener suficientemente bien a sus hijos que están estudiando en un modesto centro educativo D. su pequeña ciudad, así que decidió empezar a vender mercadería D. diverso uso en especial ropa que traía D. la capital, esta incursión le dió buenos resultados y no deja D. trabajar vendiendo, gracias al esfuerzo y al buen manejo D. las utilidades que genera su labor ha podido ahorrar llegando a obtener un mototaxi que es manejado por su hijo mayor.El buen cuidado que le da su querido socio a la unidad móvil desD. que la obtuvieron se encuentra en la urgente necesidad D. comprar un motor nuevo ya que el anterior ya cumplió su ciclo D. vida, también desea cambiar los accesorios para seguir trabajando ya que está dentro D. sus planes comprar otro mototaxi en un tiempo determinado.La suma que necesita para poder llevar adelante sus proyectos es D. 500 dólares, cifra que le permitirá seguir percibiendo ingresos y ahorrar con la buena y acertada inversión que va a realizar.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle and parts

loans.name: Loydi

texts.es:
Loydi’s family consists of seven children. Three of the children work with their father and the other four are students. Her husband is responsible to the home and its expenses. He works as a lumberjack and therefore travels often with the three oldest children. Loydi learned to sew when she was fourteen. This noble profession was passed on to her by her mother. Loydi began as a seamstress in a small shop for a fixed wage and purchased a pedal operated sewing machine. From there Loydi started her own seamstress shop in her home. Over time, with the clientele that she attracted, she was able to purchase an electric sewing machine. Having had customers placing advanced orders she increased her sales greatly.

She is very proud of her work and what she sews. In order to maintain the satisfaction of her clients, Loydi is asking for a loan which she will repay in six months. This money will enable her to purchase materials to make clothing.

Eternal thanks for the noble assistance of our father in heaven.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La familia de Loydi consta de siete hijos, de los cuales tres trabajan con su papá y los otros cuatro estudian en el colegio; su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera por lo que viaja frecuentemente con sus hijos mayores, sin descuidar los gastos de su hogar. Loydi aprendió a coser cuando tenía catorce años a raíz que aprendió esta noble labor de su mamá, empezó a elaborar sus primeras creaciones en una máquina a pedal que se había conseguido de ocasión ya que ella trabaja en un taller como costurera con un sueldo fijo, llevando adelante el proyecto de tener su propio taller de costura en su casa.Con el transcurrir del tiempo y la clientela que pudo conseguir, compró una máquina eléctrica y empezó a incrementar sus ventas teniendo pedidos con anticipación y sintiéndose muy orgullosa de su trabajo y sus creaciones. Para poder mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, está solicitando un préstamo con un período de devolución de seis meses, este dinero le permitirá comprar los materiales para la elaboración de las prendas, agradeciendo eternamente por tan noble apoyo de vuestra parte.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura has been immersed in her cleaning business for 14 years. She is the mother of five children, three of which are school-age students and two of which attend college. She lives with her husband who is an employee of the Regional Hospital of Pucallpa. Laura began with the fabrication of disinfectants and liquid air fresheners, her husband and son doing the mixing in the afternoons after work. Due to the sales and general acceptance of the goods the production grew into a small family business.

To fulfill the needs of this growth Laura must stock up on mixing supplies which she purchases in the capital city. Her business is becoming more stable now that she has various contracts with business and institutions. The loan that she needs is $200, which will be repaid in six months. This value will enable her to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Laura esta inmersa en el negocio D. la limpieza desD. hace 14 años, ella es madre D. cinco hijos, tres D. las cuales están en el colegio y los otros dos en la universidad, vive con su esposo que trabaja como empleado en el Hospital Regional D. Pucallpa; comenzó con la fabricación D. desinfectantes y ambientadores líquidos, encargándose D. la elaboración su esposo y su hijo por las tardes; debido a las ventas y aceptación que empezó a obtener sus productos fueron aumentando el nivel D. producción D. la microempresa familiar.Frente a esta necesidad D. crecimiento D. la empresa Laura tiene que abastecerse D. insumos para su elaboración comprándolos en la capital ya que sumado a la venta que realiza en su casa tiene varios contratos con empresas e instituciones convirtiéndose en una venta ya segura.El préstamo que necesita es D. 200 dólares, para poder aumentar su producción con un compromiso D. devolución del crédito en seis meses.

loans.use: Purchase of mixing supplies for the production of cleaning products.

loans.name: Silvia Cerafina

texts.es:
Victoria is 42 years old and married to Wilfredo. They have three children together. She and her husband work tirelessly to support their family with their business selling fuel, which they run from their home. They also grow coffee and various seasonal fruits which they take to market. Sometimes all these efforts are not enough, and they find their children have additional requirements they need to fulfull. This has motivated the couple to take on another project in their new house which they building; they plan to open a small shop/cafe which will generate more income and help them improve their standard of living.

They need our support to help them reach these goals. They are requesting a loan which will enable them to increase their harvests, as well as purchase more fuel to better meet their customer's demands. With the additional money they can save, they can finish the construction on the house, open their new business, and offer a better quality of life to their young children. With your support, we can help them convert their dreams into reality.

La señora Victoria tiene 42 años y junto a su esposo Wilfredo, formó una familia fruto de esa unión tiene tres hijos, por los cuales abnegadamente se esfuerzan en sus labores de venta de combustible que realizan conjuntamente en su propia casa además de la siembra café y diversas frutas que realizan anualmente en sus fructíferas tierras las cuales al alcanzar su madurez son trasladadas a los mercados, todo este sacrificio para hacer de sus hijos unos hombres íntegros y realizados. Muchas veces este esfuerzo no ha sido suficiente, para ayudarlos plenamente, debido a que sus hijos les demandan nuevas necesidades que ellos como padres tienen la responsabilidad de satisfacer.Esto ha motivado a que la familia en su conjunto emprenda un nuevo proyecto en su futura casa que está en construcción y planean abrir una bodega en la que podrán participara y contribuir con el incremento de su nivel de vida.Sin embargo necesitan, el apoyo de todos nosotros para poder cumplir, sus metas y anhelos; solicitan un préstamo de dinero con el que podrán aumentar sus cosechas e incrementar la compra de combustible para abastecer a sus clientes, lograr incrementar sus ahorros, concluir la construcción de su casa y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos. Con su colaboración podrá convertir los sueños de esta familia en realidad.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BE ABLE TO PURCHASE MORE FUEL WHICH THEY SELL, AS WELL AS SEEDS FOR THE VARIOUS SEASONAL CROPS THEY CULTIVATE AND TAKE TO MARKET.  THIS WILL HELP THEM IMPROVE THEIR FINANCIAL SITUATION AND PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THEIR YOUNG CHILDREN.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en: Eladia C. is 44 years old. Her husband left her to care for their two children alone eight years ago. The eldest child, 23, is wheelchair-bound and requires a great deal of attention. The other child is 16 and currently in school. The younger child often helps Eladia in the store so that she can attend to the older child. The three are lucky enough to live in their own house. Eladia is the sole provider for her two children. With the money she earns from her small grocery she is able to put her kids through school, and feed and clothe them. She is now asking for a loan to buy more groceries for her store so that she can go on providing for her family. She already carries oil, rice, noodles, yerba mate, salt, sugar, and vegetables in addition to a wide variety of conveniences. As a result, she has established a good reputation with the people of her neighborhood. She currently wishes to increase her stock so she is able to better serve her clients. She plans to purchase canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour.

loans.name: Teresa Eudocia

texts.es:
Teresa is 43 years old and married. She and her husband are inseparable. They work closely together creating ceramic handicrafts. With their patience and talent, they produce very fine and beautiful pieces which they sell wholesale in the city of Lima. This work gives them a lot of satisfaction, because they have been able to achieve rapid results which means they can provide a better quality of life for their 4 young children. Today, Teresa and her husband want to continue growing their ceramic business so they can begin to export outside their country. To reach their goals, they are requesting a loan to buy the materials they need to make their handicrafts. They both have committed to repay the loan within a 6 month period. With your support, we can help give them the opportunity to continue growing their business and improving the quality of life for themselves and their children.

Doña Teresa de 43 años de edad y su inseparable esposo están dedicados a elaborar trabajos de cerámica basados en arcilla, gracias a la paciencia que tienen y al talento de sus manos realizan finos y hermosos trabajos, que luego son vendidos al por mayor en la ciudad de lima, esta labor los llena de satisfacción porque están logrando obtener rápidamente resultados favorables, con los que pueden ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus cuatro hijos menores.Hoy en día Teresa y su esposo están deseosos de seguir creciendo con su trabajo de cerámica, hasta llegar a exportar al mundo entero y para lograr sus objetivos anhelan obtener un préstamo, con los que podrán comprar materia prima para seguir realizando sus trabajos, ambos se comprometen a rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses. En nuestras manos está poder darles la oportunidad de seguir creciendo con su oficio de toda la vida.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NEEDED TO CREATE THEIR CERAMIC HANDICRAFTS, INCREASE PRODUCTION  AND GROW THEIR BUSINESS.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique M. López is a street vendor selling novelty items and clothing. His stock includes: toys, office supplies, sports shoes, artificial flowers, and others. He is forty-two years old and married to Rosa Nuñez, 35, with whom he has three children. His daughter of 16 goes to high school and his two younger children, ages 1 and 4 respectively, still stay at home with their mother. Enrique is lucky enough to own both his own home and his own car. He uses the car to carry his merchandise to a variety of towns. After 22 years of service, Enrique has numerous clients. In the beginning he worked with family and friends helping them in their work. Later, he obtained a loan and began selling on his own. He is now saving the money he earns in order to build a house for his family and put his daughter through school.

In Paraguay during the first week of November the people celebrate two holidays, “dia de todos los santos” or All Saints Day" and “los difuntos” or "The Day of the Dead", and during this time the demand for the products sold by Enrique is especially high. For this reason, Enrique has asked for a loan to temporarily increase the amount of merchandise he carries, especially artificial and natural flowers, candles, etc. With this money he will be better able to serve his clients and expand his business.

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise especially artificial and natural flowers, candles

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Mr. Felix R. León is 46 years old, and is married to Brasiliana López, 45. Unfortunately, his wife has moved to Spain for better work opportunities. She sends money back to Felix from there. They have three children: the oldest is 22 and lives with Brasiliana in Spain. The other two children are a 15-year-old girl and a 13-year-old boy, both of whom live in Paraguay.

Felix and his two children live in their own house and run a small grocery. He has had this business for the past 17 years. Felix also has a taxi, however, right now he does not use his taxi because he does not want to leave his children alone in the house all day. With the loan he has requested Felix plans to buy a new cooler so that he can have cold drinks for his customers during the upcoming summer months.

loans.use: To buy a new cooler

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Doña Guillermina is 54 years old, an active and entrepreneurial mother who attends to her general store from early morning and thanks to her politeness and dedication the business has grown little by little and currently it has become one of the most popular stores in the area. While she is busy attending to her daily orders, her husband, Martín, is working as a mechanic at a repair shop and thanks to their jobs they can offer their two sons university studies. Doña Guillermina wishes to expand and increase the variety of her products in order to offer a better and more complete service to her regular customers and she is asking for a loan of $500 which will be invested in increasing the stock and that way improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Guillermina D. 54 años, es una madre activa y emprendedora, desD. tempranas horas se dedica a atender su bodeguita D. abarrotes, negocio que gracias a su amabilidad y dedicación fue creciendo poco a poco, y hoy en día se convirtió en una D. las tienditas más concurridas D. su localidad, mientras ella se dedica a atender sus pedidos diarios; Martín su esposo trabaja como mecánico en un taller, gracias al oficio que ambos desempeñan pueden brindarles estudios universitarios a sus dos hijos.El deseo D. Guillermina es ampliar y aumentar la variedad D. sus productos con el fin D. ofrecer un mejor y completo servicio a sus asiduos clientes, para esto solicita un préstamo D. 500 dólares, dinero que podrá invertir en aumentar el stock D. su mercadería y así mejorar su situación económica.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to increase stock and  improve sales at general store.

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Pilar owns a luncheonette where she sells drinks, cookies and other ready-to-eat foods. Her shop is located at the busy intersection of two major streets in San Ignacio. This business is her livelihood and has helped her sustain her family. Maria, now 50 years old, is married with two daughters, one of whom helps her in her shop and the other is now married and lives with her husband.

Like many women in Paraguay, Maria worked in Argentina for a number of years. The economic situation is good enough in Argentina to allow these women to work and save money, rather than living day to day. It is in this way that Maria was able to save the money to open her store by renting some space. She is also grateful to her husband who helped maintain the family during this time. Today she lives in her own house in a preferred neighborhood in San Ignacio, Paraguay.

With the credit she has requested, Maria will repair a small-refrigerated cart, which will be of much use during the hot summer months.

loans.use: To repair a small-refrigerated cart

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Mrs. Matilde J. Olmedo is a 52-year-old widow and mother of two living in San Ignacio, Paraguay. Her two daughters are ages 18 and 16 respectively. Both daughters are currently in high school and help their mother when they are not studying. Matilde is thankful for the help of her daughters, as maintaining her business and family has been difficult since the death of her husband in 2001. Mr. Olmedo died of cancer at the age of 45. This was a tremendous loss for the family and also left Matilde with the debt incurred due to the operations and treatment her husband undertook to try and cure him. For this reason Matilde works extremely hard to cover the debt she has as a result of her husband’s death.

Her store, a small grocery, is very well-stocked and well-managed due to the time and effort Matilde dedicates to it. She sells rice, noodles, oil, sugar, flour and eggs. Having had this store for 14 years, she understands how to make things run smoothly. She has asked for a loan to buy articles of clothing. She wishes to expand her store to also sell clothing. It is her hope that with the summer months and added inventory she will be able to increase her sales. By expanding her store Matilde wishes to pay off her debt faster.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing

loans.name: Gilda Berta

texts.es:
Gilda is a woman who does not give up easily. Since she was very young, she has been dedicated to the fine art of making ceramics with clay (arcilla) which she learned from her adorable and humble parents and thanks to her dedication and diligent performance, together with her husband and children, she is able to meet the family expenses. She and her family work very hard in their studio from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m seven days a week, then the finished product is carefully packed to be sold at market places throughout the different regions of her country, Peru. The wish of this keen mother is to increase the production and sale in order to export and improve her economic situation with the profits. To reach her goal, she and her family are asking for a loan of $500 which will be invested in her business and will allow her to fulfill her plans in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Gilda es una mujer luchadora, desde pequeña está dedicada al bello arte de realizar trabajos de cerámica en barro (arcilla), oficio que aprendió de sus adorables y humildes padres y que gracias a su interiorización y desempeño diligente junto a su esposo e hijos puede cubrir sus gastos familiares.Ella y su familia trabajan arduamente en su taller de cerámica desde las 8.00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde durante todos los días de la semana, luego de terminarlas las empaquetan cuidadosamente para venderlas en los mercados de los diferentes departamentos de su país Perú; el deseo de esta afanosa madre es aumentar la producción y venta hasta llegar a exportar su mercadería al exterior y con las ganancias que genere busca mejorar su situación económica; para cumplir sus objetivos ella y su familia solicitan un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que les permitirá invertir en su negocio y concretar sus planes en muy poco tiempo.

loans.use: To purchase raw material in order to increase production of ceramic articles.

loans.name: Saturnina Hermelinda

texts.es:
Saturnina is a single mother of 2 young daughters. A native of the district of Pukara, she has worked making ceramic handicrafts, including miniature animals, jewelry boxes, and nativities) for more than 15 years. She learned this craft from her mother, Pascuala, and she now creates these pieces with a lot a love and professionalism. Her young daughters are the daily motivation behind her efforts. She works very hard, from 4 in the morning until 7 in the evening. In their free time, her daughters help her with their enthusiastic support. The goal of this enterprising woman is to continue to grow her business. For this she is requesting a loan to purchase the material she needs to make these fine crafts, so she can increase production and meet the high number of orders she has. In the near future, she hopes to export her pieces to other countries.

Doña Saturnina es madre soltera de 2 niñas, natural del distrito de Pukará, desde hace más de 15 años está dedicada a realizar trabajos de cerámica en arcilla y yeso(Animales en miniaturas, alcancías, nacimientos), oficio que aprendió de su madre Pascuala y que ahora inculca con mucho amor y sumo profesionalismo a sus pequeñas niñas, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo día a día.Trabaja arduamente desde las 4:00 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche, en sus horas libres la apoyan muy entusiastas sus pequeñas niñas y el deseo de esta emprendedora familia es crecer aún más con su negocio, para esto desean adquirir materia prima (Yeso, Arcilla, Pintura) para mayor producción de sus artículos y así cumplir con la gran cantidad de pedidos que tienen y en un futuro no muy lejano exportar al exterior sus preciadas creaciones.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE THE NECESSARY MATERIALS AND PAINT TO CONTINUE GROWING HER HANDICRAFT BUSINESS, SO SHE CAN IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HERSELF AND HER TWO YOUNG DAUGHTERS.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Chapparo is 39 years old and is married to Maria Balbina Gomez. Together they have two children: a girl of 17 who is now in her senior year of high school; and a boy of 11 who is in the 5th grade. The family lives in their own house in Villa Universitaria, a neighborhood of San Ignacio.

Since 1997, Mr. Chapparo has had a stand that sells magazines. He sells magazines of all kinds with both national and international distribution, as well as newspapers, lottery tickets, and other similar items. His wife, Maria, helps run the store when Roberto has other work. Occasionally, Roberto works as a photographer or videographer for special events. Additionally, he works as a photographer for a weekly paper called “La Jornada”.

He has asked for a loan in order to repair his magazine shop. By maintaining his business he hopes to improve day by day his life and that of his family .

loans.use: To repair his magazine shop

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Mr. Roque Jacinto O. Valenzuela is 48 years old and is married to Nidia Alvarenga, 42 years old. They live with their three children in San Ignacio, Paraguay. The oldest of their three children is 23 and works as an employee of a private institution and also studies at the University in the evenings. Their daughter of 21 is also in college, and their youngest son, 16, is now in high school. The family lives together in their own home, which Roque was able to buy years ago due to his hard work and sacrifice.

Roque is dedicated to making cornmeal, which is used in making Paraguayan sopa, a very popular dish similar to cornbread with cheese and other ingredients, as well as other typical Paraguayan foods. He also owns a van, which he uses to distribute his products to various cities in southern Paraguay, near San Ignacio. He has been engaged in this business for 11 years and has many clients who rely on him for his services. Roque obtains the corn used to make his cornmeal at a local market, which at this moment to reduce prices and insure a permanent stock has cultivated four hectares of corn. Roque has asked for a loan to buy a portion of this at its newly reduced price.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa Adalia A. Meza, 54 years old, is a married mother of three who lives in San Ignacio, Paraguay. Two of her children are now in high school and the eldest child is now in college. Her husband, Fidel Ramon Meza, owns a construction company. Rosa owns a grocery store, which helps greatly with the family income. Her store is located in an area of San Ignacio where few other stores exist, and for this reason she receives a great deal of customers from the area. This is also an asset for her husband who also works in the area.

Rosa is very thankful for the help and support she has received from the Fundación. She is now asking for a loan to increase the amount of inventory she can buy, and thereby increase the number of clients she can serve. Also, by buying in bulk she will be able to offer better prices and garner more clients.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour.

loans.name: Victricia

texts.en:
Mrs. Victricia I., 62 years old, lives with her five children in the neighborhood of Pablo Sexto in the town of Santa Rosa Misiones, Paraguay. The family is dedicated to growing vegetables, which include onions, radishes, parsley, carrots, cassava and corn. Each of these products is sold by Victricia or one of her children. They sell them in the town center or in other towns around their home. By traveling outside their home city they are able to earn more money and sell at better prices. The money earned from the vegetables will go toward education, a cause that Victricia very much believes in.

She has requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers in greater quantities, which will allow the family to increase their output. The additional crops will also ensure the economic prosperity of the family in years to come.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers in greater quantities

loans.name: Erika Fabiola

texts.es:
In July 1997, Erika Fabiola needed money to finish her studies to be able to offer her unborn child a promising future. She also had to help her unemployed brothers, this is why they joined forces to open an automotive electrical repair shop. With very few tools, and no client base they managed to raise the business through enthusiasm and a lot of faith in themselves.

Her child is currently 10 years old and is achieving excellent report cards at primary school which is a great source of joy for her family.

In her business, Erika would like to offer her clients a guarantee that the repairs are well performed. To this end, she wishes to purchase a tester for starter motors and alternators. Erika feels that this tool would give her clients a better service and would increase their confidence in her repair shop.

Erika is requesting a $1050 loan to be payed back in 6 months to purchase the tester. With your loan, Erika will make her business grow so her son can continue studying and she will be able to keep helping her brothers.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< En Julio de 1997, Erika Fabiola, necesitaba dinero para poder terminar sus estudios, ofrecerle un futuro alentador a su hijo de quien estaba esperando su llegada y ayudar a sus hermanos que no tenían trabajo. Así fue como con unos pocos ahorros que tenía, rentó un tejaban que adecuaron para dar servicio de reparaciones autoelectricas, ya que sus hermanos, quienes también tenían familia, estaban desempleados. Con poca herramienta, sin clientes, pero con fe y entusiasmo lograron despegar su negocio. Su hijo actualmente tiene 10 años y está estudiando la primaria con muy buenas calificaciones, lo que enorgullece a Erika, sin embargo, el negocio necesita de una garantía que ofrecerle a sus clientes para que éstos se vayan más tranquilos.

Por lo tanto Erika está solicitando un crédito de US $ 1,050 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así poder comprar una maquina que le va a ayudar a hacer pruebas de arranques y alternadores, para que ellos puedan otorgarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y éstos salgan con más confianza. Con tu ayuda Erika podrá crecer su negocio y con esto ayuda a sus hermanos y a que su hijo pueda seguir estudiando.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical tester

loans.name: Claudelino

texts.en:
Claudelino B., 54 years old, is married with four children. He is a taxi driver. He bought his own car some years ago and since then has been working privately as a taxi service. He has been engaged in this work for more than 20 years. Claudelino has told us that this type of work requires a lot of sacrifice. In order to obtain a decent wage he has to work at night, particularly in the early morning hours. For this reason, his job can be quite dangerous. In Paraguay, crime on the streets is common and this is something he must confront when he works late at night. However, he is thankful that he is able to earn a decent wage and maintain his family. He feels it is particularly important that children go to school and is thankful that this job has allowed him to do this. Today his children are fully grown and relatively successful. Although, one of his older sons has left the country in search of better work opportunities.

He has asked for a loan to buy spare parts for his taxi. His car requires minor repairs so that he can stay in business. Maintaining his car is important to his livelihood and he has always been very meticulous about caring for it.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Nidia María

texts.es:
Nidia Maria had to start working in order to support the youngest of her three children after she got divorced and the separation caused a lot of problems and time wasted. That meant that she did not have a stable business that provided her enough money, and the help that she gets from her two older sons is not enough since they also have children that they have to support. Nidia started helping a niece who sells clothes in a market in Uman, a town in Yucatan, Mexico, and with time, she was able to be independent and get her own business by buying used clothes and selling them in the market. However, the business does not give her enough earnings in order to support themselves and to reinvest in the business. That is why Nidia is asking for a loan of $300 that she will pay back in a four month period and with that money Nidia will be able to buy merchandise for the winter season and obtain higher earnings. That way she will be able to celebrate Christmas with her son without worrying about debts. With your help, Nidia will be able to support her son so that he is not impacted by the divorce of his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Nidia María se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para poder sacar adelante al menor de sus tres hijos, ya que ella se divorció, y la separación, causó muchos problemas y pérdida de tiempo, lo que hizo que ella no tuviera un negocio estable de dónde sacar dinero y la ayuda económica que le dan sus 2 hijos mayores no le alcanza, puesto que ellos también tienen hijos que apoyar y el dinero no les rinde. Nidia empezó ayudando a una sobrina que vende ropa en el mercado del poblado de Umán, Yucatán, México y con el tiempo, le llegó la oportunidad de obtener su propio puesto e independizarse, así fue como comenzó su negocio, comprando poco a poco ropa usada y vendiéndola en el mercadito. Sin embargo el negocio no da lo suficiente como para mantenerse a ella y su hijo pequeño, y como para resurtir su negocio. Por lo tanto Nidia hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con ese dinero Nidia podrá comprar mercancía para surtir su puesto de ropa para la temporada de invierno y obtener mayores ganancias. Y así poder celebrar junto con su hijo una navidad, sin preocupaciones de deudas. Con tu ayuda Nidia podrá sacar a su hijo adelante, y que no le afecte más de lo que hasta hoy le perjudicó, el divorcio de sus padres.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. Antonio C. is 45 years old, and married with two children. He is the owner of a tire repair shop in Caacupé, Paraguay. In addition to tires, his shop also does minor repairs and sells a variety of tires of various sizes and other hardware for automobiles. His business is located in a busy commercial zone, and because of this he is able to attract many customers. Antonio has been dedicated to his business for 12 years. He is thankful to have a job, which earns him enough money to take care of his family and educate his children.

The loan he has asked for would go towards buying more tires for his shop. He has been presented with the opportunity to acquire a larger quantity of tires at very low prices. However, in order to be able to buy this quantity right now he will need to secure a loan. The added inventory at lower costs will allow him to attract more customers and grow his business. His ultimate goal is to expand his business enough to be able to sell a greater variety of items in his store.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana is a hard working and caring mother. She has a 6 year-old son and as of one year ago has been dedicated to selling yogurt, cakes, and caramels in a small square in her birth town, Pukará. She begins her small business at 9 A.M. every day and works until 5 P.M. Thanks to her friendly nature and the delicious yogurts and cakes that she prepares, she has been able to procure a lot of clients. The funds that her business has generated have permitted her to cover the basic necessities for her home and most importantly to help her husband Roger raise the level of education of their son. Maximiliana asks for a loan of $300, with the objectives of enlarging the area where she sells and increasing the variety of her products in order to better her economic situation. She promises to reimburse the loan within 7 months and anxiously awaits your response to her request.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Maximiliana es una madre muy trabajadora y cariñosa, tiene un niño de 6 años y desde hace un año está dedicada a la venta de yogurt, tortas y caramelos en forma ambulatoria en una plaza de toritos de su pueblo natal Pukará; atiende su pequeño negocio a partir de las 9:00 de la mañana y concluye su labor a las 5:00 de la tarde.Gracias a su amabilidad y a los deliciosos yogures y tortas que prepara ha logrado obtener asiduos clientes y las ganancias que ha generado con su trabajo le ha permitido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y sobre todo apoyar a su esposo Roger a incrementar el nivel educativo de su retoñito.Ella desea obtener un préstamo de 300 dólares, con el objetivo de ampliar su puesto de ventas y aumentar la variedad de sus productos para mejorar su situación económica. Maximiliana promete reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de siete meses y espera ansiosa tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Increase her capital to enlarge her small working area

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela is 55 years old and for the past thirty-four years she and her inseparable husband Nicolás have dedicated themselves to making beautiful pieces of pottery (cooking pots, flower pots) made using mud and clay. Thanks to their agile and creative hands their work has achieved an excellent quality. This work has allowed them to obtain a good income that satisfactorily covers the expenses of their home and schooling for their five children. Now, after many years and despite their advanced age, they want to continue expanding their work and merchandise to be able to export throughout the world. In order to make that happen they have diligently wrapped themselves in this noble labor and at the same time are asking for a loan of $500 dollars, money that they will invest in the purchase of raw materials (clay, wood) for the elaboration of their flower and cooking pots. Furthermore, they promise to repay the loan in the space of seven months. Your generous support will be a wise investment in the hands of this enterprising pair. Give them the opportunity to increase the satisfaction of their large family with their small business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.
