Ángela tiene 55 años de edad y junto a su inseparable esposo Nicolás están dedicados hace treinta y cuatro años a realizar hermosos trabajos de alfarería (ollas, maceteros) fabricados utilizando barro y arcilla, gracias a sus ágiles y creativas manos lograron realizar excelentes trabajos de calidad; permitiéndoles obtener mediante este oficio buenos ingresos económicos, para cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de sus cinco hijos.Ahora, después de muchos años y pese a la avanzada edad de cada uno aún están deseosos de seguir expandiendo sus trabajos y mercadería hasta llegar a exportar al mundo entero; para lograrlo se desenvuelven diligentemente en esta noble labor y al mismo tiempo solicitan un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirán en la compra materia prima (arcilla, leña) para la elaboración de sus maceteros y ollitas, así mismo prometen reembolsarles el préstamo en un lapso de siete meses.“Tu aporte generoso será una inversión sabia en las manos de esta emprendedora pareja, dales la oportunidad de incrementar las satisfacciones de su numerosa familia con su pequeño negocio”

loans.use: Purchase raw material and fuel for finishing clay pots

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia and Percy is a young enterprising couple willing to accomplish many things. Since the beginning of their marriage they decided to make a living making ceramic and clay figurines and pottery. Each object they create is of the highest quality, beautifully finished, and original; that is why their articles are in high demand in many places in Peru. This activity is very rewarding for Patricia and Percy, and has allowed them to support themselves and give their little daughter the best within their reach. She has been the guiding light for them.

The couple wishes to make their business grow, and maybe one day export their products to other places in the world. To keep going with their projects Patricia and Percy need a loan to get more materials. Your help can make possible that this hard-working and enthusiastic couple see their goals accomplished.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia y Percy forman una joven pareja emprendedora que atesora dentro de su corazón muchas ganas de superación; desde que formaron su hogar decidieron dedicarse a la fabricación de objetos cerámicos (floreros, figuras ornamentales, etc.); cada una de las obras que realizan son de excelentes acabados y alta calidad, creativos, novedosos y muy cotizados en los mercados de las diferentes ciudades de su país, esta actividad los llena de satisfacción y les permite sostener con eficacia las demandas de su hogar y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña niña quién desde que los acompaña se ha convertido en la luz de sus sueños. Ambos están deseosos de seguir expandiendo su negocio hasta llegar a exportarlos a diferentes ciudades del planeta y para lograr cada uno de sus objetivos requieren obtener un préstamo de dinero que les será muy beneficioso y útil para el crecimiento de su negocio.“En vuestras manos está la posibilidad de que esta joven pareja cumpla cada uno de sus sueños con el importante ingrediente de su diligencia y entusiasmo”

loans.use: To buy raw materials and step-up production.

loans.name: Phien Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Phien is married and has 2 children, and her husband works as a brick-layer. Her 2 children are going to school, resulting in expenses for books, pens and tuition fees. Income from her husband’s work can only partly  contribute to the family's expenses. Mrs. Phien is a tailor and wishes to have more cloth to design and sell clothes. She will be very happy to get a loan to achieve her dreams and will repay the loan with income from tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase more material to design and tailor clothing

loans.name: Thoi Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Thoi has been in the job of junk dealing for many years. In this work, she travels through the street salvaging junk that she sells to businesses who can reuse the material, e.g. metals and plastics. She has found it more and more difficult to earn enough income from this job. She has decided to diversify her income sources by generating income through buying baby chickens to raise and sell in the market. Fortunately, she has been introduced to the microfinance program of Binhminh cdc where she can obtain a loan to implement her plan.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for raising

loans.name: I Wayan Yudi Cahyana

texts.id:
Yudi Cahyana likes to participate in counseling sessions in his village. From those sessions, he knows how to raise cow so that it grows fast. He found it very interesting and decided to raise Kereman cow (cow which is raised in the barn). For the initial capital, he borrowed money from Dinari. He bought 2 male cows that cost Rp. 2,500,000 (about $276). The rest of the loan was used to built the barn for the cow and to purchase cow food for 4 months. He feeds the cow twice a day, in the morning and in the evening. In the afternoon, he feeds the cows with grass and leaves as supplements. He bought food concentrate from the merchants in his village. The food concentrate cost Rp. 1,500 (about $0.16) per kg. The Kereman cow is given 1 kg food concentrate with sugar cane liquid, salt, and some water. After 4 months passes, the cow with 400 kg of weight can be sold for Rp. 16,500 (about $1.8) per kg. With this business, Yudi Cahyana hopes to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Yudi Cahyana rajin mengikuti penyuluhan-penyuluhan yang diadakan di desanya. Dari situlah Yudi Cahyana tahu bagaimana cara memelihara sapi yang cepat menghasilkan dan mudah memeliharanya. Yudi Cahyana tertarik dan memutuskan untuk pelihara sapi Kereman ( sapi yang dikandangkan ). Untuk modal, Yudi Cahyana meminjam dari Dinari sebagai modal awal untuk mencoba menerapkan ilmu yang diperolehnya. Yudi Cahyana membeli 2 sapi pejantan yang sudah cukup besar dengan harga Rp. 2.500.000,- Sisa modalnya dipergunakan untuk membuat kandang sapi dan untuk modal pakan selama 4 bulan. Setiap hari Yudi Cahyana memberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore. Untuk siang hari diberi hijauan sebagai makanan tambahan. Yudi Cahyana membeli konsentrat di pedagang yang ada didesanya. Per kg harganya Rp.1500,-. Sapi kereman diberi makan 1 kg konsentrat dicampur tetes tebu ( cairan dari pembuatan gula ) dan garam, lalu diisi air secukupnya. Setelah 4 bulan sapi bisa dijual dengan berat sapinya mencapai 400 kg dengan harga per kilo Rp.16.500,-. Dengan usaha beternak sapi yang ditekuninya sekarang, Yudi Cahyana berharap akan semakin meningkat kesejahteraan hidupnya.

loans.use: To purchase cow, cow food, and to build better barn

loans.name: Men Thi

texts.en: Being an industrious, hard-work woman, 25-year-old Mrs. Men always tries her best to earn a living. She and her husband have two school-aged children. Their main job now is to make soya curd to sell in the nearby market, as well as raising cows. However, income from soya curd is not enough for their increasing everyday expenses, so Mrs. Men wants to diversify and use her loan to buy baby chickens to raise and sell. Income from soya curd and chicken sales will be used to make loan repayments.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to raise

loans.name: I Wayan Rampen

texts.id:
Raising and breeding cow is one of Wayan Rampen's daily routines. He has done this business since 2 years ago. He bought 1 cow which cost Rp. 3,300,000 (about $365) and fed it for 4 months. By spending Rp. 9,000 (about $1) per day, he earned Rp. 850,000 (about $94) of profit after he sold the cow. Thank to this business, he can cover his family's expenses, including his children's education fee. His son, Dionisius is a junior high school student and his daughter, Tasia is a first-year elementary school student. The increasing daily needs and expenses have motivated him to expand the business because the business can help his family go through the tough economic situation. With the loan from DINARI, he is more encouraged to work hard so that the business will become better.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Memelihara dan merawat sapi merupakan kegiatan rutin yang dilakukan oleh Wayan Rampen. Usaha beternak sapi ini sudah ditekuninya sejak 2 tahun lalu dengan memelihara 1 ekor penggemukan yang dibelinya dengan haga Rp. 3.300.000,- dan dipeliharanya selama 4 bulan. Dengan mengeluarkan biaya Rp. 9.000,- per hari Wayan Rampen mendapat keuntungan Rp. 850.000,- setelah sapinya dijual. Dari hasil usahanya inilah Wayan Rampen menanggung semua biaya hidup keluarganya, termasuk untuk menyekolahkan dua orang anaknya yaitu Dionisius yang masih SMP dan Tasia yang masih kelas 1 SD. Kebutuhan hidup yang semakin meningkat membuat Wayan Rampen berusaha keras untuk bisa mengembangkan usahanya karena lewat usaha inilah keluarganya bisa bertahan dalam situasi ekonomi yang sulit. Dengan adanya pinjaman dari DINARI Wayan Rampen lebih bersemangat lagi dalam menjalankan usahanya supaya bisa lebih berkembang lagi.

loans.use: To purchase cow and cow food

loans.name: I Made Parma

texts.id:
Living in a humble house with bamboo wall has not discouraged Made Parma and his family at all. Despite this situation, he became more motivated to work for a better life by raising cow. Fortunately, the cow's food materials in his neighborhood are quite abundant. Due to limited capital, he can only raise 1 cow. The cow was bought with price Rp. 3,500,000 (about $387) and in 4 months he could sell it for Rp. 5,000,000 (about $553) so his net profit was Rp. 800,000 (about $88) after subtracting the cow's food expenses. Although the profit was not much, he is very thankful because he can cover his family's daily expenses. His dream to repair his house has encouraged him to save some money from this business. After getting the loan from DINARI, he will work harder in this business because the loans will make his hope to expand the business become reality.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di rumah yang sangat sederhana yang hanya berdinding gedeg tidak membuat Made Parma dan keluarganya patah semangat dalam menjalani kehidupan. Segala kesederhanaan itu justru membuatnya bersemangat dalam bekerja untuk bisa hidup lebih baik lagi yaitu dengan memelihara sapi. Hal ini dilakukannya mengingat situasi lingkungan yang mendukung yaitu dengan tersedianya pakan yang cukup bagi keperluan ternaknya ini. Terbatasnya modal yang dimiliki mengharuskan Made Parma hanya memelihara 1 ekor sapi . Sapi itu dibeli dengan harga Rp. 3.500.000,- dan dalam waktu 4 bulan berhasil dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 5.000.000,- sehingga keuntungan bersih yang diperolehnya Rp. 800.000,- setelah dikurangi biaya pemeliharaan. Walaupun keuntungan yang diperolehnya tidak banyak tapi Made Parma tetap bersyukur karena keluarganya bisa hidup dari hasil usahanya tersebut. Keinginannya untuk memperbaiki rumahnya membuatnya terpacu untuk mulai menyisihkan sedikit hasil usahanya ini sehingga setelah terkumpul banyak nantinya Made Parma bisa memperbaiki rumahnya. Setelah menerima pinjaman modal usaha dari DINARI Made Parma menjadi lebih bersemangat lagi dalam usahanya karena harapannya untuk mengembangkan usahanya bisa terpenuhi lewat pinjaman ini.

loans.use: To purchase baby cow and cow food

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Noli

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Noli and her husband, Nyoman Kicen, work as farmers. Due to the increasing family expenses and their children's high school fees, Ni Nyoman Noli decided to start breeding pigs. She got the initial capital from Dinari. Using the loan, she bought 2 pigs which cost Rp. 250,000 (about $28) per pig so the 2 pigs cost Rp. 500,000 (about $55). The rest of the loan was used to cover the pig's food expenses for 6 months. Her pigpen is very simple with bamboo wall and cement floor. Everyday she cleans the pigpen, and then feeds the pigs with food mixtures such as rice chaff, tofu concentrate and dregs. The food cost her Rp. 1,000,000 (about $110). The revenue from selling the pigs were Rp. 2,000,000 (about $221) so the net income was Rp. 500,000 (about $55). She is very grateful that the earned profit can be used to support her children. She hopes to get more loans from Dinari in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Dalam keseharian Ni Nyoman Noli dan suaminya, Nyoman Kicen, hidup dari hasil bercocok tani. Karena kebutuhan keluarga yang semakin besar dan kedua anaknya sekarang duduk di bangku SMU. Akhirnya Ni Nyoman Noli memiliki usaha sampingan yaitu berternak babi. Modal yang didapatnya diperoleh dari Dinari . Dari modal ini Ni Nyoman Noli membeli 2 ekor babi penggemukan dengan harga satu ekor Rp.250.000,- jadi 2 babi harganya Rp.500.000,-. Sisa dari pembelian bibit dipakai untuk modal pakan selama 6 bulan. Kondisi kandang babi Nyoman Noli sederhana, dinding dari bambu dan lantai semen. Setiap hari Ni Nyoman Noli rajin membersihkan kandangnya, setelah itu baru babinya diberi makan dengan campuran makanannya seperti dedak padi, konsentrat dan ampas tahu. Sampai babi siap dipanen, menghabiskan biaya pakan sebesar Rp.1.000.000,-. Sedangkan pendapatan kotornya Rp.2.000.000,- jadi pendapatan bersihnya Rp.500.000,-. Ni Nyoman Noli bersyukur dengan keuntungan yang diperolehnya ini bisa dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan anaknya. Harapan Ni Nyoman Noli agar pinjaman dari Dinari bisa meningkat.

loans.use: To purchase pig seed and pig's food

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sumarmi

texts.id:
Ketut Sumarmi and her husband Ketut Wiana comes from Manistutu village. She has a 6-year-old son called I Putu Diva who is now studying in kindergarten. She raises and breeds pig. Although she doesn't have a pigpen and can only raise the pig traditionally, she wasn't discouraged at all to start this business. Her pig just gave birth to 10 piglets 2 weeks ago. Every day she takes care of the piglets. The food mixtures that she gave to the pig consist of fine rice chaff, concentrate, and mineral so that the milk quality is good. After 2 months, the piglets can be sold for Rp. 250,000 (about $27) per piglet so she can earn Rp. 2,500,000 (about $276). As the food expense was Rp. 500,000, the net profit was Rp. 1,500,000 (about $166). She hopes to buy 1 more female pig.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Sumarmi dan suaminya Ketut Wiana berasal dari desa Manistutu. Ketut Sumarmi memiliki 1 orang anak yang diberi nama I Putu Diva baru berumur 6 tahun dan sekarang baru bersekolah di TK. Ketut Sumarni saat ini memelihara babi penginduk.Walaupun belum memiliki kandang dan hanya memelihara secara tradisional, tidak membuat Ketut Sumarmi putus asa untuk memelihara induk babi. Saat ini induk babi Ketut Sumarmi memiliki anak 10 ekor baru melahirkan 2 minggu yang lalu. Setiap hari Ketut Sumarmi memperhatikan perkembangan dari semua anak babinya. Adapun campuran makanan yang diberi Ketut Sumarmi seperti dedak padi yang halus, konsentrat dan mineral susu supaya air susu induknya bagus. Umur 2 bulan 10 ekor anak babi ini akan siap dijual dengan harga 1 ekornya Rp.250.000,- jadi uang yang didapat nanti Rp.2.500.000,-. Sedangkan pengeluaran pakan sampai dijual menghabiskan biaya Rp. 500.000,-. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat Ketut Sumarmi setiap panen sebesar Rp.1.500.000,-. Harapan Ketut Sumarmi supaya bisa membeli 1 ekor lagi induk babi.

loans.use: To purchase female pig and pig food

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 40 years old. He has 3 children: two of them are in school, and the other one is going to the university. He lives in a rented house, and his sick mother lives with him. He has a small spare parts shop for cars. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase more spare parts for his shop, paint the shop, make new shelves, and do some advertising. He wants to increase his income and develop himself.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Planificados Group

texts.pt:
Neli and Nineta are members of the Planificados group. They joined the program this year. They each sell food products at their own homes. Neither Neli nor Nineta are officially married. But each one lives with a man. Nineta has 3 children and Neli has 5. All the children are studying. Neli's husband as well as Nineta's husband are unemployed. They live on small resources to be able to support their respective families. And that's why the two of them joined the credit program to support the home expenses and pay for their children's schooling.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Neli e Nineta sao membros do grupo Planificados. Elas entraram para o programa ainda este ano.Elas vendem produtos alimenticios cada uma na sua residencia.Tanto a Neli assim como a Nineta nao sao casadas oficialmente. Mas cada uma vive com um homem. Nineta tem 3 filhos e a Neli tem 5 filhos. Todas as criancas estao a estudar.Tanto o marido da Neli assim como o da Nineta nao estao empregados. Vivem de pequenos expedientes para poderem sustentar as respectivas familias. E por isso que as duas entraram para o programa de credirto para apoiarem nas despesas da casa e pagar a escola dos filhos.

loans.use: Neli and Nineta want to use the money to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Thai Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Thai, who lives in Nghiem Xa Hamlet, Bac Ninh, Vietnam, is a very hard-working person. She started her business of selling fabric and soon discovered that selling clothes as well would integrate well with her fabric business, and she could earn more money. However, she still faces financial difficulties covering expenses for her four school-aged children. Her business is the main source of income for her family. She now wants to obtain a loan to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nghia Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nghia is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a brick layer, and he also can contribute to the income of the family. Mrs. Nghia’s main focus is on making rice cakes to sell. Her house is in a market area, so she can sell her goods in the front of her house. In addition, she also raises chickens and ducks for eggs and meat to sell. She wants to obtain a loan to support her business by buying more kitchenware to use for her rice cake production as well as purchasing more chickens to raise.

loans.use: Purchase kitchenware as well as chickens for raising

loans.name: Trien Van

texts.en: Mr. Trien is 30 years old, married, and has 4 children. His wife grows vegetables and raises chickens for the family’s consumption. His family’s main source of income is from his brick transporting business. Every day, he goes to brick sellers near his house who hire his services to transport bricks to their customers. In addition, he also sells small amounts of brick around his neighborhood. He wishes to expand further into selling bricks and requires a loan to purchase more brick stocks to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing stock to sell

loans.name: Hue Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Hue is 36 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Her husband also runs a fish pond, and every three or four months they can gather the fish to sell. However, to generate more regular income to cover their expenses, Mrs Hue raises ducks for eggs and then sells them in the market. She intends to use the loan to purchase additional feed for the ducks.

loans.use: Purchase feed for ducks

loans.name: Lucilo

texts.en:
Mr. Lucilo Caceres is 61 years old and married with two children. He lives with his wife Elodia Araujo in Itacuribí, Paraguay. Together they run two separate businesses. One of their businesses is a shop that makes and sells ice cream and the other is a laundry business.

Lucilo has had these businesses for the past 15 years. From past experience, Lucilo and his wife have much more work in the summer than during other times of the year. Due to the sweltering temperatures in Paraguay, ice cream is in high demand. During the summer months, which Paraguay is now entering, Lucilo must produce a much larger quantity of ice cream to meet consumer demands. The laundry also requires work but less so than the ice cream parlor. The laundry is almost automated, as Lucilo and Elodia own four washing machines and two driers.

The loan they have requested will go toward building another small salon in which they can make more ice cream. In this way they will be able to better serve their clients at the ice cream parlor. With the laundry they have already established fixed weekly customers and are less concerned about growth in this respect. With the money they earn from both endeavors they are able to maintain their family and put their two children through college.

loans.use: To build an ice cream salon

loans.name: Suminah

texts.id:
Presently, Suminah sells at the market daily. Her stall is approximately 1.5 meter square, paying a rent of Rp 1.000.000,00 (about USD110) for 2 years. The capital is needed to fund the daily turnover between Rp 500.000,00 to Rp 1.000.000,00 (USD55 to USD110) generating a profit of Rp 50.000,00 (about USD5.50). The loan amounting Rp 5.000.000,00 (about USD550) she received will be used business funding and payment of rent of the stall in the market. With this additional funding, she hopes to generate a daily profit of Rp 65.000,00 (USD7). She work on this business herself while her husband lives in Java. He is a farmer. Selling spices and preserved salt fish diligently over the prior 12 months had supported the family.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Suminah saat ini berjualan di pasar Sempidi. Setiap hari dia berjualan di pasar. Tempat usahanya berukuran 1.5 m2 dengan biaya sewa Rp 1.000.000,00/ 2 tahunnya. Modal yang dia butuhkan setiap hari berkisar antara Rp 500.000,00 – Rp 1.000.000,00 dengan keuntungan Rp 50.000,00. Pinjaman sejumlah Rp 5.000.000,00 yang dia peroleh akan digunakan sebagai modal usaha dan untuk membayar sewa tempat di pasar. Dengan tambahan modal in dia berharap mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 65.000,00/harinya. Usaha ini dia kerjakan sendiri, sementara suaminya tinggal di Jawa. Dia bekerja sebagai petani. Usaha jual bumbu dan ikan asin yang sudah ditekuni sejak 12 tahun yang lalu mampu membiayai hidupnya dan anak – anaknya.

loans.use: As funding for business and stall rent (Sebagai modal usaha dan untuk membayar sewa tempat di pasar)

loans.name: Cabe Kebonsari Group

texts.id:
This group of farmers lives in Bluangan, Perean Kangin village, Baturiti, Tabanan. This group led by I Wayan S. comprises I Gede Made Sukardi, I Nyoman Subawa, I Ketut Sucita dan I Made Juniarta. As cabbage farmers, they require at least 3 months, from preparing the land for planting cabbage seeds to harvesting. They prepare the land through mutual cooperation. Before the field is ready for preparation, they are aerated. This will make the field easier for the process. When the fields and seed are ready they are planted. Thereafter commences the care. They need fertilizer for nutrition and pesticide for the insects. The amount of water also needs to be controlled, not too much or too little. These activities are carried out till almost harvest. Their effort will generate a profit of Rp 3.000.000,00 (about USD330) per person. This amount is attained from 3 months of farming. Apart from cabbage, they also grow padi and tomato. Their loan will be used to purchase seeds, manure, and pay for care and working expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok tani ini terletak di Br. Bluangan, Desa Perean Kangin, Baturiti, Tabanan. Kelompok tani yang diketuai oleh I Wayan S. ini beranggotakan : I Gede Made Sukardi, I Nyoman Subawa, I Ketut Sucita dan I Made Juniarta. Sebagai petani cabe mereka membutuhkan waktu kurang lebih 3 bulan, mulai dari persiapan lahan untuk ditanami bibit cabe sampai dengan saat panen. Mereka mempersiapkan lahan dengan cara bergotong royong. Sebelum lahan siap untuk diolah, perlu diairi dengan cukup. Hal ini akan membuat lahan menjadi gembur-mudah untuk diolah. Setelah lahan dan bibit cabe siap, maka dilakukan penanaman. Pada masa-masa berikutnya merupakan masa perawatan. Mereka perlu memberikan pupuk-untuk nutrisi-dan atau pestisida –untuk membasmi serangga. Jumlah air juga perlu dikontrol. Jumlah air tidak boleh terlalu banyak atau terlalu sedikit. Aktivitas ini mereka lakukan sampai menjelang masa panen. Usaha yang mereka lakukan tersebut memberikan keuntungan sebesar Rp 3.000.000,00/orang. Nilai ini mereka peroleh setelah 3 bulan penantian. Selain cabe mereka juga menanam padi dan tomat. Pergantian tanaman ini mereka lakukan sesuai dengan kesepakatan bersama. Pinjaman yang mereka peroleh akan mereka pakai untuk membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja

loans.use: For purchasing seeds, manure, and payment of care expenses (untuk membeli bibit, pupuk, biaya perawatan)

loans.name: Tomat Kebonsari Group

texts.id:
This group with members I Wayan Mudiana, I Wayan Moder, I Nyoman Lisig, I Nyoman Sueda dan I Nyoman Cindra is tomato farmers. To meet each family’s needs, they use the fields they own to grow tomato, which can be harvest in 3 months. Although the tomato price is unstable, they believe that their efforts will yield satisfying crop. All 5 members in this tomato group are hopeful the funding will help in their farming effort, thus they are grateful that this aid will support the purchase of all essential like seeds, manure, and payment of care expenses for the growing period.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok yang beranggotakan I Wayan Mudiana, I Wayan Moder, I Nyoman Lisig, I Nyoman Sueda dan I Nyoman Cindra adalah sebagai petani tomat. Untuk mencukupi setiap kebutuhan keluarga mereka masing-masing lahan yang mereka punyai ditanami tomat yang masa panennya hanya tiga bulan. Meskipun harga tomat tidak stabil tetapi mereka selalu percaya bahwa segala sesuatu apabila dilakukan dengan sungguh-sungguh maka akan mendatangkan hasil yang memuaskan. Kelima anggota dalam kelompok tomat ini sangat mengharapkan bantuan permodalan untuk menunjang akan usaha pertanian mereka, untuk itu mereka sangat bersukacita atas bantuan yang diberikan untuk membeli segala keperluan seperti bibit, pupuk, dan biaya perawatan selama proses penanaman berlangsung.

loans.use: Purchase all essentials like seeds, manure and pay for care expenses (Membeli segala keperluan seperti bibit, pupuk, dan biaya perawatan)

loans.name: Timun Kebonsari Group

texts.id:
The cucumber farmers led by I Wayan Wisnawa consists of 5 members: I Made Muliawan, I Wayan Sudartana, I Ketut Mundra dan I Nyoman Bading. As cucumber farmers, they need about a month, from preparing the land for planting cucumber seeds till harvesting. Before the field is ready is the preparation process to ready the land for planting. Thereafter commences the care prior to harvesting. Their efforts generate profit of Rp 3.500.000,00 (about USD385) per person. This amount they earned after 3 months of farming. Besides cucumber, they also grow hot peppers. They agree upon which substitute crop to grow through mutual consensus. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, manure, pay care and working expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Para Petani Timun yang diketuai oleh I Wayan Wisnawa ini beranggotakan lima orang yaitu: I Made Muliawan, I Wayan Sudartana, I Ketut Mundra dan I Nyoman Bading. Sebagai petani timun mereka membutuhkan waktu kurang lebih 1 bulan, mulai dari persiapan lahan untuk ditanami bibit timun sampai dengan saat panen. Sebelum lahan siap untuk diolah ada proses persiapan untuk menjadikan tanah tersebut siap untuk ditanami. Pada masa-masa berikutnya merupakan masa perawatan yang berikutnya masa panen tiba setelah melewati sekian masa untuk siap dipanen. Usaha yang mereka lakukan tersebut memberikan keuntungan sebesar Rp 3.500.000,00/orang. Nilai ini mereka peroleh setelah 3 bulan penantian. Selain timun mereka juga menanam cabai. Pergantian tanaman ini mereka lakukan sesuai dengan kesepakatan bersama. Pinjaman yang mereka peroleh akan mereka pakai untuk membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, manure, and pay for care and working expenses (Membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja)

loans.name: Kacang Kebonsari Group

texts.id:
This group of peanut farmers led by I Made Suta has the following members: I Wayan Sukarman, I Nyoman Ariana, I Wayan Itep dan I Made Budiasa. To grow peanut the time required is 3 months and does not require as much water as rice. When the land and peanut seedlings are ready they are planted. Thereafter commences the care. They need fertilizer for nutrition and pesticide for the insects. This need not be performed as frequently as growing padi. The amount of water also needs to be controlled, not too much or too little. These activities are carried out till almost harvest. Their effort will generate a profit of Rp 4.000.000,00 (about USD440) per person. This amount is attained from 3 months of farming. Their loan will be used to purchase peanut seedlings, manure, care and working expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok Petani Kacang yang diketuai oleh I Made Suta ini beranggotakan : I Wayan Sukarman, I Nyoman Ariana, I Wayan Itep dan I Made Budiasa. Untuk bercocok tanam kacang mereka membutuhkan waktu kurang lebih 3 bulan. Kacang tidak membutuhkan air sebanyak tanaman padi. Setelah lahan dan bibit kacang siap, maka dilakukan penanaman. Pada masa-masa berikutnya merupakan masa perawatan. Mereka perlu memberikan pupuk-untuk nutrisi-dan atau pestisida –untuk membasmi serangga. Hal ini dilakukan tidak dilakukan sesering seperti yang harus dilakukan pada tanaman padi. Jumlah air juga perlu dikontrol. Jumlah air tidak boleh terlalu banyak atau terlalu sedikit. Aktivitas ini mereka lakukan sampai menjelang masa panen. Usaha yang mereka lakukan tersebut memberikan keuntungan sebesar Rp 4.000.000,00/orang. Nilai ini mereka peroleh setelah 3 bulan penantian. Pinjaman yang mereka peroleh akan mereka pakai untuk membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja.

loans.use: Purchase peanut seedlings, manure, care and working expenses (Membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja)

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fotunata is 48 years old and is the loving mother of three children. Since she began her family alongside Félix, she has dedicated herself to raising livestock, work that she continues to this day with much love and patience. As a result of her self-sacrificing work and the care that she brings to each one of her young cows, she has been able to increase the quantity of her calves so that now she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, which apart from everything fill her with pride and much satisfaction. Her next desire is to move into the business of buying and selling cheese, milk, and beef. This business would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and to enable her to pay the university costs of her beloved children. In order to meet her goals Fortunata is relying on your generous heart and asks for a loan in order to begin this new occupation without delay. Fortunata awaits your response in order to finalize her plans and to make her dreams of seeing her dear children become professionals a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Fortunata tiene 48 años y es una amorosa madre de tres hijos; desde que formó su familia junto a Félix, se dedicó a la labor ganadera, trabajo que desempeña hasta el día de hoy con mucho amor y paciencia; como recompensa a su abnegado trabajo y al cuidado que les brinda a cada una de sus generosas vaquitas ha logrado acrecentar la cantidad de sus terneritos con el que ahora puede brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir sus estudios universitarios que mención aparte la llenan de orgullo y mucha satisfacción.Su próximo deseo es incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de queso, leche y carne; negocio que le generará ingresos económicos adicionales para el sustento de su hogar y con el que terminará de cubrir los gastos de estudios superiores de sus queridos hijos.Para concretar sus objetivos la señora Fortunata recurre a tu generoso corazón y solicita un préstamo para iniciar sin demora esta nueva ocupación. “Fortunata espera por tu pronta respuesta para concretar sus planes y hacer realidad los sueños de ver profesionales a sus queridos hijos”

loans.use: Capital investment in order to begin a new business with the help of her dear calves.

loans.name: Padi Kebonsari Group

texts.id:
This group of farmers lives in Bluangan, Perean Kangin village, Baturiti, Tabanan. This group led by I Wayan Purna comprises I Nyoman Joni, I Gede Suandi, I Ketut Sudiarta dan I Wayan Keret. As padi (rice) farmers, they require at least 6 months, from preparing the land for planting the padi seeds till harvest. They prepare the land through mutual cooperation. These activities are performed until almost harvesting. Their efforts generated profit of Rp 3.000.000,00 (about USD330) per person. This amount is earned after 6 months of farming. Apart from rice, they also grow hot peppers and peanuts. This subsidy crop is carried out by mutual consensus. Each family’s daily expense of Rp 30.000,00 (USD3) will be less if they already have their own rice. This loan will be used to purchase padi seeds, manure, care and working expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok tani ini terletak di Br. Bluangan, Desa Perean Kangin, Baturiti, Tabanan. Kelompok yang diketuai oleh I Wayan Purna ini beranggotakan : I Nyoman Joni, I Gede Suandi, I Ketut Sudiarta dan I Wayan Keret. Sebagai petani padi mereka membutuhkan waktu kurang lebih 6 bulan, mulai dari persiapan lahan untuk ditanami bibit padi sampai dengan saat panen. Mereka mempersiapkan lahan dengan cara bergotong royong. Aktivitas ini mereka lakukan sampai menjelang masa panen. Usaha yang mereka lakukan tersebut memberikan keuntungan sebesar Rp 3.000.000,00/orang. Nilai ini mereka peroleh setelah 6 bulan penantian. Selain padi mereka juga menanam cabai dan kacang. Pergantian tanaman ini mereka lakukan sesuai dengan kesepakatan bersama. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 30.000,00/keluarga akan lebih ringan, jika mereka memiliki persediaan beras sendiri. Pinjaman yang mereka peroleh akan mereka pakai untuk membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja.

loans.use: Purchase rice seeds, manure, care and working expenses (Membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja)

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
I am concerned about the security of my children. For this reason I would like to build a wall in front of my home so that they can be safe under the care of my wife. We live on a street where there is very little light so it is likely that when cars pass, the drivers do not see my kids playing, as they are very small. I therefore am requesting a loan of $600 to build a barrier on my property.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Me preocupa la seguridad de mis hijos por eso me gustaría poner una barda en mi vivienda para que puedan estar seguros al cuidado de mi esposa, tenemos poca luz en la calle así es que si pasan los carros es probable que no vean a los niños que juegan debido a que son muy pequeños”.Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para construir una barda en mi vivienda.

loans.use: To construct a barrier

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Thirty years ago, Segundina decided to start a family with Zacarías, her life-long partner. The fruit of that union and their enormous love for each other is their only son, Luis, to whom they try to bring the best education so that he can conduct himself as a fine man of means in the future. Both have always worked diligently selling meat, leather, and sheep’s wool at markets in the cities of Arequipa and Cuzco to displaced people with the goal of getting better prices and increased sales. With their earnings, they have been able to improve the economic stability for their young son and the quality of life for her 77-year-old mother that they lovingly care for. Segundina’s wish is to further increase sales of their products, but to do this they need a loan to invest in their long-standing business. She is committed to repaying the loan within seven months.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Segundina hace más de treinta años decidió formar una familia con Zacarías su compañero de toda su vida, fruto de su unión y el inmenso amor que se profesan nació su único hijo, Luis, a quién cuidan y tratan de brindarle la mejor educación y ejemplo para que en un futuro se conduzca por la sociedad como un hombre de bien.Desde siempre ambos han trabajado diligentemente en la comercialización de carne roja, cuero y lana de ovino, ofreciéndolos en los mercados de las ciudades de Arequipa y Cuzco a los que se desplazan mes a mes con el objetivo de obtener mejores precios y mayores ventas; con las ganancias que obtienen han ido incrementando la solvencia económica de su hijo menor y a la calidad de vida de su anciana madre María de 77 años, a quién cuidan con mucho amor y dedicación.El deseo de Segundina es acrecentar aún más la comercialización de sus productos y para esto requiere un préstamo, que tiene pensado invertir completamente en el negocio de toda su vida; comprometiéndose en rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de siete meses.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Twenty-two years ago, Irene started a family with Juan who works as a miner far away from his home village of Pukará. The fruit of their immense love are four adorable children; with the birth of each, household expenses have increased. Like any mother concerned for the well being of her children, Irene decided to address this problem and avidly dedicated herself to selling pottery, a noble work that, with the help of her children, brings them great rewards. After many years of dedication, she and her family have become one of the most highly sought-after small businesses, and their demands have grown thanks to the interest and devotion they give to each of their orders. To keep up with the high level of demand, they are requesting a monetary loan that they will invest in raw materials such as firewood and clay in order to fulfill their orders. They promise to repay the loan in seven months. Let’s make this outstanding family’s request possible so they can keep growing and keep selling their fine arts.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Irene hace más de 22 años formó su familia junto a Juan quién se desempeña como obrero en una mina muy lejana de su pueblo natal, Pukará, fruto del inmenso amor que se profesaban nacieron cuatro adorables hijos; conforme han ido pasando los años los gastos en su hogar se han ido incrementando y desde que observó este fenómeno en casa y como toda madre preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijos, Irene decidió apalear este hecho dedicándose arduamente a la alfarería, oficio noble y bizarro que actualmente con ayuda de sus hijos le está trayendo muchas satisfacciones.Ahora después de muchos años de dedicación ella y su familia se han convertido en una de las microempresas más solicitadas y con mayor cantidad de pedidos en ese tipo de trabajo, esto ha sido posible gracias al interés y dedicación que ponen cada uno en la producción de sus bellos trabajos.Para cumplir con la gran cantidad de pedidos solicitan un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de materia prima (arcilla, leña) para la elaboración de sus trabajos y promete reembolsarlos en un lapso de siete meses.“Hagamos posible la solicitud de esta ejemplar familia para que continúen creciendo y sacando a flote su bello arte”

loans.use: Purchase of raw material and firewood for their final product

loans.name: Fidencia

texts.es:
Several families live together in our house, and between all of us we share one outhouse. The hygienic conditions of the bathroom are not very appropriate, so I would like to install a new bathroom for my family and thereby avoid infections. I am asking for $600 dollars in order to build a new bathroom for my house.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Vivimos varias familias y entre todas tenemos que compartir un baño de pozo, pero las condiciones higiénicas del baño no son muy apropiadas así es que me gustaría instalar un baño nuevo solo para mi familia y así evitar infecciones. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para la construcción de un baño nuevo para mi vivienda..

loans.use: Bathroom Construction

loans.name: Janeth Mercedes

texts.es:
Twenty-seven year old Mercedes is the youngest daughter of Felícitas, who is 67. Her father died when Mercedes was very young, and ever since then, her adorable mother guided her through the paths of life alone, without help. Due to the economic scarcity that plagues her family – as Mercedes is the youngest of six children – she began work immediately after finishing her secondary studies. She never had the chance to pursue a professional career because hunger was always stronger and more urgent than her dreams. Mercedes has since started her own family with Willy, her husband and dearest companion, and the fruit of their union is their little daughter Nayely, for whom they work tirelessly selling groceries wholesale to a large shop in the city and also in various village districts. This young and enthusiastic couple’s dream is to buy their own truck so that they can move their goods more often to outlying villages. With this goal in mind, they have saved some money, but still lack a certain amount, so they are turning to us in search of your unselfish support. Mercedes hopes to count on your generous support to make her plans reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes tiene 27 años de edad y es la hija menor de Felícitas de 67 años, su padre falleció cuando Mercedes era muy pequeña y desde entonces su adorable madre la condujo por el sendero de la vida sola y sin ninguna ayuda, por la falta de recursos económicos que atravesaba su numerosa familia, porque ella es la más pequeña de seis hermanos, trabajó inmediatamente luego de concluir sus estudios secundarios y no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir una carrera profesional porque el hambre era más apremiante y más fuerte que sus deseos.Actualmente ella ya ha formado su propia familia junto a Willy su esposo y querido compañero, y fruto de su unión tienen a la pequeña Nayely por quién se esfuerzan y trabajan arduamente en la venta de abarrotes al por mayor en un espacioso establecimiento de su ciudad y también en los distintos distritos aledaños.El deseo de esta joven y entusiasta pareja es comprar su propia movilidad ( Camioneta) para trasladar sus artículos con mayor frecuencia a los pueblitos limítrofes, para este objetivo ya tienen ahorrado un dinerito pero aún les falta cierta cantidad, por eso es que recurren a nosotros en busca de vuestro apoyo desinteresado.“ Mercedes espera contar con tu ayuda generosa para concretar sus planes”

loans.use: Acquisition of a truck to move their goods to points of sale more easily

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Ever since she started her family, Doña Leonor was always focused on her home and the well-being of her four adolescent children. With the immense desire that all mothers have to improve their household’s quality of life, she began working in a small grocery store that she set up in the vicinity of her home. But due to constant conflicts with her husband, she had to close it and focus exclusively on caring for the children at home. Now after much effort and sacrifice, she has been able to save a little money to invest in building a mobile stand for grocery sales. This enterprising mother’s dream is to own a secure sales booth in the Las Mercedes plaza in the city of Juliaca and increase the amount of merchandise so that her earnings can send her four children to college. To make her plans a reality she is requesting a $400 loan that she will invest in acquiring more products to augment the stock for her shop. She is committed to repaying the loan in no more than seven months. Your important help will make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Leonor desD. que formó su familia siempre fue muy hogareña y preocupada por el bienestar D. sus cuatro hijos adolescentes y con el inmenso deseo que toda madre posee por incrementar el nivel D. vida D. los miembros D. su hogar inició su responsable labor trabajando en una pequeña bodeguita que instaló en las inmediaciones D. su hogar; pero por conflictos muy constantes con su esposo tuvo que cerrarla y sólo hacerse cargo D. la atención a sus hijos en casa; ahora después D. mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido ahorrar un mediano capital para invertirlo en la constitución D. un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en forma ambulatoria.El deseo D. esta emprendedora madre es poseer un puesto seguro D. venta en la plaza Las Mercedes D. la ciudad D. Juliaca y aumentar la cantidad D. su mercadería para que con las ganancias que obtenga pueda ofrecerles estudios universitarios a sus cuatro hijos.Para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo D. 400 dólares dinero que invertirá en adquirir más productos para aumentar el stock D. su mercadería, comprometiéndose a retornar el préstamo en un lapso no mayor a siete meses.“Vuestra importante ayuda posibilitará la cristalización D. estos anhelos”

loans.use: Increase of sales and products to acquire a small sales stand in the main plaza of the city.

loans.name: Agustín

texts.en:
Agustin A. is a 31 year old single father with one daughter living in San Lorenzo, Paraguay. He owns a small shop in the local market where he sells a variety of clothing, including shirts, shorts, socks, soccer jerseys and underwear. He began this business eight years ago.

Before opening this shop Agustin worked at a service station. He was unhappy with the position and decided to go into business for himself. His business has been doing well. With the money he earns he has been able to care for his 3-year-old daughter and pay for someone to look after her during the day.

His current loan will go towards purchasing new merchandise; however, he hopes to save enough to eventually buy his own bus. His plan is to obtain a regular bus route and, along with a partner, run the bus and the shop concurrently. In this way, Agustin would be able to further improve his own life as well as that of his daughter.

loans.use: Buy more clothing for his store

loans.name: Cirila Bitte

texts.es:
Ever since she was little, Doña Cirila has been hard-working, optimistic, and above all, creative. Her husband left her without any kind of support when their children were very little, but thanks to the drive and dedication she has put into every job, she has been able to meet the family’s expenses so that they can get ahead. For many years, she has dedicated herself to making decorations and other items for campaigns or seasonal celebrations. As the Christmas season is approaching, the most-demanded work will be paper crowns made for saint's day festivals, widely celebrated in her country, where diverse customs are celebrated. Cirila’s wish is to increase the quantity of her production, and for this she needs raw materials. That is why she is seeking this loan of $200 that she will invest in her small business that is so busy during these months. She promises to repay the loan in no more than seven months. Let’s help this enterprising mother bring the possibility of higher education to her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Cirila, desde pequeña siempre se caracterizó por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, optimista, y sobretodo creativa; su esposo la dejó cuando sus hijos aún eran muy pequeños sin amparo alguno, gracias al empeño y dedicación que pone y ha puesto en cada uno de sus trabajos manuales ha podido solventar sola los gastos que genera su familia con el único propósito de sacarlos adelante.Ella se dedicó por muchos años a la realización de adornos y demás artículos únicamente por campañas y/o temporadas y como las fiestas navideñas se aproximan los trabajos que mayor demanda tienen son las coronas de papel que realizan por motivos de todos los santos, fecha muy recordada donde practican diversas costumbres en su país. El deseo de Cirila es aumentar la cantidad de su producción y para esto requiere adquirir materia prima, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que podrá invertir en su pequeño negocio que por estos meses tiene mucha acogida y promete reembolsarles el préstamo en un lapso no mayor de los siete meses.“Ayudemos a esta madre emprendedora a brindarles la posibilidad de seguir estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos”

loans.use: Purchase of base materials to decorate a wider variety of handicrafts.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina has been married to Antonio for 27 years, and they have two children. Thanks to the values and the good examples instilled in them, they have become exemplary people that are their parents’ pride and joy. Ever since she started her family and up until just a little while ago, she dedicated herself to selling delicious cheeses that her highly valued in her city markets. Now, having saved enough money with this job, she decided to rent a space and open a poultry restaurant with the support of her loving husband and wonderful children. To finish opening her poultry business, she needs a loan that she will invest in buying tables and chairs. She promises to repay the loan in no more than her seven months. Guillermina and her lovely family await your selfless support to meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina está casada desde hace 27 años con Antonio y tienen dos hijos quienes gracias al buen ejemplo y valores que inculcaron en ellos ahora se han convertido en personas ejemplares que los llenan de satisfacción y mucho orgullo.Ella desde que formó su familia y hasta hace poco siempre se dedicó a la comercialización de quesos muy sabrosos y bien cotizados en los mercados de su ciudad; ahora después de haber ahorrado lo suficiente con este trabajo decidió alquilar un local y abrir una pollería; con apoyo de su fiel esposo y sus ejemplares hijos y para terminar de implementar su pollería solicita un préstamo que invertirá para adquirir mesas y sillas con el compromiso de reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso no mayor de los siete meses.“Guillermina y su encantadora familia esperan tu apoyo desinteresado para cumplir con sus objetivos”.

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs to open a new restaurant.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a young entrepeneur with high hopes of achieving his goals. After finishing his secondary studies he moved out of his home and relocated in his countries´ capital, Lima. There he learned the artisan craft of sweater weaving and after a lot of hard work he saved enough money to purchase weaving machinery to start his own workshop.

Juan returned to his beautiful hometown to open the workshop and hire five collaborators. The workshop has a reputation for producing high quality sweaters and his professional staff has an important client base with many pending orders. He wishes to expand the workshop to improve the working conditions of his team and to be able to employ more collaborators thereby helping his community to reduce unemployment.

Through your generous loan, you can help Juan make an investment in raw materials to allow him to increase the production of sweaters. Once he increases production he will be able to save enough money to purchase an industrial weaving machine.

Let´s help this young entrepeneur turn his wishes into a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Juan es un joven emprendedor con muchos deseos de superación en mente, apenas concluyó sus estudios secundarios se independizó y fue en busca de mejores oportunidades a la capital de su país, Lima, ciudad donde aprendió la bella labor artesana del tejido de chompas con el paso del tiempo y mucho esfuerzo ahorró y compró sus máquinas de tejer con el propósito de implementar su pequeño taller; entonces decidió retornar a su bella ciudad para emprender su pequeño viaje comercial, esta faena la desempeña junto a sus cinco trabajadores con sumo profesionalismo y acabados de excelente calidad, gracias a eso sus artículos son muy cotizados y valorados por sus clientes y mes a mes tiene gran cantidad de pedidos.El deseo de Juan es ampliar e implementar aún más su taller para brindarles un mejor espacio de trabajo a sus socios y emplear a más jóvenes con el propósito de colaborar a reducir la tasa de desocupación en su país. El dinero que puedan brindarle a través de su generoso aporte lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la producción de más chompas con el fin de ahorrar lo suficiente y lograr adquirir su tan deseada máquina de tejer industrial.“Hagamos que este joven emprendedor cristalice sus deseos”

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to increase production.

loans.name: Gladis Basilia

texts.es:
Gladis is from a a large and humble family. At the age of 16 she had to become independent and work hard because she was obligated to by poverty. Now that she is married and has a 10 month-old baby, she has decided to open a grocery store, as she must give the baby much care and attention. Gladis found an excellent way to increase her economic income by locating her small, growing business in the home of her mother in law. At this time, with the rising amount of requests from her clients, Gladis wants to augment the variety of her products in order to continue satisfying the needs of the people. Her purpose is to increase her economic benefits and the quality of life for her family. For these reasons she is requesting a loan of 200 dollars, money that she will use to increase her capital and her stock of products. Gladis thanks you all for the support you are giving her - soon enough she will realize her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Gladis proviene de una amplia y humilde familia, a la edad de 16 años tuvo que independizarse y trabajar arduamente porque la necesidad la obligaba.Ahora ya casada y con una bebé de 10 meses, decidió abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes debido a que tiene que brindarle muchos cuidados y atenciones a su pequeño y encontró una excelente alternativa de incrementar sus ingresos económicos ubicando en el domicilio de su suegra este pequeño negocio que poco a poco está implementando.En este momento y con el incremento de solicitudes y pedidos Gladis desea aumentar la variedad de sus productos para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus exigentes clientes con el propósito de acrecentar sus beneficios económicos y nivel de vida familiar, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que utilizará para ampliar su capital y el stock de sus productos.“Gracias al apoyo que puedes darle, en poco tiempo podrá concretar sus planes”

loans.use: To raise her capital in order to aquire more products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia is a very self-sacrificing and hard-working mother. 21 years ago she began her own family with Mario and now they have three school-age children under their protection. Her husband Mario is a miner in a mine very far from their home town, Juliaca. Meanwhile, Virginia is dedicated to taking care of their children and manning a small grocery store that offers a variety of items for basic needs. In her free time she also makes handicrafts, putting together beautiful traditional knitted sweaters. She is known for this work in the surrounding community. Her most important desire is to provide her children with a college education in the hope that they will be able to work in areas that they love and have a vocation. For this reason she hopes to grow and expand the variety of her merchandise and she is asking for a loan of $200, money that will permit her to increase her stock of products. Virginia is certain that with this injection of capital her business earnings will increase substantially. Your collaboration is very important in order for her plans to be realized.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia es una madre muy abnegada y trabajadora, desde hace 21 años formó su familia con Mario y ahora fruto de esa unión tiene bajo su protección a tres pequeños en edad escolar.Su esposo Mario se desempeña como obrero en una mina muy lejana de su ciudad natal, Juliaca y mientras tanto ella se dedica en brindarles cuidado a sus pequeños y a atender su bodeguita de abarrotes donde ofrece todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad; en sus ratos libres también se dedica a la artesanía, confeccionando hermosas chompas puesto que también es conocida por esa labor en las inmediaciones de su comunidad.Su deseo más importante es ofrecerle estudios superiores a sus hijos en un futuro con el objetivo de que puedan desempeñarse en las actividades para las cuales tenga mucha afición o cierta vocación, para esto anhela aumentar y ampliar la variedad de su mercadería y solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que le permitirá aumentar el stock de sus productos.Virginia está segura de que con esta inyección de capital a su negocio podrá aumentar sustancialmente su margen de ganancias.“Tu colaboración es muy importante para concretar sus planes”.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to expand stock of merchandise

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
Julián is a native of Pukará- Juliaca and is a very hard-working and responsible father. Since he married his wife Mari he has dedicated himself to breeding livestock and to ceramics, work that he carries out with great professionalism and dedication. Thanks to the income that he has obtained through his work he has been able to meet family economic expenses and provide schooling for his eight young children with satisfaction. Currently, the work that is producing the best economic return is that of artisan. Along with his wife and children, Julián makes beautiful pots of different sizes and models out of clay, in order to then sell them in the markets of various towns in his country. Julián and his wonderful family hope to increase their income and quality of life through this work. In order to begin that journey, Julián already purchased a dump truck for clay, a raw material that is used in the production of pots. However, Julián still needs a certain amount of money in order to buy wood to finish processing his excellent pieces. For this reason he is asking for a loan of $100 dollars. With your support Juan could very soon have the opportunity to make his dreams into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián es natural del distrito de Pukará- Juliaca, es un padre muy trabajador y responsable, desde que se casó con Mari siempre se dedicó a la ganadería y a la cerámica, trabajos que desempeña con sumo profesionalismo y dedicación, gracias a los ingresos que obtiene con estos oficios ha podido solventar los gastos económicos familiares y los estudios de sus ocho hijos menores con satisfacción.Actualmente, el oficio que mayor ingreso económico le está generando es su trabajo de artesano con el que elabora junto a su esposa e hijos hermosas ollas de diferentes tamaños y modelos basado en barro (arcilla), para luego ofrecerlos en las ferias de los distintos pueblos de su país.}El deseo de Julián y su encantadora familia es incrementar su economía y nivel de vida con este trabajo y para iniciar su travesía ya adquirió un volquete de arcilla, materia prima que utiliza en la elaboración de su producción sin embargo aún requiere cierta cantidad de dinero para comprar leña para terminar de procesar sus excelentes enceres, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de100 dólares.“Gracias al apoyo que puedes otorgarle en corto tiempo Julián podrá convertir sus deseos en realidad”.

loans.use: To buy raw material in order to increase the quality of merchandise

loans.name: Flor Ibeth

texts.es:
Flor separated from her husband and currently lives with her eldest daughter. After the separation, she decided to open a tire repair shop in the outskirts of the city. She thought it was a good business venture, but things did not turn out as she had expected.

Flor decided to try another business idea and opened a general store/catering service in her home. Her daughter is studying to obtain a technical degree in IT and also helps her mother with the store. Sales are good, especially on weekends because their shop is located in the main square of her neighborhood and she wishes to increase her product range to meet the demands of the clients who visit the town square after sunset.

Flor is requesting a $1200 loan to increase her stock. Let´s make a contribution so this hard working single mom can achieve her aspirations.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Flor vive sólo con su última hija; a raíz de la separación de su esposo, se dedicó a crear su propio negocio e instaló con mucho entusiasmo una vulcanizadota en las afueras de la ciudad creyendo que daría resultado sin embargo la realidad fue otra, abandonó su propósito y surgió en ella otra idea y aperturó una bodega en casa paralelamente incursionó en la preparación y venta de comida regional como actividad secundaria para percibir ingresos extras siempre contando con la ayuda de su hija que aparte de colaborar se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de computación e informática en un instituto de formación profesional de su ciudad.Por la aceptación y las buenas ventas, en especial los fines de semana, que obtiene flor debido a que su bodega esta al frente de la plaza en el barrio que habita, se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar sus productos, para poder atender la demanda de sus clientes que salen a recrearse a la plaza diariamente cuando cae el sol.La suma que solicita flor para cubrir las necesidades y poder tener los productos en stock es de 1200 dólares.Contribuyamos para que esta afanosa madre pueda alcanzar lo que se propone.

loans.use: Purchase stock to increase product offer

loans.name: Marita Astra

texts.es:
Marita is a mother of three, two of her sons are studying Systems Engineering at university. The youngest son is still in primary school and lives in her home along with her husband. She started selling bread as there were no bakeries near her neighborhood. Her artisan oven and keen business acumen have helped her to produce delicious bread, which her sons and husband help to dispatch from their bakery located next to their home.

The family business produces enough bread daily to meet the current demand, but they would like to increase their production. They need more raw materials to increase bread production to be able to grow the business. Let´s help Marita accomplish her dreams of having a well furnished bakery and home delivery of her excellent bread.

Marita wants to generate jobs in the community and help her family grow financially by fulfilling a basic need for her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Marita es madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian en la universidad la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas y el último aún está en el colegio y habita con su querido esposo su modesto hogar. Ella empezó con el negocio de la venta de panes debido a que por la zona donde vive no hay una panadería cercana en varias manzanas a la redonda, observando este hecho y gracias a su aguda mentalidad comercial instaló un pequeño horno artesanal de barro en las instalaciones de su casita con el propósito de elaborar una muy buena cantidad de panes, con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo en la atención diaria al público colindante a su domicilio; siempre preparan suficientes panes para cubrir la demanda de las personas que acostumbradas a degustar un delicioso pan acuden a la panadería de Marita.Debido al crecimiento de su negocio se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar los insumos para la elaboración de los deliciosos panes.Ayudemos a Marita a hacer crecer su negocio, ya que uno de sus deseos es tener la panadería bien implementada y con unidades de reparto para generar puestos de trabajo y contribuir con el desarrollo de su familia y la satisfacción de sus vecinos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to increase production and sales

loans.name: Los Tulipanes Group

texts.es:
The women of the communal bank “The Tulips” are very charismatic. These women have an unequalled spirit. A confidence and a hope was reflected in their faces during the pre-credit meetings (four informational sessions that are given to potential clients of Friendship Bridge in order to help them administer their credit and their business in the best manner). The average loan that each one of these clients will receive is $264 in six payments.

During their childhood and adolescence, many of these women worked as artisans, since the majority of indigenous women are taught the art of weaving traditional clothing as children. In addition, many of them have worked as housekeepers in their respective homes. However, these women, along with the help of Friendship Bridge, are no longer going to follow that path, since they have opted to become successful micro-entreprenuers.

These women have been becoming micro-entrepenuers for a long time; however, they have not been able to get ahead in the the field of their respective businesses due to a lack of capital. Thanks to the credit that they will receive, the women will be able to invest their credit in distinct economic areas. For example, the credit will be used to buy clothing in bulk and resell it, to buy wholesale materials for making “huipiles” (traditional Guatemalan dresses), to buy chickens and pigs and begin a livestock business, to buy flowers in bulk and sell them during the day of the dead (a traditional holiday in Guatemala during which you show respect for relatives who have died), to buy wood wholesale in order to resell it in the villages, and finally, to buy rice, milk and chocolate and to strengthen a coffee break stand.

The dreams of these women, like the majority of our clients, are that their businesses will grow in order to be able to give their children a better future. Mrs. María L. L. commented: “I want my business to grow so that my children will be able to attend school and will not have to deal with the problems that I have had to face.” Mrs. Candelaria A. said “I want my business to be successful in order to give a little hope to my children.” It is for these reasons that we are asking for your help, in order that these women will be able to reach their dreams.

Note: One woman decided not to be included in the group photograph due to her cultural beliefs, although she was present at the meeting when the team from Friendship Bridge met with this group.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras del banco comunal “Los Tulipanes” son muy carismáticas. Estas señoras tienen un espíritu inigualable. Ellas reflejaban una confianza y una esperanza en sus miradas durante las reuniones de pre-crédito (cuatro sesiones de capacitación que se les otorga a las potenciales clientas de Friendship Bridge para administrar su crédito y su negocio de la mejor manera). El promedio del préstamo que se les va a otorgar a cada una de las clientas es de $264 a seis cuotas.

Durante la niñez y la adolescencia de muchas de estas señoras, ellas trabajaron como artesanas, ya que a la gran mayoría de mujeres indígenas se les enseñan el arte de tejer trajes típicos durante su niñez. Además, muchas de ellas han trabajado como ama de llaves en sus respectivas casas. Sin embargo, ellas, con la ayuda de Friendship Bridge, ya no van a seguir ese camino, ya que ellas han optado por volverse microempresarias exitosas.

Estas señoras han venido siendo microempresarias por muC. tiempo, sin embargo, no han podido destacar en el ámbito de su respectivo negocio por falta de inversión. Gracias al crédito que ellas van a recibir, las señoras van a poder invertir su crédito en distintas áreas económicas. Por ejemplo: el crédito se va a utilizar para comprar ropa al por mayor y revenderla, para comprar materiales al por mayor para tejer huipiles (vestido tradicional Guatemalteco), para comprar pollos y cerdos y empezar un negocio de crianza de animales, para comprar flores al por mayor y venderlas durante el día de los muertos (fiesta tradicional en Guatemala en la cual se guarda respeto a los familiares fallecidos) y, para comprar leña al por mayor para revenderla en las aldeas, y, finalmente, para comprar arroz, leche y chocolate y fortalecer un negocio de refacciones o coffee breaks.

Los sueños de las señoras, como la gran mayoría de nuestras clientas, es que su negocio crezca para poder darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Doña María L. L. comentó: “yo quiero que mi negocio crezca para que mis hijos puedan asistir al colegio y no tengan que enfrentar los problemas que yo tuve que enfrentar.” Doña Candelaria A. dijo: “yo quiero que mi negocio salga adelante para regalarle un poco de esperanza a mis hijos.” Es por eso que nosotros solicitamos vuestra ayuda, para que así nuestras clientas puedan cumplir sus sueños.

Nota: Una señora decidió no presentarse en la fotografía grupal por creencias culturales, aunque estaba presente en el reunion cuando el equipo de Friendship Bridge fueron para reunir con este grupo.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk for resale in distant villages, to buy material for traditional weaving, to raise animals, and to expand coffee break stands.

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
The women of ComUnidad or communal bank “El Mirador at first appeared very timid. Nevertheless, after a few minutes of questioning they began to show their personalities and entrepreneurial spirit.

Many of the women have dedicated themselves to weaving traditional clothing of the region or working as housekeepers from their homes. However, little by little they soon discovered an untapped market for nutritional foods at different levels in the local economy. It is because of this vision and enterprising drive that Friendship Bridge has decided to support them with a loan, with help from Kiva. The average loan requested by each woman is of Q200 (Guatemalen Quetzales) or $264 USD. This means that these women are willing to invest a considerable amount for the improvement of their business.

The women will use the loan for varioU. activities. Many of them will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and cultivating tools in order to plant and harvest vegetables and sell them in the local market. The loan will also be used to purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk and resell them in the local market. The women will also purchase maize in bulk in order to prepare tortillas for later sale. Other women will purchase chickens and pigs to help grow their business of raising animals.

The dreams of these women go hand-in-hand with the wellbeing of their children. These women would like to receive this loan so that they can invest in their business. The money earned will allow them to purchase better clothes for their children, fix and enlarge their homes so that their children can live comfortably, and to pay for their children’s schooling. This will allow their children to enjoy a better future. Finally, the dream of one woman was the other women would be in God’s graces helping them pay on time and allowing the group to become a solid group of colleagues and friends. Friendship Bridge will do what is required to monitor and distribute the loan funds, will allocate the appropriate loan amount to each borrower and will establish guidelines for this to take place.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras que constituyen la ComUnidad o banco comunal “El Mirador” son unas mujeres que al comienzo reflejaban una mirada temerosa. Sin embargo, al pasar los minutos y las preguntas ellas empezaron a sacar a relucir su personalidad y su actitud empresarial.

Mucha de estas señoras han sido artesanas de pequeñas, tejiendo los trajes típicos de su región o trabajando dentro de sU. casas como empleadas domésticas. Pero, poco a poco fueron descubriendo un mercado virgen para la venta de productos alimenticios en distintos niveles de la economía local. Es por esa visión y empuje empresarial que Friendship Bridge ha decidido apoyarlas con un crédito, por medio de los prestamistas de Kiva. El promedio del primer crédito solicitado por cada señora es de Q2000 o U.$264. Eso quiere decir que estas señoras están dispuestas a invertir una cantidad considerable para el mejoramiento de su negocio.

Las señoras van a usar su préstamo para distintas actividades. Muchas de las señoras van a usar su préstamo para comprar fertilizante, semillas y herramientas de cultivo para poder sembrar y cosechar vegetales y venderlos en el mercado local. También, el préstamo se va a utilizar para comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor y revenderlas en el mercado local. Asimismo, ellas van a comprar maíz al por mayor para prepara tortillas y luego venderlas. Otras señoras van a comprar pollos y cerdos para agrandar su negocio de crianza de animales.

Los sueños de estas señoras van de la mano con el bienestar de sU. hijos. Ellas quieren solicitar este préstamo para que de esa manera ellas puedan invertir en su negocio y con el dinero ganado puedan comprarles mejor ropa a sU. hijos, arreglar y agrandar sU. casas para que sU. hijos puedan vivir con relativa comodidad y para que ellas puedan mandar sU. hijos al colegio. De esa manera sU. hijos puedan disfrutar de un mejor futuro. Finalmente, el sueño que una señora tuvo fue que el resto de sU. compañeras estén en la gracia de Dios para que todas puedan pagar a tiempo y de esa manera construir un grupo sólido de socias y amigas. Friendship Bridge va a hacer todo lo posible mediante capacitaciones, otorgando el crédito apropiado a la necesidad de la clienta y la fomentación de valores para que eso suceda.

loans.use:
Purchase tools and supplies for the cultivation and harvesting of vegetables. Purchase of animals to raise and resell. Purchase of quality materials for embroidery. Purchase of maiz to prepare tortillas for sale. Purchase of vegetables and fruit in bulk to resell.

Comprar herramientas e insumos de cultivo para la siembra de vegetales. Comprar animales para su crianza y reventa. Comprar materia prima para sus tejidos. Comprar maíz para preparar tortillas y luego venderlas. Comprar verduras y frutas al por mayor para su respectiva reventa.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina has tried to get ahead in life and help her husband with the household expenses, given that he works as an independent bricklayer and goes long periods of time without work. She started selling cosmetics through catalogues and later selling shoes. However, when her husband suffered an accident that left him unable to work for a long time, the care he required made Florentina neglect her business. With their small savings, she started buying general merchandise to sell, setting up a small room in her house for this end, and thanks to the help of one of her three children who quit her job to help Florentina take care of her dad and attend the new business.

Currently, they want to offer a greater variety of products in their store, to have better things to offer to their clients. With this goal in mind, Florentina is requesting a loan for US $475 to be paid in a period of 4 months. They are confident that with this money they will be able to make their business grow and have more clients. With your help, Florentina and her family will be able to recuperate from this terrible accident.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Florentina, a tratado de salir adelante, y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, puesto que el señor trabaja como albañil independiente, y en largas temporadas no tiene trabajo. Comenzó por vender cosméticos por catálogo y posteriormente comenzó a vender zapatos. Sin embargo, su esposo sufrió un accidente que lo dejó sin trabajar durante un largo tiempo, y los cuidados que necesitaba hicieron que Florentina descuidara el negocio que tenía, y con unos pocos ahorros que tenía, fue como empezó a comprar abarrotes para venderlos, adecuando un cuartito en su casa, y con la ayuda de una de sus 3 hijos que se salió de trabajar para ayudarle a Florentina a cuidar a su papá y a atender el negocio.

Actualmente están buscando, surtir de más productos su tienda, para poder tener mejores cosas qué ofrecerle a sus clientes, por lo tanto está solicitando Florentina un préstamo de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, y con ese dinero están seguras que su negocio podrá crecer y tener más clientes. Con tu ayuda Florentina y su familia podrán superar este terrible accidente.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for general store

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es:
Felipe's dad worked making barbacoa (slow cooked meat) to sell among his neighbors. Felipe's dad was able to get ahead, using a small spot in their house set up to sell barbacoa, and with much patience he taught Felipe the secrets to preparing good quality barbacoa . Felipe has produced and sold barbacoa tacos for 30 years. With his savings he bought a trailer to establish his business in a strategic location for the sale of barbacoa.

However, Felipe's job takes a lot of his time, together with other problems he had when he separated from his wife. Now he is looking to expand his business and buy another trailer to have a second location and obtain a greater income. Felipe is requesting a loan of US $1200 to be paid in a period of 6 months, and with this money be able to buy a second trailer to let his business keep growing. With your help, Felipe's business will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

El papá D. Felipe, se dedicaba a hacer barbacoa para venderla entre sus vecinos. Con un pequeño lugarcito dentro D. su casa, adecuado para poder vender la barbacoa, fue como sacó adelante el papá D. Felipe, quien con mucha paciencia enseñó a Felipe los secretos para preparar una barbacoa D. buena calidad. Y desD. hace treinta años que Felipe se dedica a la producción y venta D. tacos D. barbacoa. Y poco a poco se ha ido haciendo D. clientes. Con lo que juntó dinero y compró un remolque en el que estableció su negocio en un lugar estratégico para la venta D. la barbacoa.

Sin embargo el trabajo le absorbe mucho el tiempo y junto con otros problemas que tenía se separó D. su esposa y hoy está buscando ampliar su negocio y comprar otro remolque para tener una sucursal y así obtener mayores ingresos. Felipe está solicitando un crédito D. US $1200 para pagarlo en un plazo D. 6 meses y con ese dinero poder comprar su remolque para que su empresa siga creciendo. Con tu ayuda Felipe podrá salir adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying a trailer to expand his business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
