Herminia is a single mother of 3 children to whom she has tried to give them the best. Sometimes she has been successful and sometimes she has made mistakes that have marked her life forever. Herminia has been working for a long time doing maintenance job at the city council. In this job she has the afternoons off and she uses this time to work on her own business. The first opportunity that she had was with a bar that was given to her. She left one of her children in charge of dispatching drinks, nevertheless after a time, due to lack of administration she had to close the business. After this terrible defeat, she continued looking for a business opportunity until in 2005 she was convinced by a neighbor to start selling clothes since her sister use to send packs of used clothes and Herminia liked the idea. She began selling on the sidewalk of her house, since there is a market in front of her house, and since then she has been trying to improve her business.

However, today she is requesting help to be able to stock her clothing business and have a more structured business with more merchandise available to her customers. The loan she is requesting is for the amount of $475.00 and she will repay the loan in four months. With your help Herminia will be able to increase her business opportunity to better support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Díaz, Kiva Volunteer.

Herminia, es Madre soltera de 3 hijos, a quienes ella con mucho esfuerzo a tratado de sacarlos adelante. En ocasiones con aciertos y en otras con errores que marcan para siempre su vida. Herminia trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo como personal de limpieza en el ayuntamiento, y su horario le deja las tardes libres, por lo que ella a buscado la manera de salir adelante haciendo su propio negocio. La primer oportunidad que se le presentó, fue que le traspasaron un bar, y ella accedió, dejando a uno de sus hijos a cargo de despachar las bebidas, sin embargo al cabo de un tiempo, por falta de administración tuvo que cerrar el negocio. Después de esta terrible derrota, siguió buscando hasta que en el 2005 una vecina la animó para que vendiera ropa usada ya que una hermana de su vecina le mandaba pacas de ropa usada y a Herminia le gustó la idea. Comenzó vendiendo en la banqueta de su casa, ya que enfrente de su casa se instala un mercado rodante, y desde entonces a tratado de sacar su negocio a flote.

Sin embargo hoy está solicitando ayuda para poder surtir su negocio de ropa y así poner un establecimiento un poco más estructurado y con más mercancía para que su clientela vea más surdido. El crédito que está solicitando es de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses. Y así poder surtir su negocio. Con tu ayuda Herminia podrá crecer su negocio para sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Alma Delfina

texts.es:
17 years ago Alma Delfina's father was the support of her family but he suffered a stroke and was not able to support his family anylonger. Alma Delfina started selling clothes to be able to afford the expenses of the house and the medicine that her father needed so much. At this moment she established her business at a market and she has customers that buy clothes from her in order to help her support her family.

Alma considers (and it is true) that christmas season is when people are interested the most in buying a gift for their family and that is why she is requesting a loan for $675 and she is willing to pay for it in six months. With this money Alma will be able to stock her business and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Díaz, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de que el padre de Alma Delfina le diera un derrame cerebral ella comenzó a vender ropa de ella y de su familia, puesto que su padre era el sustento de su casa, y así comenzo a vender para poder sacar para los gastos de su casa y del medicamento que tanto necesita su padre, todo esto fue hace 17 años, y de ahí en adelante ella se a dedicado a este oficio, actualmente ya se encuentra más establecida en un mercado y con mucho esfuerzo a ido haciendo de clientes que la buscan para comprarle ropa y así ayudarla a su sustento.

Alma considera, (y está en lo cierto) que las fechas de navidad es cuando las personas más están interesadas en comprar algun regalo para sus failiares, y es po esto que ella está solicitando un crédito de US $ 675 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Alma podrá surtir su negocio y así tener más ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda is a good mother and a good wife, who supports her husband is any way she can. Given that her husband's salary is not enough to pay the school expenses of their children, she decided to sell flour tortillas among her friends and relatives. However, she was sick and for a long time did not make tortillas, so she lost the clientele she had formed in that business and had to start selling other things. After thinking about the needs of the people in her neighborhood, she decided to sell clothes to offer to her friends, and with the help of her husband, she has been gathering a good clientele.

However, the clothes she has right now are for the summer season and she cannot keep offering that to her clients, since this business requires a constant rotation of merchandise. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $ 575, which she is sure she will be able to pay within 6 months and have enough profit to be able to celebrate Christmas and the new year with her family without worrying about not having enough food in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Griselda es una madre de familia y buena esposa, que apoya a su esposo en todo lo que le es posible. Puesto que el sueldo que gana su esposo no alcanza para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos ella decidió vender tortillas de harina para venderlas entre sus familiares y amigos, sin embargo se enfermó y duró mucho tiempo sin elaborar sus tortillas, así que perdió la clientela de este negocio, y se tuvo que dedicar a la venta de otras cosas, después de pensar qué era lo que necesitaba la gente de su colonia, decidió comenzar a vender ropa y ofrecersela a sus amigas, y así con la ayuda de su esposo a ido haciendose de clientela.

Sin embargo, actualmente, la ropa que tiene, es para la temporada de verano, y esa ya no la puede seguir presentando ante sus clientes, puesto que este negocio requiere de constante cambio de mercancía, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $575 y está segura que en un plazo de 6 meses ella podrá recuperar el préstamo y obtener suficientes ganancias para poder celebar junto con su familia una navidad y un año nuevo sin preocuparse de que falta la comida en su casa.

loans.use: Buying season clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more electrical appliances and cell phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more undergarments for sale.

loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Jaya T., a 58- year-old woman, lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She has three members in her family including herself. Her husband, Mr. Mukanda Lal T., died three years ago. Her daughter works in a printing press, and her son is studying in grade 7.
Mrs. T. opened a metal utensil shop six years ago. She sells different types of metal goods such as bells, gagris (water-carrying pots), metal plates and other different traditional metal pots used for worshipping god and goddess. Now she seeks a loan to buy these metal items because demands for these different items are increasing constantly in the local market.

loans.use: To buy metal goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita M. is 31 years old and lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives  with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Manish M., is a plumber. Her older son is in grade 8 and  her younger son is in grade 1.
Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop two years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. Due to lack of money she cannot expand her business. So she is seeking a Rs25000 (US$400) loan to buy necessary goods like rice, bitten rice, noodles, biscuits, etc. to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi S. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business activities. Mrs. S. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Binod S., works in a Mobil shop. Her older son is studying in grade 7 and her younger son is in primary school.
Mrs. S. sells different types of shoes and sandals in a footpath market. The rent for the shops in that area is very high, so she can't afford to pay rent.  She needs to purchase different varieties of shoes and sandals for her shop. So she is asking for a Rs15,000 (US$250) loan to purchase different types of shoes and sandals, especially for children and ladies.

loans.use: To buy different types of shoes and sandals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina S. is a resident of Dhalko and lives with her husband, son and daughter. Dhalko is one of the popular commercial areas of  the Kathmandu district.
Her husband, Mr. Birandra S., is a plumber. Her son is studying in grade 4 and her daughter is in pre-primary school. Only the income of her husband is not enough to cover household expenses. So, a year ago Mrs. S. opened a grocery shop. Now she seeks a  Rs10,000 (US$175) loan to invest in her shop to buy grocery goods.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Andre Joaquim

texts.pt:
Andre is single but lives with a woman who has 4 children. Andre is a worker with ORAM, an organization that works with rural people. He lives in the town of Macia. He built his residence and now plans to acquire some home appliances and other furniture for his home. Andre's children are studying. Andre's wife doesn't work outside the home. She is a homemaker.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Andre e solteiro mas vive maritalmente com uma mulher com quem tem 4 filhos. Andre e trabalhador da ORAM, uma organizacao que trabalha com os camponeses.Ele vive na vila da Macia. Ele construiu a sua residencia, agora pretende adquirir alguns electrodomesticos e ootras mobilias para a sua residencia. Os filhos de Andre estao a estudar. A esposa de Andre nao trabalha fora de casa.E domestica, cuida dos afazeres domesticos.

loans.use: Andre wants to use the money to buy some home appliances and furniture like a refrigerator, stove and sofas

loans.name: Punyabati

texts.en:
Mrs. Punyabati S. is 29 years old and lives in Dhalko.  Dhalko is situated in Kathmandu Valley, and most of the people in this place are engaged in business activities. 
Mrs. S. has only one son, who is eight years old and studying in grade 3. Her husband, Mr. Narandra S., and she both prepare fried dry fish. They sell their product in grocery shops and department stores.
Now Mrs. S. is requesting a Rs10,000 (US$175) loan to buy fish and spices necessary for their work. Her income is to be used for the better education of her children.

loans.use: To buy fish for her work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Naintara

texts.en:
Mrs. Naintara S. is a 44-year-old resident of Dholko and lives with her husband and son. Her husband, Mr. Ganu S., works in a private office, and her son is studying in BBS level.
Mrs. S. opened a grocery shop a few years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. But due to lack of fund she can't expand her business. So in order to expand their business, she needs a Rs10,000 (US$175) loan. With this amount she will buy noodles, biscuits, rice, etc. for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Mrs. Gita M. is a resident of Dholko and lives with her husband and two sons. Dholko is located in Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this town are engaged in business.
Her husband, Mr. Mukesh M., works in a private office. Her older son is studying in BBS level and her younger son is in grade 12. Only the income of her husband is not enough to cover the household expenses. So, two years ago Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop. Now she seeks a Rs10,000 (US$175) loan to invest in her shop to buy grocery goods like biscuits, noodles, chocolates and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti M. is resident of Dholko and lives with her husband and son. Dholko is located in Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this town are engaged in business.
Her husband, Mr. Monaj M., works in a private office. Her son is studying in grade 11. Only the income of her husband is not enough to run the household expenses. So, a year ago Mrs. M. opened a cosmetic shop. She sells different types of cosmetic goods like creams, powders, oils and glass bangles in her shop. Now she seeks a Rs10,000 (US$175) loan to buy cosmetic goods, because demand for cosmetic goods are increasing in that area.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic goods

loans.name: Ratna Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratna Maiya N. is 57 years old and lives in Dhalko in the Kathmandu district.  She lives with her husband, Mr. Karna Bhadur, and two sons. Her husband is a laborer. Her older son is a house painter and her younger son is illiterate and has no work. 
Mrs. N. sells greens and other vegetables in a footpath market. Their condition is not good. To overcome this problem she sells vegetables in the footpath. 
Now she is asking for her first loan of Rs10,000 (US$175) to buy vegetables, because in Nepal green vegetables are very popular among the food items.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Batai

texts.en:
Mrs. Batai T. is 46 years old and lives in Dhalko in the Kathmandu district. She lives with her husband, Mr. Kainla T., and two sons. Her husband is a laborer and does house construction work. Her sons are studying in primary and pre-primary school.
Mrs. T. sells green vegetables in a footpath market. Their family condition is so miserable that they can hardly solve their hand-to-mouth problem. So she sells vegetables in the footpath to overcome this condition.
Now she is asking for her first loan of Rs10, 000 (US$175) to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thoi Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Thoi is 42 years old, married with 4 children who are still in school. Her main occupation is raising duck for meat and eggs. She also sells recycled glass bottles. Her husband is a construction worker. With his salary he contributes a lot to the family. Ms Thoi really hopes to get this loan so that she can buy more ducks to raise. She and her husband would put part of his salary into savings to repay this loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Thoi ,42 tuổi, có chồng và có 4 con đang đi học. Chị chủ yếu chăn nuôi gà vịt để lấy trứng và ăn thịt. N.ài ra chị còn làm nghề mua bán đồng nát (ve chai). Chồng chị là ảnh Toản làm nghề thợ xây cũng giúp đỡ được gia đình rất nhiều từ thu nhập của mình. Chị rất mong sớm nhận được khoản vốn vay này để phụ giúp cho việc chăn nuôi của gia đình. Anh chị sẽ dành dụm số tiền từ công việc xây dựng của anh để hoàn vốn vay.

loans.use: For purchasing more ducks to raise

loans.name: Ambica

texts.en:
Mrs. Ambica T. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located near the main bazaar of Lalitpur. Mrs. T. lives  with her husband, two sons, daughter, daughter-in-law and granddaughter.  Most of the people in this place are engaged in metal handicraft work. Her husband and both of her sons buff old metal goods and make them new. They also polish new metal crafts for the markets.These types of work are traditional work of their family. All the requirements of the family are fulfilled by the earning of this work.
Now Mrs. Ambica T. is requesting her fourth term loan of Rs25,000 (US$400) to buy an advanced buffing machine necessary for her work.

loans.use: To buy a buffing machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Minh Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Minh is 24 years old. She is married with 2 children who are in school. She raises pigs and chickens for eggs. Every 7-8 months, she would sell a pig (weight: 70-80 kg). The money from selling the pig is then used to pay for expenses and school fees for her children. She also owns a piece of land to cultivate vegetables that she would sell at the market. Her husband, main bread winner in the family, is a construction worker like most of the men in the village. They would use part of his salary to repay the loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Minh 24 tuổi, có chồng và có 2 con đang đi học. Chị nuôi gà để lấy trứng và nuôi lợn lớn để bán. Cứ 7-8 tháng chi lại xuất chuồng một con lợn khoảng 70-80 kg. Tiền bán lợn chị dành một phần để trang trải chi phí trong gia đình và chi phí học hành của 2 con. Ngoài ra chị cũng có mảnh vườn khá rộng đủ để trồng các loại rau theo mùa vụ và mang ra chợ bán. Chồng chị cũng giống như hầu hết đàn ông trong làng chủ yếu làm nghề thợ xây. Thu nhập của anh có được cũng là một nguồn tài chính hỗ trợ cho cuộc sống gia đình và dùng để hoàn vốn vay.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Ngoc Khac

texts.vi:
Mr Ngọc is 36 years old, married with 2 children who are in school. Raising ducks is an essential task for him and his wife. As a matter of fact it is their main family income. Right now he needs money to buy breeding ducks. On average, every 3 months he would sell a paddle of ducks and with the money he would buy chicks to raise. Both of them are hard working people. They would be very happy to receive a loan to buy more ducks and expand their business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Anh Ngọc năm nay 36 tuổi có vợ và có 2 con đang đi học. Gia đình anh chị chủ yếu nuôi ngan để bán. Đây là nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình. Hiện nay anh đang cần có thêm vốn để mua ngan giống về nuôi. Trung bình khoảng 3 tháng anh lại bán một lứa ngan và quay vòng vốn mua lứa mới. Anh chị rất chăm chỉ và chịu khó. Anh chị rất vui mừng nếu sớm nhận được khoản vay này để giúp thêm vốn mở rộng chăn nuôi.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise

loans.name: Dung Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Dung is married with Nguyễn Văn Phi, she has 2 children. She cultivates rice and vegetables that she would sell at the market. She also raises poultry. Her husband is a construction worker, his salary helps cover the expenses for the family. But his work requires him to be on site, away from home. So Dung has to take care of everything. She has to manage wisely the money from the sale of vegetables and her poultry in order to cover the increasing expenses of her family. She really hopes to obtain a loan to buy more ducks and chickens to raise thus this would increase her income in the long run.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Dung có chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Phi làm nghề xây dựng và có 2 con. Chị trồng lúa và rau để ăn và bán. Ngoài ra, gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi gà, vịt. Thu nhập từ nghề thợ xây của anh cũng đỡ đần chị phần nào trong sinh hoạt của gia đình. Tuy nhiên do tính chất công việc, chồng chị thường xuyên vắng nhà do đó mọi công việc ở nhà đều do chị gánh vác. Từ công việc nuôi trồng của mình, chị cũng cố gắng để xoay xở cho các khoản chi phí ngày càng tăng của gia đình. Chị rất mong có thêm khoản tiền nhỏ để hỗ trợ cho công việc kiếm sống của gia đình và có thể dành dụm để hoàn vốn.

loans.use: To purchase feed for ducks and chickens and other items to support her business

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
A. Ilham is a 37-year-old farmer who lives with his family in the southern Azerbaijani region of Bilasuvar. Ilham is an internally displaced person who fled to Bilasuvar from the Jabrail region in the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.

Ilham is a farmer who owns a small herd of sheep and sells sheep to the local bazaar traders. Ilham has six years of experience in sheep breeding, and all that time it brought him good income. For the last two years, Ilham feels that it is not enough to keep a small herd. He is going to expand his business, so he applied for 1000 USD to purchase an additional 15 sheep and fodder for the winter season. The estimated cost for sheep is 50-60 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria decided to invest some of her and her husband's savings to start buying wood and some tools to make kitchens. Given that there are 6 family members, and all of them were in school, their financial needs were increasing, and so in February of 1982, in a space they had behind their house, they started taking orders and offering kitchens to their neighbors. Their business continued to grow little by little through word of mouth. They started with a kitchen and have expanded to make living room and dining room furniture.

However, the quality of the finishes in their products is not as good as that of products made in factories, since they lack machinery and more working tools. This is why they are requesting a loan for US $950, to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money, Maria and her husband will be able to produce higher quality furniture and obtain a higher income. With your help, Maria and her husband will be able to grow their business and see their family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria decide invertir unos ahorros que tenían entre ella y su esposo para empezar a comprar madera y una que otra herramienta para elaborar cocinas, al ser 6 miembros de familia y estar todos en la escuela veían que las necesidades se estaban haciendo más pesadas y fue así como en febrero de 1982 en un espacio que tenían por detrás de su casa, empezaron levantando pedidos, ofreciéndole cocinas a sus vecinos ya que así se podría ir corriendo la voz y poco a poco crecería su negocio, iniciaron con una cocina y de ahí con la elaboración de salas y comedores.

Sin embargo el acabado de sus productos no han podido dejarlo como los de fábrica puesto que les falta maquinaria y más instrumentos de trabajo. Por lo tanto están solicitando un crédito de US $950 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dinero María y su esposo podrán fabricar muebles de mejor calidad y así obtener mayores ganancias. Con tu ayuda María y su esposo podrán crecer su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buying wood-working machinery and tools.

loans.name: Roxana Maricela

texts.es:
Roxana Maricela and her husband have a beautiful daughter who is doing really well in school, since she is getting very good grades. However, Roxana's husband's luck is not so good, since he was fired from his previous job due to his company downsizing. Because of this, Roxana had to figure out how to help her family get through this. And so it was that she got a job with a woman who owned a beauty salon close to her house, and she learned how to apply artificial fingernails, which she was really good at. After a few months, she decided to start her own business applying artificial fingernail, which has allowed her to support her family.

Right now, her husband does have a job, but Roxana is determined to grow this business so that it can be left as patrimony to her daughter. Roxana is convinced that this winter season is the best for the application of artificial fingernails, since many women have parties and want to look their best. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $ 635 to be paid within 6 months. With this money Roxana will be able to buy more materials to apply more fingernails, and so be able to buy a small gift to her daughter as a reward for studying hard and getting ahead. In your hands you have the power to help Roxana.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Roxana Maricela y su esposo tienen una hermosa hija que está estudiando y aprobecha muy bien la escuela, puesto que tiene buenas calificaciones, sin embargo la suerte de el esposo de Roxana no es la misma, puesto que de su anterior trabajo, lo despidieron, por un recorte que hicieron en la empresa dónde trabajaba, y fue así como Roxana tuvo que idearselas para que su familia saliera adelante. Y Fue así como consiguió trabajo con una señora que tenía una estética cerca de su casa y aprendió a poner uñas, lo cual se le dio con facilidad, y a los meses decide separarse de la señora para comenzar su propio camino como aplicadora de uñas. Lo cual es lo que a podido solventar a su familia.

Actualmente su esposo tiene trabajo pero Roxana está decidida a crecer este negocio, para que se quede como un patrimonio para su hija. Roxana está convencida que la temporada de invierno es la mejor para las aplicaciones de uñas, puesto que muchas mujeres tiene fiestas y desean estar presentables, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $625 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Roxana podrá comprar mercancía para aplicar más uñas y así poder comprarle un pequeño obsequi a su hija como recompensa a su esfuerzo por estudiar y salir adelante. En tus manos está el poder ayudar a Roxana.

loans.use: Buying materials to apply artificial fingernails.

loans.name: Carolina Esther

texts.es:
Carolina Esther suffered the terrible loss of her husband. Her husband supported her and their four daughters who are students and need money to buy school supplies. After the terrible loss, Esther gathered her courage to fight for her daughters and decided to start selling groceries, setting up a small place for this in her home. After some time, and with greater expenses, she decided to start selling meals, to have more clients.

Unfortunately, the place she has is not well set up with tables and chairs so her clients can stay and eat comfortably. This is why she is requesting a loan of US $ 400, which she is sure she can pay back within 4 months. With this money she will buy chairs and tables and merchandise for her general store. With your help, Carolina will be able to support her daughters, in spite of the grief she carries for the loss of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Carolina Esther, sufrió la terrible pérdida de su esposo, quien era el que mantenía a ella y a sus cuatro hijas quienes están estudiando y necesitan de dinero para poder comprar sus útiles escolares. Después de la terrible pérdida, Esther se armó de valor para luchar por sus hijas y decidió comenzar a vender abarrotes adecuando un pequeño lugar dentro de su casa. Después de un tiempo, y con mayores gastos, decide comenzar a vender comidas, para poder tener más clientes.

Sin embargo no tiene muy bien adecuado con sillas y mesas para que sus clientes se queden a comer a gusto. Por lo que hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $400 y está segura que en un plazo de 4 meses podrá recuperar el dinero y pagarlo. Con el dinero comprará sillas y mesas y material para surtir sus abarrotes. Con tu ayuda Carolina podrá sacar adelante a sus hijas, a pesar de la tristeza que lleva por la pérdida de su esposo.

loans.use: Buying chairs and tables for food locale

loans.name: Dayanny María

texts.en:
Dayanny is 25 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. The children attend the local public school, except the youngest, who is no more than one year old. Her husband works in a hardware store.

For more than five years, Dayanny has been offering her services as hair stylist. Her beauty salon is very well known by local women. She attends to more than 10 customers and new clients every day. Currently, she makes a weekly profit of USD 180.

With the purpose to offer a complete service to her customers, Dayanny has requested a loan in order to buy materials that the business lacks. With the loan, she will buy a hairdryer, an automatic shampoo dispenser and a second-hand hair wash system. With those devices, the entrepreneur's beauty salon will offer a wider variety of services to the customers and attract new people. Dayanny will also increase her income.

loans.use: Dayanny needs to purchase new materials for her beauty salon so she can provide better services for her customers and attract new ones.

loans.name: Flora Marte

texts.en:
For more than eleven years, this intrepid and diligent woman has been working to help her grocery store grow. She was only 19 and had just had her first child when she started the business. At the beginning, she operated the grocery store only four days a week, and she was selling just some foodstuffs. But, over the years, the business has grown considerably and Flora now can operate it all the days of the week.

With profit from the business, and with her husband’s help, Flora can provide her four children with a very good education and housing. Bi-weekly, Flora goes to Monte Plata (located about a one-hour drive from Yamasá) to purchase the goods for her grocery store.

With the loan requested, the entrepreneur will purchase goods such as sacks of rice, bunches of plantains and bananas, gallons of vegetable oil and some sacks of beans. Flora will also buy red wine and some energy drinks so as to diversify inventory and attract more clients.

loans.use: With this loan, the entrepreneur will supply her business with products like rice, vegetables and other goods so that she can continue with her sales activity and attract new clients.

loans.name: Francisca Abad

texts.en:
Francisca, 57 years old, is a very persistent and optimistic woman. She is married, with eight children (six boys and two girls). They are studying and working in Santo Domingo, the capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Francisca runs a small cafeteria, which she operates all day. In the morning, she serves spaghetti with manioc, manioc with boiled or fried eggs, and chocolate with bread (mixed with peanut butter). For lunch, she prepares and sells white rice with ground meat. At night, Francisca turns her cafeteria into an authentic gathering place. She has laid out a space where the customers can play billiards from 7 p.m. to 12 p.m. On weekends, people can stay until 2:00 am.

For the last two months, the cafeteria has been closed because the entrepreneur was renovating the location so as to offer a better service to her customers. With the loan she has requested, it will be easier for her to invest in the renovation and fix her billiard table. That way, she will continue satisfying her customers’ needs and attract more people with her succulent dishes and through the billiards games.

loans.use: Francisca will use the loan to renovate where she runs the business and fix a billiard table the customers use.

loans.name: Eduarda Flores

texts.en:
Eduarda, 47, has been happily married for 20 years. Seven children (six boys and one girl) have resulted from this union. The children are grown up and are studying at the university and working. Eduarda dedicates herself to the fabrication and the sale of mosquito nets and tablecloths. In her community, lots of mosquitoes swarm and are causative agents of dengue disease. The entrepreneur sells the nets not only in her community, but also in Santo Domingo, the capital, where dengue disease is very frequent.

Eduarda has requested a loan to invest in the purchase of a quintal (approximately 100 pounds) of cloth so that she can continue producing her mosquito nets and the tablecloths. With a quintal of cloth, she usually makes 50 mosquito nets, and it takes about fifteen days to have them ready. That quantity of nets can be sold in four weeks, and the entrepreneur makes a weekly profit of USD 40 from the sale of her products.

This loan will help this assiduous woman keep on contributing to the well-being of many families in her community and other parts of the country and vastly improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy cloth so she can continue producing and selling mosquito nets and tablecloths.

loans.name: Francis De Jesús

texts.en:
Francis is a very young mother of three girls. Her partner is a taxi driver and works part-time for a company. Eight months ago, just after her third daughter’s birth, Francis had to start a small business to help her husband with the new responsibilities of the family. She sells tennis shoes and trainers for women.

Every month, she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital, to buy the goods. Sometimes, she purchases the products in Elías Piña, a border city with Haiti.

A short time after her first pregnancy, like many other young girls of her community, Francis had to drop out school so that she could look after her child. Now, she is making plans to go back to school. With the loan requested, as well as purchasing shoes and slippers to supply her business, she will also set aside some money to hire a babysitter for her daughters. Thus, she will have more time to dedicate to her sales activity, and she will also be able to go to school and become a professional.

loans.use: This young entrepreneur will use her loan to supply her small business with a large quantity of shoes and slippers so that she can significantly increase her income for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mayas Kachikel Group

texts.es:
The women of the bank of confidence, “Mayas Kachikel” like to smile a lot. Since I came to interview them, they received me with an insuperable joy and an applause that made me very happy.

Many of these women have worked as maids, and have knitted traditional dresses like huipiles (traditional blouse in Guatemala), and they have sold cans they picked up in the streets. However, they are determined to change this fate for a more promising one.

In order to invest in a promising business, they have come to Friendship Bridge to request an initial loan of approximately US$ 220, in 9 installments, plus the training in business and loan administration that Friendship Bridge gives all its clients.

In this group, the businesswomen work in different economic activities, and because of this, the women will not use their loan in the same way. For example, one of these women will use her loan to buy wire, paper, and candy, to make piñatas. Another one has just opened a small restaurant called Moon & Soon, by the central plaza, and she requested a loan to buy the last things she needs to open her restaurant’s doors to the public. Another group of women wants to buy merchandise wholesale to make huipiles. Finally, another group of women have decided to buy clothing wholesale in the city of Guatemala, to resell it in the local market. This loan that will be given to the clients will allow them to dream of a larger business and more.

The dream of Clemencia T. Xovin is having a great business with which she can make enough money to send her children to school. Angela Graciela C. Tuc said, “I would like my business to grow so I can have enough money to expand my little house.” The dreams of these women go hand in hand with the success of their respective business. All they need is that initial support so that they can make their dreams reality. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Las señoras del banco de confianza “Mayas Kachikel” son muy risueñas. Desde que llegué a entrevistarlas me recibieron con una alegría insuperable y unas palmas que me llenaron de alegría.

Muchas de estas señoras han trabajado como empleadas domésticas, han tejido trajes tradicionales como los huipiles (blusa tradicional en Guatemala)y han vendido latas que recogieron en la calle. Sin embargo, ellas están dispuestas a cambiar ese destino por uno más prometedor.

Ellas han acudido a Frienship Bridge para solicitar un crédito dinicial de aproximadamente US$220 a nueve cuotas, más la capacitación de administración de empresas y crédito, que se les da a todas las clientes de Friendship Bridge, para así invertir en un negocio prometedor.

En este grupo las empresarias trabajan en distintas actividades económicas, debido a eso las señoras no van a usar su crédito de la misma manera. Por ejemplo, una de las señoras va a utilizar su préstamos para comprar alambre, papel y dulces para prepara piñatas. Otra acaba de abrir un pequeño restaurante, llamado Moon & Soon adyacente a la plaza central y ha solicitud un crédito para comprar lo último que necesita para abrir las puertas al público. Otro grupo de señoras quieren comprar mercadería al por mayor para poder empezar a tejer sus huipiles. Finalmente, otro grupo de señoras han decidido comprar ropa al por mayor en la Ciudad de Guatemala para revenderla en el mercado local. Este préstamo que se le va a otorgar a las clientas les va a permitir soñar con un negocio más grande y con algo más,

El sueño de Clemencia T. Xovin es de tener un gran negocio con el cual ella pueda ganar suficiente dinero para mandar a sus hijos al colegio. Angela Graciela C. Tuc dijo: “a mi me gustaría que mi negocio crezca para así poder tener suficiente dinero para ampliar mi casita.” Los sueños de estas señoras van de la mano del éxito de sus respectivos negocios, ellas solo necesitan de ese apoyo inicial para que puedan a concretar sus ideales. ¡Apóyenlas! Nota: Tres de las señoras del grupo no pudieron estar presente en la foto porque estaban hospitalizada o tenían problemas familiares. Por suerte ya están rehabilitadas y trabajando con normalidad. Sus fotos se van a colgar en los journals. Gracias por la comprención

loans.use: Buying materials to create Guatemalan typical dresses. Buying materials to make piñatas.  Buying clothing wholesale. Buying kitchen utensils to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Nacoj Women Group

texts.es:
The women of Nacoj are very enterprising and dynamic. What is more, they have an immense knowledge about Mayan crafts. Many of them are specialists in the meaning of the designs and colors that the Mayans use in the traditional clothing of the Chimaltenango region.

Since they were children, all of the members of this group have cultivated the art of traditional weaving. It is for this reason that they feel so confident about starting a business of traditional weaving, as they know the art like the palms of their hands. In total, the group is requesting a loan of $2,631, each woman receiving between $132 and $263 in six installments. This means that the women in the group will have the same business capacity, as the amount is similar for each.

The majority of the women in the group work making, selling, and reselling traditional weavings such as huipiles (traditional clothing of indigenous Guatemalan women), cortes (traditional skirts), tablecloths and napkins. Thus, they will use their loans to buy merchandise wholesale in order to resell it in the villages and markets of Chimaltenango, and to buy raw materials to weave their traditional products. Nonetheless, Mrs. María Lucia E. Tu has a bicycle repair shop. She is going to need her loan to buy spare parts. María B. has a tortillería (store that sells tortillas) and she needs the money to continue buying corn to make tortillas.

The dream of these craftswomen is to find a market for crafts abroad. They would like to be able to export their beautiful and well-developed products abroad. In addition, they have the desire to give a better future to their children. Ligia Verónica Sanjak C. said, “I would like a better education for my children so they will be able to have a better future.” Friendship Bridge is committed to giving these women a better future, but we can’t do it without your support.

Note: Due to health problems, one of the clients could not appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Las mujeres de Nacoj son muy emprendedoras y dinámicas. Además, tienen un conocimiento sobre la artesanía Maya inmenso. Muchas de ellas son especialistas en el significado de los diseños y colores que los Mayas utilizan en los trajes típicos de la región de Chimaltenango.

Desde niñas todas las integrantes de este grupo han cultivado el arte del tejido típico. Es por eso, que se sienten tan confiadas de empezar un negocio de tejido típico, ya que conocen el arte como la palma de su mano. En total el grupo está pidiendo un préstamo de US$2631 y el rango de préstamos por señora es de US$132 hasta US$263 a un plazo de seis cuotas. Eso significa que las señoras dentro del grupo tienen la misma capacidad empresarial ya que el préstamo es similar.

La gran mayoría de señoras dentro del grupo trabajan produciendo, vendiendo y revendiendo tejidos típicos como huipiles (traje típico de las mujeres indígenas Guatemaltecas), cortes (falda típica), manteles y servilletas. Por ende, sus préstamos los van a utilizar para comprar mercadería al por mayor para revenderla en sus aldeas y en el mercado de Chimaltenango y para comprar materia prima para tejer los productos típicos. Sin embargo, doña María Lucia E. Tu tiene un taller de bicicletas. Ella va a necesitar su préstamo para comprar repuestos. María B. tiene una tortillería y ella necesita el dinero para seguir comprando maíz para preprar tortillas.

El sueño de estas señoras artesanas es de encontrar un mercado de artesanías en el exterior. Ellas quieren ser capaces de exportar sus bellos y bien desarrollados productos al exterior. También, ellas tienen la ambición de brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Ligia Verónica Sanjak C. dijo: “A mi me gustaría una mejor educación para mis hijos ya que de esa manera ellos van a tener un mejor futuro”. Friendship Bridge está comprometido a darles a estas señoras un mejor futuro, solo nos falta tu apoyo.

Nota: Debido problemas de salud una de las clientas no pudo estar en la foto.

loans.use: Buy traditional clothing at wholesale price to resell in distant villages and in the Chimaltenango market.  Buy raw materials to weave traditional clothing which will be sold in the market along with napkins and tablecloths.

loans.name: Carmen Arelis López

texts.en:
Carmen, 38 years old, is a single mother of two boys. She has been separated from her first husband, and during her second pregnancy, her last partner left her. Consequently, she had to take care of her family on her own.

One year and three months ago, she started to sell gold-filled jewelry such as necklaces, bracelets, rings and earrings. As she makes business with friends and very trustworthy persons, she sells on credit and allows a fortnight to the customers to pay the products. That practice has helped her get a lot of customers.

Now, the entrepreneur would like to enlarge her client portfolio. She needs a loan to buy a large quantity of jewelry so she can sell more to her existing clientele and attract new clients with some special Christmas offers she plans to give during the two next months.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of gold-filled jewelry in order to grow her business and earn a lot of money so that she can keep taking care of her children.

loans.name: Brigida María Acosta

texts.en:
Brigida, 32 years old, has been separated from her husband for two years. Now, she is living with her two children, a boy and a girl, that attend to the local public school. To earn a living, Brigida dedicates herself to the production and sale of decorative and aromatic candles.

She explains that this kind of business is very profitable. Generally, she invests about 5,000 Dominican pesos (USD 150) to purchase raw materials in order to make the candles; and she earns USD 400.00 more or less. With income from business, she pays the rent on the house, provides food for her children and buys fuel for the small oven with which she prepares the candles.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as paraffin wax, aromas and colourings so that she can produce a big quantity of candles to sell for Christmas. That will be an opportunity for Brigida to notably make more profit and continue doing the business which is helping her work for the sake of her family.

loans.use: Brigida will use the loan to purchase paraffin, wax and other raw materials for the fabrication of her decorative and aromatic candles.

loans.name: I Made Hermanto

texts.id:
In addition to being a crop farmer, Made Hermanto raises cattles. He prepares the green plants to feed his cattles. Since he joined DINARI, Made bought a cattle for 3,500,000 IDR (USD~9,000 IDR) from a friend in a neighboring village and bought wheat pollard for additional feed. Every morning, I Made Hermanto washes his cattle to keep it clean. Feeding the cattle and cleaning the stall are done three times a day, morning, noon and afternoon. It took him two hours to complete the tasks. The rest of the time was spent working on his crops. The cattle feeds cost him 3,000 IDR per day. After three months, I Made Hermanto sells his cattle and plans on getting another cattle to be raised again. A cattle was sold for 4,900,000 IDR with a net profit of 1,000,000 IDR in three months. With the loan, Made Hermanto plans on adding more cattle to increase his income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ditengah tengah kesibukan sebagi petani Made Hermanto melengkapi usahanya dengan memelihara sapi. Persiapan pakan hijauan memang disediakan dari dulu untuk memenuhi pakannya. Semenjak bergabung menjadi client Yayasan DINARI Made membeli satu ekor sapi dengan harga Rp.3.500.000,- dari temannya yang ada di desa tetangga dan membeli dedak gandum sebagai pakan jadi untuk pakan tambahan. Setiap pagi, I Made Hermanto selalu memandikan sapinya agar kebersiahan dan kesehatannya terjaga. Pembersihan kandang dan pemberian pakan dilakukan dalam sehari sebanyak tiga kali yaitu pagi, siang dan sore. Waktu yang diperlukan hanya dua jam saja.Waktu selebihnya dipakai untuk bekerja dan mengurus kebunnya untuk menambah pemasukan keuangan dalam keluarganya. Biaya pakan dalam setiap hari mencapai Rp. 3.000,-. Setelah tiga bulan masa pemeliharaan, I Made Hermanto menjual sapinya dan rencananya akan membeli lagi sapi dengan harga yang lebih murah dan dipelihara kembali. Sapi dijual dengan harga Rp.4.900.000,-dengan keuntungan bersih mencapai Rp. 1.000.000,- dalam tiga bulan pelihara. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Made Hermanto berencana untuk menambah populasi sapinya agar pendapatannya dari beternak sapi lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To buy cattle and to build a nice and clean stall

loans.name: I Wayan Putra

texts.id:
I Wayan Putra is the bread winner of his family. Ever since his both children were married, he has been living only with his wife Ni Ketut Neri. To cover daily needs, I Wayan Putra raises Balinese Cattle. With loan from DINARI, I Wayan Putra bought a calf for 4,200,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR). With helps from a veterinary from DINARI, I Wayan Putra learned a lot of experience on how to raise cattle well. In the morning, the cattle was fed with wheat pollard. Each day he spends 5,000 IDR to raise the cattle with the help of his wife Ketut Neri. After four months, the calf can be sold and is priced by its weight. Hence I Wayan Putra works really hard to raise the cattle so he could maximize its weight when it comes to the selling time.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

I Wayan Putra adalah tulang punggung bagi keluarganya. Semenjak kedua anaknya sudah menikah, saat ini I Wayan Putra hanya tinggal dengan Ni Ketut Neri, istrinya. Untuk mencukupi kebutuhan hidup sehari - hari I Wayan Putra sudah terbiasa memelihara Sapi Bali. Dengan modal bantuan dari Yayasan DINARI, I Wayan Putra membeli sapi pejantan dengan harga Rp.4.200.000,- Dengan pembinaan-pembinaan yang diadakan oleh Dokter hewan yang merupakan salah satu Staf dari Yayasan DINARI , I wayan Putra banyak memperoleh pengalaman tentang beternak sapi dengan baik. Pagi hari sapi diberi pakan jadi yaitu dedak gandum sedangkan kulit coklat pakan hijaun seperti dedaunan dan kulit kakao.Total pengeluaran satu ekor sapi dalam satu hari mencapai Rp.5.000,-. Begitulah aktifitas I Wayan Putra setiap harinya yang dibantu oleh Ketut Neri, istrinya. Setelah kurun waktu empat bulan barulah sapi pejantan sudah dapat dijual dengan harga yang dihitung berdasarkan berat badannya. Oleh karena itu, I Wayan Putra sangat tekun dalam memelihara sapinya sehingga di waktu penjualan akan mencapai berat yang maksimal.

loans.use: To buy cattle and build the stall

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sueli

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Sueli is a homemaker with two children, who nowadays need more funding. Ni Nengah Sueli's husband is Ketut Suela, a farmer. In addition to being a homemaker, Ni Nengah Sueli sells crops. She uses the loan from Dinari to add to her working capital. Every day Ni Nengah Sueli travels to purchase goods such as bananas, cacao, banana leafs and coconut leafs. She leaves home at 5AM to start selling in Negara market. Before getting loan from Dinari, her profit was about 30,000-50,000 IDR per day. After getting the loan she could earn 50,000-70,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR). Ni Nengah Sueli is very happy with her job. With her increased profit Ni Nengah Sueli can pay for her children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam keseharian Ni Nengah Sueli adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga dengan 2 anaknya yang sekarang membutuhkan biaya yang cukup besar. Suami Ni Nengah Sueli bernama Ketut Suela, dengan mata pencaharian sebagai petani. Disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga Ni Nengah Sueli memiliki usaha sebagai pedagang hasil bumi. Dengan modal pinjaman yang di dapat dari Dinari, dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usahanya. Setiap hari Ni Nengah Sueli keliling membeli dagangan seperti pisang, kakao, daun pisang dan janur. Pagi hari, jam 5, Ni Nengah Sueli sudah berangkat ke pasar Negara untuk berjualan. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari, keuntungan yang diperoleh per hari Rp. 30.000.- sd Rp. 50.000,-. Tetapi setelah mendapat pinjaman, keuntungan yang diperoleh perhari Rp. 50.000,- sd Rp. 70.000,-. Ni Nengah Sueli senang dengan pekerjaannya ini dengan keuntungan yang semakin meningkat Ni Nengah Sueli bisa membiayai pendidikan ke dua anaknya .

loans.use: To add working capital by buying more goods.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Rahayu

texts.id:
In her older age, Ni Ketut Rahayu and her husband Nengah Wiriyana still work hard to make the ends meet. All their children are married. With loan from Dinari, Ni Ketut Rahayu can buy items for her food mart. She buys rice, sugar, spices, snacks and beverages. Everyday, Ni Ketut Rahayu starts at 7AM. She starts with cleaning up the shop, arranging the items and managing the stock. If she ever runs out of supply she then go to the market and buy. Before getting the loan, Ni Ketut Rahayu's profit was 25,000-30,000 IDR. After getting the loan she could earn 30,000-50,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR)

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam usia yang sudah tua, Ni Ketut Rahayu dan suaminya Nengah Wiriyana tetap bekerja keras untuk mencukupi kebutuhan hidupnya. Semua anak-anaknya sudah berumah tangga. Dengan modal yang di pinjam dari Dinari, Ni Ketut Rahayu bisa melengkapi kebutuhan warungnya. Adapun barang yang dibeli seperti beras, gula pasir, bermacam bumbu dapur, makanan ringan dan minuman. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Rahayu memulai pekerjaannya jam 7 pagi. Hal pertama yang dilakukannya adalah membersihkan warung, menata barang dagangan dan mencatat stok barang sehingga kalau ada barang yang habis bisa segera baru kepasar. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman, keuntungan Ni Ketut Rahayu Rp.25.000,- sd Rp.30,000,-. Setelah mendapat pinjaman modal, keuntungan yang diterima Rp. 30.000,- sd Rp.50,000,-.

loans.use: To add working capital for more variety such as rice, oil, spices and snacks

loans.name: Delete Dhahabu Group

texts.en:
HALIMA, a widow in her early forties, lives with her 4-year-old orphaned niece and supports her teenage son who is currently attending boarding school. A year ago, Halima opened a diner called “Mama Lishe Halima” (Swahili for Mama Halima’s Café), where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner from 7a.m. onward. Before this business, her income was dependent on selling clothes, but she found this business to be an unreliable source of income since her customers were often not paying her the full amount on the spot. As a result, she took out a loan and found the confidence in herself to start a new trade.


Halima’s diner now makes a profit of around $20 a day. The diner holds about 10 customers at a time, but people can eat outside as well. As business is currently going well, and she was able to pay back her first loan successfully, her hope is to take out another loan in order to begin serving French fry dishes. Halima currently hires a helper for half the day and has plans to hire another helper to be in charge of cooking the French fries. She also has plans of setting up umbrella booths in front of her diner where people can eat them. 


Halima belongs to the group Dhahabu (Swahili for “gold”) along with Rose L., Rahema S., Irene F., MwaJ. M., and Pili F., who also own food venues. Together, with the money from this loan of $1150, they will improve their businesses.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Delete Dhahabu Group

texts.en:
KHADIJA, 31-years-old and an elementary teacher by profession, is an experienced businesswoman in raising chickens. From a previous loan, she raised and sold two different groups of 250 chickens. Having repaid this loan successfully, she aspires to get another loan in order to continue with and expand her business. With a new loan, she plans to purchase 750 chicks (250 broilers and 500 layers), which cost about 1 dollar each. She plans to also build another chicken coup. 

Even while dealing with health concerns resulting from diabetes and a stroke that occurred less than two years ago, Khadija continues to strive to improve her business. Living with her husband, 1 year old son, and 10 year old stepson, she has many dreams of improving her family’s quality of life. From the profits of her business, they are currently building an addition onto the back of their home.

Khadija belongs to the group Dhahabu (Swahili for “gold”) along with Selina W. and Averina V., who also sell chickens. Together, with the money from this loan of $1125, they will improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy chicks for chicken businesses

loans.name: Sundi

texts.en:
SUNDI, aged 21, works with her brother, aged 27, to run a movie hall, where viewers pay about 10 cents to watch a movie. Sundi had borrowed a previous loan of $200 about 6 months ago to purchase the TV set. Every day, they play 7 movies (when the electricity is stable) and have around 120 customers. This business makes around $11 a day.

Sundi and her brother began this business 6 months ago after realizing that they needed to find a stable source of income. Living alone, along with Sundi’s 2-year-old girl, they explained that they came up with the idea of borrowing a loan and starting this business because they didn’t have jobs and were going through a rough time financially. As a result of their ambition, their business has been successful and Sundi was able to pay back the first loan on time. Using the profits from the movie hall and from a new loan, they hope to expand their business ventures to include 2 pool tables. A pool table costs $960, and they plan to charge players about 20 cents per game.

Sundi belongs to the group Dhahabu (Swahili for “gold”), which consists of 36 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To expand business with pool tables

payments.comment: Sundi has paid back her loan successflly before the end of the loan term.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a wider assortment of phone accessories.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
CHRISTINA, age 29, named her shop after her 6-year-old daughter, and only child, Michelle. “Michelle’s Cosmetics,” which sells wigs, creams, soaps, and other cosmetics, has now been open for 3 months. Before starting this business, Christina sold Chinese imported clothing but found that the competition was too steep in her locality. Making little to no profit, she decided to move on to selling cosmetics, which she heard had a better market.

Now with cosmetics, she can earn a profit of around $10 a day. While hiring a helper and paying about $45 a month for her shop’s rent, she hopes to use some of the remaining profit in conjunction with a loan to increase her inventory. Hearing of a demand from her customers, she plans to begin selling sodas and phone card vouchers in her shop. She also hopes to increase her stock of cosmetics.

Christina belongs to the group Ruaha (the name for a river in Tanzania), which consists of 19 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

payments.comment: Christina was able to pay the remaining of her loan before the end of the loan term!!

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by buying more cooking ingredients, utensils and furniture.

loans.name: O.m.m. Group

texts.pt:
The 5 women in this group are not officially married but each one of them lives with a man who has children. Elina has 3 children, Lina has 6 children, Helena has 3 children, Argentina has 7 children and Lucia has 4. The men with home these women live are not employed. They live from small jobs and the machamba (small agricultural field). And that's why these women have small businesses to contribute to the household expenses. Because otherwise, it's very difficult to ensure that the children can study.

If business goes well in the future, some of these women plan to improve their homes, while others want to save money to pay for their children's schooling, for them to continue as long as possible.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

As 5 senhoras nao sao casadas oficialmente mas cada uma delas vive com um homem com quem tem filhos.Elina tem 3 filhos,Lina tem 6 filhos, Helena tem 3 filhos, Argentina tem 7 filhos e Lucia tem 4 filhos.Os homens com os quais estas senhoras vivem nao estao empregados. Eles vivem de pequenos expedientes e fazem machamba.E por isso que estas senhoras fazem pequenos negocios para apoiar nas despesas da casa. Porque de contrario torna-se muito dificil assegurar que as criancas estudem. Se o negocio correr bem no futuro umas pensam melhorar a residencia, outras guardar dinheiro para pagar a escola dos filhos ate onde puderem estudar.

loans.use: The 5 members of the OMM Group want to use the loan money for the purchase of products for their stands at the market.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
VERONICA, age 30, has had 14 years of experience in hairdressing. Three years ago, she started her own business, “Vero Natural Beauty Hair Salon” and now employs 3 full-time workers to assist her. Business is going well and they have around 15 customers a day, bringing in about $35-40. Problems come when the electricity and water are not stable.

Knowing the potential of her growing business, Veronica hopes to get a loan to upgrade her salon with mirrors, shelves, and other salon furnishings. Living with her husband, 9-year-old son, and 3-year-old daughter, Veronica spends the profits from her business on school fees and improving their quality of life at home.

Veronica belongs to the group Ruaha (the name for a river in Tanzania), which consists of 19 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase salon furnishings

payments.comment: Veronica was able to repay the remaining of her loan before the end of the loan term!

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is a 42 year-old mother of two children and lives with her family in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. For the last five years, she has owned and operated a general store.  She is applying for a loan of $725 to buy more food items so she can attract more clients and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy food items for general inventory

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 23096

loans.name: Delete Songambele Group

texts.en:
SOFIA, age 28, single-handedly supports her 7-year-old son and 8-year-old niece through her business, the “T. Shop.” Her shop sells fresh vegetables, fish, fruit, sugar, flour, and other general items. Having started her business in January of this year, she collects about $2.50 in profit each day. Her first loan, which was paid back successfully, helped to initially open the shop. Since then, she has taken out another loan, which was used to help her get back on her feet after her shop was robbed in April. As a result of the robbery, she had to repurchase a scale and restock her inventory. She now has had to also invest in hiring a community watchman to guard her shop at night. 

Sofia belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”) along with Ally S., Saidi Z., and Saidi H.. Together, they will borrow this loan to increase their businesses' inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a more hygienic food kiosk.

loans.name: Delete Songambele Group

texts.en:
GODLISEN is 38-years-old and the father of twin 5-year-old boys. Starting a shop two years ago, he is able to support his wife and children. His shop sells vegetables, juice, lotions, candy, bread, fish, notebooks, rice, and other general items. Everyday, his shop receives around 20 customers and takes in a profit of about $9. In the past, Godlisen has taken out two successful loans and now he hopes to take out another loan to once again expand his inventory. The first two loans were used to purchase tomatoes in Iringa, a town about 9 hours away by bus. Godlisen hopes to use this new loan to purchase Irish potatoes in Iringa.  

Godlisen belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”) along with John I., Angela M., Zubery N., and Iddy T.. Together, they will borrow this loan to increase their businesses' inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur D. is 27 years old and he is married with one child.  For the last 3 years, he has owned and operated an farm in Khaladj village in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He has requested a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve the size and quality of the produce he grows on his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Namik

texts.en: Namik S. is 37 years old, is married, and has three children. He lives in the Yenikand village in the Salyan region.  He has been in this business for 8 years. With this business he can support his family. Now he applies for a loan of $1200 to buy  a plot of land for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Florinda Juda

texts.pt:
florinda has 3 children. She is not officially married. But she lives with a man who is the father of their 3 children. Florinda's husband is not employed. He lives from small jobs and the machamba (small agricultural field). Florinda is joining the credit program now. She lives in Chasson, a location along the national highway no. 1. In addition to the business, she works with her husband in the field, sometimes selling vegetables that she grows in her small field. Florinda's children are studying in primary school. In the future, she wants to build a house from conventional materials.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Florinda tem 3 filhos. Ela nao e casada oficialmente. Mas vive com um homem que e o pai de seus 3 filhos. O marido de Florinda nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expedientes e machamba. Florinda esta entrando agorea parao programa de credito. Ela vive em Chissano uma localidade ao longo da estrad nacional nr. 1. Para alem do negoci ela tambem trabalha com o marido na machamba, dai vender algumas vezes verduras que ela tira de sua pequena machamba. Os filhos de Florinda estao a estudar no ensin Basico. No futuro ela quer construir uma casa de material convencional.

loans.use: Florinda wants to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Delete

texts.en:
ABDALAH, age 42, is the father of 3 boys. He and his wife have started businesses within the past two years to support their family. In February, 2006, Abdalah opened a shop called “Genge Duka” (Swahili meaning “a small market shop”). There, he sells vegetables, sodas, ice pops, and general-needs items. His shop has around 45 customers each day, and from them, he makes a profit of around $9. In the past, Abdalah has taken out two successful loans and hopes to take out a third loan, which will also be used to build up his shop’s inventory. 

In January of this year, Abdalah’s wife was able to open her own breakfast café, which brings a profit of about $2.50 a day. Because of starting these businesses, Abdalah and his wife say that they no longer have problems paying general expenses such as school fees and hospital bills.

Abdalah belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Sahila

texts.en: Sahila is 57 years old, widowed, and lives in the Khaladj  village in the Salyan region  with her  five  children. She has run her own farm for the past 20 years and has used the income it generates to care for her family. Sahila has requested a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer which she will use to improve the size and quality of her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina has three sons and she wishes to provide the best for them. To this end she has worked hard all her life selling cookies, candy and varied sundry items from her vendor cart. Her daily work and her husband´s income as a handyman have helped this family to save enough money to increase their standard of living and are now saving up to buy their own home. On market days in Juliaca, her hometown, Martina also sells soup.

Martina´s wish is to purchase more stock to increase sales to save up enough capital to put the last finishing touches on the family home.

The entire family appreciates your help, and eagerly await your loan.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< El deseo de superación y el objetivo de brindarles lo mejor a sus tres queridos hijos, son las importantes razones que posee Martina para esforzarse en su oficio de toda su vida, la venta de galletas, caramelos y demás en forma ambulatoria. Su desempeño diario sumado a los ingresos económicos que su esposo, Edgar, obtiene de sus trabajos de reparaciones han podido incrementar su nivel adquisitivo y han ahorrado con el objetivo de comprar un lugar seguro donde cobijar amorosamente a sus hijos.Adicionalmente al negocio de ventas, Martina, también se dedica a vender caldo de cabeza, los días de feria en su ciudad natal, Juliaca. El deseo de esta madre trabajadora es aumentar el stock de su mercadería para que con las ganancias que obtenga, concluir la refacción y darle los últimos detalles de acabado a su casita.“Todos y cada uno de los miembros de esta familia agradecen y esperan pronto tu respuesta”

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and increase sales to put the finishing touches on their small home.

loans.name: Elena Francisca

texts.es:
Elena has three young children that she takes care of by herself. Her oldest daughter is a professional and works in a health camp; the other two are entirely dependent on her since they are still students in high school. Elena set up a store because she received some money after getting laid off from a business that she helped to operate. Previously, she was also very anxious about the little money she was receiving despite the long arduous hours she was putting in; her dismissal exacerbated their financial conditions even more. Being the only vital source of income for her family, she depends on her sons to help her in their little store. Both take turns so they can still do their schoolwork. Elena has plans to increase the products offered in their little store until she is able to convert it into a mini-mart with hard work in the medium term while trying to meet her customers' demands. She leaves this goal at the disposal of your generous contribution which can help her realize her desires.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Elena, tiene tres pequeños a los que cobija sin ayuda alguna; la hija mayor es profesional y trabaja en el campo de la salud, mientras que los otros dos dependen enteramente de ella debido a que se encuentran estudiando en el colegio. Ella instaló una bodega a raíz de que recibió su liquidación por el tiempo de permanencia que mantuvo en la empresa para la cual laboraba. Su situación antes de este hecho ya era preocupante por el poco dinero que recibía por las arduas horas de trabajo y su despido agudizó aún más su difícil situación económica.Siendo la única fuente vital de ingresos para mantener a su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos que la ayudan en la atención de la bodeguita, turnándose ambos para no dejar de realizar sus tareas del colegio.Elena tiene planeado incrementar los artículos de su pequeño centro de ventas hasta llegar a convertirlo con mucho esfuerzo y a mediano plazo en un minimarket, mientras tanto tiene que satisfacer la exigente demanda de sus clientes y con este propósito recurre a vuestra generosa contribución a fin de convertir su anhelo en realidad.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock up her grocery store

loans.name: Heyda

texts.es:
Heyda has three children, two of whom are in primary school and her eldest daughter is studying accounting in a prestigious high school in the city. They all live with with her husband, a fish trader in Bellavista market.

Her entrepeneur adventure started with an ice cream and ice store in her house. With her savings and the assessment and help provided by her loving husband, she increased her product offering and expanded the shop. Within three months (and after a lot of hard work) she had to increase the surface of her living room to help her sell with greater ease and security.

As the business has grown, she feels that she needs to increase the products she offers her clients and to improve her family´s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Heyda, tiene tres hijos, dos estudian en el centro educativo primario nacional y la hija mayor está estudiando contabilidad en un instituto de prestigio de la ciudad. Vive con su esposo quién se dedica a la compra y venta de pescados en el mercado Bellavista.Su travesía comercial empezó cuando decidió vender helados y hielo en su casa y de ahí con unos ahorros y el importante asesoramiento y ayuda de su querido esposo, empezó a incrementar sus productos y acondicionó un espacio en casa exclusivamente para este fin. Con el transcurso de los meses y la constancia de su trabajo empezó a ver los frutos ampliando la salita de su casa para poder vender con mayor comodidad y seguridad. Debido al rápido crecimiento de su pequeño negocio se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar más productos para atender a sus clientes y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase stock to increase sales

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene is a young mother who lives happily with her husband. She has a 4 year old daughter that’s in the school of her town near her home. She began the competitive business of selling used clothing because of the advice of her beloved mother, who taught her ways and tactics of selling to get the most out of her daily sales trips. She travels with her husband by the rivers and farms, selling her items. Due to the large demand, they have seen the need to buy more clothes so that they don't lose this great opportunity to fulfill the advanced orders from the residents of the areas by the streams. Look to your noble heart so that the amount of the loan that is being requested can be acheived to assure the well-being of this family by means of their work.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Marlene es una joven madre que vive feliz en compañía de su esposo; tiene una niña de cuatro años que está en el centro de aprestamiento inicial de su pequeña ciudad cerca de su domicilio.Ella ingresó al competitivo negocio de la venta de ropa usada por consejo de su querida mamá, quién la enseñó las funciones y tácticas de venta para sacarle provecho a su desempeño diario. Viaja con su esposo por los ríos y las chacras ofreciendo sus artículos. Debido a la gran demanda que obtienen en los viajes, se han visto en la necesidad de comprar más fardos de ropa con el propósito de no desaprovechar esta magnífica ocasión, para poder cumplir con los pedidos hechos con anticipación por los moradores de las riveras.Acude a vuestro noble corazón con el objetivo de acumular la cantidad que solicita para asegurar el bienestar de su familia a través de su trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to increase sales

loans.name: Ena

texts.es:
Ena is a hard-working mother that got into the world of natural medicine as a result of the difficult illness from which her youngest child suffers, diabetes. She began her voyage by attending training talks, given by respected professionals, about the goodness of specific products native to their countries, capable of returning the health and well-being of those who consume them appropriately. Absorbed with a lot of information, and with the little savings that she had, she decided to aquire specific products to provide to the general public. In the beginning and because of the lack of knowledge of these natural products, she had a certain difficulty; however, gradually, the sales from these products became her primary source of income.

In this way and thanks to her hard work, she is contributing to the improvement of the quality of life of her humble home. Because of the great acceptance (of the products) and because her clientele is constantly growing, she has an urgent need to buy more products. To carry out the fulfillment her goals, she's asking for a loan of $425, which she will repay in 6 months, which will permit her to lay the foundation of her business. Through your help, we will make it possible to fulfill this desire.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Ena, es una diligente madre que incursionó en el mundo de la medicina natural a raíz de la delicada enfermedad que padece el menor de sus hijos, diabetes. Inició su travesía asistiendo a las charlas de capacitación que otorgaban profesionales respecto a las bondades de determinado productos oriundos de su país, capaces de devolverle la salud y bienestar a quién las consume adecuadamente.Empapada de mucha información, con los pequeños ahorros que tenia decidió adquirir determinados productos para ofrecerlos al público en general, a principio y debido a la poca difusión de estos preparados naturales tuvo cierta dificultad; sin embargo paulatinamente se fue convirtiendo en su principal fuente de ingresos. De esta manera y gracias a su desempeño contribuye a incrementar el nivel de vida de su humilde hogar.Por la gran aceptación y la cartera de clientes en constante crecimiento, se encuentra en la apremiante necesidad de comprar más productos. Para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de sus metas esta solicitando 425 dólares en calidad de préstamo con un periodo de devolución de seis meses, que le permitirá la cimentación de su negocio.A través de vuestro apoyo posibilitaremos el cumplimiento de este anhelo.

loans.use: The purchase of Natural Products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
Ana is from Cullpa Alta, all her life has been spent in touch with the land since her parents and grandmother taught her how to farm. Agriculture and livestock are her passion and she is highly motivated as this is the source of livelihood for four of her five children.

She raises young cows and bulls until they are large enough to sell. Her dairy producing cows are well fed at the stables she has constructed in her home. Ana´s cattle are very well cared after and she nurtures her animals with such care that she even has a name for every animal.

She would like to build a small milking station which is allready being planned. To reach her aspirations, she calls out to your generous hearts to receive the loan that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Ana, es natural de la zona de Cullpa Alta, su vida siempre ha estado en continuo contacto con el trabajo en el campo, ya que sus padres y su abuelita le enseñaron cultivar sus tierras desde muy pequeña. Las actividades agrícolas y la crianza de animales siempre han sido labores muy apasionantes para ella y ahora más aún que su trabajo y esfuerzo se desplega en beneficio de cuatro de sus cinco hijos que están bajo su cobijo.Día a día se dedica a la crianza de vacas y toros, ella los compra cuando aún están tiernos y luego los engorda para venderlos, también alimenta bien a sus vacas para luego emparentarlas y en época de lactancia poder extraer la leche y utilizarla o venderla; es por ello que ha habilitado en su casa un establo para sus bellas vacas y finísimos toros y les otorga tanta dedicación y cariño que les ha dado un nombre a cada uno de ellos.Tiene en mente construir una pequeña planta lechera para lo cual está preparando y capacitando constantemente y con el propósito de implementar muy pronto su ansiado sueño; apela a vuestro generoso corazón para reunir la suma que está solicitando.

loans.use: Implement a new project

loans.name: Namid

texts.en: Namid A. lives in the village of Khaladj of the Salyan region with his wife and four children. This 47-year-old man has been in farming for 15 years. He is requesting a loan of US$1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He wants to improve his business to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 43 years old and has 3 children, one in secondary school and the two others in primary school. His little child was injured in an explosion when he was going to his school in Kirkuk. The entrepreneur has a small minmarket and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new ice box and more goods and to renovate his shop so that he can increase his income, expand his project, and provide a better and safer life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and more goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 40 years old. She is marred and has three children. Her husband is unemployed. She works at her house, which is rented, and she is responsible for all of her family's expenses. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric to make new clothes to sell. She also wants to paint the shop and renovate it in order to increase her income and develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine
